name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: hydrosphere
trans: n. [地物] 水界，[地物] 水圈；水气

sentences.english: Geosphere, hydrosphere and atmosphere are fluids in motion; their main difference is their viscosity.
sentences.chinese: 地圈，水圈和大气是流体；他们的主要差别是他们的黏性。

sentences.english: Hitting candle every months also is very be necessary, but before waxing, should mix hydrosphere besmirch wipe up .
sentences.chinese: 每月打一次蜡也是很有必要的，但是打蜡前要将水气和污渍擦干净。

sentences.english: To physical science that has denatured reality the world is a material place of molecules and atoms, of solids, liquids and gases, of atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere and biosphere.
sentences.chinese: 对于具有变性的物理学来说世界是由分子、原子，固体、液体、气体，大气圈、水圈、岩石圈和生物圈组成的物质世界；

detailed_translations.english: the watery part of the earth's surface, including oceans, lakes, water vapour in the atmosphere, etc

name: lithosphere
trans: n. 陆界，[地物][地质] 岩石圈

sentences.english: Even the planet's outer skin, or lithosphere, has been transformed.
sentences.chinese: 甚至于地球的表层——岩石圈——也已经被改变了。

sentences.english: Since the size of the Earth is essentially constant, new lithosphere can be created at the mid-ocean ridges only if an equal amount of lithospheric material is consumed elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球的大小本质上是不变的，只有同等数量的岩石圈物质在其它地方被吞没，新的岩石圈才能生成。

sentences.english: To physical science that has denatured reality the world is a material place of molecules and atoms, of solids, liquids and gases, of atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere and biosphere.
sentences.chinese: 对于具有变性的物理学来说世界是由分子、原子，固体、液体、气体，大气圈、水圈、岩石圈和生物圈组成的物质世界；

detailed_translations.english: the rigid outer layer of the earth, having an average thickness of about 75 km and comprising the earth's crust and the solid part of the mantle above the asthenosphere

name: oxygen
trans: n. [化学] 氧气，[化学] 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: oxide
trans: n. [化学] 氧化物

sentences.english: iron oxide
sentences.chinese: 氧化铁

detailed_translations.english: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

name: carbon dioxide
trans: n. 二氧化碳

sentences.english: How much carbon dioxide you save, if any, depends on how far you live from work and how you get there, among other things.
sentences.chinese: 如果真有的话，你可以节约多少二氧化碳？ 它取决于你住得有多远还是你如何完成目标抑或其他因素？

sentences.english: And then we have gas cooled reactors which can use supercritical carbon dioxide or helium.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们有气体冷却反应堆,那能使用超临界二氧化碳或者氦。

sentences.english: But as Solomon and colleagues suggest in a new study published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, it is not true for the most abundant greenhouse gas: carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 但是，正如所罗门和他的同事提出的一项发表在《美国国家科学院院刊》的新研究表明，对最丰富的温室气体，二氧化碳，这是不正确的。

detailed_translations.english: the gas produced when animals breathe out, when carbon is burned in air, or when animal or vegetable substances decay

name: hydrogen
trans: n. [化学] 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: core
trans: n. 核心；要点；果心；[计] 磁心 vt. 挖...的核

sentences.english: Remove the cores, and bake the apples for 40 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 去除果心，然后把苹果烤40分钟。

sentences.english: Debt is at the core of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 债务是问题的关键。

detailed_translations.english: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

name: crust
trans: n. 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮 vi. 结硬皮；结成外壳 vt. 盖以硬皮；在…上结硬皮

sentences.english: sandwiches with the crusts cut off
sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

detailed_translations.chinese: 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮
detailed_translations.english: the hard brown outer surface of bread

name: mantle
trans: n. 地幔；斗篷；覆盖物 vi. 覆盖；脸红 vt. 覆盖

sentences.english: The parks and squares looked grim under a mantle of soot and ash.
sentences.chinese: 在一层烟尘的笼罩下，这些公园和广场显得阴沉沉的。

detailed_translations.english: a loose piece of outer clothing without sleeves, worn especially in former times
to cover the surface of something

name: longitude
trans: n. [地理] 经度；经线

sentences.english: The town lies at longitude 12˚ east.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇位于东经12度。

detailed_translations.english: the distance east or west of a particular  meridian (= imaginary line along the Earth’s surface from the North Pole to the South Pole )  , measured in degrees

name: latitude
trans: n. 纬度；界限；活动范围

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: horizon
trans: n. [天] 地平线；视野；眼界；范围

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: altitude
trans: n. 高地；高度；[数] 顶垂线；（等级和地位等的）高级；海拔

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

detailed_translations.english: the height of an object or place above the sea

name: disaster
trans: n. 灾难，灾祸；不幸

sentences.english: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.english: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: mishap
trans: n. 灾祸；不幸事故；晦气

sentences.english: I had a slight mishap with one of the glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了一个小小的错误，把其中的一个玻璃杯打破了。

name: catastrophic
trans: adj. 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的

sentences.english: A tidal wave caused by the earthquake hit the coast causing catastrophic damage.
sentences.chinese: 地震引发的海啸袭击了海岸，造成了灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: The water shortage in this country is potentially catastrophic.
sentences.chinese: 该国水资源的匮乏很可能是灾难性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is catastrophic involves or causes a sudden terrible disaster

name: calamity
trans: n. 灾难；不幸事件

sentences.english: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.chinese: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering

name: endanger
trans: vt. 危及；使遭到危险

sentences.english: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

name: jeopardise
trans: vt. 危及（等于jeopardize）；使…受危险

name: destructive
trans: adj. 破坏的；毁灭性的；有害的，消极的

sentences.english: the destructive power of modern weapons
sentences.chinese: 现代武器的破坏力

detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

name: El Niño
trans: n.厄尔尼诺现象

name: greenhouse
trans: n. 温室；造成温室效应的

sentences.english: What we are seeking, after all, is not simply an agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻求的目标毕竟不只是一项限制温室气体排放的协议。

sentences.english: I think each and every one of us is responsible for the greenhouse gases we emit in our daily actions and choices.
sentences.chinese: 我认为每一个人都是我们每天的行动和选择中排放的温室气体的责任。

sentences.english: But presently it was set in a greenhouse, where the sunlight fell warm upon it, and water was sprinkled over it, and day by day as it waited, a change began to come to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是过了不久，黏土又给人放进了一间温室，这里阳光和煦地照射着它，并且经常给它喷水，这样就在它一天天静静等候的时候，某种变化终于开始到来。

detailed_translations.english: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: pebble
trans: n. 卵石；水晶透镜 vt. 用卵石铺

sentences.english: As the last Ice Age came to an end, somebody picked a pebble out of a small river not far from Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 随着最后一个冰河时代宣告结束，有人从伯利恒附近流水淙淙的小溪边，捡起了一枚鹅卵石。

sentences.english: And what I do is, I select a hard stone hammer, in this case a quartzite pebble about the size of a cricket ball, and I elect to hit it in one place - and this is where I start to knap.
sentences.chinese: “现在你瞧瞧，这儿呢，我挑了块燧石，比较细长的，要削薄下来工作量并不大。” “我要做的就是，选择一块够硬的石锤，这次我选这块是个头有板球大小的石英岩卵石。

name: magnet
trans: n. 磁铁；[电磁] 磁体；磁石

sentences.english: It's possible to hang a nail from a magnet and then use that nail to pick up another nail.
sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

name: ore
trans: n. 矿；矿石

sentences.english: iron ore
sentences.chinese: 铁矿石

sentences.english: veins of rich ore
sentences.chinese: 富矿脉

detailed_translations.english: rock or earth from which metal can be obtained

name: mineral
trans: n. 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示） adj. 矿物的；矿质的

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: marble
trans: n. 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠 adj. 大理石的；冷酷无情的

sentences.english: The columns were of white marble.
sentences.chinese: 柱子是白色的大理石。

sentences.english: a marble statue
sentences.chinese: 大理石雕像

detailed_translations.chinese: 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠
detailed_translations.english: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

name: quartz
trans: n. 石英

sentences.english: quartz crystals
sentences.chinese: 石英晶体

sentences.english: a quartz watch
sentences.chinese: 石英表

detailed_translations.english: a hard mineral substance that is used in making electronic watches and clocks

name: granite
trans: n. 花岗岩；坚毅；冷酷无情

sentences.english: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.chinese: 他善于把花岗岩石凿平。

sentences.english: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用钢或花岗岩来工作，重新设计或增加一些东西是很贵的。

sentences.english: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.chinese: 影片里你所见之处，从角色走过的鹅卵石路到大楼的花岗石，所有的细节都能帮助将你置身于那个年代。” 克罗尔解释道。

detailed_translations.english: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

name: gust
trans: n. 风味；一阵狂风；趣味 vi. 一阵阵地劲吹

sentences.english: A gust of wind drove down the valley.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风掠过山谷。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc
if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements

name: breeze
trans: n. 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波 vi. 吹微风；逃走

sentences.english: flowers waving in the breeze
sentences.chinese: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

detailed_translations.chinese: 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波
detailed_translations.english: a gentle wind

name: monsoon
trans: n. 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风

sentences.english: ...the end of the monsoon.
sentences.chinese: …雨季的结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风
detailed_translations.english: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

name: gale
trans: n. [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风，暴风

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: tornado
trans: n. [气象] 龙卷风；旋风；暴风；大雷雨

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: typhoon
trans: n. [气象] 台风

sentences.english: They have received notice of a typhoon approaching.
sentences.chinese: 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。

sentences.english: We both are under stress and standing in the middle of a typhoon .
sentences.chinese: 你我都处在很紧张的环境中，站在台风的中心。

sentences.english: The football match have to stand over next week for the typhoon storm.
sentences.chinese: 由于台风风暴，这场足球赛延期到下个星期举行。

detailed_translations.english: a very violent tropical storm

name: volcano
trans: n. 火山

sentences.english: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.chinese: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava is sometimes forced out

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙 vt. 爆发；喷出

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: magma
trans: n. [地质] 岩浆；糊剂

sentences.english: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

name: thermodynamic
trans: adj. 热力学的；使用热动力的

sentences.english: After that, the formalism of statistical mechanics takes over, and calculates partition functions and thermodynamic functions.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，都是统计力学的内容，计算配分函数,和热力学函数。

sentences.english: That is, in terms of equations of state. For any material Then we would really be able to essentially calculate anything. Anything thermodynamic.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，利用任何一种物质的状态方程,我们就能够实质上,计算所有物理量，所有热力学量。

sentences.english: This must be brought into the picture, along with the performance of thermodynamic work cycles that link spontaneous and non-spontaneous processes like an engine.
sentences.chinese: 这一点必须与热力学功循环的表现一起考虑，热力学连系到自发过程和像发动机那样的非自发过程。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热力学的, 使用热动力的
detailed_translations.english: of or concerned with thermodynamics

name: smog
trans: n. 烟雾

sentences.english: Cars cause pollution, both smog and acid rain.
sentences.chinese: 汽车引起污染，既有烟雾又有酸雨。

detailed_translations.english: dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and  fog  , caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities

name: fume
trans: n. 烟；愤怒，烦恼 vt. 熏；冒烟；愤怒地说 vi. 冒烟；发怒

sentences.english: ...car exhaust fumes.
sentences.chinese: …汽车尾气。

detailed_translations.english: Fumes are the unpleasant and often unhealthy smoke and gases that are produced by fires or by things such as chemicals, fuel, or cooking
to give off smoke or gases

name: mist
trans: n. 薄雾；视线模糊不清；模糊不清之物 vi. 下雾；变模糊 vt. 使模糊；使蒙上薄雾

sentences.english: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。

sentences.english: He vanished into the mist.
sentences.chinese: 他消失在雾中。

sentences.english: The hills were shrouded in mist (= covered in mist, so that you could not see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。

sentences.english: The mist came down off the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 雾从山上飘下来。

sentences.english: The mists rolled in off the sea (= came on to the land from the sea ) .
sentences.chinese: 雾气从海上涌来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄雾；视线模糊不清；模糊不清之物
detailed_translations.english: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

name: tsunami
trans: n. 海啸

sentences.english: You see this in the faces of tsunami and earthquake survivors on television.
sentences.chinese: 你能从电视上海啸和地震的生还者的脸上看到这点。

sentences.english: They urged other town residents unaffected by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

sentences.english: But I am lucky because we did get a little bit of the tsunami but nothing like what they got up north.
sentences.chinese: 但我算是幸运的因为我们这只受到了海啸很小的侵害远不及北方所受到的那样。

detailed_translations.english: a very large wave, caused by extreme conditions such as an  earthquake  , which can cause a lot of damage when it reaches land

name: drought
trans: n. 干旱；缺乏

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: flooding
trans: n. 泛滥；产后出血

name: torrent
trans: n. 奔流；倾注；迸发；连续不断

sentences.english: After five days of heavy rain the Telle river was a raging torrent (= a very violent torrent ) .
sentences.chinese: 下了五天的大雨之后，泰勒河急流汹涌。

detailed_translations.english: a large amount of water moving very quickly and strongly in a particular direction

name: earthquake
trans: n. 地震；大动荡

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: seismic
trans: adj. 地震的；因地震而引起的

sentences.english: increased seismic activity
sentences.chinese: 越来越频繁的地震活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 地震的；因地震而引起的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by  earthquakes

name: avalanche
trans: n. 雪崩 vt. 雪崩 vi. 崩塌

sentences.english: Just after the avalanche.
sentences.chinese: 就在这雪崩后不久。

sentences.english: But what if the avalanche happened?
sentences.chinese: 不过，要是发生雪崩怎么办呢？

sentences.english: If the value was much lower than one, on the other hand, the avalanche would soon die out.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，如果结果是一个比一小很多的数字，那么雪崩很快就会停止。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of snow, ice, and rocks that falls down the side of a mountain

name: terrain
trans: n. [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: landscape
trans: n. 风景；风景画；景色；山水画；乡村风景画；地形；（文件的）横向打印格式 vt. 对…做景观美化，给…做园林美化；从事庭园设计 vi. 美化（环境等），使景色宜人；从事景观美化工作，做庭园设计师

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: continent
trans: n. 大陆，洲，陆地 adj. 自制的，克制的

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

name: cave
trans: n. 洞穴，窑洞 vi. 凹陷，塌落；投降 vt. 使凹陷，使塌落；在…挖洞穴

sentences.english: the entrance to a cave
sentences.chinese: 洞穴的入口

detailed_translations.chinese: 使凹陷，使塌落；在…挖洞穴
detailed_translations.english: to hollow out
a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground

name: cliff
trans: n. 悬崖；绝壁

sentences.english: The car rolled over the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 汽车翻下了悬崖边。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

name: glacier
trans: n. 冰河，冰川

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: swamp
trans: vt. 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境 n. 沼泽；湿地 vi. 下沉；陷入沼泽；陷入困境；不知所措（过去式swamped，过去分词swamped，现在分词swamping，第三人称单数swamps，名词swampiness，形容词swampy）

sentences.english: I spent one whole night by a swamp behind the road listening to frogs.
sentences.chinese: 我整个晚上都在这条路后面的一个沼泽地旁听蛙鸣。

sentences.english: Their electronic navigation failed and a rogue wave swamped the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他们的电子导航装置失灵了，一个巨浪吞没了那只船。

detailed_translations.english: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

detailed_translations.chinese: 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
detailed_translations.english: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

name: delta
trans: n. （河流的）三角洲；德耳塔（希腊字母的第四个字）

sentences.english: the Nile delta
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河三角洲

detailed_translations.chinese: （河流的）三角洲；德耳塔（希腊字母的第四个字）
detailed_translations.english: the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet

name: plain
trans: n. 平原；无格式；朴实无华的东西 adj. 平的；简单的；朴素的；清晰的 adv. 清楚地；平易地

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

name: plateau
trans: n. 高原 n. [地名] [肯尼亚、美国] 普拉托 n. （活动或进程中的）稳定阶段，停滞时期 adj. 高原印第安人的

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: oasis
trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

name: globe
trans: n. 地球；地球仪；球体 vt. 使…成球形 vi. 成球状

sentences.english: Three large globes stand on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 3个巨大的地球仪立在地板上。

sentences.english: We export our goods all over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

detailed_translations.english: the world

name: hemisphere
trans: n. 半球

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: equator
trans: n. 赤道

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: arctic
trans: n. 北极圈；御寒防水套鞋 adj. 北极的；极寒的

sentences.english: the Arctic island of Novaya Zemlya
sentences.chinese: 北极的新地岛

sentences.english: winter in the Arctic
sentences.chinese: 北极的冬天。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most northern part of the world
the regions of the world around the North Pole

name: Antarctic
trans: adj.南极的

sentences.english: I like to read his Antarctic adventures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢读他的南极种种的冒险事迹。

sentences.english: 'They would, in fact, feel more connected to home than the early Antarctic explorers, ' they write in their article.
sentences.chinese: “事实上，他们会比早期的南极探险者感受到更多与家庭的联系。”他们在文章中写道。

sentences.english: Antarctic octopuses eat a wide variety of animals, from clams to fish. They catch their prey with their tentacles and use their venom to kill them, much like snakes.
sentences.chinese: 南极章鱼的食谱宽泛，从蛤蚌到鱼类皆来者不拒。捕猎时，章鱼先用触须抓住猎物，然后用毒液杀死它们，其捕猎过程和毒蛇很相像。

detailed_translations.english: the very cold most southern part of the world

name: pole
trans: n. 杆；极点；电极 vt. 用竿支撑

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: polar
trans: n. 极面；极线 adj. 极地的；两极的；正好相反的

sentences.english: Well, what is the equation of this circle in polar coordinates?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这个圆方程在极坐标系下相当于什么呢？

sentences.english: This image shows part of a polar crater that still holds on to some summer ice, as well as beautiful sand dunes sculpted by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片展示了某个极地陨坑，陨坑中还保存着一些夏季冰的痕迹，在风的作用下形成了一些美丽的沙丘。

sentences.english: Yet, while not wanting to begrudge the polar bear his ice, we should be at least somewhat concerned at this recent shift in thinking.
sentences.chinese: 然而，虽然我们并不想希望北极熊失去它的冰，我们至少应该对近期的这些意识上的转变有一点担心。

name: axis
trans: n. 轴；轴线；轴心国

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: deteriorate
trans: vi. 恶化，变坏 vt. 恶化

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: aggravate
trans: vt. 加重；使恶化；激怒

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: degrade
trans: vt. 贬低；使……丢脸；使……降级；使……降解 vi. 降级，降低；退化

sentences.english: a movie that degrades women
sentences.chinese: 贬损女性的影片

sentences.english: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

name: upgrade
trans: n. 升级；上升；上坡 vt. 使升级；提升；改良品种 adj. 向上的 adv. 往上

sentences.english: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized.
sentences.chinese: 直升机已经升级并且装上现代化设备。

detailed_translations.english: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

name: erode
trans: vt. 腐蚀，侵蚀 vi. 侵蚀；受腐蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: Mediterranean
trans: n. 地中海 adj. 地中海的

sentences.english: You have the choice of night fishing in the Mediterranean, or windsurfing on a lake in Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 你可选择在地中海夜间垂钓，或是在瑞士的湖上玩帆板。

sentences.english: a Mediterranean country
sentences.chinese: 地中海国家

detailed_translations.english: the Mediterranean Sea
relating to the Mediterranean Sea, or typical of the area of southern Europe around it

name: Atlantic
trans: n. 大西洋 adj. 大西洋的

sentences.english: They underlaid the Atlantic with a cable.
sentences.chinese: 他们在大西洋海底铺设了一条电缆。

sentences.english: The Straits of Gibraltar are the strategic passage between the Mediterranean and the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 直布罗陀海峡是地中海通向大西洋的咽喉。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or bordering the Atlantic Ocean
Atlantic Ocean

name: pacific
trans: adj. 和平的；温和的；平静的 n. 太平洋 adj. 太平洋的

sentences.english: Gorbachev was less pacific than people thought.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫不像人们想得那样温和。

detailed_translations.english: peaceful and loving or wanting peace

name: ocean
trans: n. 海洋；大量；广阔

sentences.english: She stood on the beach, gazing at the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 她站在海滩上，凝视着大海。

sentences.english: I like to swim in the ocean when it’s warm enough.
sentences.chinese: 海水足够暖的时候，我喜欢在海里游泳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋， 海洋； 许多， 大量
detailed_translations.english: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的 n. 海运业；舰队；水兵；（海军）士兵或军官

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: navigation
trans: n. 航行；航海

sentences.english: compasses and other instruments of navigation
sentences.chinese: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

detailed_translations.chinese: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
detailed_translations.english: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

name: gulf
trans: n. 海湾；深渊；分歧；漩涡 vt. 吞没

sentences.english: the Gulf of Mexico
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥湾

detailed_translations.english: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land

name: beach
trans: n. 海滩；湖滨 vt. 将…拖上岸 vi. 搁浅；定居

sentences.english: a sandy beach
sentences.chinese: 沙滩

sentences.english: surfers on the beach
sentences.chinese: 沙滩上的冲浪者

detailed_translations.english: an area of sand or small stones at the edge of the sea or a lake

name: coast
trans: n. 海岸；滑坡 vt. 沿…岸航行 vi. 滑行；沿岸航行

sentences.english: He pushed in the clutch and coasted to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 他踩下离合器，滑行了一会儿便停下来了。

detailed_translations.english: if a car or bicycle coasts, it moves without any effort from you or any power from the engine
the area where the land meets the sea

name: shore
trans: n. 海滨；支柱 vt. 支撑，使稳住；用支柱撑住

sentences.english: We could see a boat about a mile from shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见离岸边大约一英里的地方有一艘船。

sentences.english: Only a few survivors reached the shore.
sentences.chinese: 仅有几个生还者到达岸边。

sentences.english: She began to swim to shore.
sentences.chinese: 她开始朝岸边游去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，使稳住；用支柱撑住
detailed_translations.english: to prop or make safe with or as if with a shore
the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

name: tide
trans: n. 趋势，潮流；潮汐 vt. 随潮漂流

sentences.english: Is the tide going out or coming in ?
sentences.chinese: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？

sentences.english: We went for a walk and got cut off by the tide .
sentences.chinese: 我们去散步，结果被潮水困住了。

detailed_translations.english: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

name: current
trans: n. （水，气，电）流；趋势；涌流 adj. 现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: brook
trans: n. 小溪；小河 vt. 忍受；容忍

sentences.english: He would brook no criticism, even from his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他不能容忍任何批评，哪怕是自己深爱的女儿也不行。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow or accept something
a small stream

name: stream
trans: n. 溪流；流动；潮流；光线 vt. 流出；涌出；使飘动 vi. 流；涌进；飘扬

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

name: source
trans: n. 来源；水源；原始资料

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: shallow
trans: n. [地理] 浅滩 adj. 浅的；肤浅的 vt. 使变浅 vi. 变浅

sentences.english: a shallow river
sentences.chinese: 浅河

sentences.english: The lake is quite shallow.
sentences.chinese: 这湖很浅。

sentences.english: the shallow end of the pool
sentences.chinese: 游泳池的浅水区

sentences.english: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

name: superficial
trans: adj. 表面的；肤浅的 ；表面文章的；外表的；（人）浅薄的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: flat
trans: n. 平地；公寓；平面 adj. 平的；单调的；不景气的；干脆的；平坦的；扁平的；浅的 vi. 逐渐变平；[音乐]以降调唱（或奏） vt. 使变平；[音乐]使（音调）下降，尤指降半音 adv. （尤指贴着另一表面）平直地；断然地；水平地；直接地，完全地

sentences.english: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。
