sentences.chinese: 为什么电话铃总是在我洗澡的时候响？

sentences.english: I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，我想用一下这里的淋浴。

sentences.english: The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle (= a shower in a separate part of the room ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫生间里有一个独立的淋浴间。

sentences.english: I need a shower.
sentences.chinese: 我需要洗个淋浴。

sentences.english: Mike shaved and showered.
sentences.chinese: 迈克刮了脸，冲了个淋浴。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body
to wash your whole body while standing under a shower

name: Celsius
trans: n. 摄氏度 adj. 摄氏的

sentences.english: Highest temperatures 11° Celsius, that's 52° Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 最高温度11摄氏度，即52华氏度。

detailed_translations.english: Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 0˚ and boils at 100˚

name: temperature
trans: n. 温度；体温；气温；发烧

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

name: forecast
trans: n. 预测，预报；预想 vt. 预报，预测；预示 vi. 进行预报，作预测

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌 adj. 最高的；最大值的 vt. 使达到最高点；使竖起 vi. 消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: mount
trans: vt. 增加；爬上；使骑上马；安装，架置；镶嵌，嵌入；准备上演；成立（军队等） vi. 爬；增加；上升 n. 山峰；底座；乘骑用马；攀，登；运载工具；底座 v. 登上；骑上

sentences.english: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他登上楼梯，慢慢环顾四周。

sentences.english: Mount Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: to go up a step or stairs
used as part of the name of a mountain

name: mountain
trans: n. 山；山脉

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉 vt. 漫游；放牧；使并列；归类于；来回走动 vi. （在...内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: ridge
trans: n. 山脊；山脉；屋脊 vt. 使成脊状；作垄 vi. 成脊状

sentences.english: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

detailed_translations.english: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

name: slope
trans: n. 斜坡；倾斜；斜率；扛枪姿势 vt. 倾斜；使倾斜；扛 vi. 倾斜；逃走

sentences.english: a steep slope
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

sentences.english: a gentle
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: She looked back up the grassy slope.
sentences.chinese: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

sentences.english: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
sentences.chinese: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

detailed_translations.english: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

name: valley
trans: n. 山谷；流域；溪谷

sentences.english: the San Fernando Valley
sentences.chinese: 圣费尔南多山谷

detailed_translations.english: an area of lower land between two lines of hills or mountains, usually with a river flowing through it

name: hillside
trans: n. 山坡，山腹；山腰

sentences.english: The airplane crashed on a hillside.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在山坡上坠毁。

sentences.english: They are quarrying the hillside for marble.
sentences.chinese: 他们正从山坡上采大理石。

sentences.english: They sat and had their lunch on a grassy hillside.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐在长满草的山坡上吃午饭。

detailed_translations.english: the sloping side of a hill

name: overlook
trans: vt. 忽略；俯瞰；远眺；检查；高耸于…之上 n. 忽视；眺望

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: southern
trans: n. 南方人 adj. 南的；南方的

sentences.english: a southern accent
sentences.chinese: 南部口音

sentences.english: Southern Italy
sentences.chinese: 意大利南部

detailed_translations.english: in or from the south of a country or area

name: southeast
trans: n. 东南；东南地区 adj. 东南的；来自东南的 adv. 来自东南

sentences.english: the southeast quarter of the city
sentences.chinese: 该市的东南部

sentences.english: I know we have to go southeast, more or less.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我们大概得往东南方向走。

detailed_translations.english: a southeast wind comes from the southeast
the direction that is exactly between south and east
If you go southeast, you travel toward the southeast

name: southwest
trans: n. 西南方 adj. 西南的 adv. 往西南；来自西南

sentences.english: ...some 500 kilometres to the southwest of Johannesburg.
sentences.chinese: …约翰内斯堡西南约五百公里。

sentences.english: We took a plane southwest across the Anatolian plateau to Cappadocia.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘飞机朝西南方,越过安纳托利亚高原,飞往卡帕多细亚。

detailed_translations.english: the direction that is exactly between south and west
a southwest wind comes from the southwest
If you go southwest, you travel toward the southwest

name: northeast
trans: adj. 东北的；向东北的；来自东北的 n. 东北 adv. 向东北；来自东北

sentences.english: The land to the north-east fell away into meadows.
sentences.chinese: 陆地向东北方向倾斜延伸成了牧场。

sentences.english: These islands of the north-east coast can only be reached in small boats.
sentences.chinese: 东北部沿海的这些岛屿只有坐小船才能抵达。

detailed_translations.english: the direction that is exactly between north and east
The northeast edge, corner, or part of a place is the part which is toward the northeast

name: northwest
trans: adj. 西北的；向西北的；来自西北的 n. 西北 adv. 在西北；向西北；来自西北

sentences.english: four miles to the northwest
sentences.chinese: 西北方向4英里

sentences.english: the northwest suburbs of the city
sentences.chinese: 城市西北部的郊区

detailed_translations.english: the direction that is exactly between north and west
in the northwest of a place

name: eastern
trans: n. 东方人；（美国）东部地区的人 adj. 东方的；朝东的；东洋的

sentences.english: the eastern shore of the island
sentences.chinese: 岛的东岸

sentences.english: farmers in eastern England
sentences.chinese: 英格兰东部的农民

sentences.english: Eastern religions
sentences.chinese: 东方宗教

detailed_translations.english: in or from the east of a country or area

name: oriental
trans: adj. 东方的；东方人的 n. 东方人

sentences.english: a beautiful oriental rug
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的东方地毯

sentences.english: oriental art
sentences.chinese: 东方艺术

detailed_translations.english: relating to or from the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
a word for someone from the eastern part of the world, especially China or Japan, now considered offensive

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: irreversible
trans: adj. 不可逆的；不能取消的；不能翻转的

sentences.english: Fossil fuels have caused irreversible damage to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 矿物燃料已对环境造成了不可挽回的破坏。

detailed_translations.english: irreversible damage, change etc is so serious or so great that you cannot change something back to how it was before

name: irregularly
trans: adv. 不规则地；不整齐地

sentences.english: Good golfers do better if they give themselves little time to prepare for their shots--and even better if they are distracted by researchers asking them to count irregularly spaced sounds.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的高尔夫球手在击球前准备的时间越少成绩越好—即使被研究人员骚扰，让他们数不规则间隔的声响，最后击球成绩依然不俗。

sentences.english: The glove went through a series of designs, with dots and patches of different shapes and colors, but the current version is covered with 20 irregularly shaped patches that use 10 different colors.
sentences.chinese: 这个手套经过了一系列的设计，试过不同形状和颜色的点状和块状布料，不过目前的版本是覆盖着20种不规则形状、10种不同颜色的块状布料。

name: inappropriate
trans: adj. 不适当的；不相称的

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

name: abnormal
trans: adj. 反常的，不规则的；变态的

sentences.english: abnormal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 反常行为

sentences.english: an abnormal level of cholesterol
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇水平异常

sentences.english: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
sentences.chinese: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

detailed_translations.english: very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous

name: sediment
trans: n. 沉积；沉淀物

sentences.english: a thick layer of sediment
sentences.chinese: 一层厚厚的沉积物

detailed_translations.english: solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid

name: silt
trans: n. 淤泥，泥沙；煤粉；残渣 vt. 使淤塞；充塞 vi. 淤塞，充塞；为淤泥堵塞

sentences.english: The lake was almost solid with silt and vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 这个湖几乎填满了泥沙和植被。

detailed_translations.english: sand, mud, soil etc that is carried in water and then settles at a bend in a river, an entrance to a port etc

name: muddy
trans: adj. 泥泞的；模糊的；混乱的 vt. 使污浊；使沾上泥；把…弄糊涂 vi. 变得泥泞；沾满烂泥

sentences.english: Take your boots off outside if they’re muddy.
sentences.chinese: 要是靴子上都是泥，你就脱在门外吧。

sentences.english: the muddy waters of the lake
sentences.chinese: 浑浊的湖水

detailed_translations.english: covered with mud or containing mud

name: clay
trans: n. [土壤] 粘土；泥土；肉体；似黏土的东西 vt. 用黏土处理

sentences.english: Bricks are made from clay.
sentences.chinese: 砖是用黏土制成的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [土壤] 粘土；泥土；肉体；似黏土的东西
detailed_translations.english: a type of heavy sticky earth that can be used for making pots, bricks etc

name: dirt
trans: n. 污垢，泥土；灰尘，尘土；下流话

sentences.english: You should have seen the dirt on that car!
sentences.chinese: 你没看见那车上沾了多少泥！

sentences.english: His face and hands were black with dirt.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸和手黑乎乎的，全是泥。

sentences.english: Michael threw his handful of dirt onto the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔往棺材上撒了一把土。

detailed_translations.english: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

name: rural
trans: adj. 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: suburb
trans: n. 郊区；边缘

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

name: outskirts
trans: n. 市郊，郊区

sentences.english: The rubble was then dumped in a municipal landfill site on the outskirts of Florence.
sentences.chinese: 这堆碎石后来被倾倒在佛罗伦萨市郊的一处垃圾填埋场。

sentences.english: On the outskirts of every city I saw, there was a veritable forest of apartment blocks under construction.
sentences.chinese: 在我造访的每个城市的郊区，一栋栋在建公寓楼确实是鳞次栉比。

sentences.english: After abandoning his devastated home on the outskirts of Damascus, Mustafa, his wife, children and aging parents spent months seeking safety in one town after another.
sentences.chinese: 在抛弃大马士革郊区破坏殆尽的家后，穆斯塔法和他的妻子，孩子几年迈的父母花了几个月的时间在一个又一个小镇躲避战祸。

detailed_translations.english: the parts of a town or city that are furthest from the centre

name: remote
trans: n. 远程 adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: desolate
trans: adj. 荒凉的；无人烟的 vt. 使荒凉；使孤寂

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

name: distant
trans: adj. 遥远的；冷漠的；远隔的；不友好的，冷淡的

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的，毗连的

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: toxic
trans: adj. 有毒的；中毒的

sentences.english: fumes from a toxic waste dump
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

detailed_translations.english: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

name: pollution
trans: n. 污染 污染物

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

name: pollutant
trans: n. 污染物

sentences.english: a dumping ground for toxic pollutants
sentences.chinese: 有毒污染物堆放场

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty, and is caused by cars, factories etc

name: contaminate
trans: vt. 污染，弄脏

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: geology
trans: n. 地质学；地质情况

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

name: border
trans: n. 边境；边界；国界 vt. 接近；与…接壤；在…上镶边 vi. 接界；近似

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: margin
trans: n. 边缘；利润，余裕；页边的空白 vt. 加边于；加旁注于

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

name: fringe
trans: n. 边缘；穗；刘海 adj. 边缘的；附加的 vt. 加穗于

sentences.english: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events

name: plate
trans: n. 碟；金属板；金属牌；感光底片 vt. 电镀；给…装甲

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: crack
trans: n. 裂缝；声变；噼啪声 adj. 最好的；高明的 vi. 破裂；爆裂 vt. 使破裂；打开；变声

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

name: gap
trans: n. 间隙；缺口；差距；分歧 vt. 使形成缺口 vi. 裂开

sentences.english: ...the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: …贫富差距。

detailed_translations.english: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

name: splendid
trans: adj. 辉煌的；灿烂的；极好的；杰出的

sentences.english: a splendid idea
sentences.chinese: 很妙的主意

sentences.english: a splendid opportunity
sentences.chinese: 绝佳的机会

sentences.english: The staff are doing a splendid job.
sentences.chinese: 员工们干得非常棒。

detailed_translations.english: very good

name: grand
trans: n. 大钢琴；一千美元 adj. 宏伟的；豪华的；极重要的

sentences.english: a grand country house
sentences.chinese: 豪华的乡间大宅

sentences.english: The party was a grand affair.
sentences.chinese: 这个聚会场面隆重。

sentences.english: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

detailed_translations.english: big and very impressive

name: magnificent
trans: adj. 高尚的；壮丽的；华丽的；宏伟的

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: super
trans: n. 特级品，特大号；临时雇员 adj. 特级的；极好的

sentences.english: an old car in super condition
sentences.chinese: 一辆状况极好的旧车

sentences.english: That sounds super.
sentences.chinese: 那听起来棒极了。

sentences.english: What a super idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意太妙了！

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

detailed_translations.chinese: 特级品，特大号；临时雇员

name: interesting
trans: adj. 有趣的；引起兴趣的，令人关注的

sentences.english: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.english: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.chinese: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.english: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.chinese: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.english: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.chinese: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

detailed_translations.english: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

name: dramatic
trans: adj. 戏剧的；急剧的；引人注目的；激动人心的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: wilderness
trans: n. 荒地；大量，茫茫一片

sentences.english: ...the icy Canadian wilderness.
sentences.chinese: …冰封的加拿大荒野。

detailed_translations.english: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people

name: desert
trans: n. 沙漠；荒原；应得的赏罚 vt. 遗弃；放弃；逃跑 adj. 沙漠的；荒凉的；不毛的 vi. 遗弃；开小差；逃掉

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

name: deforest
trans: vt. 采伐森林；清除…上的树林

name: barren
trans: n. 荒地 adj. 贫瘠的；不生育的；无益的；沉闷无趣的；空洞的

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

name: fertile
trans: adj. 富饶的，肥沃的；能生育的

sentences.english: the product of a fertile imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力丰富的产物

detailed_translations.english: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

name: fertilise
trans: vt. 使受精；施肥于；使肥沃

detailed_translations.chinese: 使肥沃， 使多产； 施肥于； 使受精

name: solar
trans: n. 日光浴室 adj. 太阳的；日光的；利用太阳光的；与太阳相关的

sentences.english: a solar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 日食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sun

name: lunar
trans: adj. 月亮的，月球的；阴历的；银的；微亮的

sentences.english: studies of the lunar surface
sentences.chinese: 对月球表面的研究

sentences.english: a lunar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 月食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

name: calendar
trans: n. 日历；[天] 历法；日程表 vt. 将…列入表中；将…排入日程表

sentences.english: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

name: sunrise
trans: n. 日出；黎明

sentences.english: a picture of sunrise over Mount Fuji
sentences.chinese: 富士山日出的照片

detailed_translations.english: the time when the sun first appears in the morning

name: sunset
trans: n. 日落，傍晚

sentences.english: a glorious sunset
sentences.chinese: 壮丽的日落景象

detailed_translations.english: the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

name: eclipse
trans: n. 日蚀，月蚀；黯然失色 vt. 使黯然失色；形成蚀

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

name: dusk
trans: n. 黄昏，薄暮；幽暗，昏暗 vt. 使变微暗 adj. 微暗的 vi. 变微暗

sentences.english: The street lights go on at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在黄昏时亮起来。

detailed_translations.english: the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright

name: heaven
trans: n. 天堂；天空；极乐

sentences.english: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

sentences.english: He looked up towards the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 他仰望苍穹。

detailed_translations.english: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

name: paradise
trans: n. 天堂 至福境地

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: sunshine
trans: n. 阳光；愉快；晴天；快活

sentences.english: We had three days of spring sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们享受了三天的春日阳光。

detailed_translations.english: the light and heat that come from the sun when there is no cloud

name: shade
trans: n. 树荫；阴影；阴凉处；遮阳物；（照片等的）明暗度；少量、些微；细微的差别 vt. 使阴暗；使渐变；为…遮阳；使阴郁；掩盖 vi. （颜色、色彩等）渐变

sentences.english: a delicate/pale/rich/soft shade of red
sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

name: shadow
trans: n. 阴影；影子；幽灵；庇护；隐蔽处 adj. 影子内阁的 vt. 遮蔽；使朦胧；尾随；预示 vi. 渐变；变阴暗

sentences.english: the long dark shadow of an old oak tree
sentences.chinese: 一棵老橡树长长的影子

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴影；影子；幽灵；庇护；隐蔽处
detailed_translations.english: the dark shape that someone or something makes on a surface when they are between that surface and the light
to follow someone closely in order to watch what they are doing
the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government

name: vapour
trans: n. 蒸气（等于vapor）；水蒸气

sentences.english: water vapour
sentences.chinese: 水蒸气

detailed_translations.english: a mass of very small drops of a liquid which float in the air, for example because the liquid has been heated

name: evaporate
trans: vt. 使……蒸发；使……脱水；使……消失 vi. 蒸发，挥发；消失，失踪

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: circulate
trans: vt. 使循环；使流通；使传播 vi. 传播，流传；循环；流通

sentences.english: Swimming helps to get the blood circulating through the muscles.
sentences.chinese: 游泳有助于肌肉的血液循环。

sentences.english: Ceiling fans circulated warm air around the room.
sentences.chinese: 吊扇使暖空气在房间里循环。

detailed_translations.english: to move around within a system, or to make something do this
to move around within a system, or to make something do this

name: precipitate
trans: n. [化学] 沉淀物 vt. 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入 adj. 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的 vi. [化学] 沉淀；猛地落下；冷凝成为雨或雪等

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
detailed_translations.english: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
detailed_translations.english: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible

name: reservoir
trans: n. 水库；蓄水池

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

name: waterfall
trans: n. 瀑布；瀑布似的东西

sentences.english: ...Angel Falls, the world's highest waterfall.
sentences.chinese: …安赫尔瀑布，世界上最高的瀑布。

detailed_translations.english: a place where water from a river or stream falls down over a cliff or rock

name: fountain
trans: n. 喷泉，泉水；源泉

sentences.english: The fountain wells its cold water.
sentences.chinese: 喷泉涌出清凉的泉水。

sentences.english: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

detailed_translations.english: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park

name: spring
trans: n. 春天；弹簧；泉水；活力；跳跃 adj. 春天的 vt. 使跳起；使爆炸；突然提出；使弹开 vi. 生长；涌出；跃出；裂开

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: dew
trans: n. 珠，滴；露水；清新 vt. （露水等）弄湿 vi. 结露水

sentences.english: The dew gathered on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 露水在叶片上聚集。

detailed_translations.english: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night

name: pour
trans: n. 倾泻；流出；骤雨 vt. 灌，注；倒；倾泻；倾吐 vi. 倾泻；涌流；斟茶

sentences.english: She poured coffee for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

name: drain
trans: n. 排水；下水道，排水管；消耗 vt. 喝光，耗尽；使流出；排掉水 vi. 排水；流干

sentences.english: He flushed the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他用水冲排水沟。

sentences.english: The boat drifted helplessly along the drain until some people saw him.
sentences.chinese: 船儿无助地顺着排水沟漂流直到有人看见他。

detailed_translations.english: something that continuously uses a lot of time, money etc

name: drip
trans: n. 水滴，滴水声；静脉滴注；使人厌烦的人 vt. 使滴下；溢出，发出 vi. 滴下；充满；漏下

sentences.english: The tap’s dripping .
sentences.chinese: 水龙头在滴水。

sentences.english: Her boots were muddy and her hair was dripping.
sentences.chinese: 她的靴子沾满了泥，头发在滴水。

sentences.english: Water was dripping through the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 水正透过天花板滴下来。

sentences.english: I put some plastic buckets on the floor to catch the drips.
sentences.chinese: 我把几个塑料桶放在地板上接滴下来的水。

detailed_translations.english: to let liquid fall in drops
one of the drops of liquid that fall from something

name: drown
trans: vt. 淹没；把…淹死 vi. 淹死；溺死

sentences.english: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。

sentences.english: Jane was drowned in the river.
sentences.chinese: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

detailed_translations.english: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

name: blow
trans: n. 吹；打击；殴打 vt. 风吹 vi. 风吹；喘气

sentences.english: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.english: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.english: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.chinese: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

name: puff
trans: n. 粉扑；泡芙；蓬松；一阵喷烟；肿块；吹嘘，宣传广告 vt. 喷出，张开；使膨胀；夸张；使骄傲自满 vi. 膨胀；张开；鼓吹；夸张

sentences.english: Steam puffed out of the chimney.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽从烟囱里一股一股地喷出来。

sentences.english: The boiler was puffing thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 锅炉一股股地冒出浓浓的黑烟。

sentences.english: Don’t puff smoke into my face.
sentences.chinese: 别把烟朝我脸上喷。

sentences.english: I took a puff on the cigarette and started coughing.
sentences.chinese: 我抽了一口烟就开始咳嗽起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷出，张开；使膨胀；夸张；使骄傲自满
detailed_translations.english: if smoke, steam etc puffs from somewhere, or if something puffs it, it comes out in little clouds

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉扑；泡芙；蓬松；一阵喷烟；肿块；吹嘘，宣传广告
detailed_translations.english: Puff is also a noun

name: gush
trans: n. 涌出；迸发 v. 涌出；迸出

sentences.english: All that pent-up frustration gushed out in a torrent of abuse.
sentences.chinese: 所有压抑着的失望与不快通过一阵痛骂全都发泄了出来。

detailed_translations.english: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly
a large quantity of something, usually a liquid, that suddenly pours out of something

name: dense
trans: adj. 稠密的；浓厚的；愚钝的

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: intensity
trans: n. 强度；强烈；[电子] 亮度；紧张

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: intensive
trans: n. 加强器 adj. 加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: emerge
trans: vi. 浮现；摆脱；暴露

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: flash
trans: n. 闪光，闪现；一瞬间 adj. 闪光的，火速的 vt. 使闪光；反射 vi. 闪光，闪现；反射

sentences.english: Two flashes mean danger.
sentences.chinese: 两次闪光表示危险。

sentences.english: Lightning flashed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 头顶上电光闪闪。

detailed_translations.english: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

name: float
trans: n. 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍 vi. 浮动；飘动，散播；摇摆；付诸实施 vt. 使漂浮；实行

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

name: environment
trans: n. 环境，外界

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: surrounding
trans: n. 环境，周围的事物 adj. 周围的，附近的

sentences.english: Troops sealed off the surrounding area .
sentences.chinese: 军队封锁了周围地区。

sentences.english: We decided to explore the surrounding countryside .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定去附近的乡间走走看看。

detailed_translations.english: near or around a particular place

name: condition
trans: n. 条件；情况；环境；身份 vt. 决定；使适应；使健康；以…为条件

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: situation
trans: n. 情况；形势；处境；位置

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: nature
trans: n. 自然；性质；本性；种类

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的；物质的；天生的；不做作的 n. 自然的事情；白痴；本位音

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: artificial
trans: adj. 人造的；仿造的；虚伪的；非原产地的；武断的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: synthetic
trans: n. 合成物 adj. 综合的；合成的，人造的

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

name: petrol
trans: n. （英）汽油

sentences.english: unleaded petrol
sentences.chinese: 无铅汽油

sentences.english: petrol prices
sentences.chinese: 汽油价格

sentences.english: The petrol tank is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 油箱漏了。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid obtained from  petroleum that is used to supply power to the engine of cars and other vehicles

name: gas
trans: n. 气体；[矿业] 瓦斯；汽油；毒气 vt. 加油；毒（死） vi. 加油；放出气体；空谈

sentences.english: hydrogen gas
sentences.chinese: 氢气

sentences.english: Can you light the gas for me?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我点燃煤气好吗？

sentences.english: I probably spend over 200 a month on gas.
sentences.chinese: 我一个月大概要花200多美元汽油钱。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen

name: gasoline
trans: n. 汽油

sentences.english: They ran short of gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 他们的汽油不够了。

sentences.english: It smelled like gasoline and flowers mixed together.
sentences.chinese: “咦~~~~”难闻死了，像是汽油和花香混在一起。

sentences.english: This system traps the gasoline vapor escaping from the fuel tank and carburetor .
sentences.chinese: 这个系统能收集从燃油箱和化油器泄漏出来的汽油蒸气。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid obtained from petroleum, used mainly for producing power in the engines of cars, trucks etc

name: petroleum
trans: n. 石油

sentences.english: petroleum-based products
sentences.chinese: 石油产品

detailed_translations.english: oil that is obtained from below the surface of the Earth and is used to make petrol,  paraffin  , and various chemical substances

name: photosynthesis
trans: n. 光合作用

sentences.english: It has at least one gene necessary for photosynthesis—so far it’s the only animal known with this ability.
sentences.chinese: 它有至少一个基因是光合作用所必需的——到目前为止这是唯一被发现具有此项能力的动物。

sentences.english: The belt of vegetation that crosses Africa below the Sahara is very dark because most of the sunlight is absorbed by plants for photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉沙漠下方，横贯非洲中部的植被带颜色非常深，因为植物由于光合作用吸收了大多数太阳光。

sentences.english: As the ocean warms, it becomes more stratified, with the warmer water remaining at the top where the organisms need to be in order to do photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着海水变暖，它的层次会更加分明，温度更高的海水会停留在表面，而这里正是生物体进行光合作用必需的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

name: respire
trans: vt. 呼吸 vi. 呼吸

sentences.english: Because I wish I can respire the natural fresh air during exercise , which is more health and benefit to my body.
sentences.chinese: 因为我喜欢在运动的同时能呼吸到大自然的清新空气，这样更健康，更有益。

sentences.english: He also discovered that plants respire in the same way as animals, taking up oxygen and giving out carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 另外，他还发现了植物拥有和动物相同的呼吸方式，即吸收氧气并释放出二氧化碳。

sentences.english: Some products, such as asparagus, corn, and strawberries, respire at a higher rate than other products, such as apples, oranges, and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 一些农产品，比如芦笋、玉米和草莓，与其它农产品（如苹果、桔子和马铃薯）相比，其呼吸速率较大。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe

name: dioxide
trans: n. 二氧化物

sentences.english: carbon/sulphur dioxide
sentences.chinese: 二氧化碳／硫

detailed_translations.english: a chemical compound that contains two atoms of oxygen and one atom of another chemical element

name: vegetation
trans: n. 植被；植物，草木；呆板单调的生活

sentences.english: Lefkas has an abundance of lush green vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 莱夫卡斯有葱郁茂盛的植被。

detailed_translations.chinese: 植被；植物，草木；呆板单调的生活
detailed_translations.english: plants in general

name: herb
trans: n. 香草，药草

sentences.english: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
sentences.chinese: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

detailed_translations.english: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

name: perennial
trans: n. 多年生植物 adj. 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的

sentences.english: Lack of resources has been a perennial problem since the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的
detailed_translations.english: a plant that is perennial lives for more than two years
a plant that lives for more than two years

name: botany
trans: n. 植物学；地区植物总称

sentences.english: He studied botany at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学学习植物学。

sentences.english: To what degree are you interested in botany?
sentences.chinese: 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度?

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物学领域，这些最早的著作是本草书。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of plants

name: ecology
trans: n. 生态学；社会生态学

sentences.english: the natural ecology of the Earth
sentences.chinese: 地球的自然生态

sentences.english: plant ecology
sentences.chinese: 植物生态学

detailed_translations.english: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

name: ecosystem
trans: n. 生态系统

sentences.english: ...the forest ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: …森林生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment

name: eco-friendly
trans: adj. 对生态环境友好的，不妨害生态环境的；不损坏生态环境的

sentences.english: eco-friendly products
sentences.chinese: 对环境无害的产品

detailed_translations.english: not harmful to the environment

name: horticulture
trans: n. 园艺，园艺学

sentences.english: The area has a long tradition of horticulture.
sentences.chinese: 园艺是这个地区源远流长的传统。

sentences.english: Thus, to earn a Plant Science merit badge, a scout can choose between agronomy, horticulture, or field botany.
sentences.chinese: 因此，为了赚取植物科学奖章，一个童子军可以选择农学，园艺，或田野植物学。

sentences.english: All volunteers first go through orientation sessions, which are followed with one of three more specific training tracks:horticulture, “Ambassadors, ” and animal care.
sentences.chinese: 所有的志愿者先要通过新成员训练，然后再在三种特殊训练规划（园艺、“大使”和动物照料）中选择一种。

detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of growing flowers, fruit, and vegetables

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: genetics
trans: n. 遗传学

sentences.english: Genetics is also bringing about dramatic changes in our understanding of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学也正使我们对癌症的理解发生巨大的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the study of how the qualities of living things are passed on in their genes

name: mutation
trans: n. [遗] 突变；变化；元音变化

sentences.english: The more people who have the virus, the more virus particles there are for that one, fatal mutation to appear in.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果有越多人感染到病毒，就有越多病毒颗粒可以酝酿出一种致命的突变病毒品种。

sentences.english: Analyzes the factors that influence the stretching changing in the hoisting process and put forward a method that adopting S-curve could reduce the stretching mutation.
sentences.chinese: 分析了提升过程中钢丝绳张力变化的影响因素，提出了采用S曲线速度图是可以减小张力突变的一种方法。

sentences.english: For example, it is hard to say whether an ART baby has died because of the ART technology or because one of its parents had a mutation that mutually contributed to subpar fertility and infant death.
sentences.chinese: 例如，很难说是否一个ART的宝宝会因为ART技术而死亡，或者他父母中的其中一个出现突变，这对于在平均水平以下的受精和婴儿的死亡是互相贡献的。

trans: n. 变化；[生物] 变异，变种

sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

trans: n. <主英>杂交，杂种培植，配种

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

name: evolve

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动；涨落；动摇 vt. 使波动；使动摇

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: reclaim
trans: n. 改造，感化；再生胶 vt. 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改 vi. 抗议，喊叫

sentences.english: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改
detailed_translations.english: to get back an amount of money that you have paid

name: cultivate
trans: vt. 培养；陶冶；耕作

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: sow
trans: n. 母猪 vt. 播种；散布；使密布 vi. 播种

sentences.english: Sow the seeds in late March.
sentences.chinese: 三月底播种。

detailed_translations.english: to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground
a fully grown female pig

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获；产量；结果 vt. 收割；得到 vi. 收割庄稼

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: pluck
trans: n. 勇气；内脏；快而猛的拉 vt. 摘；拔；扯 vi. 拉；拽；扯

sentences.english: It takes a lot of pluck to stand up to a bully.
sentences.chinese: 不向恃强凌弱者屈服需要很大勇气。

detailed_translations.english: courage and determination
to pull something quickly in order to remove it

name: pick
trans: n. 选择；鹤嘴锄；挖；掩护 vi. 挑选；采摘；挖 vt. 拾取；精选；采摘；掘

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: yield
trans: n. 产量；收益 vt. 屈服；出产，产生；放弃 vi. 屈服，投降

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: rear
trans: n. 后面；屁股；后方部队 adj. 后方的；后面的；背面的 vt. 培养；树立；栽种 adv. 向后；在后面 vi. 暴跳；高耸

sentences.english: It’s a good place to rear young children.
sentences.chinese: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。

sentences.english: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟笼养成功。

detailed_translations.english: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

name: arable
trans: n. 耕地 adj. 适于耕种的；可开垦的

sentences.english: arable farming
sentences.chinese: 耕作农业

sentences.english: arable land (=  land that is suitable for growing crops  )
sentences.chinese: 可耕地

detailed_translations.english: relating to growing crops

name: plough
trans: n. 犁；耕地（等于plow） vi. 用犁耕田；开路 vt. 犁；耕

sentences.english: In those days the land was plowed by oxen.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代是用公牛来犁地的。

sentences.english: a ploughed field
sentences.chinese: 犁过的地

detailed_translations.english: to turn over the earth using a plough so that seeds can be planted
a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted

name: spade
trans: n. 铁锹，铲子 vt. 铲；把……弄实抹平 vi. 铲

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

name: rake
trans: n. 耙子；斜度；钱耙；放荡的人，浪子 vt. 倾斜；搜索；掠过；用耙子耙 vi. 搜索；用耙子耙；掠过，擦过

sentences.english: The searchlight raked the open ground around the prison.
sentences.chinese: 探照灯在监狱周围的空地上来回扫射。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索；用耙子耙；掠过，擦过
detailed_translations.english: to move a rake across a surface in order to make the soil level, gather dead leaves etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 耙子；斜度；钱耙；放荡的人，浪子
detailed_translations.english: a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc

name: stack
trans: n. 堆；堆叠 vt. 使堆叠；把…堆积起来 vi. 堆积，堆叠

sentences.english: stacks of dirty dishes
sentences.chinese: 一摞摞脏盘子

sentences.english: Mrs. Cathiard was stacking the clean bottles in crates.
sentences.chinese: 卡提亚夫人当时正在把干净的瓶子堆放到板条箱里。

detailed_translations.english: a neat pile of things
If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles

name: heap
trans: n. 堆；许多；累积 vt. 堆；堆积 vi. 堆起来

sentences.english: a rubbish heap
sentences.chinese: 垃圾堆

sentences.english: We piled the branches into heaps for burning.
sentences.chinese: 我们把树枝堆起来烧。

detailed_translations.english: a large untidy pile of things
to put a lot of things on top of each other in an untidy way

name: bundle
trans: n. 束；捆 vt. 捆 vi. 匆忙离开

sentences.english: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
sentences.chinese: 一个小包袱，里面主要是衣服

detailed_translations.english: a container used to put flowers in or for decoration

trans: n. 日光

sentences.chinese: 水面在灿烂的阳光下闪闪发亮。

sentences.english: (= came in large amounts ) through the windows.

sentences.chinese: 一束阳光

detailed_translations.english: natural light that comes from the sun

name: short-day
trans: adj. 短日照的

sentences.english: So how do you kill a fungus without harming its host?
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，我们如何才能做到不伤害宿主只杀死真菌呢?。

sentences.chinese: 这种真菌的单核体在平板或液体培养时能像腐生菌那样容易生长。

sentences.chinese: 发生这样的问题是因为植物需要通过风和昆虫传递花粉进行受精繁殖。

sentences.chinese: 他说，“根据花粉和花蜜含量，几乎所有的产品标签都有问题。”

name: seed
trans: n. 种子；根据；精液；萌芽；子孙；原由 vt. 播种；结实；成熟；去…籽 vi. 播种；（植物）结实

sentences.chinese: 他在过去两年中一直是头号种子选手。

sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.chinese: 一簇开着娇嫩的粉红色花朵的美丽蔷薇

sentences.chinese: 淡粉色的花朵

sentences.chinese: 我走在草地上。

sentences.chinese: 请勿践踏草地。

sentences.chinese: 那片草地已用犁翻过。

sentences.english: The colt bounded through the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马驹跳着跑过牧场。

sentences.chinese: 很多小羊在草地上蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

If someone has olive skin, the colour of their skin is yellowish brown

name: pine
trans: n. [林] 松树；凤梨，菠萝 adj. 松木的；似松的 vt. 为…悲哀；哀悼 vi. 渴望，痛苦；憔悴

sentences.english: I pine for the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望乡下的生活。

detailed_translations.english: If you pine for something, you want it very much, especially when it is unlikely that you will be able to have it
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

name: vine
trans: n. 藤；葡萄树；藤本植物；攀缘植物 vi. 长成藤蔓；爬藤

sentences.english: Every square metre of soil was used, mainly for olives, vines, and almonds.
sentences.chinese: 每一平方米的土壤都用上了，主要是种植橄榄、葡萄藤和杏树。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藤；葡萄树；藤本植物；攀缘植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that produces grapes

name: violet
trans: n. 紫罗兰；堇菜；羞怯的人 adj. 紫色的；紫罗兰色的

sentences.english: She inhaled the violet perfume, saying “How sweet!”
sentences.chinese: 她一边闻紫罗兰的芳香， 一边说“好香啊！”

detailed_translations.english: a plant with small dark purple flowers, or sometimes white or yellow ones

name: tulip
trans: n. 郁金香

sentences.english: He rooted the tulip bulbs in potting soil.
sentences.chinese: 他把郁金香的鳞茎种在盆栽用土中使其生根。

sentences.english: Finance has a history of messing up, from the Dutch tulip bubble in 1637 to now.
sentences.chinese: 从1637年的荷兰郁金香狂热至今，金融业讲述着一个一团糟的历史。

detailed_translations.english: a brightly coloured flower that is shaped like a cup and grows from a  bulb  in spring

name: mint
trans: n. 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款 vt. 铸造，铸币 adj. 完美的

sentences.english: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
sentences.chinese: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯

sentences.english: roast lamb with mint sauce
sentences.chinese: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉

sentences.english: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
sentences.chinese: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款
detailed_translations.english: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
to make a coin
looking new and in perfect condition

name: reef
trans: n. 暗礁；[地质] 矿脉；收帆 vt. 收帆；缩帆 vi. 缩帆；收帆

sentences.english: a proposal to protect several miles of thousand-year-old coral reef
sentences.chinese: 保护绵延数英里的千年古珊瑚礁的提案

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗礁；[地质] 矿脉；收帆
detailed_translations.english: a line of sharp rocks, often made of  coral  , or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea
to tie up part of a sail in order to make it smaller

name: alga
trans: n. 水藻

sentences.english: Even more strangely, the researchers think the salamanders might inherit the alga from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 更奇怪的是，研究人员认为这些海藻是火蜥蜴从它们父母那里继承来的。

sentences.english: The town is the centre of a black-market trade in facai, a species of alga whose name is spelt and pronounced similarly to 'get rich'.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇是一个发菜黑市交易的中心。 发菜是一种藻类，在汉语里它的写法和发音类似于“发财”。

name: enzyme
trans: n. [生化] 酶

sentences.english: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.chinese: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.english: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.chinese: 这种酶在幼虫体内积累到一定浓度，就会变得有毒并杀死它们。

sentences.english: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.chinese: 虽然表面上是这样，CYP2E1却影响着大脑对酒精的敏感度，或许因为它—不像在肝脏中的酶—产生了自由基，能损害细胞的微小分子。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal

name: catalyst
trans: n. [物化] 催化剂；刺激因素

sentences.english: I very much hope that this case will prove to be a catalyst for change.
sentences.chinese: 我非常希望这件事终将成为促成变化的催化剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without being changed itself

name: release
trans: n. 释放；发布；让与 vt. 释放；发射；让与；允许发表

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: emission
trans: n. （光、热等的）发射，散发；喷射；发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: exceed
trans: vt. 超过；胜过 vi. 超过其他

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: uptake
trans: n. 摄取；领会；举起

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物 adj. 营养的；滋养的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: energy
trans: n. [物] 能量；精力；活力；精神

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: surroundings
trans: n. 环境；周围的事物

sentences.english: I need to work in pleasant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 我需要在舒适的环境下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the objects, buildings, natural things etc that are around a person or thing at a particular time

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；原理，途径；进程；机械装置；技巧

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: counterbalance
trans: n. 平衡力；自动抵销 vt. 使平衡；抵消

sentences.english: Riskier investments tend to be counterbalanced by high rewards.
sentences.chinese: 较高风险的投资往往报以高回报。

sentences.english: ...organizations set up as a counterbalance to groups allied to the ANC.
sentences.chinese: ...作为对与非洲人国民大会联盟团体制衡而成立的各种组织。

detailed_translations.english: to have an equal and opposite effect to something such as a change, feeling etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 平衡量， 平衡力； 势均力敌
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a counterbalance to something else counterbalances that thing

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品 vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: conservation
trans: n. 保存，保持；保护

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: bush fire
trans: n. 野火；山林大火

name: extinguish
trans: vt. 熄灭；压制；偿清

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

name: destruct
trans: n. 自毁 为可自毁而设计的 vi. 自毁

name: ruin
trans: n. 废墟；毁坏；灭亡 vt. 毁灭；使破产 vi. 破产；堕落；被毁灭

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed

name: perish
trans: vi. 死亡；毁灭；腐烂；枯萎 vt. 使麻木；毁坏

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

name: demolish
trans: vt. 拆除；破坏；毁坏；推翻；驳倒

sentences.english: The entire east wing of the building was demolished in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的整个东翼都被大火烧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a building

trans: vt. 侵犯；违反；破坏 vi. 侵犯；侵害

sentences.english: A backup copy of a computer program does not infringe copyright.
sentences.chinese: 计算机程序的备份不侵犯版权。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is against a law or someone’s legal rights

name: undermine

sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝；消失；消灭；废止

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing
