trans: n. 模式；图案；样品 vt. 模仿；以图案装饰 vi. 形成图案

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，结局；成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: impact
trans: vi. 影响；撞击；冲突；压紧（on，upon，with） n. 影响；效果；碰撞；冲击力 vt. 挤入，压紧；撞击；对…产生影响

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: seasonal
trans: adj. 季节的；周期性的；依照季节的

sentences.english: heavy seasonal rains
sentences.chinese: 季节性的大雨

detailed_translations.chinese: 季节的；周期性的；依照季节的
detailed_translations.english: happening, expected, or needed during a particular season

name: experimental
trans: adj. 实验的；根据实验的；试验性的

sentences.english: experimental teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 试验性教学方法

detailed_translations.english: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have

name: favourable
trans: n. 有利 adj. 有利的，顺利的；赞成的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

sentences.english: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
sentences.chinese: 这种病在合适的条件下会传播得很快。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: effective
trans: adj. 有效的，起作用的；实际的，实在的；给人深刻印象

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: efficient
trans: adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大的；重要的，值得考虑的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: massive
trans: adj. 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: maximal
trans: adj. 最高的，最大的；最全面的

name: minimal
trans: adj. 最低的；最小限度的

sentences.english: The storm caused only minimal damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.english: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.english: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

name: optimal
trans: adj. 最佳的；最理想的

sentences.english: Why do we need optimal sleep?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么需要最佳的睡眠？

sentences.english: However, if you want optimal shadow quality and performance, there are some additional things to consider.
sentences.chinese: 不过，如果你想要最佳的阴影质量和性能，有一些其他的事情要考虑。

sentences.english: Although the optimal user path is a straight line from search and results to customization and purchase, the interface offers several detours from this route.
sentences.chinese: 尽管最佳的用户路径是从搜索和结果到定制和购买的直线路径，但该界面却提供了一些迂回的路径。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable

name: biologist
trans: n. 生物学家

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or works in biology

name: zoologist
trans: n. 动物学家

sentences.english: “This is a classic example of freak events coinciding,” noted Peter Boeckmann, a leading Norwegian zoologist. “In the United States, the reaction is: 'Oh no, doomsday is coming!
sentences.chinese: “这是一个典型的同时发生的反常事件，”挪威重要动物学家彼德.伯格曼解释说，“在美国，这原因是'哦，不，末日来了！'

sentences.english: Barja, an Autonomous University of Madrid zoologist, inspected wolf scat in a mountainous region of Spain's northwest Iberian Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 一个马德里自治大学的动物学家，研究了西班牙伊比利亚半岛西北部一个多山地区嚎叫的狼。

sentences.english: Kay E.Holekamp, a zoologist atMichigan State University, writes from the Masai Mara National Reserve inKenya, where she is studying the behavior of spotted hyenas.
sentences.chinese: 凯 E. 哈乐凯普，密歇根州立大学的动物学家，写于肯尼亚的马赛马拉国家保护区，此时正在那里研究斑点鬣狗的行为。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies animals and their behaviour

name: ecologist
trans: n. 生态学者

sentences.english: Ecologists argue that the benefits of treating sewage with disinfectants are doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 生态学家们认为用消毒剂处理污水的好处是值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies ecology

name: botanist
trans: n. 植物学家

sentences.english: A botanist can differentiate varieties of plants.
sentences.chinese: 植物学家能区分各种不同的植物。

sentences.english: Along with English botanist Joseph Hooker, Lyell was one of a small handful of people Darwin had shown early drafts of his own work on natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 同英国植物学家约瑟夫·胡克一样，莱尔是少数了解达尔文在自然选择学说方面研究的早期草稿的人之一。

sentences.english: Forty-five years on, the French botanist's gardens have grown massive in scale.
sentences.chinese: 四十五年过去，这法国植物学家的花园规模更大。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make scientific studies of wild plants

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: primate
trans: n. 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领 adj. 灵长目动物的；首要的

sentences.english: The woolly spider monkey is the largest primate in the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 绒毛蛛猴是美洲最大的灵长目动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领
detailed_translations.english: a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys

name: vertebrate
trans: adj. 脊椎动物的；有脊椎的 n. 脊椎动物

sentences.english: Because these cells are among the largest in the vertebrate brain, they were the first neurons to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些细胞是脊椎动物大脑中最大的细胞，它们是最早被识别出来的神经元。

sentences.english: Zoonoses are defined by the WHO as “Any disease or infection which is naturally transmissible from vertebrate animals to man".
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织将人畜共患病定义为“任何自然地从脊椎动物传播到人类的疾病或传染病”。

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that has a backbone

name: reptile
trans: n. 爬行动物；卑鄙的人 adj. 爬虫类的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: amphibian
trans: n. [脊椎] 两栖动物；水陆两用飞机；具有双重性格的人 adj. 两栖类的；[车辆] 水陆两用的；具有双重性格的

sentences.english: At first this amphibian deals with the cooler days by burying itself in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.english: "Almost all of them were abandoned somewhere in the city, " said Wu Weichun, the director of the zoo's amphibian department, to the Shanghai Dailynewspaper.
sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

name: carnivore
trans: n. [动] 食肉动物；食虫植物

sentences.english: This is a delicious vegetarian dish that even carnivores love.
sentences.chinese: 这是一道肉食者们都喜欢的美味素食。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that eats flesh

name: herbivore
trans: n. [动] 食草动物

sentences.english: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.chinese: 相对地，食草动物的肉闻起来要好些，更易食用。

sentences.english: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.chinese: 我只吃蔬菜(科学家称我为草食动物)—几乎常常是树梢的叶子。

sentences.english: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.chinese: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that only eats plants

name: creature
trans: n. 动物，生物；人；创造物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: wildlife
trans: n. 野生动植物 adj. 野生动植物的

sentences.english: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
sentences.chinese: 保护该地区野生生物的措施

sentences.english: the destruction of wildlife habitats
sentences.chinese: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

detailed_translations.english: animals and plants growing in natural conditions

name: fauna
trans: n. 动物群；[动] 动物区系

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

name: flora
trans: n. 植物区系；植物群

sentences.english: Tourism is damaging the flora and fauna (= plants and animals ) of the island.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业正在破坏该岛的动植物资源。

detailed_translations.english: all the plants that grow in a particular place or country

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类 adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: flock
trans: n. 群；棉束（等于floc） vi. 聚集；成群而行 vt. 用棉束填满

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: herd
trans: n. 兽群，畜群；放牧人 vt. 放牧；使成群 vi. 成群，聚在一起

sentences.english: Chobe is also renowned for its large herds of elephant and buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 乔贝还以其大群的大象和水牛而闻名。

sentences.english: It was Tom’s duty to herd the cows.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的职责是放牛。

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
to make animals move together in a group

name: swarm
trans: n. 蜂群；一大群 vi. 挤满；成群浮游；云集 vt. 挤满；爬

sentences.english: Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

detailed_translations.english: If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way
a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

name: throng
trans: n. 人群；众多 vt. 群集；挤满 vi. 蜂拥而至；群集 adj. 拥挤的

sentences.english: She got lost in the throng.
sentences.chinese: 她在人群中迷路了。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people in one place
if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers

name: crowd
trans: n. 群众

sentences.english: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.chinese: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.english: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.chinese: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.english: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.english: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.english: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

name: beast
trans: n. 野兽；畜生，人面兽心的人

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

name: brute
trans: n. 畜生；残暴的人 adj. 残忍的；无理性的

sentences.english: The brute fact is that the situation will not improve.
sentences.chinese: 情况不会好转，这是赤裸裸的事实。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is cruel, violent, and not sensitive

name: cruel
trans: adj. 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

name: originate
trans: vt. 引起；创作 vi. 发源；发生；起航

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

name: derive
trans: vt. 源于；得自；获得 vi. 起源

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: stem
trans: n. 干；茎；船首；血统 vt. 阻止；除去…的茎；给…装柄 vi. 阻止；起源于某事物；逆行

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔；子孙 adj. 下降的；祖传的

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: offspring
trans: n. 后代，子孙；产物

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: subgroup
trans: n. 小群；隶属的小组织 vt. 给…加副标题

sentences.english: The Action Group worked by dividing its tasks among a large number of subgroups.
sentences.chinese: 行动小组将任务分配给多个隶属的小组以完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: A subgroup is a group that is part of a larger group

name: feed
trans: n. 饲料；饲养；（动物或婴儿的）一餐 vt. 喂养；供给；放牧；抚养（家庭等）；靠…为生 vi. 吃东西；流入

sentences.english: Have you fed the cat?
sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: breed
trans: n. [生物] 品种；种类，类型 vt. 繁殖；饲养；养育，教育；引起 vi. 繁殖；饲养；产生

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: interbreed
trans: vt. 异种交配；混种；使品种间杂交 vi. 异种交配；混种；杂种繁殖

name: hybridise
trans: v. <主英>（使）杂交

name: proliferate
trans: vi. 增殖；扩散；激增 vt. 使激增

sentences.english: Computer courses continue to proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 计算机课程层出不穷。

detailed_translations.english: if something proliferates, it increases quickly and spreads to many different places

name: sterility
trans: n. [泌尿] 不育；[妇产] 不孕；无菌；不毛；内容贫乏

detailed_translations.chinese: [泌尿] 不育；[妇产] 不孕；无菌；不毛；内容贫乏

name: mate
trans: n. 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物 vt. 使配对；使一致；结伴 vi. 交配；成配偶；紧密配合

sentences.english: He has found his ideal mate.
sentences.chinese: 他已经找到了理想的配偶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物
detailed_translations.english: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

name: courtship
trans: n. 求爱；求婚；求爱期

sentences.english: courtship rituals
sentences.chinese: 求偶仪式

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which a man and woman have a romantic relationship before marrying

name: lay
trans: vt. 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷 adj. 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的 n. 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴 vi. 下蛋；打赌 v. 躺；位于（lie的过去式）

sentences.english: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。

sentences.english: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

detailed_translations.chinese: 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴
detailed_translations.english: a poem or song

name: hatch
trans: n. 孵化；舱口 vt. 孵；策划 vi. 孵化

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: brood
trans: n. 一窝；一伙 vt. 孵；沉思

sentences.english: ...a hungry brood of fledglings.
sentences.chinese: …一窝饥饿的雏鸟。

detailed_translations.english: a family of young birds all born at the same time
if a bird broods, it sits on its eggs to make the young birds break out

name: spawn
trans: n. 卵；菌丝；产物 vt. 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产 vi. 产卵；大量生产

sentences.english: ...her passion for collecting frog spawn.
sentences.chinese: ...她对采蛙卵的热爱。

detailed_translations.english: the eggs of a fish or  frog  laid together in a soft mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产
detailed_translations.english: to make a series of things happen or start to exist

name: mature
trans: adj. 成熟的；充分考虑的；到期的；成年人的 vi. 成熟；到期 vt. 使…成熟；使…长成；慎重作出

sentences.english: Laura is very mature for her age.
sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.english: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
to become fully grown or developed

name: skin
trans: n. 皮肤；外皮 vt. 剥皮 vi. 愈合；长皮

sentences.english: She had thick black hair and smooth dark skin.
sentences.chinese: 她一头浓密的黑发，皮肤黝黑光滑。

sentences.english: The skin on his hands was dry and rough.
sentences.chinese: 他手上的皮肤干燥粗糙。

detailed_translations.english: the natural outer layer of a person’s or animal’s body
to remove the skin from an animal, fruit, or vegetable

name: claw
trans: n. 爪；螯，钳；爪形器具 vi. 用爪抓（或挖） vt. 用爪抓（或挖）

sentences.english: The cat dug his claws into my leg.
sentences.chinese: 猫的爪子抓进了我的腿中。

sentences.english: lobster claws
sentences.chinese: 龙虾的螯

detailed_translations.english: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects
to tear or pull at something, using claws or your fingers

name: paw
trans: n. 爪子；手 vt. 抓，扒；亲昵地抚摸 vi. 用爪子抓；翻找

sentences.english: His horse pawed the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他的马刨着地面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用爪子抓， 用蹄扒； 翻找
detailed_translations.english: if an animal paws a surface, it touches or rubs one place several times with its paw
an animal’s foot that has nails or  claw s

name: beak
trans: n. [鸟] 鸟嘴；鹰钩鼻子；地方执法官；男教师

sentences.english: ...a black bird with a yellow beak.
sentences.chinese: …一只有着黄喙的黑鸟。

detailed_translations.english: the hard pointed mouth of a bird

name: fin
trans: n. 鳍；鱼翅；鳍状物 vt. 切除鳍；装上翅 vi. 猛挥鳍；潜泳

sentences.english: As a fossil hunter, Shubin distinguished himself by leading an expedition to the Arctic in 2004 which uncovered the remains of a fish with a wrist, a creature with part fin, part limb.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名化石搜寻者，舒宾的杰出成就是在2004年带领了一次北极探险。 在这次探险中，他们发现了一种半鳍半肢的动物——一条有腕的鱼化石。

sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚为这次活动卷了头发。

sentences.chinese: …一种使安全软件失灵的新型计算机蠕虫病毒。

sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

sentences.chinese: 同样的，按这些研究者的逻辑，男性蜘蛛恐惧者每次看到蜘蛛爬过桌子都应该下身瘙痒咯？

sentences.chinese: 雄蚊不叮。

sentences.english: Are your mosquito bites still itching?
sentences.chinese: 你被蚊子咬的地方还痒吗?

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

sentences.chinese: 那男孩用他的刀子换了一个板球棒。

sentences.chinese: 他去问小鸟们，知不知道小企鹅是从哪里来的啊，可是她们却睬都不睬他。

sentences.english: Perhaps we cannot relate to the severe conditions enduring by the Emperor penguin, but each of us knows what it means to sit on our own versions of ice and egg.
sentences.chinese: 可能我们无法理解国王企鹅所忍受的严酷环境与我们有何关联，但我们每一个人都知道在冰上孵育自己的蛋代表什么意思。

sentences.chinese: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

sentences.chinese: 他揭去封蜡，把纸卷展开。

sentences.english: The window was sealed shut.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

sentences.chinese: 像乌龟一样慢慢跑。

sentences.english: a five-month old lion cub
sentences.chinese: 五个月大的幼狮

sentences.chinese: …一处小腿的伤。

sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬幼崽

sentences.english: a litter of pups
sentences.chinese: 一窝小狗

sentences.english: roast lamb

detailed_translations.english: male; masculine

detailed_translations.chinese: 企图抬高证券价格；吓唬；强力实现

sentences.chinese: 猎人在灌木丛中追踪那只受伤的美洲野牛。

sentences.chinese: 为了提醒美国公民保护环境，政府就发行了这种野牛镍币。

sentences.chinese: 或许有一天，人类会组织生活社区，在那里鹿、野牛、麋鹿、熊、大象、长颈鹿和河马会再一次自由倘佯。

sentences.chinese: 一辆马车

sentences.english: Lee had never ridden a horse before.
sentences.chinese: 李以前从未骑过马。

sentences.chinese: 狮子咬断了那头斑马的脖子。

sentences.chinese: 可是如果那匹马突然长出了斑马的条纹呢？

sentences.english: Sixty acres of woods and ponds are home to camels, zebra, bison, water buffalo, ostrich and antelope.
sentences.chinese: 六十英亩的森林和池塘是骆驼，斑马，野牛，水牛，鸵鸟和羚羊的家园。

sentences.chinese: 她能给马备鞍并没有什么值得惊讶的。

sentences.english: Thee bike's frame, wheels, handlebars and saddle are all made of cardboard in this way, and then fitted together.
sentences.chinese: 自行车的车架、车轮、车把和车座都用以此方式制造的纸板制成，然后组装在一起。

name: falcon
trans: n. [鸟] 猎鹰；[鸟] 隼

sentences.english: Animals representing mythical powers and military might surrounded him—pumas, a wolf, eagles, a falcon, an owl, and rattlesnakes—some buried alive in cages.
sentences.chinese: 一些动物作为神和军事的力量的象征置放在他的周围——美洲狮、狼、鹰、隼、猫头鹰、响尾蛇——装在笼子里一起活埋。

detailed_translations.english: a bird that kills and eats other animals and can be trained to hunt

name: hawk
trans: n. 鹰；鹰派成员；掠夺他人的人 vi. 清嗓；咳嗽；像鹰一般地袭击 vt. 兜售，沿街叫卖；捕捉；咳出

sentences.english: Oil thieves sometimes hawk stolen gasoline on the side of highways.
sentences.chinese: 石油大盗们有时在公路边上兜售偷来的石油。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them

name: eagle
trans: n. 鹰；鹰状标饰

sentences.english: The eagle drooped its wings.
sentences.chinese: 那只鹰收拢双翅做俯冲。

sentences.english: Maybe they could not hold on to the arrival of the spring, but the female eagle thought what if their father could bring back the food?
sentences.chinese: 它们或许已经挨不到春天的到来了。 雌鹰这样想，但如果它们的爸爸会把食物带来呢？

sentences.english: She lacks the skill to accomplish this, but recognizes that an eagle can help her.
sentences.chinese: 她缺乏完成这项任务的能力，不过她认识到老鹰可以帮助她。

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

name: owl
trans: n. 猫头鹰；枭；惯于晚上活动的人

sentences.english: Some of the more extreme contacts give you "cat eyes" or how about "owl eyes"?
sentences.chinese: 一些更酷的隐形眼镜可以给你一双"猫眼"或者是"猫头鹰的眼睛"。

sentences.english: A great owl, with yellow sulphurous eyes, called to him by his name, but he made it no answer.
sentences.chinese: 一只长着黄色硫磺的巨大眼睛的猫头鹰，呼唤着他的名字，但他没有应答。

detailed_translations.english: a bird with large eyes that hunts at night

name: swallow
trans: n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量 vt. 忍受；吞没 vi. 吞下；咽下

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: sparrow
trans: n. 麻雀；矮小的人

sentences.english: The myrtle, dove, sparrow, and swan are sacred to her.
sentences.chinese: 桃金娘，鸽子，麻雀和天鹅是她的圣物。

sentences.english: Appearing in great danger, the tiny sparrow tumbled on to the lawn, but softy Flint appeared to have taken pity on him.
sentences.chinese: 跌落在草地上的小麻雀看起来处于非常危险的境地，但是温柔的“弗林特”似乎非常同情他。

sentences.english: Only a solitary cracked-voiced reed-sparrow greeted her from the bushes by the river, in a sad, machine-made tone, resembling that of a past friend whose friendship she had outworn.
sentences.chinese: 只有一只声音嘶哑的芦雀，在河边的树丛中用悲伤机械的音调向她打招呼，就像一个已经没有了友谊的从前的朋友向她打招呼的声音一样。

detailed_translations.english: a small brown bird, very common in many parts of the world

name: pigeon
trans: n. 鸽子

sentences.english: Many journalists here choose to pigeon all but the most innocuous of stories.
sentences.chinese: 除了平淡乏味的报道，这儿的新闻记者将一切通过鸽子传递出去。

sentences.english: As the name implies, pigeon is an awkward pose, and it happens to be the most challenging for me.
sentences.chinese: 顾名思义，鸽子式是一个很棘手的姿势，它对于我来说是最有挑战性的。

sentences.english: Start slow with forward bends and calf stretches, move on to pigeon pose and plow at the end.
sentences.chinese: 开始时缓慢的前倾伸展和小腿伸展，然后摆出鸽子的姿势再是犁头的姿势。

detailed_translations.english: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities

name: crow
trans: n. [鸟] 乌鸦；鸡鸣；撬棍 vi. 啼叫；报晓

sentences.english: Ben rushed to his father, crowing with pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 本欢叫着跑向他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: if a  cock  crows, it makes a loud high sound
a large shiny black bird with a loud cry

name: swan
trans: n. 天鹅；天鹅星座 vi. 游荡，闲荡

sentences.english: You are one of us. You are a swan!
sentences.chinese: 你是我们中的一个。你是一只天鹅！

sentences.english: Hey, you be the swan.
sentences.chinese: 而你是那天鹅。

sentences.english: Toads pursuit of swans, swan disdain said: If I as long as you die!
sentences.chinese: 癞蛤蟆追求天鹅，天鹅不屑地说：我要是长成你这样早去死了！

detailed_translations.english: a large white bird with a long neck that lives on rivers and lakes

name: goose
trans: n. 鹅；鹅肉；傻瓜；雌鹅 vt. 突然加大油门；嘘骂

sentences.english: ...roast goose.
sentences.chinese: …烤鹅。

detailed_translations.english: the cooked meat of this bird

name: cock
trans: n. 公鸡；龙头；雄鸟；头目 vt. 使竖起；使耸立；使朝上 vi. 翘起；竖起；大摇大摆

sentences.english: A cock crowed in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 远处有只公鸡在打鸣。

detailed_translations.english: an adult male chicken

name: mouse
trans: n. 鼠标；老鼠；胆小羞怯的人 vt. 探出 vi. 捕鼠；窥探

sentences.english: The cat laid a dead mouse at my feet.
sentences.chinese: 猫把一只死老鼠放在我的脚边。

sentences.english: a field mouse
sentences.chinese: 田鼠

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼠标；老鼠；胆小羞怯的人
detailed_translations.english: a small furry animal with a pointed nose and a long tail that lives in people’s houses or in fields

name: rat
trans: n. 鼠；卑鄙小人，叛徒 vi. 捕鼠；背叛，告密

sentences.english: This was demonstrated in a laboratory experiment with rats.
sentences.chinese: 这点通过在实验室中用老鼠做试验得到证明。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail

name: squirrel
trans: n. 松鼠；松鼠毛皮 vt. 贮藏

sentences.english: The squirrel makes a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠贮藏坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: The squirrel has laid in a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠已经贮存了许多坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: It was moving fast like a squirrel, but it was as loud as a bear.
sentences.chinese: 它像松鼠一样快速的移动但那声音却像是熊发出的似的。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with a long furry tail that climbs trees and eats nuts

name: hare
trans: n. 野兔

sentences.english: Because it makes its home in an extreme environment, the desert hare is biologically designed to radiate excess heat through its lanky limbs and oversized ears.
sentences.chinese: 因为生长在极端环境中，沙漠兔子形成了独特的生物学构造，通过瘦长的四肢和超大的耳朵辐射多余的热量。

sentences.english: He found the shin-bone of a hare lying on the grass.
sentences.chinese: 他在草地上发现一根野兔的胫骨，骨头上有个洞；

detailed_translations.english: an animal like a rabbit but larger, which can run very quickly

name: frog
trans: n. 青蛙；[铁路] 辙叉；饰扣 vi. 捕蛙

sentences.english: The tadpole has become a frog.
sentences.chinese: 这个蝌蚪已长成青蛙。

sentences.english: A tadpole metamorphoses into a frog.
sentences.chinese: 蝌蚪会变成青蛙。

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 青蛙；[铁路] 辙叉；饰扣
detailed_translations.english: a small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping

name: behaviour
trans: n. 行为；习性；运行状况（=behavior）

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: bite
trans: n. 咬；一口；咬伤；刺痛 abbr. 机内测试设备（Built-In Test Equipment） vt. 咬；刺痛 vi. 咬；刺痛

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

name: sting
trans: n. 刺痛；讽刺，刺激；刺毛 vt. 刺；驱使；使…苦恼；使…疼痛 vi. 刺痛；被刺痛；感到剧痛

sentences.english: She felt the sting of tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉泪水刺痛了眼睛。

sentences.english: He was stung by a bee.
sentences.chinese: 他被蜜蜂蜇了。

detailed_translations.english: a sharp pain in your eyes or skin, caused by being hit, by smoke etc
(of an insect or plant) to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

name: bark
trans: n. 树皮；深青棕色；毛皮；皮肤；狗叫 vt. 狗叫；尖叫；剥皮

sentences.english: In Finland purists insist that only birch bark should be added.
sentences.chinese: 在芬兰，纯化论者坚持说只能加白桦树皮。

sentences.english: Cork bark is closely intertwined with the lives of the people in these regions.
sentences.chinese: 软木橡树的树皮与这些地方的百姓生活密切地交织在一起。

sentences.english: In his workshop, a Kakunodate craftsman prepares the cherry bark before applying this as a veneer to a range of objects.
sentences.chinese: 在将这种工艺作为一系列物体的单板运用之前，角馆的工匠在自己的作坊准备樱花树皮。

detailed_translations.english: the outer covering of a tree

name: roar
trans: n. 咆哮；吼；轰鸣 vi. 咆哮；吼叫；喧闹 vt. 咆哮；呼喊；使……轰鸣

sentences.english: We heard a lion roar.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到狮子在吼叫。

sentences.english: The engines roared.
sentences.chinese: 引擎轰鸣。

sentences.english: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
sentences.chinese: “从我家里滚出去！”他吼道。

sentences.english: the roar of the crowd
sentences.chinese: 人群的喊叫声

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep, very loud noise
a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

name: rub
trans: n. 摩擦；障碍；磨损处 vt. 擦；摩擦；惹怒 vi. 擦；摩擦；擦破

sentences.english: You’ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想把它弄干净，就得更使劲地擦。

sentences.english: I hurriedly rubbed myself dry.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧把自己擦干。

detailed_translations.english: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

name: creep
trans: n. 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者 vi. 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: crawl
trans: n. 爬行；养鱼池；匍匐而行 vt. 爬行；缓慢地行进 vi. 爬行；匍匐行进

sentences.english: We crawled into bed at 2 am.
sentences.chinese: 我们凌晨两点爬上了床。

detailed_translations.english: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground
a way of swimming in which you lie on your stomach and move one arm, and then the other, over your head

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: nest
trans: n. 巢，窝；安乐窝；温床 vt. 筑巢；嵌套 vi. 筑巢；找鸟巢

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: hive
trans: n. 蜂房，蜂巢；热闹的场所；熙攘喧闹的人群 vi. 群居；入蜂房；生活在蜂房中 vt. 入蜂箱；贮备

sentences.english: The most important member of any hive is the queen bee.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.english: What people must remember is that one hive quickly become two, two become four and four become eight.
sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

detailed_translations.english: a small box where  bees  are kept, or the bees that live in this box

name: cell
trans: n. 细胞；电池；蜂房的巢室；单人小室 vi. 住在牢房或小室中

sentences.english: cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 癌细胞

sentences.english: Embryos grow by cell division (= the splitting of cells ) .
sentences.chinese: 胚胎通过细胞分裂而成长。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

name: cage
trans: n. 笼，兽笼；牢房，监狱 vt. 把…关进笼子；把…囚禁起来

sentences.english: I hate to see birds in cages.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢看到鸟在笼子里。

detailed_translations.english: a structure made of wires or bars in which birds or animals can be kept

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进笼子；把…囚禁起来
detailed_translations.english: to put or keep an animal or bird in a cage

name: stable
trans: n. 马厩；牛棚 adj. 稳定的；牢固的；坚定的 vt. 赶入马房 vi. 被关在马厩

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: barn
trans: n. 谷仓；畜棚；车库；靶（核反应截面单位） vt. 把…贮存入仓

sentences.english: The barn was heaped with grain.
sentences.chinese: 谷仓里堆满了粮食。

sentences.english: The dilapidated barn detracts charm from the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 圮废失修的谷仓有损景色的美。

sentences.english: The grain is liable to mildew when the humidity in the barn is too high.
sentences.chinese: 仓库里潮气太大， 粮食就容易发霉。

detailed_translations.english: a large farm building for storing crops, or for keeping animals in

name: hedge
trans: v. 用树篱笆围住；避免作正面答复 n. 对冲，套期保值；树篱；障碍

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线 vt. 把…关入栅栏

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: bar
trans: n. 条，棒；酒吧；障碍；法庭 prep. 除……外 vt. 禁止；阻拦

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: anatomy
trans: n. 解剖；解剖学；剖析；骨骼

sentences.english: a professor of anatomy
sentences.chinese: 解剖学教授

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

name: epidemic
trans: n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行 adj. 流行的；传染性的

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: gene
trans: n. [遗] 基因，遗传因子

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: germ
trans: n. [植] 胚芽，萌芽；细菌 vi. 萌芽

sentences.english: Put disinfectant down the toilet to kill any germs.
sentences.chinese: 在抽水马桶里投放消毒剂杀菌。

sentences.english: germ cells containing DNA
sentences.chinese: 含DNA的生殖细胞

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that can make you ill

name: bacteria
trans: n. [微] 细菌

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

name: virus
trans: n. [病毒] 病毒；恶毒；毒害

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: metabolism
trans: n. [生理] 新陈代谢

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

name: protein
trans: n. 蛋白质；朊 adj. 蛋白质的

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: vitamin
trans: n. [生化] 维生素；[生化] 维他命

sentences.english: Try to eat foods that are rich in vitamins and minerals.
sentences.chinese: 尽量吃富含维生素和矿物质的食物。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

name: secrete
trans: vt. 藏匿；私下侵吞；分泌

sentences.english: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
sentences.chinese: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it

name: excrete
trans: vt. 排泄；分泌

sentences.english: Your open pores excrete sweat and dirt.
sentences.chinese: 你张开的毛孔排出汗液与污垢。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of waste material from your body through your bowels, your skin etc

name: devour
trans: v. 吞食；毁灭

sentences.english: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

detailed_translations.english: to destroy someone or something

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能，直觉；天性 adj. 充满着的

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: intuitive
trans: adj. 直觉的；凭直觉获知的

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: potential
trans: n. 潜能；可能性；[电] 电势 adj. 潜在的；可能的；势的

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；情报工作；情报机关；理解力；才智，智慧；天分

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: functional
trans: adj. 功能的

sentences.english: The two departments have slight functional differences.
sentences.chinese: 这两个部门功能稍有不同。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the purpose of something

name: sensitive
trans: adj. 敏感的；感觉的；[仪] 灵敏的；感光的；易受伤害的；易受影响的 n. 敏感的人；有灵异能力的人

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: acoustic
trans: n. 原声乐器；不用电传音的乐器 adj. 声学的；音响的；听觉的

sentences.english: In our case, we have found the true acoustic echo beacon.
sentences.chinese: 但在这种情况下，我们发现了真正的声学‘回声灯塔’ ”。

sentences.english: This gives it excellent thermal and acoustic properties, but the suitability of the product for a large-scale commercial project was questioned.
sentences.chinese: 这给了它出色的热学和声学属性，但是这种产品是否适合于一个大尺度的商业项目还是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有关声音的, 声学的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound and the way people hear things

name: optical
trans: adj. 光学的；眼睛的，视觉的

sentences.english: microscopes and other optical instruments
sentences.chinese: 显微镜和其他光学仪器

detailed_translations.english: relating to machines or processes which are concerned with light, images, or the way we see things

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: dormant
trans: adj. 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: hibernation
trans: n. 冬眠；过冬；避寒

sentences.english: "In fact, " she said after a while, "We have gone into hibernation.
sentences.chinese: “实际上，”过了一会儿，她说道，“我们已经被困在这里过冬了。

sentences.english: After all, he reasoned, some single-celled creatures are known to enter a hibernation-like state and survive for years with no air or food.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，他推断，众所周知一些单细胞生物可以进入一种类似冬眠的状态，并在没有空气和水的状态下生存数年。

sentences.english: Heart rate tracking for three of the Alaska bears showed a drop from 55 beats per minute on average before hibernation to 14 erratic ones per minute in winter.
sentences.chinese: 对三头阿拉斯加的黑熊的心率追踪显示出它们在冬眠前的平均每分钟 55 下降低到了冬天里每分钟飘忽不定的 14 下。

name: track
trans: n. 轨道；足迹，踪迹；小道 vt. 追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉 vi. 追踪；走；留下足迹

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: trace
trans: n. 痕迹，踪迹；微量；[仪] 迹线；缰绳 vt. 追踪，查探；描绘；回溯 vi. 追溯；沿路走

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: alternate
trans: n. 替换物 adj. 交替的；轮流的 vt. 使交替；使轮流 vi. 交替；轮流

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: prey
trans: n. 捕食；牺牲者；被捕食的动物 vi. 捕食；掠夺；折磨

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: victim
trans: n. 受害人；牺牲品；牺牲者

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

name: captive
trans: n. 俘虏；迷恋者 adj. 被俘虏的；被迷住的

sentences.english: captive soldiers
sentences.chinese: 被俘的士兵

sentences.english: captive animals
sentences.chinese: 被关住的动物

sentences.english: His son had been taken captive (= became a prisoner ) during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子在这次突袭中被劫持了。

sentences.english: a pilot who was held captive (= kept as a prisoner ) for six years
sentences.chinese: 一名被囚六年的飞行员

detailed_translations.chinese: 被俘虏的， 被监禁的
detailed_translations.english: kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave
someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war

name: defensive
trans: n. 防御；守势 adj. 自卫的；防御用的

sentences.english: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.
sentences.chinese: 亲王将部队布成坚固的防御阵势。

sentences.english: The rockets are a purely defensive measure against nuclear attack.
sentences.chinese: 火箭弹纯粹是针对核攻击的防御性措施。

detailed_translations.english: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历，经受；忍受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: suffer
trans: vi. 遭受，忍受；受痛苦；经验；受损害 vt. 遭受；忍受；经历

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: subsistence
trans: n. 生活；生存；存在

sentences.english: Many of the families are forced to live at the subsistence level.
sentences.chinese: 很多家庭被迫生活在基本生活水准线上。

sentences.english: The land provided subsistence and little more.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地只能提供人们的基本生活所需，别无富余。

detailed_translations.english: the condition of only just having enough money or food to stay alive

name: exist
trans: vi. 存在；生存；生活；继续存在

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: exterminate
trans: vt. 消灭；根除

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: tame
trans: adj. 驯服的；平淡的；乏味的；顺从的 vt. 驯养；使变得平淡；制服 vi. 变得驯服

sentences.english: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
sentences.chinese: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。

sentences.english: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
sentences.chinese: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 驯服的，顺从的；沉闷的，乏味的
detailed_translations.english: dull and disappointing

detailed_translations.chinese: 制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
detailed_translations.english: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble

name: keeper
trans: n. 监护人；饲养员；看守人；管理人

sentences.english: a beekeeper
sentences.chinese: 养蜂人

sentences.english: Bob is head lion keeper at the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃是动物园养狮主管。

sentences.english: a lighthouse keeper
sentences.chinese: 灯塔管理员

detailed_translations.english: someone who looks after animals

name: shepherd
trans: n. 牧羊人；牧师；指导者 vt. 牧羊；带领；指导；看管

sentences.english: The shepherd tended a flock.
sentences.chinese: 这个牧羊人照管羊群。

sentences.english: The chevalier might boast with reason to the friends who visited him that few retired captains were more snugly quartered than he in his crib in shepherd's inn.
sentences.chinese: 骑士完全有理由向前来拜访的朋友夸口，说他在牧羊人会馆的住所是他的安乐窝，退伍的上尉能象他这么逍遥自在的不多。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to take care of sheep
to lead or guide a group of people somewhere, making sure that they go where you want them to go

name: galaxy
trans: n. 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人 n. 三星智能手机品牌 2015年三星中国公布Galaxy的中文名称为“盖乐世”（Galaxy） [ 复数galaxies ]

sentences.english: Astronomers have discovered a distant galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家们发现了一个遥远的星系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
detailed_translations.english: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

name: cosmos
trans: n. 宇宙；和谐；秩序；大波斯菊

sentences.english: ...the natural laws of the cosmos.
sentences.chinese: …宇宙的自然法则。

detailed_translations.english: the whole universe, especially when you think of it as a system

name: universe
trans: n. 宇宙；世界；领域

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: interstellar
trans: adj. [航][天] 星际的

sentences.english: ...interstellar space.
sentences.chinese: ...星际空间。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing between the stars

name: terrestrial
trans: n. 陆地生物；地球上的人 adj. 地球的；陆地的，[生物] 陆生的；人间的

sentences.english: ...terrestrial life forms.
sentences.chinese: …地球上的生命形态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地球的；陆地的，[生物] 陆生的；人间的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Earth rather than to the moon or other  planets

name: celestial
trans: n. 神仙，天堂里的居民 adj. 天上的，天空的

sentences.english: ...the clusters of celestial bodies in the ever-expanding universe.
sentences.chinese: …不断扩展的宇宙中的这些天体群。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sky or heaven

name: astronomy
trans: n. 天文学

sentences.english: The book treats of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲天文学的。

sentences.english: This was the birth of astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 这就是天文学的起源。

sentences.english: You could study astronomy , or space engineering , and be good at it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以学习天文学，或是空间工程学，可以学的很棒。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the stars and  planet s

name: astrology
trans: n. 占星术；占星学；星座

sentences.english: Astronomy inherits from astrology.
sentences.chinese: 天文学的前身是占星术。

sentences.english: This should be contrasted with nonscientific programs and the best example of a nonscientific program is astrology.
sentences.chinese: 这点与非科学假说正好相反,非科学假说最好的例子便是占星术了。

sentences.english: It was a great innovator in medicine, astronomy, astrology, mathematics and banking; the Babylonians may even have believed that the world was round.
sentences.chinese: 它在医药，天文学，占星术，数学和银行业方面都堪称一个伟大的改革者。 甚至，古巴比伦人可能已经相信地球是圆的。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the positions and movements of the stars and how they might influence people and events

name: astronaut
trans: n. 宇航员，航天员；太空旅行者

sentences.english: So why become an astronaut at all?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: comet
trans: n. [天] 彗星

sentences.english: Halley’s comet
sentences.chinese: 哈雷彗星

detailed_translations.english: an object in space like a bright ball with a long tail, that moves around the sun

name: meteorite
trans: n. 陨星；流星

sentences.english: I close the meteorite room and try the door across thecorridor.
sentences.chinese: 我关上陨石房间的门，又打开了走廊对面的门。

sentences.english: If the contamination were terrestrial, one could expect equal amounts of the molecules (or less) to be present in the meteorite samples, certainly not more.
sentences.chinese: 如果污染是来自地面的，在陨石样品中有可能会发现等量（或者较少）的分子，但肯定不会多。

sentences.english: The group, based at Imperial College London, found some of the base building blocks for life, nucleobases, in dust from the Murchison meteorite which fell to Earth in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 研究小组由伦敦帝国学院创建，他们在1969年坠入地球的默奇森陨石尘埃中发现了碱基，这是构建生命的基本成分。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth

name: crater
trans: n. 火山口；弹坑 vt. 在…上形成坑；取消；毁坏 vi. 形成坑；消亡

sentences.english: craters on the moon’s surface
sentences.chinese: 月球表面的坑

detailed_translations.english: a round hole in the ground made by something that has fallen on it or by an explosion

name: dust
trans: n. 灰尘；尘埃；尘土 vt. 撒；拂去灰尘 vi. 拂去灰尘；化为粉末

sentences.english: All the furniture was covered in dust .
sentences.chinese: 所有的家具都蒙上了灰尘。

sentences.english: a thick layer of dust
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的一层灰尘

sentences.english: There’s not a speck of dust in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里一尘不染。

sentences.english: Dust particles floated in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光里飘浮着尘埃颗粒。

sentences.english: A sudden breeze sent motes of dust (= small bits of dust ) dancing in the air.
sentences.chinese: 突然刮起一阵微风吹得灰尘飞扬。

detailed_translations.english: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean

name: ash
trans: n. 灰；灰烬

sentences.english: cigarette ash
sentences.chinese: 香烟灰

sentences.english: The house burnt to ashes.
sentences.chinese: 那房子烧成了灰烬。

sentences.english: His ashes were scattered at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他的骨灰被撒向大海。

detailed_translations.english: the soft grey powder that remains after something has been burned

name: envelope
trans: n. 信封，封皮；包膜；[天] 包层；包迹

sentences.english: envelopes and stamps
sentences.chinese: 信封和邮票

sentences.english: She tore open the envelope and frantically read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她撕开信封慌忙看信。

sentences.english: He got a job stuffing envelopes (= filling them with letters ) at the campaign headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他找了一份在竞选总部装信封的工作。

detailed_translations.english: a thin paper cover in which you put and send a letter

name: chunk
trans: n. 大块；矮胖的人或物

sentences.english: ice chunks
sentences.chinese: 大冰块

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分
detailed_translations.english: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

name: spacecraft
trans: n. [航] 宇宙飞船，航天器

sentences.english: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

name: spaceship
trans: n. [航] 宇宙飞船

sentences.english: ...an alien spaceship.
sentences.chinese: …一艘外星人的宇宙飞船。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for carrying people through space

name: probe
trans: n. 探针；调查 vi. 调查；探测 vt. 探查；用探针探测

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: module
trans: n. [计] 模块；组件；模数

sentences.english: Switch from one module to another.
sentences.chinese: 从一个模块转换到另一个模块。

sentences.english: In this step, you create a new module for the selector.
sentences.chinese: 在此步骤中，您将为选择器创建一个新的模块。

sentences.english: You then iterate the modules that depended on you and remove this module from their lists.
sentences.chinese: 然后迭代具有依赖性的模块，并将这个模块从这些列表中删除。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job

name: propulsion
trans: n. 推进；推进力

sentences.english: research into liquid hydrogen as a means of propulsion
sentences.chinese: 对液态氢作为一种动力方式进行的研究

detailed_translations.english: the force that drives a vehicle forward

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫，[物] 压强 vt. 迫使；密封；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: dynamics
trans: n. 动力学，力学

sentences.english: And our goal is to find out the time, the dynamics of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是找出时间，找出这个问题的动力学。

sentences.english: We know the dynamics of outsourcing.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解外包的动力。

sentences.english: Both are believed to have important roles in sea ice dynamics, but how important they are remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 认为这两者在海冰动力学方面都有重要的作用，但是他们尚不清楚是多么重要。

detailed_translations.english: the branch of mechanics concerned with the forces that change or produce the motions of bodies

name: motion
trans: n. 动作；移动；手势；请求；意向；议案 vi. 运动；打手势 vt. 运动；向…打手势

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: vent
trans: n. （感情的）发泄；出口；通风孔 vt. 发泄感情；放出…；给…开孔 vi. 放出；（通过排泄等）减轻压力

sentences.english: a blocked air vent
sentences.chinese: 堵塞的通风口

sentences.english: a volcanic vent
sentences.chinese: 火山口

detailed_translations.english: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful

name: tail
trans: n. 尾巴；踪迹；辫子；燕尾服 adj. 从后面而来的；尾部的 vt. 尾随；装上尾巴 vi. 跟踪；变少或缩小

sentences.english: The dog wagged its tail .
sentences.chinese: 那条狗摇了摇尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move

name: curve
trans: n. 曲线；弯曲；曲线球；曲线图表 adj. 弯曲的；曲线形的 vt. 弯；使弯曲 vi. 成曲形

sentences.english: a sweeping curve of railroad track
sentences.chinese: 铁轨的大弧线

sentences.english: The car took the curve much too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那辆汽车拐弯太快了。

sentences.english: The track curved round the side of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 小路弯弯曲曲，依山盘旋。

detailed_translations.english: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle
to bend or move in the shape of a curve, or to make something do this

name: exploration
trans: n. 探测；探究；踏勘

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: flyby
trans: n. 飞越；飞近探测；在低空飞过指定地点

name: observatory
trans: n. 天文台；气象台；瞭望台

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜；缩叠式旅行袋 vi. 套叠；变短 vt. 压缩；使套叠

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: spectacle
trans: n. 景象；场面；奇观；壮观；公开展示；表相，假相 n.（复）眼镜

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: ecliptic
trans: n. 黄道 adj. 黄道的；（日或月）食的；蚀的

sentences.english: On the astrolabe, an off - centered circle represents the orbit of the sun - the ecliptic.
sentences.chinese: 在星盘上， 一个偏心的圆代表了太阳的运行轨道――黄道。

sentences.english: Recall that vernal equinox is one of the two intersection points of the celestial equator and the ecliptic.
sentences.chinese: 赤经计算的起点为春分点，相信你仍记得春分点是天球赤道和黄道的其中一个相交点。

sentences.english: Because the Moon and bright planets wander through the sky near the ecliptic plane, such occultation events are not uncommon, but they are dramatic, especially in telescopic views.
sentences.chinese: 因为月球和明亮的行星出现在天空中黄道平面附近，这种掩星事件也很平常，但是它们也很富有戏剧性，特别是在望远镜影像里。

detailed_translations.english: the path along which the Sun seems to move

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: radius
trans: n. 半径，半径范围；[解剖] 桡骨；辐射光线；有效航程

sentences.english: The shock of the explosion was felt over a radius of forty miles.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.english: an area that covers a particular distance in all directions from a central point

name: substance
trans: n. 物质；实质；资产；主旨

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: composition
trans: n. 作文，作曲，作品；[材] 构成；合成物；成分

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

name: compound
trans: n. [化学] 化合物；混合物；复合词 adj. 复合的；混合的 v. 合成；混合；恶化，加重；和解，妥协

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人 adj. 化石的；陈腐的，守旧的

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: sample
trans: n. 样品；样本；例子 adj. 试样的，样品的；作为例子的 vt. 取样；尝试；抽样检查

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
detailed_translations.english: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

name: specimen
trans: n. 样品，样本；标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

name: particle
trans: n. 颗粒；[物] 质点；极小量；小品词

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

name: molecule
trans: n. [化学] 分子；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: atom
trans: n. 原子

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: ion
trans: n. [化学] 离子

sentences.english: These vibrations turn the ion into a sort of superfast metronome.
sentences.chinese: 铝离子因为这些振动成为一种超高速节拍器。

sentences.english: The ion channel was the missing circuit element I was looking for, and it already existed in nature.
sentences.chinese: 这种离子通道是我正在寻找的缺失的电路元件，而且它的确在自然界中存在。

detailed_translations.english: an atom which has been given a positive or negative force by adding or taking away an  electron

name: electron
trans: n. 电子

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: quantum
trans: n. 量子论；额；美国昆腾公司（世界领先的硬盘生产商）

sentences.english: But it does happen in quantum mechanics.
sentences.chinese: 但它在量子力学中就发生了。

sentences.english: What happens when you try to copy one quantum variable onto another?
sentences.chinese: 您试图把一个量子变量拷贝到另一个上时发生了什么事？

sentences.english: If quantum computing can become a reality in the near future, it can provide a more effective and safer way to interact with the Internet, even for the development of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 若量子计算在不久的将来能够成为现实，便可以与量子通信一起为互联网，甚至人类的发展提供一种更有效、更安全的信息交互方式。

detailed_translations.english: a unit of energy in nuclear physics

name: liquid
trans: adj. 液体的；清澈的；明亮的；易变的 n. 液体，流体；流音

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: fluid
trans: n. 流体；液体 adj. 流动的；流畅的；不固定的

sentences.english: He is not allowed solid food yet, only fluids.
sentences.chinese: 他还不能吃固体食物，只能进流食。

sentences.english: a powerful cleaning fluid
sentences.chinese: 一种强力清洁液

detailed_translations.english: a liquid
fluid movements are smooth, relaxed, and graceful

name: solid
trans: n. 固体；立方体 adj. 固体的；可靠的；立体的；结实的；一致的

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

name: synthesise
trans: vt.vi. 综合

name: formation
trans: n. 形成；构造；编队

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: method
trans: n. 方法；条理；类函数 adj. 使用体验派表演方法的

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸 adj. 规格的

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: frequency
trans: n. 频率；频繁

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

name: signal
trans: n. 信号；暗号；导火线 adj. 显著的；作为信号的 vt. 标志；用信号通知；表示 vi. 发信号

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

name: antenna
trans: n. [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须

sentences.english: television antennas
sentences.chinese: 电视机天线

detailed_translations.chinese: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
detailed_translations.english: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

name: circuit
trans: n. [电子] 电路，回路；巡回；一圈；环道 vt. 绕回…环行 vi. 环行

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。
