detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: refraction
trans: n. 折射；折光

sentences.english: If water had a negative index of refraction, then a straw placed in a glass would appear to bend back under itself.
sentences.chinese: 如果水具有负折射率，那么放在玻璃杯中的吸管似乎可能弯曲到自身下方。

sentences.english: With all that reflection and refraction, modernism creates the illusion that there is an illusion when in fact it is a straightforward statement of money and power.
sentences.chinese: 通过反射和折射，现代主义创造了一个幻觉存在的假象，而实际上它是对金钱和权力不加掩饰的声明。

sentences.english: Rapidly changing refraction due to turbulence along the line of sight affects different colors of light by different amounts and generally produces a twinkling effect for stars.
sentences.chinese: 由于湍流而快速变化的折射在视线中会影响到光的不同颜色，这种影响也各不相同，一般会给恒星产生一种闪烁的效果。

name: ultraviolet
trans: adj. 紫外的；紫外线的 n. 紫外线辐射，紫外光

sentences.english: Ozone in the stratosphere is important because it absorbs some of the Sun’s dangerous ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 在平流层的臭氧是重要的，因为它吸收了一些太阳中危险的紫外线辐射。

sentences.english: Birds perceive the world differently tohumans, being able to see light in the ultraviolet range of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 鸟类感知世界的方式和人类不同，他们能够在紫外线光谱范围内看见光线。

sentences.english: But it also says there is no evidence to support disinfecting toothbrushes in the microwave or with ultraviolet devices on the market.
sentences.chinese: 但它也说，没有证据支持在微波炉或市面上销售的紫外线设备中对牙刷消毒。

detailed_translations.english: ultraviolet light cannot be seen by people, but is responsible for making your skin darker when you are in the sun

name: radioactive
trans: adj. [核] 放射性的；有辐射的

sentences.english: the problem of how to dispose of radioactive waste
sentences.chinese: 如何处理放射性废物的问题

sentences.english: a consignment of highly radioactive plutonium
sentences.chinese: 发送的一批高放射性钚

detailed_translations.chinese: 放射性的， 有辐射能的
detailed_translations.english: a radioactive substance is dangerous because it contains  radiation (= a form of energy that can harm living things )

name: distinct
trans: adj. 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: discernible
trans: adj. 可辨别的；可识别的

sentences.english: Far away the outline of the island is just discernible.
sentences.chinese: 远远的，那岛的轮廓依稀可见。

detailed_translations.english: If something is discernible, you can see it or recognize that it exists

name: invisible
trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: collision
trans: n. 碰撞；冲突；（意见，看法）的抵触；（政党等的）倾轧

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: squash
trans: n. 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料 vt. 镇压；把…压扁；使沉默 vi. 受挤压；发出挤压声；挤入

sentences.english: Her suggestions were always squashed.
sentences.chinese: 她的建 议总是受到压制。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power or authority to stop something

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料
detailed_translations.english: a game played by two people who use  rackets  to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分 vt. 使成碎片 vi. 破碎或裂开

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: cataclysmic
trans: adj. 大变动的；洪水的

sentences.english: Few had expected that change to be as cataclysmic as it turned out to be.
sentences.chinese: 没有人预测到那些变化会变成一种大灾难。

detailed_translations.english: A cataclysmic event is one that changes a situation or society very greatly, especially in an unpleasant way

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的；势不可挡的 v. 压倒；淹没（overwhelm的ing形式）；制服

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: despair
trans: n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事 vi. 绝望，丧失信心

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: desperate
trans: adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: hopeless
trans: adj. 绝望的；不可救药的

sentences.english: We tried to stop the flames from spreading, but we knew it was hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 我们试图阻止火势蔓延，但我们知道这是不可能的。

sentences.english: Getting your work published often seems a hopeless task.
sentences.chinese: 想让自己的作品出版似乎总是徒劳的。

sentences.english: I kept on struggling forward, even though I knew it was hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 虽然知道无望，我还是奋力挣扎向前。

sentences.english: I began to feel lonely and hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 我开始感到寂寞绝望。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you try to do is hopeless, there is no possibility of it being successful

name: education
trans: n. 教育；培养；教育学

sentences.english: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
sentences.chinese: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。

sentences.english: efforts to improve girls’ access to education
sentences.chinese: 为增加女孩受教育机会所作的努力

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university

name: primary
trans: n. 原色；最主要者 adj. 主要的；初级的；基本的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: secondary
trans: n. 副手；代理人 adj. 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的

sentences.english: the novel’s secondary characters
sentences.chinese: 这本小说中的次要人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as something else

name: university
trans: n. 大学；综合性大学；大学校舍

sentences.english: He teaches Esperanto at that university.
sentences.chinese: 他在那所大学教世界语。

sentences.english: She buddied up with a student from another university.
sentences.chinese: 她与来自另一大学的一名学生交朋友。

sentences.english: The student left the university to go out into the world and find himself.
sentences.chinese: 这个学生离开了大学进入社会去发现自己的才能所在。

detailed_translations.english: an educational institution at the highest level, where you study for a degree

name: college
trans: n. 大学；学院；学会

sentences.english: a teacher training college
sentences.chinese: 师范学院

sentences.english: Donna left school and went to art college.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜中学毕业后进了艺术学院。

sentences.english: Some people who want to go to college still can’t get there.
sentences.chinese: 有些想上大学的人仍然无法如愿。

detailed_translations.english: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill

name: institute
trans: n. 学会，协会；学院 vt. 开始（调查）；制定；创立；提起（诉讼）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: academy
trans: n. 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

name: learn
trans: vt. 学习；得知；认识到 vi. 学习；获悉

sentences.english: What’s the best way to learn a language?
sentences.chinese: 学习语言的最佳方法是什么？

sentences.english: The teacher’s task is to help the pupil learn.
sentences.chinese: 老师的任务是帮助学生学习。

sentences.english: The student will learn from experience about the importance of planning.
sentences.chinese: 学生将从经验中学到制订计划的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, by experience, by studying it, or by being taught

name: study
trans: n. 学习，研究；课题；书房；学问 vt. 学习；考虑；攻读；细察 vi. 研究；用功

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: knowledge
trans: n. 知识，学问；知道，认识；学科

sentences.english: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.chinese: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.english: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

detailed_translations.english: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识；专门技术；专家的意见

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: novice
trans: n. 初学者，新手

sentences.english: The computer course is ideal for novices.
sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

name: recruit
trans: n. 招聘；新兵；新成员 vi. 复原；征募新兵；得到补充；恢复健康 vt. 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: literate
trans: adj. 受过教育的；精通文学的 n. 学者

sentences.english: The drawback of the internet is that you have to be literate to use it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网的缺点就是人们必须得有文化才能使用它。

detailed_translations.english: able to read and write

name: illiteracy
trans: n. 文盲；无知

sentences.english: India tolerated dissent, but it also tolerated inefficiency, disease and illiteracy.
sentences.chinese: 印度容许异议，但同时它也容忍了无能、疾病与文盲。

sentences.english: Tackling corruption would be the fastest way to address problems like poverty, disease, and illiteracy, he contended.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，反腐败可能是解决诸如贫困、疾病和文盲等问题的最快途径。

sentences.english: This great institution must work for great purposes -- to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance, and poverty and despair.
sentences.chinese: 这个伟大的机构必须努力达到伟大的目的──使人们摆脱暴政与暴力、饥饿与疾病、文盲与愚昧、贫困与绝望。

detailed_translations.english: Illiteracy is the state of not knowing how to read or write

name: numerate
trans: vt. 数，列举；读（数） adj. 识数的，会计算的

sentences.english: Where children respect a parent and know that he or she demands good behavior in school, even mediocre or loutish teachers can pull off the trick④of producing modestly literate and numerate children.
sentences.chinese: 如果孩子尊重父母，并且知道父母要求自己好好上学，即便是平庸的或是很笨的老师也能够成功地教出一般水平的能读会算的小学生。

name: problem
trans: n. 难题；引起麻烦的人 adj. 成问题的；难处理的

sentences.english: She was older than me, but that wasn’t really a problem.
sentences.chinese: 她比我年长，不过那不算什么问题。

sentences.english: She gave us 20 mathematical problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 她让我们解20道数学题。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that causes difficulties

name: issue
trans: n. 问题；流出；期号；发行物 vt. 发行，发布；发给；放出，排出 vi. 发行；流出；造成…结果；传下

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: controversial
trans: adj. 有争议的；有争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: puzzle
trans: n. 谜；难题；迷惑 vt. 使…困惑；使…为难；苦思而得出 vi. 迷惑；冥思苦想

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等 vt. 解谜；给...出谜；充满于 vi. 出谜

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: obscure
trans: adj. 昏暗的，朦胧的；晦涩的，不清楚的；隐蔽的；不著名的，无名的 vt. 使…模糊不清，掩盖；隐藏；使难理解 n. 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: instil
trans: vt. 逐渐灌输；使渗透；滴注

sentences.english: The tough thing is trying to instil a winning attitude in the kids.
sentences.chinese: 困难在于要尽力给孩子们灌输胜利的心态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴注； 逐渐灌输； 逐步培养
detailed_translations.english: to teach someone to think, behave, or feel in a particular way over a period of time

name: cram
trans: n. 死记硬背；极度拥挤 adj. 填鸭式学的 vi. 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课 vt. 填满，塞满；死记硬背；猛吃

sentences.english: She’s been cramming hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 她整个星期都在拼命准备应付考试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课

name: emphasise
trans: vt. （英）强调；加强…的语气（等于emphasize ）

sentences.english: I would emphasise three criteria.
sentences.chinese: 我想强调三条标准。

sentences.english: Many candidates go into interviews and are keen to emphasise their skills.
sentences.chinese: 在面试中，更多的候选人倾向于强调他们的专业技能。

sentences.english: They emphasise the significance of economic stability and social equality.
sentences.chinese: 他们强调了经济稳定、社会平等的重要性。

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的；主题 adj. 发动的；成为动机的 vt. 使产生动机，激起

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: stimulate
trans: vi. 起刺激作用；起促进作用 vt. 刺激；鼓舞，激励

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: spur
trans: n. 鼓舞，刺激；马刺；山坡 vt. 激励，鞭策；给…装踢马刺 vi. 骑马疾驰；给予刺激

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: impetus
trans: n. 动力；促进；冲力

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: indulge
trans: vi. 沉溺；满足；放任 vt. 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: spoil
trans: n. 次品；奖品 vt. 溺爱；糟蹋；破坏；掠夺 vi. 掠夺；变坏；腐败

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: abuse
trans: n. 滥用；虐待；辱骂；弊端；恶习，陋习 vt. 滥用；虐待；辱骂

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: clever
trans: adj. 聪明的；机灵的；熟练的 [ 比较级cleverer 最高级 cleverest ]

sentences.english: a clever man
sentences.chinese: 聪明的人

detailed_translations.english: able to learn and understand things quickly

name: smart
trans: adj. 聪明的；巧妙的；敏捷的；厉害的；潇洒的；剧烈的；时髦的

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

name: all-round
trans: adj. 多才多艺的；全面的；多方面的；综合性的

name: genius
trans: n. 天才，天赋；精神

sentences.english: The film reveals Fellini’s genius.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.english: a work of pure genius
sentences.chinese: 天才之作

detailed_translations.english: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

name: elite
trans: n. 精英；精华；中坚分子

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: idiot
trans: n. 笨蛋，傻瓜；白痴

sentences.english: ‘You are an idiot, ’ he tells them.
sentences.chinese: ‘你确实是傻瓜，’他对他们说。

sentences.english: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的读者，假设你是一个白痴。再假设你是一名国会成员。不过我的话说重复了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: wit
trans: n. 智慧；才智；智力 v. <古>知道；即

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

name: aptitude
trans: n. 天资；自然倾向；适宜

sentences.english: He drifted into publishing and discovered an aptitude for working with accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: capable
trans: adj. 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: excellent
trans: adj. 卓越的；极好的；杰出的

sentences.english: an excellent suggestion
sentences.chinese: 极好的建议

sentences.english: His car is in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车状况极佳。

sentences.english: Second-hand computers can be excellent value.
sentences.chinese: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

detailed_translations.english: extremely good or of very high quality

name: outstanding
trans: adj. 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的 n. 未偿贷款

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: brilliant
trans: adj. 灿烂的，闪耀的；杰出的；有才气的；精彩的，绝妙的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: prestige
trans: n. 威望，声望；声誉

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: eminent
trans: adj. 杰出的；有名的；明显的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: notorious
trans: adj. 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

name: esteem
trans: n. 尊重；尊敬 vt. 尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意 vt. 尊敬，尊重；遵守

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: diligent
trans: adj. 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的

sentences.english: a diligent student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 勤勉的；用功的，费尽心血的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough

name: painstaking
trans: adj. 艰苦的；勤勉的；小心的 n. 辛苦；勤勉

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

name: skill
trans: n. 技能，技巧；本领，技术

sentences.english: Reading and writing are two different skills.
sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.english: Many jobs today require computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

name: approach
trans: n. 方法；途径；接近 vt. 接近；着手处理 vi. 靠近

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: scheme
trans: n. 计划；组合；体制；诡计 vt. 计划；策划 vi. 搞阴谋；拟订计划

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: headmaster
trans: n. 校长

sentences.english: This headmaster is very modest.
sentences.chinese: 这位校长很谦虚。

sentences.english: Our headmaster rattled on for at least two hours at the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 我们的校长在开学典礼上唠唠叨叨地讲了至少两个小时。

sentences.english: Before the door of the headmaster's office,she stopped and re-collected herself for a while.
sentences.chinese: 在校长办公室门前，她停步片刻使自己镇静下来。

detailed_translations.english: a male teacher who is in charge of a school

name: principal
trans: adj. 主要的；资本的 n. 首长；校长；资本；当事人

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: dean
trans: n. 院长；系主任；教务长；主持牧师

sentences.english: the admissions dean
sentences.chinese: 招生主任

detailed_translations.english: someone in a university who is responsible for a particular area of work

name: faculty
trans: n. 科，系；能力；全体教员

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: professor
trans: n. 教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: scientist
trans: n. 科学家

sentences.english: He is a scientist of high prestige.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位有声望的科学家。

sentences.english: As a scientist,he disbelieves in Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名科学家，他不信耶稣。

sentences.english: The scientist thirsts after an achievement.
sentences.chinese: 这名科学家渴望取得成就。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works or is trained in science

name: mentor
trans: n. 指导者，良师益友 vt. 指导

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: tutor
trans: n. 导师；家庭教师；助教 vt. 辅导；约束 vi. 当家庭教师；（美）在家庭教师指导下学习

sentences.english: He was privately tutored.
sentences.chinese: 他是由家庭教师教的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

name: lecturer
trans: n. 讲师，演讲者

sentences.english: She’s a brilliant lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 她是位出色的演讲者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives lectures, especially in a university

name: assistant
trans: n. 助手，助理，助教 adj. 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: degree

name: file
trans: n. 文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀 vt. 提出；锉；琢磨；把…归档 vi. 列队行进；用锉刀锉

trans: n. 侧面；轮廓；外形；剖面；简况 vt. 描…的轮廓；扼要描述 vi. 给出轮廓

sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

trans: n. 汇票；草稿；选派；（尤指房间、烟囱、炉子等供暖系统中的）（小股）气流 vt. 起草；制定；征募 vi. 拟稿；绘样；作草图 adj. 初步画出或（写出）的；（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的；以草稿形式的；草图的

sentences.chinese: 电子工程师

sentences.chinese: 快速心算

sentences.english: On the basis of minimax algebra theory, this paper provides an algebra method of solving countable stages decision problems in the dynamic programming.
sentences.chinese: 本文根据极大极小代数理论，给出了一种用以求解动态规划中有限多阶段决策问题的代数算法。

sentences.english: Through the symbol computer algebra, a fourth order perturbation solution for the one dimentional stable coupled flows of elastic fluids in the deformable porous media.
sentences.chinese: 用计算机代数系统进行符号运算，求得了可变形多孔介质中弹性流体一维定常耦合渗流问题的四阶摄动解。

sentences.english: This paper uses several methods of complex functions theorey to prove fundamental theorem of algebra by argument principle, maximum modulus principle and minimum modulus principle.
sentences.chinese: 从复变函数理论出发，利用辐角原理、最大模原理、最小模原理给出代数学基本定理的几种新的证明方法。

detailed_translations.english: a type of mathematics that uses letters and other signs to represent numbers and values

name: calculus
trans: n. [病理] 结石；微积分学

sentences.english: We have to factor that into the calculus.
sentences.chinese: 我们要在微积分学中考虑这些因素。

sentences.english: All this leads up to the most fundamental of theorems of calculus .
sentences.chinese: 综上所述就导出了微积分学中的最基本的定理。

sentences.english: Obstruction with stasis also led to the formation of the yellow-brown calculus (stone).
sentences.chinese: 伴有尿液郁积的阻塞还能导致黄褐色的结石（石头）形成。

detailed_translations.english: the part of mathematics that deals with changing quantities, such as the speed of a falling stone or the slope of a curved line

name: plus
trans: prep. 加，加上 n. 正号，加号；好处；附加额 adj. 正的；附加的

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

name: sum
trans: n. 金额；总数 vt. 总结；合计 vi. 概括

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: total
trans: n. 总数，合计 adj. 全部的；完全的；整个的 vt. 总数达 vi. 合计

sentences.english: a total ban on cigarette advertising
sentences.chinese: 香烟广告的全面禁止

sentences.english: He looked at her with a total lack of comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 他一头雾水地望着她。

sentences.english: a sport that demands total commitment
sentences.chinese: 需要全身心投入的体育运动

detailed_translations.english: complete, or as great as is possible
to reach a particular total

name: merger
trans: n. （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）

sentences.english: merger negotiations
sentences.chinese: 合并谈判

detailed_translations.chinese: （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）
detailed_translations.english: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one

name: equation
trans: n. 方程式，等式；相等；[化学] 反应式

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

name: identical
trans: n. 完全相同的事物 adj. 同一的；完全相同的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: minus
trans: prep. 减，减去 n. 负号，减号；不足；负数 adj. 减的；负的

sentences.english: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款项扣除一小笔服务费后将退还给你。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or quantity is being  subtract ed  from another
something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation

name: subtract
trans: vt. 减去；扣掉

sentences.english: Then the deal is that when you sell the house they subtract -you've got to pay this.
sentences.chinese: 那么当你售出房子后，他们会从中减去，这个余额，这就是你要付给他们的。

sentences.english: That is, if you find that a sensor consistently overestimates by a certain value, you can subtract that value before the final value is reported.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，如果您发现某个传感器总是偏高于某个特定数值，那么就可以减去该数值后再报告最终的数值。

sentences.english: Thus, if you have staff activities in loops and want to run the above request, you need to ensure that you subtract only events which belong together.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果您在循环中具有人员活动，并且想要运行以上的请求，那么您必须确保您只减去了属于一起的事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a number or an amount from a larger number or amount

name: multiply
trans: vt. 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘 vi. 乘；繁殖；增加 adv. 多样地；复合地 adj. 多层的；多样的

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: divide
trans: n. [地理] 分水岭，分水线 vt. 划分；除；分开；使产生分歧 vi. 分开；意见分歧

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: dividend
trans: n. 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金

sentences.english: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 percent.
sentences.chinese: 第一季度的股息增加了近4％。

detailed_translations.chinese: 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金
detailed_translations.english: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with  share s  in the company

name: remainder
trans: n. [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人 adj. 剩余的；吃剩的 vt. 廉价出售；削价出售 vi. 廉价出售；削价出售

sentences.english: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人
detailed_translations.english: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with

name: rational
trans: n. 有理数 adj. 合理的；理性的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: parameter
trans: n. 参数；系数；参量

sentences.english: ...some of the parameters that determine the taste of a wine.
sentences.chinese: …一些决定葡萄酒味道的参数。

detailed_translations.english: Parameters are factors or limits that affect the way something can be done or made

name: variable
trans: n. [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素 adj. 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: even
trans: adj. [数] 偶数的；平坦的；相等的 adv. 甚至；即使；还；实际上 vt. 使平坦；使相等 vi. 变平；变得可比较；成为相等

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: odd
trans: adj. 奇数的；古怪的；剩余的；临时的；零散的 n. 奇数；怪人；奇特的事物

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

name: mean
trans: adj. 平均的；卑鄙的；低劣的；吝啬的 vt. 意味；想要；意欲 n. 平均值 vi. 用意

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

name: double
trans: n. 两倍；双精度型 adj. 双重的；两倍的 vt. 使加倍 adv. 双重地；两倍地；弓身地 vi. 加倍，加倍努力；快步走

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

name: triple
trans: n. 三倍数；三个一组 adj. 三倍的；三方的 vt. 使成三倍 vi. 增至三倍

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

name: quadruple
trans: n. 四倍 adj. 四倍的；四重的 vt. 使…成四倍 vi. 成为四倍

sentences.english: The subjects were given quadruple the normal dosage of the drug.
sentences.chinese: 让实验对象服用了四倍于正常剂量的药物。

detailed_translations.english: four times as big or as many
to increase and become four times as big or as high, or to make something increase in this way

name: multiple
trans: adj. 多重的；多样的；许多的 n. 倍数；[电] 并联

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

name: maximum
trans: n. [数] 极大，最大限度；最大量 adj. 最高的；最多的；最大极限的

sentences.english: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。

sentences.english: They made maximum use of the resources available.
sentences.chinese: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。

sentences.english: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
sentences.chinese: 要想获得最佳的效果，这些运动要做得慢一点。

sentences.english: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
sentences.chinese: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。

sentences.english: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

sentences.english: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元，一次性给付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最大的； 最高的； 顶点的
detailed_translations.english: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

name: minimum
trans: n. 最小值；最低限度；最小化；最小量 adj. 最小的；最低的

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

name: approximately
trans: adv. 大约，近似地；近于

sentences.english: The journey took approximately seven hours.
sentences.chinese: 旅程大约花了七个小时。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that sth is almost, but not completely, accurate or correct

name: chart
trans: n. 图表；海图；图纸；排行榜 vt. 绘制…的图表；在海图上标出；详细计划；记录；记述；跟踪（进展或发展

sentences.english: a chart showing last year’s sales
sentences.chinese: 显示去年销售情况的一份图表

sentences.english: a weather chart
sentences.chinese: 天气图

sentences.english: the theatre’s seating chart
sentences.chinese: 剧场的座位图

detailed_translations.english: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

detailed_translations.chinese: 用图表表示， 在图上表示
detailed_translations.english: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records

name: graph
trans: n. 图表；曲线图 vt. 用曲线图表示

sentences.english: Martin showed me a graph of their recent sales.
sentences.chinese: 马丁给我看了他们最近销售情况的图表。

detailed_translations.english: a drawing that uses a line or lines to show how two or more sets of measurements are related to each other

name: diagram
trans: n. 图表；图解 vt. 用图解法表示

sentences.english: This diagram will illustrate what I mean.
sentences.chinese: 这个图表可说明我的意思。

sentences.english: This is a simpler diagram than the one I just showed you but the principles are the same.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个比我刚展示的还要更简单的图解，但是原理是一样的。

sentences.english: A table or diagram containing the name and address range of each peripheral addressable by the processor within the memory space.
sentences.chinese: 一个在内存空间中的，包含每个外设的名字和可由处理器设置的地址范围的表格或图表。

detailed_translations.english: to show or represent something in a diagram

detailed_translations.chinese: 图解， 简图， 图表
detailed_translations.english: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

name: table
trans: n. 桌子；表格；平地层 vt. 制表；搁置；嵌合 adj. 桌子的

sentences.english: The food was served on long tables.
sentences.chinese: 食物放在长餐桌上供应。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs
to leave a bill etc to be discussed or dealt with in the future

name: matrix
trans: n. [数] 矩阵；模型；[生物][地质] 基质；母体；子宫；[地质] 脉石

sentences.english: a matrix table
sentences.chinese: 矩阵表

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 矩阵；模型；[生物][地质] 基质；母体；子宫；[地质] 脉石
detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of numbers, letters, or signs in rows and  column s  that you consider to be one amount, and that you use in solving mathematical problems

name: rectangle
trans: n. 矩形；长方形

sentences.english: Suppose the width of a rectangle is x metres.
sentences.chinese: 设长方形的宽是 x 米。

detailed_translations.english: a shape that has four straight sides, two of which are usually longer than the other two, and four 90˚ angles at the corners

name: cube
trans: n. 立方；立方体；骰子 vt. 使成立方形；使自乘二次；量…的体积

sentences.english: a sugar cube
sentences.chinese: 一块方糖

sentences.english: an ice cube
sentences.chinese: 一小方块冰

sentences.english: Cut the meat into small cubes.
sentences.chinese: 把肉切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: a solid object with six equal square sides

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成立方形；使自乘二次；量…的体积
detailed_translations.english: to multiply a number by itself twice

name: angle
trans: n. 角度，角，方面 vi. 钓鱼；谋取

sentences.english: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
sentences.chinese: 你没有量准角度。

detailed_translations.english: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

name: triangle
trans: n. 三角（形）；三角关系；三角形之物；三人一组

sentences.english: Yes, it is like a triangle.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它象一个三角形。

sentences.english: So, we have to find the area of the triangle.
sentences.chinese: 因此我们必须求出三角形的面积。

sentences.english: It can measure not only the sine wave, square wave, triangle wave, a sharp pulse but also can measure other characteristics of the signal wave.
sentences.chinese: 它不仅可以测量正弦波、方波、三角波、尖脉冲信号和其他具有周期特性的信号的频率，而且还可以测量它们的周期。

detailed_translations.english: a flat shape with three straight sides and three angles

name: diagonal
trans: n. 对角线；斜线 adj. 斜的；对角线的；斜纹的

sentences.english: Next, move to the diagonal section at the back-right side of the diamond.
sentences.chinese: 下一个,在钻石的背面-正确的边移到对角线的区段。

sentences.english: And then there is this group of about half a dozen right down the diagonal middle.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一个包含六个元素的元素组,在周期表的对角线的中部。

sentences.english: The average reader reads about 240 words per minute, where as a diagonal reader ‘reads’ (actually scans) closer to 15 words per second or about 900 words per minute.
sentences.chinese: 一般读者每分钟阅读240字，而作为一个对角线读者的“阅读速度”（到不如说是浏览）接近每秒15字或大约每分钟900字。

name: straight
trans: n. 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者 adj. 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的 adv. 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: circle
trans: n. 循环，周期；圆；圈子；圆形物 vt. 画圆圈；环绕…移动 vi. 盘旋，旋转；环行

sentences.english: Draw a circle 10cm in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径10厘米的圆形。

sentences.english: Johnson was part of the President’s inner circle (= the people who have the most influence ) .
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊是总统核心集团的人。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, fashion comes full circle.
sentences.chinese: 时尚迟早会流行回来的。

sentences.english: This is the road that circles the city.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那条环城路。

detailed_translations.english: a completely round shape, like the letter O
to move in the shape of a circle around something, especially in the air

name: round
trans: n. 圆；循环；一回合；圆形物 prep. 附近；绕过；大约；在…周围 adj. 圆的；完全的；大概的；肥胖的 vt. 完成；围捕；绕行；弄圆 adv. 在周围；迂回地；朝反方向；挨个 vi. 进展；变圆；环行；发胖

sentences.english: We sat round the table playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 我们围桌而坐玩纸牌。

sentences.english: Gather round! I have an important announcement to make.
sentences.chinese: 大家围拢来！我有重要事情要宣布。

sentences.english: He put his arm gently round her waist.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻地搂着她的腰。

sentences.english: I kept the key on a chain round my neck.
sentences.chinese: 我给钥匙穿了根链子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: The ballroom’s huge, with windows all the way round .
sentences.chinese: 舞厅很大，四周都是窗户。

sentences.english: There was a lovely courtyard with tables all round .
sentences.chinese: 有一个漂亮的庭院，四周都是桌子。

detailed_translations.english: surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
shaped like a circle
a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process
on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it

name: dot
trans: n. 点，圆点；嫁妆 vt. 加小点于 vi. 打上点

sentences.english: a pattern of dots
sentences.chinese: 圆点图案

sentences.english: She never dots her i’s.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不在i上面加点。

detailed_translations.english: a small round mark or spot
to mark something by putting a dot on it or above it

name: sphere
trans: n. 范围；球体 adj. 球体的 vt. 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

name: cone
trans: n. 圆锥体，圆锥形；[植] 球果 vt. 使成锥形

sentences.english: ...orange traffic cones.
sentences.chinese: …橙色的交通锥形警示标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆锥体，圆锥形；[植] 球果
detailed_translations.english: a solid or hollow shape that is round at one end, has sloping sides, and has a point at the other end, or something with this shape

name: extent
trans: n. 程度；范围；长度

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: width
trans: n. 宽度；广度

sentences.english: a covered terrace extending the full width of the house
sentences.chinese: 和房子同宽的有顶露台

detailed_translations.english: the distance from one side of something to the other

name: length
trans: n. 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

name: decimal
trans: n. 小数 adj. 小数的；十进位的

sentences.english: changing to a decimal system
sentences.chinese: 改为十进制

sentences.english: calculations accurate to three decimal places
sentences.chinese: 精确到小数点后三位的计算

detailed_translations.english: a decimal system is based on the number 10
a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

name: percent
trans: adj. 每一百中 n. 百分之…

sentences.english: At the end of the day, add up the percent DVs.
sentences.chinese: 在一天结束后，把所有营养素的百分比加起来。

sentences.english: Machines are delivering up to only 25 percent of the fuel they combust.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转效率只能达到所耗燃料的百分之二十五。

sentences.english: But there are billions more people out there who are not in the top one percent, and they’re not in the top two or three either.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有十亿多的人不在其中，他们不在其中的百分之一，也不再其中的两百分之一或者三百分之一的其中。

name: proportion
trans: n. 比例，占比；部分；面积；均衡 vt. 使成比例；使均衡；分摊

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: rate
trans: n. 比率，率；速度；价格；等级 vt. 认为；估价；责骂 vi. 责骂；被评价

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: ratio
trans: n. 比率，比例

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

name: fraction
trans: n. 分数；部分；小部分；稍微

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；比例；鳞；刻度；天平；数值范围 vt. 测量；攀登；刮鳞；依比例决定 vi. 衡量；攀登；剥落；生水垢

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: ounce
trans: n. 盎司；少量；雪豹

sentences.english: One ounce of almonds contains nearly half the recommended daily amount.
sentences.chinese: 一盎司杏仁大约包含每日需求量的一半。

sentences.english: I knew every ounce would weigh on me like a little anchor, so I was determined not to include a single item that was unnecessary or superfluous.
sentences.chinese: 我意识到每盎司的重量都会成为一个小小的船锚压迫着我，所以我决定不带任何一样不必要的或多余的东西。

sentences.english: The 9” long, 9 ounce device works when you are in motion—just plug in your mobile device, place the nPower PEG vertically in your bag or on your hip and go for a walk or run.
sentences.chinese: 这种设备长9英寸，重9盎司，可在你运动过程中发电——只需把移动设备插到摇摇发电机上，并把发电机垂直地放在包�或挂在臀部，然后走动或跑动即可。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.

name: density
trans: n. 密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: Fahrenheit
trans: n. 华氏温度计；华氏温标 adj. 华氏温度计的；华氏的

sentences.english: By mid-morning, the temperature was already above 100 degrees Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 到上午10点左右，气温已超过华氏100度了。

detailed_translations.english: Fahrenheit is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °F.
a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 32˚ and boils at 212˚

name: mercury
trans: n. 水星

sentences.english: He said that all metals were composed of mercury and sulphur in different proportions .
sentences.chinese: 他说一切金属都是由水银和硫黄按不同比例构成的。

sentences.english: Here they endure long hours at dangerous jobs, wringing flecks of gold from the dirt with mercury.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天在这种危险的环境下工作很长时间，从带有水银的泥沙中淘出金沙。

sentences.english: Because glass mercury thermometers harm both humans and the environment, they have been phased out and are no longer recommended.
sentences.chinese: 因为玻璃水银温度计对于人类和环境都有害处，现在已经逐步被淘汰不再建议使用了。

detailed_translations.english: Mercury is a silver-coloured liquid metal that is used especially in thermometers and barometers

name: battery
trans: n. [电] 电池，蓄电池 n. [法]殴打 n. [军]炮台，炮位

sentences.english: You have to take the top off to change the batteries .
sentences.chinese: 你得把顶盖拿掉才能更换电池。

sentences.english: When the red light comes on, you should recharge the battery .
sentences.chinese: 红灯亮起的时候你就应该给电池充电了。

sentences.english: The car’s got a flat battery .
sentences.chinese: 汽车的蓄电池没电了。

sentences.english: a battery-operated hairdryer
sentences.chinese: 使用电池的吹风机

detailed_translations.english: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

name: volt
trans: n. 伏特（电压单位）；环骑；闪避

sentences.english: That is one electron volt.
sentences.chinese: 就是一单位的电子伏特。

sentences.english: If I multiply these two, what is the coulomb times a volt?
sentences.chinese: 如果我把这两个乘起来，库仑乘以伏特是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

name: radiate
trans: adj. 辐射状的，有射线的 vi. 辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展 vt. 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播

sentences.english: He radiated calm confidence.
sentences.chinese: 他身上散发着沉稳自信的气质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播
detailed_translations.english: if someone radiates a feeling, or if it radiates from them, it is very easy to see that this is how they feel

name: emit
trans: vt. 发出，放射；发行；发表

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: transparent
trans: adj. 透明的；显然的；坦率的；易懂的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: hollow
trans: n. 洞；山谷；窟窿 adj. 空的；中空的，空腹的；凹的；虚伪的 vt. 使成为空洞 adv. 彻底地；无用地 vi. 形成空洞

sentences.english: a hollow tree
sentences.chinese: 空心树

sentences.english: Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.
sentences.chinese: 任何要叫警察来的威胁都是虚张声势。

sentences.english: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个世纪的踩踏，台阶上出现了凹痕

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的,中空的;；空洞的,无价值的
detailed_translations.english: having an empty space inside
to make the surface of something curve inwards

name: ozone
trans: n. [化学] 臭氧；新鲜的空气

sentences.english: Objective To observe the disinfection effect of gastroscope by ozone water.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察臭氧水在胃镜体的消毒效果监测。

sentences.english: Their skin is weathered and tanned, as if they have fossilised themselves in ozone to keep death at bay.
sentences.chinese: 他们的皮肤饱经风霜被晒得黧黑，好像他们在臭氧中变成化石并在海湾边防止死亡。

sentences.english: The synergistic effect of oxygen and (or ) ozone in atmosphere with ultraviolet also led to the adhesion failure of adhesive.
sentences.chinese: 大气中的氧和（或）臭氧与紫外线协同作用是导致该压敏粘合剂失粘的原因。

detailed_translations.english: a poisonous blue gas that is a type of oxygen

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: friction
trans: n. 摩擦，[力] 摩擦力

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: eccentric
trans: n. 古怪的人 adj. 古怪的，反常的

sentences.english: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
sentences.chinese: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: boil
trans: n. 沸腾，煮沸；疖子 vt. 煮沸，烧开；使…激动；使…蒸发 vi. 煮沸，沸腾；激动，激昂

sentences.english: Put the spaghetti into plenty of boiling salted water.
sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放入大量煮沸的盐水中。

sentences.english: We were advised to boil the water before drinking it.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议我们把这水烧开后再喝。

detailed_translations.english: when a liquid boils, or when you boil it, it becomes hot enough to turn into gas
the act or state of boiling

name: melt
trans: vi. 熔化，溶解；渐混 vt. 使融化；使熔化；使软化；使感动 n. 熔化；熔化物

sentences.english: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.english: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

detailed_translations.english: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

name: dissolve
trans: n. 叠化画面；画面的溶暗 vt. 使溶解；使分解；使液化 vi. 溶解；解散；消失

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: rust
trans: n. 锈；生锈；[植保] 锈病 vt. 使生锈；腐蚀 vi. 生锈；成铁锈色；变迟钝

sentences.english: There were large patches of rust on the car.
sentences.chinese: 车上有大片锈斑。

sentences.english: The metal had begun to rust.
sentences.chinese: 金属开始生锈。

detailed_translations.english: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet
to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

name: ferment
trans: vt. 使发酵；酝酿；使动乱 vi. 发酵；动乱 n. 发酵；酵素；动乱

sentences.english: The whole country has been in a state of political ferment for some months.
sentences.chinese: 整个国家几个月来一直处在政治骚动的状态中。

detailed_translations.english: a situation of great excitement or trouble in a country, especially caused by political change
if fruit, beer, wine etc ferments, or if it is fermented, the sugar in it changes to alcohol

name: dilute
trans: vt. 稀释；冲淡；削弱 adj. 稀释的；淡的 vi. 变稀薄；变淡

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: acid
trans: n. 酸；<俚>迷幻药 adj. 酸的；讽刺的；刻薄的

sentences.english: sulphuric acid
sentences.chinese: 硫酸

sentences.english: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
sentences.chinese: 一个多汁、略带酸味的苹果

sentences.english: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话，但他不吭声了。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
having a sharp sour taste

name: noxious
trans: adj. 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的

sentences.english: noxious fumes
sentences.chinese: 有毒烟雾

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: harmful or poisonous

name: static
trans: n. 静电；静电干扰 adj. 静态的；静电的；静力的

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

name: inert
trans: adj. [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的

sentences.english: inert gases
sentences.chinese: 惰性气体

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的
detailed_translations.english: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

name: inherent
trans: adj. 固有的；内在的；与生俱来的，遗传的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: formula
trans: n. [数] 公式，准则；配方；婴儿食品

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

name: component
trans: n. 成分；组件；[电子] 元件 adj. 组成的，构成的

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: compose
trans: vt. 构成；写作；使平静；排…的版 vi. 组成；作曲；排字

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

name: mixture
trans: n. 混合；混合物；混合剂

sentences.english: The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
sentences.chinese: 这个小城新旧结合。

detailed_translations.english: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

name: blend
trans: n. 混合；掺合物 vi. 混合；协调 vt. 混合

sentences.english: Blend the sugar, eggs, and flour.
sentences.chinese: 把糖、鸡蛋和面粉掺在一起。

sentences.english: a blend of tea
sentences.chinese: 混合茶叶

detailed_translations.english: to thoroughly mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance
a mixture of different types of the same thing

name: theory
trans: n. 理论；原理；学说；推测

sentences.english: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

name: empirical
trans: adj. 经验主义的，完全根据经验的；实证的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: practical
trans: adj. 实际的；实用性的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: doctrine
trans: n. 主义；学说；教义；信条

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: discipline
trans: n. 学科；纪律；训练；惩罚 vt. 训练，训导；惩戒

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: term
trans: n. 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项 vt. 把…叫做

sentences.english: Teachers often feel overworked in term time (= during the term ) .
sentences.chinese: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项
detailed_translations.english: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language
to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

name: semester
trans: n. 学期；半年

sentences.english: the fall semester
sentences.chinese: 秋季学期

detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

name: timetable
trans: n. 时间表；时刻表；课程表

sentences.english: The timetable was hopelessly optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 这个时间表过于乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a list of the times at which buses, trains, planes etc arrive and leave

name: schedule
trans: n. 时间表；计划表；一览表 vt. 安排，计划；编制目录；将……列入计划表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: deadline
trans: n. 截止期限，最后期限

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: course
trans: n. 科目；课程；过程；进程；道路；路线，航向；一道菜 vt. 追赶；跑过 vi. 指引航线；快跑

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: lesson
trans: n. 教训；课 vt. 教训；上课

sentences.english: piano lessons
sentences.chinese: 钢琴课

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in which someone is taught a particular skill, for example how to play a musical instrument or drive a car

name: curriculum
trans: n. 课程 总课程

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning
sentences.chinese: 课程安排

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

name: seminar
trans: n. 讨论会，研讨班

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: syllabus
trans: n. 教学大纲，摘要；课程表
