sentences.english: The course syllabus consisted mainly of novels by African-American authors, male and female.
sentences.chinese: 该课程的教学大纲主要包括了非裔美国男女作家的小说。

detailed_translations.english: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

name: system
trans: n. 制度，体制；系统；方法

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: rudimentary
trans: adj. 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的

sentences.english: Gradually, I acquired a rudimentary knowledge of music.
sentences.chinese: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。

sentences.english: my rudimentary German
sentences.chinese: 我粗浅的德语

detailed_translations.chinese: 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的
detailed_translations.english: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic

name: basic
trans: n. 基础；要素 adj. 基本的；基础的

sentences.english: the basic principles of chemistry
sentences.chinese: 化学的基本原理

sentences.english: The basic idea is simple.
sentences.chinese: 基本思想很简单。

sentences.english: basic research
sentences.chinese: 基础研究

sentences.english: basic information
sentences.chinese: 基本信息

detailed_translations.english: forming the most important or most necessary part of something

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则 adj. 基本的，根本的

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: elementary
trans: adj. 基本的；初级的；[化学] 元素的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: superficial
trans: adj. 表面的；肤浅的 ；表面文章的；外表的；（人）浅薄的

sentences.english: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
sentences.chinese: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处，但实际上大不一样。

sentences.english: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
sentences.chinese: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

detailed_translations.english: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

name: surface
trans: n. 表面；表层；外观 adj. 表面的，肤浅的 vt. 使浮出水面；使成平面 vi. 浮出水面

sentences.english: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
sentences.chinese: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。

sentences.english: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
sentences.chinese: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

detailed_translations.english: the top layer of an area of water or land
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time

name: compulsory
trans: n. （花样滑冰、竞技体操等的）规定动作 adj. 义务的；必修的；被强制的

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

name: prerequisite
trans: n. 先决条件 adj. 首要必备的

sentences.english: A person with ambition is the prerequisite to success.
sentences.chinese: 一个人有雄心壮志是成功的先决条件。

sentences.english: Historical changes to the production of embroidered shoes with embroidery into a local evaluation of the level of ingenuity of a girl prerequisite.
sentences.chinese: 历史的变革使绣花鞋的制作与刺绣水平成为当地评价一个姑娘心灵手巧的先决条件。

sentences.english: Anyone has the possibility to succeed, but the prerequisite of success is your own, both industry knowledge learning and the cultivation of innovation ability, requires great effort.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都有成功的可能性，但成功的先决条件在于你自身，无论是行业知识的学习还是创新能力的培养，都需要付出极大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的， 作为先决条件的

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done

name: selective
trans: adj. 选择性的 讲究的 有选择地 有选择性地 仔细挑选地

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

name: elective
trans: adj. 选修的；选举的；选任的 n. 选修课程

sentences.english: the 34 elective seats in the National Assembly
sentences.chinese: 国民议会中的34个选举席位

detailed_translations.english: an elective position or organization is one for which there is an election
a course that students can choose to take, but they do not have to take it in order to graduate

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: submit
trans: vi. 提交；服从 vt. 使服从；主张；呈递

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: preview
trans: n. 预览；试映；事先查看 vt. 预览；预演；事先查看

sentences.english: the press preview of the show (= when people who write for newspapers, television etc could see it )
sentences.chinese: 该节目的媒体试映

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you can see a film, play, painting etc before it is shown to the public
to see or describe something before it is shown to the public

name: review
trans: n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅 vt. 回顾；检查；复审 vi. 回顾；复习功课；写评论

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: revise
trans: n. 修订；校订 vi. 修订；校订；复习功课 vt. 修正；复习；校订

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: inspect
trans: vt. 检查；视察；检阅 vi. 进行检查；进行视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: consult
trans: vi. 请教；商议；当顾问 vt. 查阅；商量；向…请教

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: skim
trans: n. 撇；撇去的东西；表层物；瞒报所得的收入 adj. 脱脂的；撇去浮沫的；表层的 vt. 略读；撇去…的浮物；从…表面飞掠而过；去除；（为逃税而）隐瞒（部分收入） vi. 浏览；掠过

sentences.english: seagulls skimming the waves
sentences.chinese: 掠过浪尖的海鸥

sentences.english: Julie skimmed the sports page.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉浏览了体育版。

detailed_translations.english: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often

name: scan
trans: n. 扫描；浏览；审视；细看 vt. 扫描；浏览；细看；详细调查；标出格律 vi. 扫描；扫掠

sentences.english: He scanned the horizon, but there was no sign of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 他朝地平线处仔细眺望，但是找不到那艘船的踪影。

sentences.english: She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.
sentences.chinese: 她端详着他的脸，想知道他在想些什么。

sentences.english: Video cameras scanned the car park.
sentences.chinese: 摄像机监视着停车场。

sentences.english: She scanned through the paper.
sentences.chinese: 她浏览了一下报纸。

sentences.english: 英文例句:You scan the text into the computer, then edit it.
sentences.chinese: 把文本扫描进电脑，然后进行编辑。

detailed_translations.english: to examine an area carefully but quickly, often because you are looking for a particular person or thing

name: scrutinise
trans: vt. 详细检查，细看(scrutinize) vi. 作详细检查，细阅

name: recite
trans: vt. 背诵；叙述；列举 vi. 背诵；叙述

sentences.english: She recited a poem that she had learnt at school.
sentences.chinese: 她背诵了一首学校里学的诗。

detailed_translations.english: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to

name: dictate
trans: n. 命令；指示 vt. 命令；口述；使听写 vi. 口述；听写

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

name: examination
trans: n. 考试；检查；查问

sentences.english: The examination results will be announced in September.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩将于9月公布。

sentences.english: He’s already taken the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他已经参加了入学考试。

sentences.english: The proposals are still under examination.
sentences.chinese: 那些提案还在审查之中。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: test
trans: n. 试验；检验 vt. 试验；测试 vi. 试验；测试

sentences.english: Did you get a good mark in the test?
sentences.chinese: 你这次测验成绩好吗？

detailed_translations.english: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge
to examine a substance or thing in order to find out its qualities or what it contains

name: quiz
trans: n. 考查；恶作剧；课堂测验 vt. 挖苦；张望；对…进行测验

sentences.english: a love quiz in a magazine
sentences.chinese: 杂志上的爱情问答

sentences.english: a general knowledge quiz
sentences.chinese: 常识问答竞赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 智力竞赛，问答比赛；小测验
detailed_translations.english: a competition or game in which people have to answer questions
to ask someone a lot of questions

name: presentation
trans: n. 展示；描述，陈述；介绍；赠送

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: plagiarise
trans: vt. 剽窃，抄袭

name: copy
trans: n. 副本；一册；摹仿 vt. 复制；复印；抄袭 vi. 复制；复印；抄袭

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing
to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

name: print
trans: n. 印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记 vt. 印刷；打印；刊载；用印刷体写；在…印花样 vi. 印刷；出版；用印刷体写

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: thesis
trans: n. 论文；论点

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: essay
trans: n. 散文；试图；随笔 vt. 尝试；对…做试验

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

name: paper
trans: n. 纸；论文；文件；报纸 adj. 纸做的 vt. 用纸糊；用纸包装 vi. 贴糊墙纸；发交通违章传票

sentences.english: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
sentences.chinese: 我给你找张纸，你好把号码写下来。

sentences.english: Do you have a pen and paper?
sentences.chinese: 你有笔和纸吗？

sentences.english: the 1998 White Paper on political reform
sentences.chinese: 1998年政治改革白皮书

sentences.english: a paper on the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 一篇关于南北战争的论文

detailed_translations.english: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

name: dissertation
trans: n. 论文，专题；学术演讲

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

name: project
trans: n. 工程；计划；事业 vt. 设计；计划；发射；放映 vi. 设计；计划；表达；投射

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: heading
trans: n. 标题；（足球）头球；信头 v. 用头顶（head的ing形式）

sentences.english: chapter headings
sentences.chinese: 章节标题

detailed_translations.english: the title written at the beginning of a piece of writing, or at the beginning of part of a book

name: outset
trans: n. 开始；开端

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: outline
trans: n. 轮廓；大纲；概要；略图 vt. 概述；略述；描画…轮廓

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

name: point
trans: n. 要点；得分；标点；[机] 尖端 vt. 指向；弄尖；加标点于 vi. 表明；指向

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: gist
trans: n. 主旨，要点；依据

sentences.english: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist (= understand the main meaning ) of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要去管各个细节，只要理解主要意思就行了。

detailed_translations.english: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

name: opinion
trans: n. 意见；主张

sentences.english: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
sentences.chinese: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

detailed_translations.english: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

name: introduce
trans: vt. 介绍；引进；提出；采用

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

name: reference
trans: n. 参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书 vt. 引用 vi. 引用

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: elicit
trans: vt. 抽出，引出；引起

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: quote
trans: n. 引用 vi. 报价；引用；引证 vt. 报价；引述；举证

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹 vt. 提取；取出；摘录；榨取

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: abstract
trans: n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念 adj. 抽象的；深奥的 vt. 摘要；提取；使……抽象化；转移(注意力、兴趣等)；使心不在焉 vi. 做摘要；写梗概

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: summary
trans: n. 概要，摘要，总结 adj. 简易的；扼要的

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

name: assume
trans: vt. 僭取；篡夺；夺取；擅用；侵占 vi. 假定；设想；承担；采取

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: presume
trans: vi. 相信；擅自行为 vt. 假定；推测；擅自；意味着

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: suppose
trans: conj. 假使…结果会怎样 vt. 假设；认为；让（虚拟语气）；推想 vi. 猜想；料想

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: hypothesis
trans: n. 假设

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: postulate
trans: n. 基本条件；假定 vt. 假定；要求；视…为理所当然

sentences.english: He dismissed arguments postulating differing standards for human rights in different cultures and regions.
sentences.chinese: 他无法接受的是假定人权标准在不同文化和地区有所不同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 假定；要求；视…为理所当然
detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something might have happened or be true
something believed to be true, on which an argument or scientific discussion is based

name: speculate
trans: vi. 推测；投机；思索 vt. 推断

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报 vt. 预报，预言；预知

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知 vi. 感到，感知；认识到

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: detect
trans: vt. 察觉；发现；探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: discern
trans: vt. 识别；领悟，认识 vi. 看清楚，辨别

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: recognise
trans: vt. 认出；承认，认可；识别

name: conscious
trans: adj. 意识到的；故意的；神志清醒的

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: reckon
trans: vi. 估计；计算；猜想，料想 vt. 测算，估计；认为；计算

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: deem
trans: vt. 认为，视作；相信 vi. 认为，持某种看法；作某种评价

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

name: imply
trans: vt. 意味；暗示；隐含

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: deliberate
trans: adj. 故意的；深思熟虑的；从容的 vt. 仔细考虑；商议

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送 vi. 代表；提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: insist
trans: vi. 坚持，强调 vt. 坚持，强调

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: persist
trans: vi. 存留，坚持；持续，固执 vt. 坚持说，反复说

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: understand
trans: vi. 理解；懂得；熟悉 vt. 理解；懂；获悉；推断；省略

sentences.english: She doesn’t understand English.
sentences.chinese: 她不懂英语。

sentences.english: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？

sentences.english: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
sentences.chinese: 那女人口音很重，我听不懂她在说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to know the meaning of what someone is telling you, or the language that they speak

name: comprehend
trans: vt. 理解；包含；由…组成

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: analyse
trans: vt. 分析；分解；细察

sentences.english: She still needs to analyse the data.
sentences.chinese: 她仍需要分析这些数据。

sentences.english: You need to sit down and analyse why you feel so upset.
sentences.chinese: 你得坐下来想一想自己为什么会那么生气。

sentences.english: Joe had never tried to analyze their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 乔从未试图去理清他们的关系。

detailed_translations.english: to examine the nature or structure of sth, especially by separating it into its parts, in order to understand or explain it

name: diagnose
trans: vt. 诊断；断定 vi. 诊断；判断

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: infer
trans: vi. 推断；作出推论 vt. 推断；推论

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: deduce
trans: vt. 推论，推断；演绎出

sentences.english: Alison cleverly deduced that I was the author of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森聪明地推断出我是这封信的作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推论， 推断， 演绎
detailed_translations.english: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

name: conclude
trans: vi. 推断；断定；决定 vt. 推断；决定，作结论；结束

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: analogy
trans: n. 类比；类推；类似

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: compare
trans: vi. 相比，匹敌；比较，区别；比拟（常与to连用） vt. 比拟，喻为；[语]构成 n. 比较

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

name: contrast
trans: n. 对比；差别；对照物 vt. 使对比；使与…对照 vi. 对比；形成对照

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: overlap
trans: n. 重叠；重复 vi. 部分重叠；部分的同时发生 vt. 与…重叠；与…同时发生

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: contradiction
trans: n. 矛盾；否认；反驳

sentences.english: apparent contradictions in the defendant’s testimony
sentences.chinese: 被告证词中的明显矛盾

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾， 不一致； 否认， 反驳
detailed_translations.english: a difference between two statements, beliefs, or ideas about something that means they cannot both be true

name: disagree
trans: vi. 不同意；不一致；争执；不适宜

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

name: differ
trans: vi. 相异；意见分歧 vt. 使…相异；使…不同

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: diverse
trans: adj. 不同的；多种多样的；变化多的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: nuance
trans: n. 细微差别

sentences.english: He was aware of every nuance in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 他听得出她声音中的每一个细微变化。

sentences.english: subtle nuances of meaning
sentences.chinese: 含义的细微差别

detailed_translations.english: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

name: inductive
trans: adj. [数] 归纳的；[电] 感应的；诱导的

sentences.english: inductive reasoning
sentences.chinese: 归纳推理

detailed_translations.english: using known facts to produce general principles

name: detail
trans: n. 细节，详情 vt. 详述；选派 vi. 画详图

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: thorough
trans: adj. 彻底的；十分的；周密的

sentences.english: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。

sentences.english: a thorough and detailed biography
sentences.chinese: 详尽的传记

sentences.english: The police investigation was very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 警方的调查十分彻底。

sentences.english: thorough notes of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 详尽的会议记录

detailed_translations.english: including every possible detail

name: example
trans: n. 例子；榜样 vt. 作为…的例子；为…做出榜样 vi. 举例

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

name: instance
trans: n. 实例；情况；建议 vt. 举...为例

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: demonstrate
trans: vt. 证明；展示；论证 vi. 示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: illustrate
trans: vi. 举例 vt. 阐明，举例说明；图解

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: manifest
trans: vt. 证明，表明；显示 vi. 显示，出现 n. 载货单，货单；旅客名单 adj. 显然的，明显的；明白的

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: prove
trans: vi. 证明是 vt. 证明；检验；显示

sentences.english: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
sentences.chinese: 你错了，我可以证明。

sentences.english: To prove his point (= show that he was right ) , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明自己的观点，他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

name: determine
trans: v. （使）下决心，（使）做出决定 vt. 决定，确定；判定，判决；限定 vi. 确定；决定；判决，终止；[主用于法律]了结，终止，结束

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: decide
trans: vi. 决定，下决心 vt. 决定；解决；判决

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事 vt. 决定；溶解；使…分解；决心要做… vi. 解决；决心；分解

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: survey
trans: n. 调查；测量；审视；纵览 vt. 调查；勘测；俯瞰 vi. 测量土地

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: observe
trans: vt. 庆祝 vt. 观察；遵守；说；注意到；评论 vi. 观察；说；注意到；评论

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: inquire
trans: vi. 询问；查究；询价 vt. 询问；查究；问明

sentences.english: ‘Why are you doing that?’ the boy inquired.
sentences.chinese: “你为什么这么做？”男孩问道。

sentences.english: Toby would have liked to inquire further (= ask more questions ).
sentences.chinese: 托比本想问更多的问题。

sentences.english: The investigation will inquire into the company’s financial dealings.
sentences.chinese: 此次调查将会涉及公司的财务往来。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for information

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询 vi. 询问；表示怀疑 vt. 询问；对……表示疑问

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: questionnaire
trans: n. 问卷；调查表

sentences.english: Teachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

name: achieve
trans: vt. 取得；获得；实现；成功 vi. 达到预期的目的，实现预期的结果，如愿以偿

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成；实现；达到

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: attain
trans: n. 成就 vt. 达到，实现；获得；到达 vi. 达到；获得；到达

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

name: credit
trans: n. 信用，信誉；[金融] 贷款；学分；信任；声望 vt. 相信，信任；把…归给，归功于；赞颂

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: score
trans: n. 分数；二十；配乐；刻痕 vt. 获得；评价；划线，刻划；把…记下 vi. 得分；记分；刻痕

sentences.english: At half-time the score was one all.
sentences.chinese: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.english: What’s the score?
sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.chinese: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.english: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.chinese: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

name: mark
trans: n. 标志；马克；符号；痕迹；分数 vi. 作记号 vt. .标志；做标记于；打分数 n. . 标志；做标记于；打分数

sentences.english: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
sentences.chinese: 小猫身体基本为白色，背上有黑色斑点。

sentences.english: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在页末做个记号。

sentences.english: A simple wooden cross marked her grave.
sentences.chinese: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of darker or lighter colour on a plain surface such as a person’s skin or an animal’s fur
to show where something is

name: grade
trans: n. 年级；等级；成绩；级别；阶段 vt. 评分；把…分等级 vi. 分等级；逐渐变化

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.english: The best grades of tea are expensive.
sentences.chinese: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。

detailed_translations.english: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is
a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has

name: rank
trans: n. 排；等级；军衔；队列 adj. 讨厌的；恶臭的；繁茂的 vt. 排列；把…分等 vi. 列为；列队

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: row
trans: n. 行，排；划船；街道；吵闹 vt. 划船；使……成排 vi. 划船；争吵

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: queue
trans: n. 队列；长队；辫子 vt. 将…梳成辫子；使…排队 vi. 排队；排队等候

sentences.english: You’ll have to join the queue.
sentences.chinese: 你得排队。

sentences.english: Some of the people queuing for tickets had been there since dawn.
sentences.chinese: 购票队伍中有些人天刚亮就来了。

detailed_translations.english: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move
to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere

name: grant
trans: n. 拨款；[法] 授予物 vt. 授予；允许；承认 vi. 同意

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: praise
trans: n. 赞扬；称赞；荣耀；崇拜 vt. 赞美，歌颂；表扬 vi. 赞美；赞扬

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

name: appreciate
trans: vi. 增值；涨价 vt. 欣赏；感激；领会；鉴别

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；成果，资料；回复

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: underestimate
trans: n. 低估 vt. 低估；看轻

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

name: overestimate
trans: vt. 对……评价过高；对……估计过高 n. 估计过高；评价过高；出价过高 vi. 估计过高；评价过高

sentences.english: He tends to overestimate his own abilities.
sentences.chinese: 他往往高估自己的能力。

sentences.english: The importance of training in health and safety cannot be overestimated (= is extremely important ).
sentences.chinese: 对健康和安全方面的培训极为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think something is better, more important etc than it really is

name: apply
trans: vi. 申请；涂，敷；适用；请求 vt. 申请；涂，敷；应用

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: fellowship
trans: n. 团体；友谊；奖学金；研究员职位

sentences.english: Regular outings contribute to a sense of fellowship among co-workers.
sentences.chinese: 经常外出游玩可以增进同事之间的友谊。

sentences.english: ...the National Schizophrenia Fellowship.
sentences.chinese: …全国精神分裂协会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴关系,友情,友谊；团体
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of friendship resulting from shared interests or experiences

name: scholarship
trans: n. 奖学金；学识，学问

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

name: reward
trans: n. [劳经] 报酬；报答；酬谢 vt. [劳经] 奖励；奖赏

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: award
trans: n. 奖品；判决 vt. 授予；判定

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: prize
trans: n. 奖品；奖赏；战利品 adj. 获奖的 vt. 珍视；捕获；估价

sentences.english: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.chinese: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.english: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.chinese: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.english: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.chinese: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

sentences.english: The total prize money was £30,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

name: fee
trans: n. 费用；酬金；小费 vt. 付费给……

sentences.english: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
sentences.chinese: 月付35英镑，即可使用健身房和游泳池。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: technique
trans: n. 技巧，技术；手法

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

name: polytechnic
trans: n. 工艺学校；理工专科学校 adj. 各种工艺的；综合技术的

sentences.english: Baltimore Polytechnic Institute
sentences.chinese: 巴尔的摩理工学院

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种工艺的；综合技术的
工艺学校；理工专科学校
detailed_translations.english: a word used in the names of high schools or colleges in the US, where you can study technical or scientific subjects

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: mechanic
trans: n. 技工，机修工 adj. 手工的

sentences.english: a garage mechanic
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂的技工

detailed_translations.english: someone who is skilled at repairing motor vehicles and machinery

name: advance
trans: n. 发展；前进；增长；预付款 adj. 预先的；先行的 vt. 提出；预付；使……前进；将……提前 vi. 前进；进展；上涨

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: innovate
trans: vi. 创新；改革；革新 vt. 改变；创立；创始；引人

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: gizmo
trans: n. 小发明（等于gismo ）

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；执照；专利品 adj. 专利的；新奇的；显然的 vt. 授予专利；取得…的专利权

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: devise
trans: n. 遗赠 vt. 设计；想出；发明；图谋；遗赠给

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；创造；虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: discover
trans: vi. 发现 vt. 发现；发觉

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: disclose
trans: vt. 公开；揭露

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧 vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: uncover
trans: vt. 发现；揭开；揭露 vi. 发现；揭示；揭去盖子

sentences.english: When the seedlings sprout, uncover the tray.
sentences.chinese: 幼苗发芽后，揭开盘上的遮盖物。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: domain
trans: n. 领域；域名；产业；地产

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: field
trans: n. 领域；牧场；旷野；战场；运动场 adj. 扫描场；田赛的；野生的 vt. 把暴晒于场上；使上场 vi. 担任场外队员

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: realm
trans: n. 领域，范围；王国

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: foundation
trans: n. 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

name: specialise
trans: vt. 使专门化；限定…的范围；深入（等于specialize） vi. 专门研究（等于specialize）

sentences.english: 'I never intended to 'specialise' in water balloons,' he added.
sentences.chinese: “我从来都没有打算“专门研究”水球，”他补充道。

sentences.english: 'I never intended to 'specialise' in water balloons,' he added. 'The idea was to create some interesting images and then move on to another subject.
sentences.chinese: “我从来都没有打算“专门研究”水球，”他补充道。“这个主意是为了拍一些有趣的图片然后转移到另外的主题上。”

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: concentrate
trans: n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液 vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集 vt. 集中；浓缩

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点；中心；清晰；焦距 vt. 使集中；使聚焦 vi. 集中；聚焦；调节焦距

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: utilise
trans: vt. 使用（等于utilize）；利用

sentences.english: The one thing that never crosses the minds of our elite is to utilise local talent, local enterprise, local money to build Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 有一件事从来没有穿过我们精英的头脑，那就是利用本地人才，本地企业，本地资金来建设巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Another benefit is that learning software can utilise all three learning techniques of hearing, seeing and doing which greatly reinforces acquisition.
sentences.chinese: 另一个好处是，学习软件可以利用看、听、做三种学习方式，加强学生对知识的理解和掌握。

name: usage
trans: n. 使用；用法；惯例

sentences.english: land usage
sentences.chinese: 土地的利用

sentences.english: a book on modern English usage
sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something is used or the way in which it is used

name: tester
trans: n. 天盖；检验器；试验员

name: apply
trans: vi. 申请；涂，敷；适用；请求 vt. 申请；涂，敷；应用

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: device
trans: n. 装置；策略；图案

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: appliance
trans: n. 器具；器械；装置

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: facility
trans: n. 设施；设备；容易；灵巧

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: equipment
trans: n. 设备，装备；器材

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: tool
trans: n. 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段 vt. 用工具给……加工 vi. 使用工具；用机床装备工厂

sentences.english: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
sentences.chinese: 我没有合适的工具来摆弄发动机。

sentences.english: a shop selling garden tools
sentences.chinese: 出售园艺工具的商店

detailed_translations.chinese: 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段
detailed_translations.english: something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用工具；用机床装备工厂

name: gauge
trans: n. 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格 vt. 测量；估计；给…定规格

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: measure
trans: n. 测量；措施；程度；尺寸 vt. 测量；估量；权衡 vi. 测量；估量

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

name: calculate
trans: vt. 计算；预测；认为；打算 vi. 计算；以为；作打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: compute
trans: n. 计算；估计；推断 vt. 计算；估算；用计算机计算 vi. 计算；估算；推断

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

name: count
trans: n. 计数；计算；伯爵 vt. 计算；认为 vi. 计数；有价值

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: estimate
trans: n. 估计，估价；判断，看法 vt. 估计，估量；判断，评价 vi. 估计，估价

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: assess
trans: vt. 评定；估价；对…征税

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: evaluate
trans: vt. 评价；估价；求…的值 vi. 评价；估价

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: accessory
trans: n. 配件；附件；[法] 从犯 adj. 副的；同谋的；附属的

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

name: byproduct
trans: n. 副产品

sentences.english: The raw material for the tyre is a byproduct of oil refining.
sentences.chinese: 这种轮胎的原料是汽油提炼的副产品。

detailed_translations.english: A byproduct is something that is produced during the manufacture or processing of another product

name: auxiliary
trans: n. 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构 adj. 辅助的；副的；附加的

sentences.english: a nursing auxiliary
sentences.chinese: 护理辅助人员

detailed_translations.chinese: 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构
detailed_translations.english: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

name: versatile
trans: adj. 多才多艺的；通用的，万能的；多面手的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: add
trans: n. 加法，加法运算 vi. 加；增加；加起来；做加法 vt. 增加，添加；补充说；计算…总和

sentences.english: If the mixture seems dry, add water.
sentences.chinese: 如果混合物看上去干，加点水。

detailed_translations.english: to put something with something else or with a group of other things

name: accumulate
trans: vt. 积攒 vi. 累积；积聚

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集 vi. 集合，聚集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: gather
trans: n. 聚集；衣褶；收获量 vt. 收集；收割；使…聚集；使…皱起 vi. 聚集；化脓；皱起

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: attach
trans: vi. 附加；附属；伴随 vt. 使依附；贴上；系上；使依恋

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: belong
trans: vi. 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置

sentences.english: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子属于她家已有三四代了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置
detailed_translations.english: If something belongs to you, you own it

name: optics
trans: n. [光] 光学

sentences.english: The key to success is the combination of transformation optics with another promising new field of science known as plasmonics.
sentences.chinese: 成功的关键是转变的光学与另一个有希望的表面电浆子场组合，被称为新的科学。

sentences.english: But it was, ironically, not until the invention of the laser in 1960 that understanding the quantum nature of optics became crucial.
sentences.chinese: 但是，具有讽刺意义的是，直到1960年激光发明后，认识光学的量子本质才变得至关重要。

sentences.english: One essential tool is adaptive optics technology, which, in effect, takes the twinkle out of the stars, thus providing sharper images from telescopes on the ground than would otherwise be possible.
sentences.chinese: 一个重要的工具就是自适应光学技术，实际上就是通过地面上的望远镜将恒星的闪耀去除，从而比采用其他方法能提供更为明显的图像。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of light and the way we see

name: microscope
trans: n. 显微镜

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: lens
trans: n. 透镜，镜头；眼睛中的水晶体；晶状体；隐形眼镜；汽车的灯玻璃 vt. 给……摄影

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: radar
trans: n. [雷达] 雷达，无线电探测器

sentences.english: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
sentences.chinese: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。

sentences.english: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

name: echo
trans: n. 回音；效仿 vt. 反射；重复 vi. 随声附和；发出回声

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: sensor
trans: n. 传感器

sentences.english: The latest Japanese vacuum cleaners contain sensors that detect the amount of dust and type of floor.
sentences.chinese: 日本最新款吸尘器装有传感器，能测出灰尘量和地板类型。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

name: multimedia
trans: n. 多媒体 adj. 多媒体的

sentences.english: ...the case of an insurance company using multimedia to improve customer service in its branches.
sentences.chinese: …一家保险公司利用多媒体技术改善其分支机构的客户服务的实例。

detailed_translations.english: You use multimedia to refer to computer programs and products which involve sound, pictures, and film, as well as text
involving computers and computer programs that use a mixture of sound, pictures, video, and writing to give information

name: network
trans: n. 网络；广播网；网状物

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

name: browser
trans: n. [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人

sentences.english: a Web browser
sentences.chinese: 网页浏览器

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人
detailed_translations.english: a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen

name: dial
trans: n. 转盘；刻度盘；钟面 vt. 给…拨号打电话 vi. 拨号

sentences.english: The lighted dial of her watch said 1.20.
sentences.chinese: 她手表上的夜光表面显示时间为1点20分。

sentences.english: I think I dialed the wrong number.
sentences.chinese: 我想我拨错号码了。

detailed_translations.english: the round part of a clock, watch, machine etc that has numbers that show you the time or a measurement
to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call

name: microcomputer
trans: n. 微电脑；[计] 微型计算机

sentences.english: The merchant sold electrical appliances, such as microcomputer, microphone, microprocessor and microwave ovens.
sentences.chinese: 商人卖一些电器，比如微型计算机，话筒，微处理器和微波炉。

sentences.english: Or, as in my case, turning on the old antique microcomputer to read my single-sided, single-density floppies might lead to a fire and the quick end of your weekend data retrieval project.
sentences.chinese: 或者，像我所作的那样，打开一个旧的古董微型计算机来读取我的单面单密度磁盘，而这有可能引起一场火灾，以及你的周末数据检索计划的快速完结。

detailed_translations.chinese: 微电脑；[计] 微型计算机
detailed_translations.english: a small computer

name: laptop
trans: n. 膝上型轻便电脑，笔记本电脑

sentences.english: She used to work at her laptop until four in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 她以前经常在笔记本电脑前工作到凌晨4点钟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 膝上型轻便电脑，笔记本电脑
detailed_translations.english: a small computer that you can carry with you

name: software
trans: n. 软件

sentences.english: She loaded the new software .
sentences.chinese: 她给电脑装上新的软件。

sentences.english: a software company
sentences.chinese: 软件公司

detailed_translations.english: the sets of programs that tell a computer how to do a particular job

name: keyboard
trans: n. 键盘 vt. 键入；用键盘式排字机排字 vi. 用键盘进行操作；作键盘式排字机排字

sentences.english: a computer keyboard
sentences.chinese: 计算机键盘

detailed_translations.english: a board with buttons marked with letters or numbers that are pressed to put information into a computer or other machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 键入；用键盘式排字机排字
detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer, using a keyboard

name: screen
trans: n. 屏，幕；屏风 vt. 筛；拍摄；放映；掩蔽 vi. 拍电影

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: loudspeaker
trans: n. 喇叭，扬声器；扩音器

sentences.english: The loudspeaker's stopped working.
sentences.chinese: 扩音器不响了。

sentences.english: BERLIN (Reuters) -- Before leaving on vacation, a German couple set up a loudspeaker and timer rigged to blast their neighbors with the sound of a crowing cock every morning.
sentences.chinese: 柏林(路透社)：一对德国夫妇在外出度假前安装好了扩音器和定时装置,使其在每天凌晨用刺耳的公鸡啼叫声骚扰邻居。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used to make sounds louder

name: microphone
trans: n. 扩音器，麦克风

sentences.english: She spoke confidently into the microphone.
sentences.chinese: 她自信地对着麦克风说话。

sentences.english: They searched the room for hidden microphones.
sentences.chinese: 他们在屋里翻找隐藏的话筒。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that you speak into to record your voice or make it louder when you are speaking or performing in public

name: cassette
trans: n. 盒式磁带；暗盒；珠宝箱；片匣
