trans: n. 唱诗班；合唱队；舞蹈队 vt. 合唱 vi. 合唱

sentences.english: The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.english: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.english: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.chinese: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

name: monk
trans: n. 僧侣，修道士；和尚

sentences.english: ...saffron-robed Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: …身穿黄袍的和尚们。

detailed_translations.english: a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a  monastery

name: temple
trans: n. 庙宇；寺院；神殿；太阳穴

sentences.english: They lighted the temple with many candles.
sentences.chinese: 他们用许多蜡烛照亮这个寺庙。

sentences.english: The entire valley reverberated with the sound of the temple bells.
sentences.chinese: 整个山谷回荡着庙宇的钟声。

sentences.english: After the fire, nothing remained of the magnificent buildings of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 大火过后， 寺院里的那些雄伟建筑已荡然无存。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people go to  worship  , in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

name: pagoda
trans: n. （东方寺院的）宝塔；印度的旧金币

detailed_translations.chinese: （东方寺院的）宝塔；印度的旧金币
detailed_translations.english: a Buddhist  temple (= religious building )  that has several levels with a decorated roof at each level

name: empire
trans: n. 帝国；帝王统治，君权

sentences.english: the Roman empire
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

name: imperial
trans: n. 纸张尺寸；特等品 adj. 帝国的；皇帝的；至高无上的；威严的

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

name: royal
trans: n. 王室；王室成员 adj. 皇家的；盛大的；女王的；高贵的；第一流的

sentences.english: the royal palace
sentences.chinese: 王宫

sentences.english: the royal family
sentences.chinese: 王室

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

name: dynasty
trans: n. 王朝，朝代

sentences.english: The Habsburg dynasty ruled in Austria from 1278 to 1918.
sentences.chinese: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

detailed_translations.english: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years

name: chronology
trans: n. 年表；年代学

sentences.english: The book includes a chronology of his life and works.
sentences.chinese: 本书附有他的生平和著作年表。

detailed_translations.english: an account of events in the order in which they happened

name: emperor
trans: n. 皇帝，君主

sentences.english: They  bowed before the emperor as he entered the court.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝进入朝廷时他们都向他鞠躬致敬。

sentences.english: The daughter of an emperor does not worry about finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝女儿不愁嫁。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

detailed_translations.english: the man who is the ruler of an empire

name: king
trans: n. 国王；最有势力者；王棋 vi. 统治；做国王 vt. 立…为王 adj. 主要的，最重要的，最大的

sentences.english: On 2 December Henry VI was crowned king (= made the king at an official ceremony ).
sentences.chinese: 12月2日，亨利六世加冕为王。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，最重要的，最大的

name: queen
trans: n. 女王，王后；（纸牌中的）皇后；（蜜蜂等的）蜂王 vt. 使…成为女王或王后 vi. 做女王

sentences.english: Queen Elizabeth
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白女王

sentences.english: the future queen
sentences.chinese: 未来的王后

sentences.english: the queen of diamonds
sentences.chinese: 方块Q，方块王后

detailed_translations.english: the female ruler of a country

name: prince
trans: n. 王子，国君；亲王；贵族

sentences.english: Prince William
sentences.chinese: 威廉王子

sentences.english: Prince Rainier of Monaco
sentences.chinese: 摩纳哥的兰尼埃亲王

detailed_translations.english: the son of a king, queen, or prince

name: princess
trans: n. 公主；王妃；女巨头

sentences.english: Princess Anne
sentences.chinese: 安妮公主

sentences.english: the Princess of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士王妃

detailed_translations.english: a close female relation of a king and queen, especially a daughter

name: majesty
trans: n. 威严；最高权威，王权；雄伟；权威

sentences.english: the sheer majesty of St Peter's in Rome
sentences.chinese: 罗马圣彼得大教堂的雄伟庄严

sentences.english: His Majesty the King
sentences.chinese: 国王陛下

detailed_translations.english: the impressive and attractive quality that sth has

name: nobility
trans: n. 贵族；高贵；高尚

sentences.english: the nobility of his intentions
sentences.chinese: 他崇高的志向

detailed_translations.english: the group of people in some countries who belong to the highest social class and have titles such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

name: lord
trans: n. 主；上帝 int. 主，天啊 vt. 使成贵族 vi. 作威作福，称王称霸

sentences.english: the feudal lords
sentences.chinese: 封建领主

detailed_translations.english: a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land
a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land

name: knight
trans: n. 骑士，武士；爵士 vt. 授以爵位

sentences.english: knights in armour
sentences.chinese: 身披盔甲的骑士

sentences.english: He was knighted in June 1988.
sentences.chinese: 他于1988年6月被授予爵士称号。

detailed_translations.english: a man with a high rank in the past who was trained to fight while riding a horse
If someone is knighted, they are given a knighthood

name: guardian
trans: n. [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者 adj. 守护的

sentences.english: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

name: nostalgia
trans: n. 乡愁；怀旧之情；怀乡病

sentences.english: He might be influenced by nostalgia for the surroundings of his happy youth.
sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

detailed_translations.english: Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time

name: homesick
trans: adj. 想家的；思乡病的

sentences.english: She's feeling a little homesick.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有些想家了。

detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because you are a long way from your home

name: celebrity
trans: n. 名人；名声

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: status
trans: n. 地位；状态；情形；重要身份

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: background
trans: n. 背景；隐蔽的位置 adj. 背景的；发布背景材料的 vt. 作…的背景

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: experience
trans: n. 经验；经历；体验 vt. 经验；经历；体验

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

name: anecdote
trans: n. 轶事；奇闻；秘史

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: accident
trans: n. 事故；意外；[法] 意外事件；机遇

sentences.english: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 肯在工作中出了事故，不得不去医院。

sentences.english: I had a slight accident with your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 出了个小小的意外，我把你的咖啡弄洒了。

sentences.english: a train accident
sentences.chinese: 火车事故

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone is injured or something is damaged without anyone intending them to be

name: incident
trans: n. 事件，事变；插曲 adj. [光] 入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: thrive
trans: vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: prosperity
trans: n. 繁荣，成功

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: setback
trans: n. 挫折；退步；逆流

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

name: adversity
trans: n. 逆境；不幸；灾难；灾祸

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

name: language
trans: n. 语言；语言文字；表达能力

sentences.english: How many languages do you speak?
sentences.chinese: 你能说几种语言？

sentences.english: one of the best-known poems in the English language
sentences.chinese: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

detailed_translations.english: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area

name: symbol
trans: n. 象征；符号；标志

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: sign
trans: n. 迹象；符号；记号；手势；指示牌 vt. 签署；示意 vi. 签署；签名

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: gesture
trans: n. 姿态；手势 vt. 用动作表示 vi. 作手势；用动作示意

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

name: handwriting
trans: n. 笔迹；书法；书写；手稿 v. 亲手写（handwrite的ing形式）

sentences.english: I recognised her handwriting on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 我认出了信封上她的笔迹。

sentences.english: My handwriting has never been very neat.
sentences.chinese: 我的字从来都写得不够工整。

detailed_translations.english: the style of someone’s writing

name: pictograph
trans: n. [语] 象形文字；古代石壁画；统计图表

sentences.english: ...a pictogram of a pine tree.
sentences.chinese: …一幅代表一棵松树的象形图画。

detailed_translations.chinese: [语] 象形文字；古代石壁画；统计图表
detailed_translations.english: A pictogram is a simple drawing that represents something. Pictograms were used as the earliest form of writing.

name: wedge
trans: n. 楔子；楔形物；导致分裂的东西 vt. 楔入；挤进；楔住 vi. 楔入；挤进

sentences.english: He hammered the wedge into the crack in the stone.
sentences.chinese: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.english: The phone was wedged under his chin.
sentences.chinese: 电话夹在他下巴下面。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood
to force something firmly into a narrow space

name: knot
trans: n. （绳等的）结；节瘤，疙瘩；海里/小时（航速单位） vt. 打结 vi. 打结

sentences.english: A pretty scarf was loosely knotted around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的脖子上松松地系着一条漂亮的围巾。

detailed_translations.english: to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc
a hard round place in a piece of wood where a branch once joined the tree
to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

name: linguistics
trans: n. 语言学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: It took three hours for the doctor of linguistics to tell us this. Again I quit.
sentences.chinese: 关于这一点，这个语言学博士足足讲了三个小时，我再次退出了。

sentences.english: Then we have research center in Grenoble, France where the focus is all on linguistics, machine learning.
sentences.chinese: 我们在法国格勒诺布尔也有研究中心,研究重点是语言学和机器学习。

detailed_translations.english: the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history

name: semantic
trans: adj. 语义的；语义学的（等于semantical）

sentences.english: He did not want to enter into a semantic debate.
sentences.chinese: 他不想卷入一场关于语义的争论。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the meanings of words

name: syntax
trans: n. 语法；句法；有秩序的排列

sentences.english: His grammar and syntax, both in oral and written expression, were much better than the average.
sentences.chinese: 无论在口头还是笔头上，他的语法和句法都非常出众。

detailed_translations.chinese: 语法；句法；有秩序的排列
detailed_translations.english: the way words are arranged to form sentences or phrases, or the rules of grammar which control this

name: grammar
trans: n. 语法；语法书

sentences.english: Check your spelling and grammar.
sentences.chinese: 检查你的拼写和语法。

sentences.english: the rules of English grammar
sentences.chinese: 英语的语法规则

sentences.english: A dictionary lists the words, a grammar states the rules.
sentences.chinese: 词典收列单词，语法书讲解语法规则。

detailed_translations.english: the rules by which words change their forms and are combined into sentences, or the study or use of these rules

name: phonetics
trans: n. 发音学，语音学

sentences.english: Forensics includes many fields of science, including anthropology, biology, chemistry, engineering, genetics, medicine, pathology, phonetics, psychiatry, and toxicology.
sentences.chinese: 法医物证学涉及到多个科学领域，包括人类学、工程学、医药学、病理学、语音学、精神病学和毒理学。

sentences.english: Taking such refresher courses in Linguistics as phonetics, phonology, morphology, and etymology in Dept. of Japanese at Shanghai University of Foreign Languages (9/1992-7/1993).
sentences.chinese: 在上海外国语大学日语系进修语音学，音位学，形态学和词源学等语言学课程（1992年9月至1993年7月）。

sentences.english: Useful Courses for English-teaching include: Psychology, teaching methodology,phonetics, rhetoric, grammar, composition.
sentences.chinese: 对英语教学有用的课程包括：心理学、教学方法论、语音学、修辞学、语法、写作。

detailed_translations.english: the science and study of speech sounds

name: pronounce
trans: vt. 发音；宣判；断言 vi. 发音；作出判断

sentences.english: The scheme was pronounced a failure.
sentences.chinese: 该方案宣告失败。

detailed_translations.english: to give a judgment or opinion
to officially state that something is true

name: intonation
trans: n. 声调，语调；语音的抑扬

sentences.english: intonation patterns
sentences.chinese: 语调类型

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the level of your voice changes in order to add meaning to what you are saying, for example by going up at the end of a question

name: inflection
trans: n. 弯曲，变形；音调变化

sentences.english: ...the upward inflection of her voice.
sentences.chinese: …她声调的升高。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which a word changes its form to show a difference in its meaning or use

name: dialect
trans: n. 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征 adj. 方言的

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

name: accent
trans: n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号 vt. 强调；重读；带…口音讲话

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: utterance
trans: n. 表达；说话；说话方式

sentences.english: These two utterances communicate the same message.
sentences.chinese: 这两句话传递同样的信息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意见, 说话, 发表
detailed_translations.english: the action of saying something

name: oral
trans: n. 口试 adj. 口头的，口述的

sentences.english: oral history
sentences.chinese: 口述的历史

sentences.english: an oral agreement
sentences.chinese: 口头协议

detailed_translations.english: spoken, not written
a spoken test, especially in a foreign language

name: verbal
trans: n. 动词的非谓语形式 adj. 口头的；言语的；动词的；照字面的

sentences.english: verbal skills
sentences.chinese: 语言技能

detailed_translations.chinese: 口头的； 用言辞的， 用文字的； 动词的
detailed_translations.english: spoken rather than written

name: syllable
trans: n. 音节 vt. 划分音节 vi. 按音节发音；讲话

sentences.english: The accent falls on the third syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音落在第三个音节上。

sentences.english: The stress falls on the second syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音在第二个音节上。

sentences.english: Accentuate the word “accent”on the first syllable.
sentences.chinese: 在“accent”一词的第一个音节上加重音符号。

detailed_translations.english: a word or part of a word which contains a single vowel sound

name: phoneme
trans: n. 音素，音位

name: vowel
trans: n. 元音；母音 adj. 元音的

sentences.english: But he could say vowel clearly and began to learn vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 但是他已经能清楚地说元音并开始学习词汇。

sentences.english: Always end the name of your child with a vowel, so that when you yell the name will carry.
sentences.chinese: 一定让孩子的名字以元音结尾，这样当你喊叫时，这样的名字会助你一臂之力。

sentences.english: Towards the end of Middle English, a sudden and distinct change in pronunciation (the Great Vowel Shift) started, with vowels being pronounced shorter and shorter.
sentences.chinese: 随着中世纪英语的泯灭，发音突然发生了很大的变化（元音大推移），元音的发音越来越短。

detailed_translations.english: one of the human speech sounds that you make by letting your breath flow out without closing any part of your mouth or throat

name: consonant
trans: n. 辅音；辅音字母 adj. 辅音的；一致的；和谐的

sentences.english: This policy is scarcely consonant with the government’s declared aims.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策与政府所宣称的目标基本上不符。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a combination of musical notes that sounds pleasant
a speech sound made by partly or completely stopping the flow of air through your mouth

name: alphabet
trans: n. 字母表，字母系统；入门，初步 n. Google创建的名为Alphabet的公司，改变Google原有公司架构，旨在使其当下主要业务和长期投资项目间的区别更加清晰。

sentences.english: The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters.
sentences.chinese: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing

name: logogram
trans: n. 简写；速记用略字；标记

name: vocabulary
trans: n. 词汇；词表；词汇量

sentences.english: Teachers were impressed by his vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 他的词汇量给老师们留下了深刻的印象。

detailed_translations.english: all the words that someone knows or uses

name: dictionary
trans: n. 字典；词典

sentences.english: a German-English dictionary
sentences.chinese: 一本德英词典

detailed_translations.english: a book that gives a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings in the same language, or another language

name: idiom
trans: n. 成语，习语；土话

sentences.english: ..familiar idioms and metaphors, such as "turning over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: …如“翻开新的一页”这样熟悉的习语和比喻。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

name: phrase
trans: n. 短语

sentences.english: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

name: clause
trans: n. 条款；[计] 子句

sentences.english: A confidentiality clause was added to the contract.
sentences.chinese: 合同中加上了一项保密条款。

detailed_translations.english: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: tense
trans: n. 时态 adj. 紧张的；拉紧的 vt. 变得紧张；使拉紧 vi. 拉紧，变得紧张

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: root
trans: n. 根；根源；词根；祖先 vt. 生根，固定；根源在于 vi. 生根；根除

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: prefix
trans: n. 前缀 vt. 加前缀；将某事物加在前面

sentences.english: To telephone from the U.S. use the prefix 011 33 before the numbers given here.
sentences.chinese: 从美国拨出电话，请在所给号码前加拨前置代码011 33。

detailed_translations.english: a group of letters that is added to the beginning of a word to change its meaning and make a new word, such as ‘un’ in ‘untie’ or ‘mis’ in ‘misunderstand’

detailed_translations.chinese: 加前缀；将某事物加在前面
detailed_translations.english: to add a prefix to a word, name, or set of numbers

name: suffix
trans: n. 后缀；下标 vt. 添后缀

sentences.english: Otherwise, the suffix will not be added.
sentences.chinese: 否则，后缀将不会被添加。

sentences.english: This required that all subtrees are all under the same suffix, since there is no common parent between suffixes.
sentences.chinese: 这需要所有的子树都位于相同的后缀中，因为后缀之间不存在公共父节点。

sentences.english: But only if the GAC as a whole does not like a suffix must the board take these objections into account—and then issue a detailed explanation if it overrides them.
sentences.chinese: 但是，只有在GAC也不同意新域名后缀的情况下，董事会才会考虑这些反对意见。 而且如果要撤销这些域名的话，它需要发布一份详细的解释报告。

detailed_translations.english: a letter or letters added to the end of a word to form a new word, such as ‘ness’ in ‘kindness’ or ‘ly’ in ‘suddenly’

name: abbreviation
trans: n. 缩写；缩写词

sentences.english: The abbreviation for Kansas is KS.
sentences.chinese: Kansas（堪萨斯州）的缩写是KS。

detailed_translations.english: a short form of a word or expression

name: synonym
trans: n. 同义词；同义字

sentences.english: The term "industrial democracy" is often used as a synonym for worker participation.
sentences.chinese: “工业民主”这一词语常被用作“工人参与”的同义词。

detailed_translations.english: a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

name: antonym
trans: n. [语] 反义词

sentences.english: a dictionary of synonyms and antonyms
sentences.chinese: 同义词和反义词词典

detailed_translations.english: a word that means the opposite of another word

name: noun
trans: n. 名词

sentences.english: An adjective must agree with  its noun in mumber and case.
sentences.chinese: 形容词在数和格方面必须符合其所修饰的名词。

sentences.english: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.chinese: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.english: On the spines of books shelved in certain libraries and bookstores you will see OATES but this is a descriptive term, this is not a noun.
sentences.chinese: 在某些图书馆或书店里某些图书的书脊上，你会看见“欧茨”，但这里的“欧茨”不能作名词解，它是个描述性的词语。

detailed_translations.english: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).

name: singular
trans: n. 单数 adj. 单数的；单一的；非凡的；异常的

sentences.english: the singular form of the noun
sentences.chinese: 该名词的单数形式

sentences.english: If the subject is singular, use a singular verb.
sentences.chinese: 如果主语是单数，就用单数动词。

sentences.english: a singular achievement
sentences.chinese: 非凡的成就

detailed_translations.english: a singular noun, verb, form etc is used when writing or speaking about one person or thing

name: plural
trans: n. 复数 adj. 复数的

sentences.english: The letter “s” terminates most plural nouns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数复数名词以字母“S”结尾。

sentences.english: What’s the plural of ‘mouse’?
sentences.chinese: ‘mouse’的复数形式是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a plural word or form shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘we’ is a plural  pronoun  .
a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

name: pronoun
trans: n. 代词

sentences.english: Here you should use plural pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 这里你应该用复数代词。

sentences.english: No chance! It was the best of the weak pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 没有机会！这真是弱者的最好代词。

sentences.english: Now if we could only figure out the pronoun problem.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们可以解决这个代词问题了。

detailed_translations.english: a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, such as ‘he’ instead of ‘Peter’ or ‘the man’

name: verb
trans: n. 动词；动词词性；动词性短语或从句 adj. 动词的；有动词性质的；起动词作用的

sentences.english: The German verb is postponed.
sentences.chinese: 德语动词放在句末。

sentences.english: The word is compounded of a preposition and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 这个词是由一个介词和一个动词复合而成的。

sentences.english: The verb agrees with its subject in number and person.
sentences.chinese: 动词的数和人称与主语一致。

detailed_translations.english: a word or group of words that describes an action, experience, or state, such as ‘come’, ‘see’, and ‘put on’

name: adjective
trans: n. 形容词 adj. 形容词的；从属的

sentences.english: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.chinese: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.english: The "me" circuit hummed not only when they thought whether a particular adjective described themselves, but also when they considered whether it described their mother.
sentences.chinese: “我”神经回路不仅当他们想到一个特定形容词是否描述自我时接通，而且当他们思考该词是否形容自己母亲时也同样。

sentences.english: Using phrases like “Darwinian selection” or “Darwinian evolution” implies there must be another kind of evolution at work, a process that can be described with another adjective.
sentences.chinese: 使用“达尔文选择”或“达尔文进化论”这样的短语意味着工作中必须有另一种进化形式，一种可以用另一个形容词来描述的过程。

detailed_translations.english: a word that describes a noun or  pronoun  . In the phrase ‘black hat’, ‘black’ is an adjective and in the sentence ‘It makes her happy’, ‘happy’ is an adjective.

name: adverb
trans: n. 副词 adj. 副词的

sentences.english: Will you please compare the adverb “well”?
sentences.chinese: 请你说出副词“well”的原级、比较级和最高级好吗?

sentences.english: In the class, the professor taught the students how to use an adverb in the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 在课堂上，教授教学生们如何在一个句子里用副词。

sentences.english: For our purposes, we get the definition of a word as well as its pronunciation and type (for example, adjective, noun, verb, adverb).
sentences.chinese: 我们这里只涉及到词汇的定义、音标和词性（如形容词、名词、动词、副词等）。

detailed_translations.english: a word that adds to the meaning of a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or a whole sentence, such as ‘slowly’ in ‘He ran slowly’, ‘very’ in ‘It’s very hot’, or ‘naturally’ in ‘Naturally, we want you to come.’

name: preposition
trans: n. 介词；前置词

sentences.english: There is nothing in the rules of grammar to suggest that ending a sentence with a preposition is wrong.
sentences.chinese: 在语法规则中没有哪一条表明以介词结束一个句子是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: a word that is used before a noun,  pronoun  , or  gerund  to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.

name: conjunction
trans: n. 结合；[语] 连接词；同时发生

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result

name: consistent
trans: adj. 始终如一的，一致的；坚持的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: complicated
trans: adj. 难懂的，复杂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: complex
trans: n. 复合体；综合设施 adj. 复杂的；合成的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: compile
trans: vt. 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件是由卫生部汇编的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: version
trans: n. 版本；译文；倒转术

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

name: translate
trans: vt. 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动 vi. 翻译

sentences.english: Poetry doesn’t usually translate well.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌通常都译不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
detailed_translations.english: to change written or spoken words into another language

name: paraphrase
trans: n. 释义；解释；意译 vt. 释义

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

name: interpret
trans: vi. 解释；翻译 vt. 说明；口译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: narrate
trans: vt. 叙述；给…作旁白 vi. 叙述；讲述

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 阐明，说明；照亮；使灿烂；用灯装饰 vi. 照亮

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: decipher
trans: n. 密电译文 vt. 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

name: eloquence
trans: n. 口才；雄辩；雄辩术；修辞

sentences.english: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 他天生具有罕见的口才。

sentences.english: On the one hand to expand my insight, on the other hand exercise my eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 一方面扩大我的洞察力，另一方面锻炼我的口才。

sentences.english: I exercise in the race his eloquence and ability to cope, to learn some basic manners.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中我锻炼了自己口才和应变能力， 学习到了一些基本的礼仪。

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染 vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: discussion
trans: n. 讨论，议论

sentences.english: class discussions
sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

name: brainstorm
trans: n. 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动 vt. 集体讨论；集思广益以寻找 vi. 集体讨论；动脑筋；出主意

sentences.english: While some of the greatest ideas and solutions come up in brainstorm meetings, we also lose most of our time in discussion without action.
sentences.chinese: 当在头脑风暴的会议上有一些顶级的主意或者解决方法提出时，我们也浪费了很多时间在没有行动的讨论上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动
集体讨论；集思广益以寻找

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；辩论会 vt. 辩论，争论，讨论 vi. 辩论，争论，讨论

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: commentary
trans: n. 评论；注释；评注；说明

sentences.english: Commentary is by Tom Ferris.
sentences.chinese: 由汤姆•费里斯现场解说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实况报道， 解说词； 评论， 评论文章
detailed_translations.english: a spoken description of an event, given while the event is happening, especially on the television or radio

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过 vi. 谈判，交涉

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: contention
trans: n. 争论，争辩；争夺；论点

sentences.english: His case has become a source of contention between civil liberties activists and the government.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子已变成了公民自由活动家们和政府之间的争论缘由。

detailed_translations.english: a strong opinion that someone expresses

name: medium
trans: adj. 中间的，中等的；半生熟的 n. 方法；媒体；媒介；中间物

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

name: press
trans: n. 压；按；新闻；出版社；[印刷] 印刷机 vt. 压；按；逼迫；紧抱 vi. 压；逼；重压

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: journalist
trans: n. 新闻工作者；报人；记日志者

sentences.english: a well-known journalist and broadcaster
sentences.chinese: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: critic
trans: n. 批评家，评论家；爱挑剔的人

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: commentator
trans: n. 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者

sentences.english: political commentators
sentences.chinese: 政治评论员

detailed_translations.chinese: 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

name: exponent
trans: n. [数] 指数；典型；说明者，说明物 n. 倡导者，鼓吹者，代表者，拥护者 adj. 说明的

sentences.english: The fatigue life increases with decreasing modulus of surface layer in a power function with a negative exponent.
sentences.chinese: 沥青面层的疲劳寿命随着面层材料模量的降低以负指数的幂函数形式增加；

sentences.english: In addition, this paper also suggests that the reason for high burning rate-pressure exponent is deflagration of some components in propellant.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本文还提出，火药中某些组分的爆燃是导致一些火药燃速压力指数较高的原因。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

detailed_translations.english: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself

name: announcer
trans: n. [广播] 广播员；宣告者

sentences.english: The radio announcer said it was nine o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 电台播音员报了9点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives information to people using a  loudspeaker  or  microphone  , especially at an airport or railway station

name: correspondent
trans: n. 通讯记者；客户；通信者；代理商行

sentences.english: The result was correspondent with my wishes.
sentences.chinese: 结果与我的愿望是一致的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通讯员，记者；异地代理商；代理银行
detailed_translations.english: someone who is employed by a newspaper or a television station etc to report news from a particular area or on a particular subject

name: messenger
trans: n. 报信者，送信者；先驱

sentences.english: There will be a messenger at the airport to collect the photographs from our courier.
sentences.chinese: 机场会有一名信使从我们的快递员那儿取走照片。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else

name: editor
trans: n. 编者，编辑；社论撰写人；编辑装置

sentences.english: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编

detailed_translations.english: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

name: typist
trans: n. 打字员，打字者

sentences.english: I’m a slow typist.
sentences.chinese: 我打字很慢。

detailed_translations.english: a secretary whose main job is to  type  letters

name: handout
trans: n. 散发材料（免费发给的新闻通报）；上课老师发的印刷品；文字资料 ,（会议上分发的）；施舍物

sentences.english: people who have to live on handouts from the state
sentences.chinese: 必须依赖国家发放的救济金生活的人们

sentences.english: a cash handout
sentences.chinese: 救济款

detailed_translations.english: money or goods that are given to someone, for example because they are poor

name: leaflet
trans: n. 小叶；传单

sentences.english: a leaflet on skin cancer
sentences.chinese: 有关皮肤癌的宣传页

sentences.english: Students were handing out election leaflets at the station.
sentences.chinese: 学生在车站分发选举传单。

detailed_translations.english: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

name: propaganda
trans: n. 宣传；传道总会

sentences.english: the spreading of political propaganda
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传的开展

sentences.english: the government propaganda machine
sentences.chinese: 政府的宣传机器

detailed_translations.english: information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them

name: publish
trans: vi. 出版；发行；刊印 vt. 出版；发表；公布

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: disseminate
trans: vt. 宣传，传播；散布 vi. 散布；广为传播

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

name: foresee
trans: vt. 预见；预知

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: expect
trans: vi. 期待；预期 vt. 期望；指望；认为；预料

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: await
trans: vt. 等候，等待；期待

sentences.english: Several men are awaiting trial for robbery.
sentences.chinese: 几个人因抢劫正在候审。

detailed_translations.english: to wait for something

name: pastime
trans: n. 娱乐，消遣

sentences.english: Reading was her favourite pastime.
sentences.chinese: 阅读是她最喜爱的消遣方式。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting

name: entertain
trans: vt. 娱乐；招待；怀抱；容纳 vi. 款待

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: recreation
trans: n. 娱乐；消遣；休养

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: amuse
trans: vt. 娱乐；消遣；使发笑；使愉快

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: gossip
trans: n. 小道传闻；随笔；爱说长道短的人 vi. 闲聊；传播流言蜚语

sentences.english: Who knows how much of the gossip was true.
sentences.chinese: 有谁知道这些流言蜚语有多少是真的呢？

sentences.english: You must avoid gossip and focus on what you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流言蜚语；爱说长道短的人
detailed_translations.english: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

name: rumour
trans: n. 谣言 vt. 传闻

sentences.english: His name has come up in the rumour mill as a possible director for the project.
sentences.chinese: 有谣传说他可能出任这个项目的主管。

detailed_translations.english: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

name: consensus
trans: n. 一致；舆论；合意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: festival
trans: n. 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐 adj. 节日的，喜庆的；快乐的

sentences.english: the Swansea Festival of Music and the Arts
sentences.chinese: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

sentences.english: Christmas is one of the main festivals in the Christian Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节是基督教历的重大节日之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔电影、戏剧、音乐等的〕节，节庆，会演；节日
detailed_translations.english: an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year

name: feast
trans: n. 筵席，宴会；节日 vt. 享受；款待，宴请 vi. 享受；参加宴会

sentences.english: They feasted well into the afternoon on mutton and corn stew.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽情享用玉米炖羊肉，一直吃到下午。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽情地吃， 宴饮； 参加宴会
detailed_translations.english: If you feast on a particular food, you eat a large amount of it with great enjoyment
a large meal where a lot of people celebrate a special occasion

name: programme
trans: n. 计划，规划；节目；程序 vt. 规划；拟…计划 vi. 编程序；制作节目

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

name: rehearsal
trans: n. 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述

sentences.english: a wedding rehearsal
sentences.chinese: 婚礼的预演

detailed_translations.chinese: 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述
detailed_translations.english: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

name: perform
trans: vt. 执行；完成；演奏 vi. 执行，机器运转；表演

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: imitate
trans: vt. 模仿，仿效；仿造，仿制

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: mimic
trans: vt. 模仿，摹拟 n. 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑 adj. 模仿的，模拟的；假装的

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

name: simulate
trans: adj. 模仿的；假装的 vt. 模仿；假装；冒充

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: circus
trans: n. 马戏；马戏团

sentences.english: Piccadilly Circus
sentences.chinese: 皮卡迪利广场

detailed_translations.english: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

name: magic
trans: n. 巫术；魔法；戏法 adj. 不可思议的；有魔力的；魔术的

sentences.english: a book of magic spells
sentences.chinese: 一本关于魔法的书

sentences.english: a magic sword
sentences.chinese: 一把魔剑

detailed_translations.english: in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things
the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions

name: drama
trans: n. 戏剧，戏剧艺术；剧本；戏剧性事件

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: concert
trans: n. 音乐会；一致；和谐 adj. 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的 vt. 使协调；协同安排 vi. 协调；协力

sentences.english: a rock concert
sentences.chinese: 摇滚音乐会

sentences.english: a concert of French choral music
sentences.chinese: 法国合唱音乐会

sentences.english: We were going to a concert in Bath Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听一场在巴斯修道院内举行的音乐会。

sentences.english: She still does about 100 concerts every year.
sentences.chinese: 她每年仍然举行100场左右的演唱会。

detailed_translations.english: a performance given by musicians or singers

detailed_translations.chinese: 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的

name: symphony
trans: n. 交响乐；谐声，和声

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

name: orchestra
trans: n. 管弦乐队；乐队演奏处

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

name: ballet
trans: n. 芭蕾舞剧；芭蕾舞乐曲

sentences.english: She wants to be a ballet dancer .
sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

sentences.english: We’re going to the ballet tomorrow evening.
sentences.chinese: 我们明天晚上要去看芭蕾舞演出。

detailed_translations.english: a style of dancing that tells a dramatic story with music but no talking or singing

name: opera
trans: n. 歌剧；歌剧院；歌剧团

sentences.english: We go to the opera (= go to a performance of opera ) regularly.
sentences.chinese: 我们常去听歌剧。

sentences.english: an opera singer
sentences.chinese: 歌剧演员

detailed_translations.english: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

name: comedy
trans: n. 喜剧；喜剧性；有趣的事情

sentences.english: a career in stand-up comedy
sentences.chinese: 单口喜剧表演职业

detailed_translations.english: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧；灾难；惨案

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: animation
trans: n. 活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制

sentences.english: 3-D animations
sentences.chinese: 三维动画片

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制
detailed_translations.english: liveliness and excitement

name: film
trans: n. 电影；薄膜；胶卷；轻烟 vt. 在…上覆以薄膜；把…拍成电影 vi. 摄制电影；生薄膜；变得朦胧

sentences.english: Have you seen any good films recently?
sentences.chinese: 你最近看过什么好的影片吗？

sentences.english: I shot five rolls of film on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 我在度假时拍了五卷胶卷。

sentences.english: a film of oil on the surface of the water
sentences.chinese: 水面上的一层油

sentences.chinese: 难以忘怀的曲调

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

name: disc

sentences.chinese: 穿在金属圆盘上的三把钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆盘，[电子] 唱片（等于disk）
detailed_translations.english: a round flat shape or object

trans: n. 钢琴

sentences.english: Jean accompanied her on the piano .
sentences.chinese: 琼为她钢琴伴奏。

detailed_translations.english: a large musical instrument that has a long row of black and white  key s  . You play the piano by sitting in front of it and pressing the keys.

name: violin
trans: n. 小提琴；小提琴手

sentences.english: He plays the violin in an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在管弦乐队中演奏小提琴。

sentences.english: She is first violin of an orchestra .
sentences.chinese: 她是管弦乐队的第一小提琴手。

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

name: cello
trans: n. 大提琴

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

sentences.english: Classical instruments like the violin or the cello are boring, you say, and definitely not cool.
sentences.chinese: 你觉得小提琴或大提琴这样的传统乐器非常枯燥，而且一点也不酷。

sentences.english: Many years ago, a young man learning cello went to Casals, the greatest cellist in the 20th century, for advice: how can I become an excellent cellist?
sentences.chinese: 很多年前，有一位学大提琴的年轻人去向20世纪最伟大的大提琴家卡萨尔斯讨教：我怎样才能成为一名优秀的大提琴家？

trans: n. 吉他，六弦琴 vi. 弹吉他

sentences.chinese: 唱歌之前他先弹了几下吉他。

sentences.chinese: 他和我说话时把吉他拨弄响了。

trans: n. 口琴（等于mouth organ）

sentences.chinese: 通常盖斯会带着他的口琴，在聊了一会儿以后，他们会一起演奏几首歌。

sentences.english: In 1995, when the ban went into effect, the only instrument allowed in the Cumberland prison was the harmonica, but inmates who already had a guitar or electronic keyboard were allowed to keep them.
sentences.chinese: 1995年该禁令实行后，坎伯兰监狱的囚犯们被允许拥有的乐器就只剩下口琴了，但在此之前已经有电吉他或键盘的囚犯被批准可以保留这些乐器。

sentences.english: He made a harmonica out of the corncob.
sentences.chinese: 他把玉米棒子弄得象口琴一样。

trans: n. 喇叭；喇叭声 vt. 吹喇叭；吹嘘 vi. 吹喇叭；发出喇叭般的声音

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

sentences.chinese: 一面低音大鼓

sentences.english: 1,000 people marched, beating drums and carrying flags.
sentences.chinese: 1,000人打着鼓扛着旗游行。

sentences.english: Jones played the drums in an all-girl band.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯在一个女子乐队里打鼓。

sentences.english: a brake drum
sentences.chinese: 制动鼓

sentences.english: a 5 gallon oil drum
sentences.chinese: 5加仑的油桶

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument made of skin stretched over a circular frame, played by hitting it with your hand or a stick

name: flute
trans: n. 长笛；【工程设计】(刀具的)出屑槽 vt. 用长笛吹奏 vi. 吹长笛

sentences.english: The boy trilled on a flute.
sentences.chinese: 男孩在长笛上吹颤音。

sentences.english: He played a nice tune on the flute.
sentences.chinese: 他吹奏了一首优美的笛子曲。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: tournament
trans: n. 锦标赛，联赛；比赛

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: Olympic
trans: adj. 奥林匹斯山的，奥林匹亚的；奥林匹克的

sentences.english: an Olympic gold medal
sentences.chinese: 奥运会金牌

detailed_translations.chinese: 奥林匹斯山的，奥林匹亚的；奥林匹克的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Olympic Games

name: sponsor
trans: n. 赞助者；主办者；保证人 vt. 赞助；发起

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: patron
trans: n. 赞助人；保护人；主顾

sentences.english: a wealthy patron
sentences.chinese: 富有的赞助人

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: champion
trans: n. 冠军；拥护者；战士 adj. 优胜的；第一流的 vt. 支持；拥护

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: spectator
trans: n. 观众；旁观者

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vt. 自愿 vi. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: famous
trans: adj. 著名的；极好的，非常令人满意的

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

name: well-known
trans: adj. 著名的；众所周知的；清楚明白的

sentences.english: This is probably their best-known song.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是他们最有名的歌曲。

sentences.english: a well-known TV presenter
sentences.chinese: 著名的电视节目主持人

detailed_translations.chinese: 众所周知的， 著名的
detailed_translations.english: known by a lot of people

name: energetic
trans: adj. 精力充沛的；积极的；有力的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

name: vigorous
trans: adj. 有力的；精力充沛的

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

name: stadium
trans: n. 体育场；露天大型运动场

sentences.english: the new Olympic Stadium
sentences.chinese: 新的奥林匹克体育场

detailed_translations.chinese: 体育场；露天大型运动场
detailed_translations.english: a building for public events, especially sports and large rock music concerts, consisting of a playing field surrounded by rows of seats

name: gym
trans: n. 健身房；体育；体育馆

sentences.english: I go to the gym as often as I can.
sentences.chinese: 我一有空就去健身房健身。

detailed_translations.english: a special building or room that has equipment for doing physical exercise

name: training
trans: n. 训练；培养；瞄准；整枝 v. 训练；教养（train的ing形式）

sentences.english: Police drivers have to undergo intensive training .
sentences.chinese: 警察驾驶员都得接受强化训练。

sentences.english: a rigorous training session
sentences.chinese: 一节严格的训练课

sentences.english: On-the-job training will be supplemented by classroom lectures.
sentences.chinese: 除了在职培训，还将有课堂授课作为补充。

sentences.english: The shop opens late on Fridays because of staff training .
sentences.chinese: 因为员工培训，这家商店周五较晚开门营业。

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching or being taught the skills for a particular job or activity

name: exercise
trans: n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼 vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐 vi. 运动；练习

sentences.english: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在日常生活中安排一些经常性的锻炼。

sentences.english: Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
sentences.chinese: 由于在办公室工作，我很少运动。

sentences.english: role-play exercises
sentences.chinese: 角色扮演练习

sentences.english: Horses need to be exercised regularly.
sentences.chinese: 马需要有规律的训练。
