sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: erection
trans: n. 勃起；建造；建筑物；直立

sentences.english: ...the erection of temporary fencing to protect hedges.
sentences.chinese: …为保护树篱的临时栅栏的搭建。

detailed_translations.english: if a man has an erection, his penis increases in size and becomes stiff and upright because he is sexually excited

name: structure
trans: n. 结构；构造；建筑物 vt. 组织；构成；建造

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

name: construct
trans: n. 构想，概念 vt. 建造，构造；创立

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: obstruct
trans: vt. 妨碍；阻塞；遮断 vi. 阻塞；设障碍

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

name: establish
trans: vi. 植物定植 vt. 建立；创办；安置

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: build
trans: n. 构造；体形；体格 vi. 建筑；建造 vt. 建立；建筑

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

name: found
trans: v. 找到（find的过去分词） vt. 创立，建立；创办

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: concrete
trans: n. 具体物；凝结物 adj. 混凝土的；实在的，具体的；有形的 vt. 使凝固；用混凝土修筑 vi. 凝结

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: steel
trans: n. 钢铁；钢制品；坚固 adj. 钢制的；钢铁业的；坚强的 vt. 钢化；使冷酷

sentences.english: a steel bridge
sentences.chinese: 钢铁大桥

sentences.english: stainless steel(= steel that does not change colour ) knives
sentences.chinese: 不锈钢小刀

detailed_translations.english: strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and  carbon

name: stability
trans: n. 稳定性；坚定，恒心

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

name: site
trans: n. 地点；位置；场所 vt. 设置；为…选址

sentences.english: an archaeological site
sentences.chinese: 考古现场

detailed_translations.english: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

name: venue
trans: n. 审判地；犯罪地点；发生地点；集合地点

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事 adj. 有重大意义或影响的

name: situated
trans: v. 使位于；使处于（situate的过去分词） adj. 位于…的；处于…境遇的

sentences.english: The house is situated near the college.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子位于学院附近。

sentences.english: a farm situated in the valley
sentences.chinese: 位于山谷里的一个农场

sentences.english: The hotel is ideally situated near the seafront.
sentences.chinese: 酒店的位置理想，靠近海滨。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular place or position

name: locate
trans: vt. 位于；查找…的地点 vi. 定位；定居

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: reside
trans: vi. 住，居住；属于

sentences.english: He spent most of his time in Rutherglen, where his family resided.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分时间都在拉瑟格伦度过，他的家人就在那里居住。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: inhabit
trans: vt. 栖息；居住于；占据 vi. （古）居住；栖息

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: settle
trans: n. 有背长椅 vi. 解决；定居；沉淀；下陷 vt. 解决；安排；使…定居

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: dwelling
trans: n. 住处；寓所 v. 居住（dwell的现在分词）

sentences.english: Some 3,500 new dwellings are planned for the area.
sentences.chinese: 大约三千五百套新住宅计划在这个地区新建。

detailed_translations.english: a house, apartment etc where people live

name: skyscraper
trans: n. 摩天楼，超高层大楼；特别高的东西

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

name: villa
trans: n. 别墅；郊区住宅

sentences.chinese: 我们在西班牙租了一座假日别墅。

detailed_translations.english: a house that you use or rent while you are on holiday

name: mansion
trans: n. 大厦；宅邸

sentences.english: a beautiful country mansion
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的乡村宅第

detailed_translations.english: a very large house

name: apartment
trans: n. 公寓；房间

sentences.english: She lives in a small apartment.
sentences.chinese: 她住在一套小公寓里。

detailed_translations.english: a set of rooms on one floor of a large building, where someone lives

name: flat

sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。

sentences.english: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我仰面平躺，眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平直地； 直截了当地
detailed_translations.english: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping

detailed_translations.chinese: 平的；固定的；漏气的；单调的，沉闷的；浅的
detailed_translations.english: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

name: hostel
trans: n. 旅社，招待所（尤指青年旅社）

sentences.english: The 260-bed hostel on Second Street, just two blocks from the beach, had come highly recommended by an Angeleno I’d met on a recent trip to the Caribbean.
sentences.chinese: 这家有260张床位的招待所离海滩只有两个街区，是我在最近一次去加勒比海的旅途上遇见的一个洛杉矶人极力推荐的。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people can stay and eat fairly cheaply

name: lodge
trans: n. 旅馆；门房；集会处；山林小屋 vt. 提出；寄存；借住；嵌入 vi. 寄宿；临时住宿

sentences.english: a building used to lodge prisoners of war
sentences.chinese: 一座关押战俘的建筑物

sentences.english: The bullet lodged in the sergeant's leg, shattering his thigh bone.
sentences.chinese: 子弹射入这个军士的腿部，击碎了他的大腿骨。

If an object lodges somewhere, it becomes stuck there

detailed_translations.chinese: 乡间小屋， 旅舍； 寄宿者， 投宿者
detailed_translations.english: a small house on the land of a large country house, usually at the main entrance gate

name: hut
trans: n. 小屋；临时营房 vt. 使住在小屋中；驻扎 vi. 住在小屋中；驻扎

sentences.english: a wooden hut
sentences.chinese: 小木屋

detailed_translations.english: a small simple building with only one or two rooms

name: cabin
trans: n. 小屋；客舱；船舱 vt. 把…关在小屋里 vi. 住在小屋里

sentences.english: a log cabin
sentences.chinese: 原木小屋

sentences.english: 英文例句He showed her to a small cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他把她带到一间小房舱。

sentences.english: He sat quietly in the first class cabin of the flight looking tired.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地坐在班机的头等舱内，看上去有些疲惫。

detailed_translations.english: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

name: cellar
trans: n. 地窖；酒窖；地下室 vt. 把…藏入地窖

sentences.english: a coal cellar
sentences.chinese: 煤窖

detailed_translations.english: a room under a house or other building, often used for storing things

name: shed
trans: n. 小屋，棚；分水岭 vt. 流出；摆脱；散发；倾吐 vi. 流出；脱落；散布

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want

name: cottage
trans: n. 小屋；村舍；（农舍式的）小别墅

sentences.english: a country cottage
sentences.chinese: 乡间小屋

sentences.english: We’re staying in a holiday cottage in Dorset.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在多塞特的一个度假小别墅里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小屋；村舍；（农舍式的）小别墅
detailed_translations.english: a small house in the country

name: nursery
trans: n. 苗圃；托儿所；温床

sentences.english: She puts her baby in this nursery and then goes back to work.
sentences.chinese: 她把孩子送到这家托儿所然后回去上班。

sentences.english: The garden, developed over the past 35 years, includes a nursery.
sentences.chinese: 这个有35年历史的花园里有一个苗圃。

detailed_translations.english: a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work

name: cradle
trans: n. 摇篮；发源地；发祥地；支船架 vt. 抚育；把...搁在支架上；把...放在摇篮内

sentences.english: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.english: Athens is often regarded as the cradle of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 雅典常常被认为是民主的发源地。

name: shelter
trans: n. 庇护；避难所；遮盖物 vt. 保护；使掩蔽 vi. 躲避，避难

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: block
trans: n. 块；街区；大厦；障碍物 adj. 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的 vt. 阻止；阻塞；限制；封盖

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

name: grid
trans: n. 网格；格子，栅格；输电网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: aisle
trans: n. 通道，走道；侧廊

sentences.english: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat (=  seat next to the aisle  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

detailed_translations.english: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

name: porch
trans: n. 门廊；走廊

sentences.english: He was standing on the porch, waving as we drove away.
sentences.chinese: 我们开车离开的时候，他站在走廊上向我们挥手。

detailed_translations.english: an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church

name: corridor
trans: 走廊

sentences.english: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这儿走，浴室就在走廊的尽头。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it

name: stair
trans: n. 楼梯，阶梯；梯级

sentences.english: We walked up four flights of stairs (= sets of stairs ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们往上走了四段楼梯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

name: staircase
trans: n. 楼梯

sentences.english: They walked down the staircase together.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起沿楼梯通道往下走。

detailed_translations.english: a set of stairs inside a building with its supports and the side parts that you hold on to

name: storey
trans: n. [建] 楼层；叠架的一层

sentences.chinese: 有一段楼梯通往上面一层。

detailed_translations.english: a floor or level of a building

name: layer
trans: n. 层，层次；膜；[植]压条；放置者，计划者 vt. 把…分层堆放；借助压条法；生根繁殖；将（头发）剪成不同层次 vi. 形成或分成层次；[植]通过压条法而生根

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

name: elevator
trans: n. 电梯；升降机；升降舵；起卸机

sentences.english: We’ll have to take the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好坐电梯了。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building

name: escalator
trans: n. （美）自动扶梯；电动扶梯

sentences.english: Take the escalator to the third floor and it's the last office on the left.
sentences.chinese: 乘电梯到4楼，左边最后的那个办公室就是。

detailed_translations.english: a set of moving stairs that take people to different levels in a building

name: handrail
trans: n. 扶手；（楼梯等的）栏杆

name: pillar
trans: n. 柱子，柱形物；栋梁；墩 vt. 用柱支持

sentences.english: Eight massive stone pillars supported the roof.
sentences.chinese: 八根巨大的石柱支撑起房顶。

sentences.english: Mr Fitzwilliam had been seen as a pillar of the community.
sentences.chinese: 菲茨威廉先生已被视为社区的骨干。

detailed_translations.english: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge

name: column
trans: n. 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: beam
trans: n. 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆 vt. 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露 vi. 照射；堆满笑容

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: vault
trans: n. 拱顶；撑竿跳；地下室 vi. 跳跃；成穹状弯曲 vt. 做成圆拱形；撑竿跳过

sentences.english: The robber vaulted over the counter and took $200 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯跃过柜台，抢走了200美元现金。

detailed_translations.english: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church
to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you

name: arch
trans: n. 弓形，拱形；拱门 adj. 主要的 vt. 使…弯成弓形；用拱连接 vi. 拱起；成为弓形

sentences.english: When she passed under the arch leading out of the park, Mira whooped with delight.
sentences.chinese: 从通向公园外的拱门下走过时，米拉高兴地喊叫起来。

detailed_translations.english: a structure with a curved top and straight sides that supports the weight of a bridge or building
to form or make something form a curved shape

name: ceiling
trans: n. 天花板；上限

sentences.english: rooms with high ceilings
sentences.chinese: 天花板很高的房间

sentences.english: a light hanging from the ceiling
sentences.chinese: 吊在天花板上的灯

detailed_translations.english: the inner surface of the top part of a room

name: eaves
trans: n. 屋檐；凸出的边缘

sentences.english: Birds had nested under the eaves.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在屋簷下筑了巢。

detailed_translations.english: the edges of a roof that stick out beyond the walls

name: chimney
trans: n. 烟囱

sentences.english: We can’t light a fire because the chimney hasn’t been swept.
sentences.chinese: 烟囱管没有清扫过，我们生不了火。

sentences.english: a factory chimney
sentences.chinese: 工厂的烟囱

detailed_translations.english: a structure through which smoke or steam is carried up away from a fire, etc. and through the roof of a building; the part of this that is above the roof

name: reception
trans: n. 接待；接收；招待会；感受；反应

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: lobby
trans: n. 大厅；休息室；会客室；游说议员的团体 vt. 对……进行游说 vi. 游说议员

sentences.english: a hotel lobby
sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: bench
trans: n. 长凳；工作台；替补队员 vt. 给…以席位；为…设置条凳

sentences.english: We sat on a park bench.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

detailed_translations.english: a long seat for two or more people, especially outdoors

name: parlour
trans: n. 客厅；会客室；雅座

detailed_translations.english: a room in a house which has comfortable chairs and is used for meeting guests

name: fireplace
trans: n. 壁炉

sentences.english: In the evenings, we gathered around the fireplace and talked in hushed whispers.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，我们聚集在壁炉周围轻声交谈。

detailed_translations.english: a special place in the wall of a room, where you can make a fire

name: radiator
trans: n. 散热器；暖气片；辐射体

sentences.english: We bled the car radiator off.
sentences.chinese: 我们排放汽车散热器中的气。

sentences.english: When her cellphone rang in class one day, the teacher smashed it against the radiator.
sentences.chinese: 有一次在课堂上她的手机响了，老师立马将它摔到了暖气片上。

sentences.english: It still has dingy corridors, ancient washrooms, rusting bunk beds (six to a room), a single fluorescent bulb hanging from the ceiling and an ancient radiator in front of the window.
sentences.chinese: 仍旧是昏暗的走廊，老式的厕所，生锈的床铺（六人一间），一只荧光灯泡吊在天花板上，还有一只旧暖气片放在窗前。

detailed_translations.english: a thin metal container that is fastened to a wall and through which hot water passes to provide heat for a room

name: living room
trans: n. 客厅；起居室

sentences.english: I made some new curtains for the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我给起居室做了新窗帘。

sentences.english: That was the extent of our living room decor – we had nothing on the walls, or the other surfaces in the room.
sentences.chinese: 这个小架子，就是我老家起居室的全部装饰了。 除此之外，墙上和任何东西上都是干干净净的。

sentences.english: Park said that although he'd only had the plastic tree for two years, he felt it was like "his best friend" and never got tired of seeing it sitting in his living room.
sentences.chinese: 帕克先生说，尽管他和这颗塑胶圣诞树在一起生活才两年时间，但是它就像是“一个最好的朋友”一样。 每天它都立在起居室�，帕克从未厌倦它。

detailed_translations.english: the main room in a house where people relax, watch television etc

name: cabinet
trans: n. 内阁；橱柜；展览艺术品的小陈列室 adj. 内阁的；私下的，秘密的

sentences.english: The President chose loyal supporters to serve in his cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 总统选择了忠诚的支持者到他的内阁服务。

sentences.english: Every year we used the State of the Union as an organizing tool for the cabinet and staff to come up with new policy ideas, and then we worked hard on how best to present them.
sentences.chinese: 每年国情咨文都被内阁和幕僚们作为我们提出新政策思路的一个组织工具，然后我们努力下功夫，让它们以最佳方式呈现在人们面前。

detailed_translations.english: the politicians with important positions in a government who meet to make decisions or advise the leader of the government

name: balcony
trans: n. 阳台；包厢；戏院楼厅

sentences.english: Has your flat got a balcony?
sentences.chinese: 你的公寓有阳台吗？

detailed_translations.english: a structure that you can stand on, that is attached to the outside wall of a building, above ground level

name: terrace
trans: n. 平台；梯田；阳台 adj. （女服）叠层式的 vt. 使成梯田，使成阶地；使有平台屋顶 vi. 成阶地；成梯田；筑成坛

sentences.english: Both a staircase and a lift connect the two floors with an enclosed terrace on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 通过一道楼梯和一台电梯连接两层楼和封闭的屋顶平台。

sentences.english: Mirrored walls, skylights and large plated windows overlooking the garden and terrace fill this modern space with light.
sentences.chinese: 镜墙、天窗和大型的金属镀窗俯瞰花园和阳台，让这个现代空间充满光线。

detailed_translations.english: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

name: kitchen
trans: n. 厨房；炊具；炊事人员

sentences.english: Sam went into the kitchen to make a pot of tea.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆走进厨房去沏一壶茶。

sentences.english: She is in the kitchen making a meal.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里做饭。

detailed_translations.english: the room where you prepare and cook food

name: lavatory
trans: n. 厕所，盥洗室

sentences.english: ...the ladies' lavatory.
sentences.chinese: …女厕所。

detailed_translations.english: a toilet or the room a toilet is in

name: toilet
trans: n. 厕所，盥洗室；梳妆，打扮 vt. 给…梳妆打扮 vi. 梳妆，打扮

sentences.english: public toilets
sentences.chinese: 公共厕所

detailed_translations.english: a room or building containing a toilet

name: bath
trans: n. 沐浴；浴室；浴盆 vt. 洗澡 vi. 洗澡

sentences.english: After a week of camping, I really needed a bath.
sentences.chinese: 我露营了一个星期，实在得洗个澡了。

sentences.english: a gigantic pink marble bath
sentences.chinese: 一个巨大的粉红色大理石浴缸

detailed_translations.english: an act of washing your whole body by sitting or lying in water

name: basin
trans: n. 水池；流域；盆地；盆

sentences.english: a wash basin
sentences.chinese: 洗脸盆

sentences.english: Fill the basin with the cake mixture.
sentences.chinese: 在盆里装入蛋糕拌料。

sentences.english: countries around the Pacific Basin
sentences.chinese: 太平洋盆地周围的国家

detailed_translations.english: a round container attached to the wall in a bathroom, where you wash your hands and face

name: reserve
trans: n. 储备，储存；自然保护区；预备队；缄默；[金融] 储备金 vt. 储备；保留；预约 vi. 预订

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: store
trans: n. 商店；储备，贮藏；仓库 vt. 贮藏，储存

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: mall
trans: n. 购物商场；林荫路；铁圈球场

sentences.english: In the winter I head for the mall.
sentences.chinese: 在冬日里,我前往这个购物商场。

sentences.english: If you see something you like at the mall, walk away.
sentences.chinese: 如果在商城里看见某件你喜欢的东西，（别买）走开。

name: complex
trans: n. 复合体；综合设施 adj. 复杂的；合成的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: supermarket
trans: n. 超级市场；自助售货商店

sentences.english: His eyes roved round the supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛环视了一下超级市场。

sentences.english: The whole supermarket was ruined in a great fire.
sentences.chinese: 整个超级市场被一场大火烧掉。

sentences.english: The supermarket near our school will be reopened soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校附近的那个超级市场不久将重新开业。

detailed_translations.english: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes

name: booth
trans: n. 货摊；公用电话亭

sentences.english: I called her from a public phone booth near the entrance to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 我在酒吧入口附近的一个公用电话亭给她打了电话。

detailed_translations.english: A booth is a small area separated from a larger public area by screens or thin walls where, for example, people can make a telephone call or vote in private

name: casino
trans: n. 俱乐部，赌场；娱乐场

sentences.english: Doesn’t that club have a casino upstairs?
sentences.chinese: 那家俱乐部楼上不是有赌场吗？

detailed_translations.english: a place where people try to win money by playing card games or  roulette

name: studio
trans: n. 工作室；[广播][电视] 演播室；画室；电影制片厂

sentences.english: a recording studio in Nashville
sentences.chinese: 在纳什维尔的一间录音室

sentences.english: a photographer’s studio
sentences.chinese: 摄影师的工作室

detailed_translations.english: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

name: downtown
trans: n. 市中心区；三分线以外 adj. 市中心的 adv. 往闹市区；在市区

sentences.english: By day he worked downtown for American Standard.
sentences.chinese: 白天，他在市中心为美国标准公司工作。

sentences.english: ...an office in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: …芝加哥市中心的一间办公室。

sentences.english: ...in a large vacant area of the downtown.
sentences.chinese: …在市中心的一大块空地上。

detailed_translations.english: Downtown is also an adverb
Downtown places are in or toward the centre of a large town or city, where the stores and places of business are
Downtown is also a noun

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: peripheral
trans: adj. 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的 n. 外部设备

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

name: vicinity
trans: n. 邻近，附近；近处

sentences.english: The stolen car was found in the vicinity of the station.
sentences.chinese: 被盗汽车在车站附近被发现。

sentences.english: There used to be a mill in the vicinity.
sentences.chinese: 附近曾有一座磨坊。

detailed_translations.english: in the area around a particular place

name: room
trans: n. 房间；空间；余地；机会；房间里所有的人 vt. 为…提供住处；租房，合住；投宿，住宿；留…住宿 vi. 居住；住宿

sentences.english: I looked around the room.
sentences.chinese: 我四下看了看房间。

sentences.english: She nodded toward a man who was standing across the room (= on the other side of the room ) .
sentences.chinese: 她朝站在屋子另一头的一个男人点点头。

sentences.english: Someone was laughing in the next room (= the one beside the one you are in ) .
sentences.chinese: 隔壁房间有人在笑。

sentences.english: Here’s your key - room 348.
sentences.chinese: 这是你的钥匙——348号房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 房间；空间；余地；机会；房间里所有的人
detailed_translations.english: a part of the inside of a building that has its own walls, floor, and ceiling

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…提供住处；租房，合住；投宿，住宿；留…住宿
detailed_translations.english: to rent and live in a room somewhere

name: void
trans: n. 空虚；空间；空隙 adj. 空的；无效的；无人的 vt. 使无效；排放

sentences.english: Her eyes were void of all expression.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼神一片茫然。

detailed_translations.english: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 空虚感，寂寞感；真空，空白
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great sadness that you have when someone you love dies or when something is taken from you
to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect

name: spacious
trans: adj. 宽敞的，广阔的；无边无际的

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: airtight
trans: adj. 密闭的，密封的；无懈可击的

sentences.english: airtight containers
sentences.chinese: 密封容器

detailed_translations.chinese: 密闭的，密封的；无懈可击的
detailed_translations.english: not allowing air to get in or out

name: expanse
trans: n. 宽阔；广阔的区域；苍天；膨胀扩张

sentences.english: The Mandarin Oriental's pool is small in real life, suitable only for a quick dip… nothing like the vast, blue expanse of water in the marketing photo.
sentences.chinese: 文华东方的游泳池在现实中是很小的，只适合快速浸泡一下......一点都不像宣传照片上那一大片宽阔的蓝色水域。

detailed_translations.english: a very large area of water, sky, land etc

name: plaza
trans: n. 广场；市场，购物中心

sentences.english: Across the busy plaza, vendors sell hot dogs and croissant sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 忙碌的露天广场对面，小贩们在卖热狗和新月形面包三明治。

detailed_translations.english: a public square or market place surrounded by buildings, especially in towns in Spanish-speaking countries

name: castle
trans: n. 城堡；象棋中的车 vt. 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

sentences.english: Edinburgh Castle
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡城堡

sentences.english: a ruined castle
sentences.chinese: 破败的城堡

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong building, built in the past as a safe place that could be easily defended against attack

detailed_translations.chinese: 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

name: carpenter
trans: n. 木匠，木工 vt. 制作 vi. 当木匠，做木匠工作

sentences.english: He is a carpenter by profession.
sentences.chinese: 他以木工为业。

sentences.english: At an early age, I was apprenticed to a carpenter.
sentences.chinese: 我小时候曾给木匠当过学徒。

sentences.english: That carpenter wanted to become a lawyer， but he was advised to stick to his last.
sentences.chinese: 那个木匠想当律师， 但别人劝他安分守己地干他自己的老本行。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is making and repairing wooden objects

name: mason
trans: n. 梅森（男子名）

detailed_translations.english: A mason is a person who is skilled at making things or building things with stone or bricks

name: tile
trans: n. 瓷砖，瓦片 vt. 铺以瓦；铺以瓷砖

sentences.english: bathroom tiles
sentences.chinese: 浴室瓷砖

detailed_translations.english: a flat square piece of baked clay or other material, used for covering walls, floors etc

name: brickwork
trans: n. 砌砖；砖砌的建筑物

name: suspension
trans: n. 悬浮；暂停；停职

sentences.english: He received a six-month suspension for unprofessional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他因有违职业道德的行为被停职六个月。

detailed_translations.english: when something is officially stopped for a period of time

name: hook
trans: n. 挂钩，吊钩 vt. 钩住；引上钩 vi. 钩住；弯成钩状

sentences.english: We hooked the trailer to the back of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我们把拖车挂在汽车尾部。

sentences.english: a dress that hooks at the back
sentences.chinese: 从后背用钩扣的连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: to fasten or hang sth on sth else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way

name: lever
trans: n. 杠杆；控制杆 vt. 用杠杆撬动；把…作为杠杆 vi. 用杠杆撬

sentences.english: Pull this lever to open the gate.
sentences.chinese: 拉此横杆开启大门。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
to move something with a lever

name: pole
trans: n. 杆；极点；电极 vt. 用竿支撑

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: scaffold
trans: n. 脚手架；鹰架；绞刑台 vt. 给…搭脚手架；用支架支撑

sentences.english: Ascending the shaky ladder to the scaffold, More addressed the executioner.
sentences.chinese: 摩尔沿着摇摇晃晃的梯子登上绞刑台，跟行刑人说了话。

detailed_translations.english: a structure built next to a wall, for workers to stand on while they build, repair, or paint a building

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…搭脚手架；用支架支撑

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: apparatus
trans: n. 装置，设备；仪器；器官

sentences.english: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

sentences.english: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械，器具，仪器；机构，组织
detailed_translations.english: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

name: crane
trans: n. 吊车，起重机；鹤 vt. 用起重机起吊；伸长脖子 vi. 伸着脖子看；迟疑，踌躇

sentences.english: The little prefabricated hut was lifted away by a huge crane.
sentences.chinese: 那间小小的预制棚屋被一台巨大的起重机吊走了。

sentences.english: She craned her neck to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 她伸长脖子以便看得清楚一些。

sentences.english: Children craned to get close to him.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们伸长脖子想靠近他。

detailed_translations.english: a large tall machine used by builders for lifting heavy things
If you crane your neck or head, you stretch your neck in a particular direction in order to see or hear something better

name: malfunction
trans: vi. 发生故障；不起作用 n. 故障；失灵；疾病

sentences.english: The radiation can damage microprocessors and computer memories, causing them to malfunction.
sentences.chinese: 该辐射会破坏微处理器和计算机存储器，使之出故障。

detailed_translations.english: If a machine or part of the body malfunctions, it fails to work properly
a fault in the way a machine or part of someone’s body works

name: maintain
trans: vt. 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: fix
trans: n. 困境；方位；贿赂 vt. 使固定；修理；安装；准备 vi. 固定；注视

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: mend
trans: vt. 修理，修补；改善；修改 vi. 改善，好转 n. 好转，改进；修补处

sentences.english: My father used to mend our shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲过去常为我们修补鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing
to be getting better after an illness or after a difficult period

name: modify
trans: vt. 修改，修饰；更改 vi. 修改

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: trim
trans: n. 修剪；整齐；情形 vt. 修剪；整理；装点 adj. 整齐的 vi. 削减

sentences.english: Pete was trimming the lawn around the roses.
sentences.chinese: 皮特在修剪玫瑰丛周围的草坪。

sentences.english: I have my hair trimmed every six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 我每六周剪一次头发。

detailed_translations.english: to make something look neater by cutting small pieces off it
when something is cut to make it look neater
neat and well cared for

name: weld
trans: n. 焊接；焊接点 vt. 焊接；使结合；使成整体 vi. 焊牢

sentences.english: The new handle will have to be welded on.
sentences.chinese: 新的把手得焊上去。

detailed_translations.english: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot
a joint that is made by welding two pieces of metal together

name: saw
trans: n. 锯子；谚语 v. see的过去式 vi. 锯；用锯；将某物锯成小块 vt. 看见；明白，了解；锯；锯成；锯开

sentences.english: The only tools in the house are a hammer and a saw.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里仅有的工具是一把锤子和一把锯。

sentences.english: She was in the back yard sawing logs.
sentences.chinese: 她在后院锯木头。

detailed_translations.english: a tool that you use for cutting wood. It has a flat blade with an edge cut into many V shapes.
to cut something using a saw

name: screw
trans: n. 螺旋；螺丝钉；吝啬鬼 vt. 旋，拧；压榨；强迫 vi. 转动，拧

sentences.english: Fix the frame in position and tighten the screws.
sentences.chinese: 把框子固定在正确位置上，拧紧螺丝。

sentences.english: The lens screws onto the front of the camera.
sentences.chinese: 镜头旋扣在照相机正面。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal that you push and turn in order to fasten pieces of metal or wood together
to fasten or close something by turning it, or to be fastened in this way

name: drill
trans: n. 训练；钻孔机；钻子；播种机 vt. 钻孔；训练；条播 vi. 钻孔；训练

sentences.english: an electric drill
sentences.chinese: 电钻

sentences.english: rifle drill
sentences.chinese: 步枪操练

sentences.english: Drill a hole in each corner.
sentences.chinese: 在每个角上钻一个孔。

detailed_translations.english: a tool or machine used for making holes in something
to make a hole in something using a drill

name: plumb
trans: n. 垂直；铅锤 adj. 垂直的 vt. 使垂直；探测，探索 adv. 恰恰，正；垂直地 vi. 当管子工

sentences.english: Psychologists try to plumb the deepest mysteries of the human psyche.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家试图探究人类心理最深层的奥秘。

detailed_translations.english: exactly upright or level

name: viaduct
trans: n. 高架桥；高架铁路

name: span
trans: n. 跨度，跨距；范围 vt. 跨越；持续；以手指测量

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

name: dam
trans: n. [水利] 水坝；障碍 v. 控制；筑坝

sentences.english: They built a dam along the seashore to retain the seawater.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿海岸筑起一道堤坝以拦住海水。

detailed_translations.english: to stop the water in a river or stream from flowing by building a special wall across it
a special wall built across a river or stream to stop the water from flowing, especially in order to make a lake or produce electricity

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集 vi. 集合，聚集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: install
trans: vt. 安装；任命；安顿

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

name: furnish
trans: vt. 提供；供应；装备

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: placement
trans: n. 布置；定位球；人员配置

name: layout
trans: n. 布局；设计；安排；陈列

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

name: design
trans: n. 设计；图案 vt. 设计；计划；构思 vi. 设计

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: entrance
trans: n. 入口；进入 vt. 使出神，使入迷

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: entry
trans: n. 进入；入口；条目；登记；报关手续；对土地的侵占

sentences.english: You can leave your umbrella in the entry.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把伞放在入口处。

sentences.english: More keyboarding staff are required for data entry.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的键盘录入人员来录入这些资料。

sentences.english: There was no sign of a forced entry.
sentences.chinese: 没有强行闯入的迹象。

sentences.english: How did the thieves gain entry (= get in )?
sentences.chinese: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate or passage where you enter a building; an entrance hall

name: enter
trans: n. [计] 输入；回车 vt. 进入；开始；参加 vi. 参加，登场；进去

sentences.english: Knock before you enter.
sentences.chinese: 进来前先敲门。

sentences.english: The rebels were prepared to enter negotiations (= start discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

detailed_translations.english: to come or go into sth

name: exit
trans: n. 出口，通道；退场 vi. 退出；离去

sentences.english: We made for the nearest exit.
sentences.chinese: 我们走向最近的出口。

sentences.english: an exit door
sentences.chinese: 出口门

sentences.english: Two men were blocking her exit.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人挡住了她出去的路。

detailed_translations.english: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
to leave a place

name: outside
trans: adj. 外面的，外部的；外来的 n. 外部；外观 adv. 在外面，向外面；在室外 prep. 在…范围之外

sentences.english: The outside of the house was painted white.
sentences.chinese: 这房子的外墙刷成了白色。

sentences.english: Outside observers said the election was free and fair.
sentences.chinese: 外部观察员说此次选举自由而公正。

detailed_translations.english: the part or surface of something that is furthest from the centre
involving people who do not belong to the same group or organization as you

name: outward
trans: adj. 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的 adv. 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地 n. 外表；外面；物质世界

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

name: exterior
trans: n. 外部；表面；外型；外貌 adj. 外部的；表面的；外在的

sentences.english: The exterior walls need a new coat of paint.
sentences.chinese: 外墙需要刷新漆了。

detailed_translations.english: on the outside of something
the outside of something, especially a building

name: external
trans: n. 外部；外观；外面 adj. 外部的；表面的；[药] 外用的；外国的；外面的

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: inner
trans: n. 内部 adj. 内部的；内心的；精神的

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

name: interior
trans: n. 内部；本质 adj. 内部的；国内的；本质的

sentences.english: The interior walls are all painted white.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

sentences.english: The interior of the church was dark.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里很暗。

detailed_translations.english: inside or indoors
the inner part or inside of something

name: inward
trans: n. 内部；内脏；密友 adj. 向内的；内部的；精神的；本质上的；熟悉的 adv. 向内；内心里

sentences.english: a feeling of inward satisfaction
sentences.chinese: 内心的满足感

sentences.english: inward panic
sentences.chinese: 内心的恐慌

sentences.english: He pushed open the front door, which swung inward with a groan.
sentences.chinese: 他推开前门，门呀的一声向里开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向内的；内部的；精神的；本质上的；熟悉的
detailed_translations.english: felt or experienced in your own mind but not expressed to other people
If something moves or faces inward, it moves or faces toward the inside or centre of something

name: internal
trans: n. 内脏；本质 adj. 内部的；里面的；体内的；（机构）内部的

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: navigate
trans: vt. 驾驶，操纵；使通过；航行于 vi. 航行，航空

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: voyage
trans: n. 航行；航程；旅行记 vt. 飞过；渡过 vi. 航行；航海

sentences.english: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
sentences.chinese: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。

sentences.english: the Titanic’s maiden voyage
sentences.chinese: “泰坦尼克”号的首航

sentences.english: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我不想独自航行。

sentences.english: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
to travel to a place, especially by ship

name: aviation
trans: n. 航空；飞行术；飞机制造业

sentences.english: ...the aviation industry.
sentences.chinese: …航空工业。

detailed_translations.english: the science or practice of flying in aircraft

name: journey
trans: n. 旅行；行程 vi. 旅行

sentences.english: the friends they made on the journey
sentences.chinese: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

name: travel
trans: n. 旅行；游历；漫游 vt. 经过；在…旅行 vi. 旅行；行进；步行；交往

sentences.english: Light travels faster than sound.
sentences.chinese: 光比声音传播得快。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅行； 行进； 被传送， 被传播； 走过， 驶过
detailed_translations.english: to move at a particular speed or in a particular direction
the activity of travelling

name: safari
trans: n. 旅行；狩猎远征；旅行队

sentences.english: He'd like to go on safari to photograph snakes and tigers.
sentences.chinese: 他想去游猎以拍摄蛇和老虎。

detailed_translations.english: a trip to see or hunt wild animals, especially in Africa

name: parade
trans: n. 游行；阅兵；炫耀；行进；阅兵场 vt. 游行；炫耀；列队行进 vi. 游行；炫耀；列队行进

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

name: haunt
trans: n. 栖息地；常去的地方 vt. 常出没于…；萦绕于…；经常去… vi. 出没；作祟

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: attraction
trans: n. 吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

name: memorial
trans: n. 纪念碑，纪念馆；纪念仪式；纪念物 adj. 记忆的；纪念的，追悼的

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: pyramid
trans: n. 金字塔；角锥体 vt. 使…渐增；使…上涨；使…成金字塔状 vi. 渐增；上涨；成金字塔状

sentences.english: different levels of the management pyramid

name: cycle
trans: n. 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间 vt. 使循环；使轮转 vi. 循环；骑自行车；轮转

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: garage
trans: n. 车库；汽车修理厂；飞机库 vt. 把……送入车库；把（汽车）开进车库

sentences.english: I’ll just go and put the car in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 我把车停到车库去。

sentences.english: an automatic garage door
sentences.chinese: 车库自动门

detailed_translations.english: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house

name: motor
trans: n. 发动机，马达；汽车 adj. 汽车的；机动的 vi. 乘汽车 vt. 以汽车载运

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: horsepower
trans: n. 马力（功率单位）

sentences.english: a two-hundred horsepower engine
sentences.chinese: 两百马力的发动机

sentences.english: the superior horsepower of a Volkswagen
sentences.chinese: 大众汽车的强劲动力

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the power of an engine, or the power of an engine measured like this

name: wheel
trans: n. 车轮；方向盘；转动 vt. 转动；使变换方向；给…装轮子 vi. 旋转；突然转变方向；盘旋飞行

sentences.english: Shall I take the wheel (= drive instead of someone else )?
sentences.chinese: 我来开车好吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of the round things under a car, bus, bicycle etc that turns when it moves

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动；使变换方向；给…装轮子
detailed_translations.english: to push something that has wheels somewhere

name: brake
trans: n. 闸，刹车；阻碍 vt. 刹车 vi. 刹车

sentences.english: Test your brakes after driving through water.
sentences.chinese: 车子涉水之后要检验一下刹车。

sentences.english: I managed to put the brakes on just in time.
sentences.chinese: 我最终及时刹了车。

sentences.english: Moira slammed on the brakes (=  used them suddenly and with a lot of force  ) .
sentences.chinese: 莫伊拉猛踩刹车。

sentences.english: the screech of brakes
sentences.chinese: 刹车的刺耳噪音

sentences.english: He braked sharply to avoid the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他突然急刹车，想避开那条狗。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop
to make a vehicle or bicycle go more slowly or stop by using its brake

name: tyre
trans: n. [橡胶] 轮胎；轮箍 vt. 装轮胎于

sentences.english: He saw a dagger sticking in his car's tyre.
sentences.chinese: 他看到一把匕首插在他汽车的轮胎上。

detailed_translations.english: a thick rubber ring that fits around the wheel of a car, bicycle etc

name: honk
trans: n. 雁叫声；汽车喇叭声 vi. 发雁鸣或汽车喇叭声 vt. 按汽车喇叭

sentences.english: Several drivers honked their horns.
sentences.chinese: 几个司机按了喇叭。

detailed_translations.english: a loud noise made by a car horn

name: crew
trans: n. 队，组；全体人员，全体船员 vt. 使当船员 vi. 一起工作

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.english: a crew member
sentences.chinese: 一名机组人员

detailed_translations.english: all the people who work on a ship or plane

name: captain
trans: n. 队长，首领；船长；上尉；海军上校 vt. 指挥；率领

sentences.english: The captain and crew welcome you aboard.
sentences.chinese: 机长和全体机组人员欢迎各位乘坐本次航班。

sentences.english: He captained the winning team in 1991.
sentences.chinese: 他于1991年率队夺得胜利。

detailed_translations.english: the sailor in charge of a ship, or the pilot in charge of an aircraft
If you captain a team or a ship, you are the captain of it

name: steward
trans: n. 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事 vi. 当服务员；当管事 vt. 管理

sentences.english: race stewards
sentences.chinese: 比赛组织者

detailed_translations.chinese: 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事
detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻 adj. 紧急的；备用的

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: wreck
trans: n. 破坏；失事；残骸；失去健康的人 vt. 破坏；使失事；拆毁 vi. 失事；营救失事船只

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

name: crash
trans: n. 撞碎；坠毁；破产；轰隆声；睡觉 vi. 摔碎；坠落；发出隆隆声；(金融企业等)破产 vt. 打碎；使坠毁、撞坏；擅自闯入

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: crush
trans: n. 粉碎；迷恋；压榨；拥挤的人群 vt. 压碎；弄皱，变形；使…挤入 vi. 挤；被压碎

sentences.english: His leg was crushed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿在事故中被压断。

sentences.english: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
sentences.chinese: 两个人在逃生过程中被踩死。

detailed_translations.english: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

name: dash
trans: n. 破折号；冲撞 vi. 猛冲；撞击 vt. 使…破灭；猛撞；泼溅

sentences.english: The boat was dashed repeatedly against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 小船一次又一次撞在岩石上。

sentences.english: When the doors opened, there was a mad dash for seats.
sentences.chinese: 门一开，人们便疯狂地朝座位奔去。

detailed_translations.english: to beat against a surface
an act of going somewhere suddenly and/or quickly

name: vanish
trans: n. 弱化音 vi. 消失；突然不见；成为零 vt. 使不见，使消失

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失；失踪；不复存在 vt. 使…不存在；使…消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，冒险；冒险的事 vt. 赌运气；冒…的危险，使遭受危险

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: harbour
trans: n. 海港（等于harbor）；避难所 vt. 庇护；藏匿；入港停泊 vi. 藏匿；入港停泊；庇护

sentences.english: I think he’s harbouring some sort of grudge against me.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他对我有点怀恨在心。

sentences.english: Sinks and draining boards can harbour germs.
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽和沥水板可能藏有病菌。

sentences.english: Accusations of harbouring suspects were raised against the former Hungarian leadership.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利前领导人被指控窝藏疑犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀着（不好的想法、恐惧或希望）；包含，藏有；窝藏
detailed_translations.english: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time

name: dock
trans: n. 码头；船坞；被告席；尾巴的骨肉部分 vt. 使靠码头；剪短 vi. 入船坞

sentences.english: The crash happened as the ferry attempted to dock on Staten Island.
sentences.chinese: 这次碰撞发生于渡船试图停靠在斯塔滕岛时。

detailed_translations.english: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload
a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

name: anchor
trans: n. 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播 adj. 末棒的；最后一棒的 vt. 抛锚；使固定；主持节目 vi. 抛锚

sentences.english: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。

sentences.english: The next morning, they weighed anchor (=  lifted the anchor  ) and began to move south again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上他们起锚，又开始向南航行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播
detailed_translations.english: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move

name: submerge
trans: vt. 淹没；把…浸入；沉浸 vi. 淹没；潜入水中；湮没

sentences.english: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯埋头工作，试图忘记汤姆。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it

name: sailor
trans: n. 水手，海员；乘船者

sentences.english: Six British sailors drowned.
sentences.chinese: 六名英国海员溺水身亡。

sentences.english: We were both experienced sailors.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个都是经验丰富的水手。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a ship

name: seaman
trans: n. 海员，水手；水兵

sentences.english: The men emigrate to work as seamen.
sentences.chinese: 这些男人移居国外当海员。

detailed_translations.english: a  sailor  on a ship or in the navy who is not an officer

name: carrier
trans: n. [化学] 载体；运送者；带菌者；货架

sentences.english: a baby carrier
sentences.chinese: 婴儿背带

detailed_translations.english: something used for carrying something

name: steamer
trans: n. 轮船；蒸汽机；蒸笼

sentences.english: The steamer touched at 3 ports.
sentences.chinese: 这艘轮船曾停靠3个港口。

sentences.english: When does your steamer sail?
sentences.chinese: 你们的轮船什么时候启航?

sentences.english: We were together only during the few days the steamer took from Calcutta to Madras, but it became quite evident that depth of friendship does not depend upon length of acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是在从加尔各答到马德拉斯的轮船上呆了几天，但很明显，友谊的深厚并不取决于认识的长久。

detailed_translations.english: a  steamship

name: liner
trans: n. 班轮，班机；衬垫；画线者

sentences.english: a dustbin liner
sentences.chinese: 垃圾袋

sentences.english: nappy liners
sentences.chinese: 尿布衬垫

detailed_translations.english: a piece of material used inside something, especially in order to keep it clean

name: vessel
trans: n. 船，舰；[组织] 脉管，血管；容器，器皿

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: ferry
trans: n. 渡船；摆渡；渡口 vt. （乘渡船）渡过；用渡船运送；空运 vi. 摆渡；来往行驶

sentences.english: They had recrossed the River Gambia by ferry.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘船又一次渡过了冈比亚河。

sentences.english: The ship was used to ferry supplies to Russia during the war.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船在战时被用来往俄罗斯 运送补给。

detailed_translations.english: a boat that carries people or goods across a river or a narrow area of water
to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

name: sail
trans: n. 帆，篷；航行 vi. 航行；启航，开船 vt. 航行

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.english: The trawler had sailed from the port of Zeebrugge.
sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

name: raft
trans: n. 筏；救生艇；（美）大量 vt. 筏运；制成筏 vi. 乘筏

sentences.english: The company has launched a whole raft of new software products.
sentences.chinese: 公司推出了大量新软件产品。

detailed_translations.english: a flat floating structure, usually made of pieces of wood tied together, used as a boat
to convey on or travel by raft, or make a raft from

name: canoe
trans: n. 独木舟；轻舟 vi. 乘独木舟 vt. 用独木舟运

sentences.english: The explorers paddled their canoe cautiously upstream.
sentences.chinese: 探险者们谨慎地把独木舟向上游划去。

sentences.english: At a summer job working as park naturalists that year, I flipped the canoe Air and I were paddling and we had to push it to shore.
sentences.chinese: 那年我在公园里做暑期兼职，我把独木舟翻转个身，然后我们一起合力将它推到岸边，这样我们就可以划船了。

sentences.english: I remember the first time I visited a village in Vietnam, in 1995: we endured hours and hours of rutty roads or long hours in a canoe to reach project sites.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1995年第一次访问越南一个村落，我们捱过很多小时的路途颠簸、坐了很多小时的独木舟，才到达项目的所在地。

detailed_translations.english: to travel by canoe
a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

name: oar
trans: n. 桨；橹；桨手 vt. 划（船） vi. 划行

sentences.english: Cold worlds shake from the oar.
sentences.chinese: 冰冷的世界从桨上摇落。

sentences.english: The roaring oar hit the coarse keyboard on the cupboard aboard the boat.
sentences.chinese: 轰鸣的桨击中了船上碗柜上的粗糙键盘。

sentences.english: Suchen never understood what had driven her to grasp the oar at the last moment.
sentences.chinese: 苏晨从来没有想明白，是什么驱使她在最后一刻抓住了一条船桨。

detailed_translations.english: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat

name: deck
trans: n. 甲板；行李仓；露天平台 vt. 装饰；装甲板；打扮

sentences.english: Eddie returned to the flight deck (= the part of an aircraft where the pilot sits ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃迪回到了驾驶舱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 甲板；公共汽车一层的车厢；纸牌
detailed_translations.english: one of the levels on a bus, plane etc
to decorate something with flowers, flags etc

name: turbine
trans: n. [动力] 涡轮；[动力] 涡轮机

sentences.english: The new ship will be powered by two gas turbines and four diesel engines.
sentences.chinese: 那艘新轮船将由2台燃气涡轮机和4台柴油机驱动。

detailed_translations.english: an engine or motor in which the pressure of a liquid or gas moves a special wheel around

name: propeller
trans: n. [航][船] 螺旋桨；推进器

sentences.english: ...a fixed three-bladed propeller.
sentences.chinese: …一个固定的三叶螺旋桨。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

name: stern
trans: n. 船尾；末端 adj. 严厉的；坚定的

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: aboard
trans: prep. 在…上 adv. 在飞机上；[船] 在船上；在火车上

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing all 200 people aboard.
sentences.chinese: 飞机失事，机上200人全部遇难。

sentences.english: The boat swayed as he stepped aboard.
sentences.chinese: 他上船时，船晃了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在飞机上；[船] 在船上；在火车上
detailed_translations.english: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
on or onto a ship, plane, or train

name: embark
trans: vi. 从事，着手；上船或飞机 vt. 使从事；使上船

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: channel
trans: n. 通道；频道；海峡 vt. 引导，开导；形成河道

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: canal
trans: n. 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠 vt. 在…开凿运河

sentences.english: We walked along by the side of the canal.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着运河边往前走。

sentences.english: the Panama Canal
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河

detailed_translations.chinese: 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠
detailed_translations.english: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

name: ditch
trans: n. 沟渠；壕沟 vt. 在…上掘沟；把…开入沟里；丢弃 vi. 开沟；掘沟

sentences.english: The government has ditched plans to privatise the prison.
sentences.chinese: 政府放弃了监狱私有化的计划。

if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
