trans: adj. 全球的；总体的；球形的

sentences.english: global climate change
sentences.chinese: 全球气候变化

sentences.english: the global economy
sentences.chinese: 全球经济

detailed_translations.english: affecting or including the whole world

name: worldwide
trans: adj. 全世界的 adv. 在世界各地

sentences.english: His books have sold more than 20 million copies worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 他的书在全世界卖出了两千多万本。

detailed_translations.english: If something exists or happens worldwide, it exists or happens throughout the world

name: federal
trans: adv. 联邦政府地 adj. 联邦的；同盟的；联邦政府的； 联邦制的

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: foreign
trans: adj. 外国的；外交的；异质的；不相关的

sentences.english: foreign students
sentences.chinese: 外国学生

sentences.english: Can you speak any foreign languages?
sentences.chinese: 你会讲外语吗？

detailed_translations.english: from or relating to a country that is not your own

name: overseas
trans: adv. 在海外，海外 adj. 海外的，国外的

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: abroad
trans: n. 海外；异国 adj. 往国外的 adv. 在国外；到海外

sentences.english: I’ve never lived abroad before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未在国外生活过。

sentences.english: She often goes abroad on business.
sentences.chinese: 她经常出国公干。

sentences.english: We never travelled abroad when we were kids.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候从来没有去国外旅行过。

sentences.english: goods imported from abroad
sentences.chinese: 从国外进口的商品

sentences.english: The books about Harry Potter have been very popular, both at home and abroad .
sentences.chinese: 有关哈利·波特的书在国内外一直都很流行。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a foreign country

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: emigrate
trans: vi. 移居；移居外国 vt. 移民

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: immigrate
trans: vi. 移入 vt. 使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: reign
trans: n. 统治；统治时期；支配 vi. 统治；支配；盛行；君临

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

name: puppet
trans: n. 木偶；傀儡；受他人操纵的人

sentences.english: a 20-minute puppet show
sentences.chinese: 20分钟的木偶表演

sentences.english: When the invasion occurred he seized power and ruled the country as a puppet of the occupiers.
sentences.chinese: 他趁入侵之时夺取了政权，作为占领者的傀儡统治着这个国家。

sentences.english: The government is in danger of becoming a mere puppet of the military.
sentences.chinese: 政府面临沦为军方傀儡的危险。

detailed_translations.english: a model of a person or animal that you move by pulling wires or strings, or by putting your hand inside it

name: throne
trans: n. 王座；君主；王权 vt. 使登王位 vi. 登上王座

sentences.english: He is next in line to the throne (= will become king when the present ruler dies ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是第一王位继承人。

sentences.english: In 1913, George V was on the throne (= was ruling ) .
sentences.chinese: 1913年乔治五世在位。

detailed_translations.english: the position and power of being a king or queen

name: crown
trans: n. 王冠；花冠；王权；顶点 vt. 加冕；居…之顶；表彰；使圆满完成

sentences.english: a hat with a high crown
sentences.chinese: 高顶帽

detailed_translations.english: the top part of a hat or someone’s head
to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

name: wreath
trans: n. 花冠；圈状物 vt. 环绕（等于wreathe） vi. 盘旋（等于wreathe）

sentences.english: The prime minister laid a wreath at the war memorial.
sentences.chinese: 首相向战争纪念碑献了花圈。

detailed_translations.english: a circle made from leaves or flowers that you put on the place where a person is buried

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: liberty
trans: n. 自由；许可；冒失

sentences.english: the fight for liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 争取自由和平等的斗争

detailed_translations.english: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: slum
trans: n. 贫民窟；陋巷；脏乱的地方 vi. （为猎奇或救济等）去贫民窟

sentences.english: The slum must be inside you.
sentences.chinese: 贫民窟一定是在你内心.

sentences.english: But, she added, even after she had a classroom, she had no idea what might come of her effort to teach kids from the slum.
sentences.chinese: 但她补充说，即使她有了教室后，她并不知道她对贫民窟的孩子施教会得出什么样的结果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫民窟；陋巷；脏乱的地方
detailed_translations.english: a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live

name: refuge
trans: n. 避难；避难所；庇护 vt. 给予…庇护；接纳…避难 vi. 避难；逃避

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: asylum
trans: n. 庇护；收容所，救济院

sentences.english: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.
sentences.chinese: 他于1987年逃脱本国的警察之后申请了避难许可。

detailed_translations.english: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

name: population
trans: n. 人口；[生物] 种群，[生物] 群体；全体居民

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: demographic
trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的

sentences.english: In the same demographic breakdown of people may have different characteristics of the consumer mentality.
sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.english: It is generally studied and mapped by an organization through lists and reportscontaining demographic information that may have an effect on the marketing of keyproducts or services.
sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: citizen
trans: n. 公民；市民；老百姓

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

name: resident
trans: n. 居民；住院医生 adj. 居住的；定居的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: ethnic
trans: adj. 种族的；人种的

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: racial
trans: adj. 种族的；人种的

sentences.english: a victim of racial discrimination
sentences.chinese: 种族歧视的受害者

sentences.english: This part of the community needs to be protected from racial prejudice .
sentences.chinese: 需保护社区里的这一部分人，使其免受种族偏见的伤害。

sentences.english: evidence of racial harassment
sentences.chinese: 种族骚扰的证据

sentences.english: the campaign for racial equality
sentences.chinese: 争取种族平等的运动

sentences.english: the need for tolerance and racial harmony
sentences.chinese: 包容与种族融洽的必要性

detailed_translations.english: relating to the relationships between different races of people who now live in the same country or area

name: clan
trans: n. 宗族；部落；集团

sentences.english: the Campbell clan
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔家族

sentences.english: warring clans
sentences.chinese: 交战的各氏族

detailed_translations.english: a large group of families who often share the same name

name: franchise
trans: n. 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权 vt. 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权

sentences.english: a franchise holder
sentences.chinese: 特许经营权持有人

sentences.english: a franchise agreement
sentences.chinese: 特许经营协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权
detailed_translations.english: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权
detailed_translations.english: to give or sell a franchise to someone

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，倾向；优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: vote
trans: n. 投票，选举；选票；得票数 vi. 选举，投票 vt. 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

name: elect
trans: n. 被选的人；特殊阶层；上帝的选民 adj. 选出的；当选的；卓越的 vi. 作出选择；进行选举 vt. 选举；选择；推选

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: respondent
trans: n. [法] 被告；应答者 adj. 回答的；应答的

sentences.english: Upon receipt of a copy of the arbitration application, the respondent shall, within the time limit prescribed by the Arbitration Rules, submit its defence to the arbitration commission.
sentences.chinese: 被申请人收到仲裁申请书副本后，应当在仲裁规则规定的期限内向仲裁委员会提交答辩书。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has to defend their own case in a law court, especially in a  divorce  case

name: poll
trans: n. 投票；民意测验；投票数；投票所 adj. 无角的；剪过毛的；修过枝的 vt. 投票；剪短；对…进行民意测验；获得选票 vi. 投票

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: ambition
trans: n. 野心，雄心；抱负，志向 vt. 追求；有…野心

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: nominate
trans: vt. 推荐；提名；任命；指定

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: checklist
trans: n. 清单；检查表；备忘录；目录册

sentences.english: The guide contains a useful checklist of points to look for when buying a car.
sentences.chinese: 手册里有一张很有用的清单，列出买车时要注意的一些事项。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清单；检查表；备忘录；目录册
detailed_translations.english: a list that helps you by reminding you of the things you need to do or get for a particular job or activity

name: succession
trans: n. 连续；继位；继承权；[生态] 演替

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

name: safety
trans: n. 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打

sentences.english: You shouldn’t travel alone, for safety’s sake .
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，不要独自一人旅行。

sentences.english: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
sentences.chinese: 为了您自身的安全，请不要在飞机上吸烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

name: welfare
trans: n. 福利；幸福；福利事业；安宁 adj. 福利的；接受社会救济的

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: well-being
trans: n. 幸福；康乐

sentences.english: Singing can create a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌能产生一种幸福感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健康， 幸福； 福利
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

name: harmony
trans: n. 协调；和睦；融洽；调和

sentences.english: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.english: three-part harmonies
sentences.chinese: 三部和声

detailed_translations.english: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

name: steady
trans: n. 关系固定的情侣；固定支架 adj. 稳定的；不变的；沉着的 vt. 使稳定；稳固；使坚定 adv. 稳定地；稳固地 vi. 稳固

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰 vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期 vt. 夸耀；挥舞

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: succeed
trans: vi. 成功；继承；继任；兴旺 vt. 继承；接替；继…之后

sentences.english: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性，而且差一点就成功了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you tried or wanted to do
to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else

name: prospect
trans: n. 前途；预期；景色 vt. 勘探，勘察 vi. 勘探，找矿

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图 adj. 透视的

sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

name: viewpoint
trans: n. 观点，看法；视角

sentences.chinese: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

name: standpoint
trans: n. 立场；观点

sentences.chinese: 从女性角度对婚姻的探讨

name: outlook

sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

sentences.chinese: 动物园请游客提建议，给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

sentences.chinese: 有人提议，如果再有球员被出售，球队主教练就辞职。

sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.

trans: n. 暗示；线索 vt. 暗示；示意 vi. 示意

sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

trans: vt. 宣布，声明；断言，宣称 vi. 声明，宣布

sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

trans: vt. 肯定；断言 vi. 确认；断言

sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

trans: vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬

sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .

sentences.english: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
sentences.chinese: 水有三种形态: 液态、气态和固态。

sentences.english: ...reform of the state social-security system.
sentences.chinese: …国家社会保障体制的改革。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in

State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies

sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

trans: n. 帮助；助攻 vi. 参加；出席 vt. 帮助；促进

sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.chinese: 从新西兰运来的肉被冷冻保藏，用特殊的船运往英国。

sentences.chinese: 他在加拿大已经住了二十多年了，现在完全加拿大化了。

sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.

trans: n. 基金；资金；存款 vt. 投资；资助

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

name: donate
trans: n. 捐赠；捐献 vt. 捐赠；捐献 vi. 捐赠；捐献

sentences.english: people who volunteer to donate blood
sentences.chinese: 自愿献血者

detailed_translations.english: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

name: endow
trans: vt. 赋予；捐赠；天生具有

sentences.english: The ambassador has endowed a $1 million public-service fellowships programme.
sentences.chinese: 大使资助了一个100万美元的公共服务奖学金项目。

sentences.english: You are endowed with wealth, good health and a lively intellect.
sentences.chinese: 你天生赋有财富、健康，和敏锐的智力。

detailed_translations.english: to give a college, hospital etc a large sum of money that provides it with an income

name: commercial
trans: n. 商业广告 adj. 商业的；营利的；靠广告收入的

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: advertise
trans: vt. 通知；为…做广告；使突出 vi. 做广告，登广告；作宣传

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

name: slogan
trans: n. 标语；呐喊声

sentences.english: an advertising slogan
sentences.chinese: 一句广告口号

sentences.english: demonstrators shouting political slogans
sentences.chinese: 高喊政治口号的示威者

sentences.english: the Democrats’ campaign slogan
sentences.chinese: 民主党的竞选口号

detailed_translations.english: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

name: purchase
trans: n. 购买；紧握；起重装置 vt. 购买；赢得 vi. 购买东西

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: lease
trans: n. 租约；租期；租赁物；租赁权 vt. 出租；租得 vi. 出租

sentences.english: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。

sentences.english: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。

sentences.english: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
sentences.chinese: 租约条款你都理解吗？

detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租； 租得， 租有
detailed_translations.english: to use a building, car etc under a lease

name: afford
trans: vt. 给予，提供；买得起

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: retail
trans: n. 零售 adj. 零售的 vt. 零售；转述 adv. 以零售方式 vi. 零售

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: chain
trans: n. 链；束缚；枷锁 vt. 束缚；囚禁；用铁链锁住

sentences.english: ...a large supermarket chain.
sentences.chinese: …一家大型连锁超市。

detailed_translations.english: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person

name: grocery
trans: n. 食品杂货店 食品杂货

sentences.english: They run a small grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 他们经营一家小食品杂货店。

detailed_translations.english: food and other goods that are sold by a grocer or a supermarket

name: discount
trans: n. 折扣；贴现率 vt. 打折扣；将…贴现；贬损；低估；忽视 vi. 贴现；打折扣出售商品

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

name: promotion
trans: n. 提升，[劳经] 晋升；推销，促销；促进；发扬，振兴

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: voucher
trans: n. 收据；证人；保证人；证明者；代金 vt. 证实...的可靠性

sentences.english: The voucher can be used at most major supermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 这种购物券可以在大多数大型超市使用。

sentences.english: First prize is a £1,000 travel voucher.
sentences.chinese: 头等奖是价值1,000英镑的旅行券。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收据；证人；保证人；证明者；代金
detailed_translations.english: a ticket that can be used instead of money for a particular purpose

name: coupon
trans: n. 息票；赠券；联票；[经] 配给券

sentences.english: The coupon entitles you to ten cents off your next purchase.
sentences.chinese: 这张优惠券可以让你在下次购物时节省10分钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 息票；赠券；联票；[经] 配给券
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

name: currency
trans: n. 货币；通货

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: exchange
trans: n. 交换；交流；交易所；兑换 vt. 交换；交易；兑换 vi. 交换；交易；兑换

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: swap
trans: n. 交换；交换之物 vt. 与...交换；以...作交换 vi. 交换；交易

sentences.english: a fair swap
sentences.chinese: 公平交换

sentences.english: We can do a swap if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意我们可以交换。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you give something to someone and get another thing in return
to give something to someone and get something in return

name: receipt
trans: n. 收到；收据；收入 vt. 收到

sentences.english: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
sentences.chinese: 保留收据以备退货之需。

sentences.english: Can you give me a receipt?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我一个收条吗？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

name: invoice
trans: n. 账单，发货单，收款请求 vt. 开发票；记清单

sentences.english: We will then send you an invoice for the total course fees.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们将寄给你一张全部课程费用的发票。

sentences.english: The agency invoices the client who then pays the full amount to the agency.
sentences.chinese: 那个代销处给客户开具发票，然后客户向代销处支付全部的款项。

detailed_translations.english: If you invoice someone, you send them a bill for goods or services you have provided them with

name: tax
trans: n. 税金；重负 vt. 向…课税；使负重担

sentences.english: No-one enjoys paying tax.
sentences.chinese: 没人喜欢缴税。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…征税； 使负担重， 使费尽力气
detailed_translations.english: to charge a tax on something

name: levy
trans: n. 征收；征兵，征税 vt. 征收（税等）；征集（兵等） vi. 征税；征兵

sentences.english: ...an annual levy on all drivers.
sentences.chinese: …向所有司机征收的年税。

sentences.english: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
sentences.chinese: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

detailed_translations.english: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

name: tariff
trans: n. 关税表；收费表 vt. 定税率；征收关税

sentences.english: America wants to eliminate tariffs on items such as electronics.
sentences.chinese: 美国想要取消电子类产品的关税。

detailed_translations.english: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country

name: duty
trans: n. 责任；[税收] 关税；职务

sentences.english: I promise I will do my duty .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会尽到我的责任。

sentences.english: We feel it is our duty to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我们感到帮助她是我们的责任。

sentences.english: Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
sentences.chinese: 地方当局有责任保持街道整洁。

sentences.english: You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
sentences.chinese: 你对你丈夫和孩子负有责任。

sentences.english: She has a strong sense of moral duty .
sentences.chinese: 她的道德责任感很强。

sentences.english: Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的职责包括清洗汽车。

sentences.english: the duty on cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 香烟税

detailed_translations.english: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

name: impose
trans: vt. 强加；征税；以…欺骗 vi. 利用；欺骗；施加影响

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: consume
trans: vt. 消耗，消费；使…着迷；挥霍 vi. 耗尽，毁灭；耗尽生命

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: spend
trans: n. 预算 vt. 度过，消磨（时光）；花费；浪费；用尽 vi. 花钱；用尽，耗尽

sentences.english: I can’t afford to spend any more money this week.
sentences.chinese: 这星期我没有能力花更多的钱了。

sentences.english: The repairs cost a lot, but it’s money well spent (= a sensible way of spending money ) .
sentences.chinese: 修理费很高，但这是该花的钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 度过，消磨（时光）；花费；浪费；用尽
detailed_translations.english: to use your money to pay for goods or services

name: cost
trans: n. 费用，代价，成本；损失 vt. 花费；使付出；使花许多钱 vi. 花费

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

name: expense
trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支 vt. 向…收取费用 vi. 被花掉

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: gross
trans: n. 总额，总数 adj. 总共的；粗野的；恶劣的；显而易见的 vt. 总共收入

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: recession
trans: n. 衰退；不景气；后退；凹处

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: depression
trans: n. 沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: crisis
trans: n. 危机；危险期；决定性时刻 adj. 危机的；用于处理危机的

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: security
trans: n. 安全；保证；证券；抵押品 adj. 安全的；保安的；保密的

sentences.english: The trial was held under tight security .
sentences.chinese: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。

sentences.english: lax security at airline check-in desks
sentences.chinese: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施

sentences.english: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
sentences.chinese: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动

sentences.english: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后，该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。

sentences.english: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
sentences.chinese: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。

sentences.english: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
sentences.chinese: 出于安全考虑，我们被要求守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。

sentences.english: The thief was caught on a security camera .
sentences.chinese: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。

sentences.english: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。

sentences.english: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
sentences.chinese: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

detailed_translations.english: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime

name: bond
trans: n. 债券；结合；约定；粘合剂；纽带 vt. 使结合；以…作保 vi. 结合，团结在一起

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

name: debt
trans: n. 债务；借款；罪过

sentences.english: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
sentences.chinese: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。

sentences.english: students who run up huge debts
sentences.chinese: 欠下巨额债务的学生

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

name: deficit
trans: n. 赤字；不足额

sentences.english: the country’s widening budget deficit
sentences.chinese: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字

sentences.english: the US’s foreign trade deficit
sentences.chinese: 美国的对外贸易逆差

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: deflation
trans: n. 通货紧缩；放气

sentences.english: Deflation is beginning to take hold in the clothing industry.
sentences.chinese: 服装业开始出现通货紧缩。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the amount of money in a country’s  economy  , so that prices fall or stop rising

name: dwindle
trans: vi. 减少；变小 vt. 使缩小，使减少

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

name: decrease
trans: n. 减少，减小；减少量 vt. 减少，减小 vi. 减少，减小

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

name: downsize
trans: vt. 以较小尺寸设计；缩小尺寸；裁减人数

sentences.english: American manufacturing organizations have been downsizing their factories.
sentences.chinese: 美国制造商们一直在缩小他们工厂的规模。

sentences.english: ...today's downsized economy.
sentences.chinese: … 今天萎缩了的经济。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩小尺寸； 缩小规模
detailed_translations.english: To downsize something such as a business or industry means to make it smaller

name: decline
trans: n. 下降；衰退；斜面 vt. 谢绝；婉拒 vi. 下降；衰落；谢绝

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: diminish
trans: vt. 使减少；使变小 vi. 减少，缩小；变小

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: reduce
trans: vi. 减少；缩小；归纳为 vt. 减少；降低；使处于；把…分解

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: increase
trans: n. 增加，增长；提高 vt. 增加，加大 vi. 增加，增大；繁殖

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: increment
trans: n. [数] 增量；增加；增额；盈余

sentences.english: The average yearly increment in productivity was 4.5 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 生产率的年平均增长量是4.5%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount by which a number, value, or amount increases

name: growth
trans: n. 增长；发展；生长；种植

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

name: escalate
trans: vt. 使逐步上升 vi. 逐步增强；逐步升高

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: expand
trans: vt. 扩张；使膨胀；详述 vi. 发展；张开，展开

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: influx
trans: n. 流入；汇集；河流的汇集处

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

name: affluent
trans: n. 支流；富人 adj. 富裕的；丰富的；流畅的

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

name: enrich
trans: vt. 使充实；使肥沃；使富足

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: sufficient
trans: adj. 足够的；充分的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: adequate
trans: adj. 充足的；适当的；胜任的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: spare
trans: n. 剩余；备用零件 vt. 节约，吝惜；饶恕；分出，分让 adj. 多余的；瘦的；少量的 vi. 饶恕，宽恕；节约

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.english: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
not being used or not needed at the present time

name: saving
trans: n. 节约；挽救；存款 prep. 考虑到；除...之外 adj. 节约的；挽救的；补偿的；保留的

sentences.english: Buying a house had taken all their savings.
sentences.chinese: 买房子花掉了他们所有的积蓄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节省， 节约； 储蓄金， 存款
detailed_translations.english: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank

name: redundant
trans: adj. 多余的，过剩的；被解雇的，失业的；冗长的，累赘的

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: lack
trans: vt. 缺乏；不足；没有；需要 vi. 缺乏；不足；没有 n. 缺乏；不足

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴；连队 vt. 陪伴 vi. 交往

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: firm
trans: n. 公司；商号 adj. 坚定的；牢固的；严格的；结实的 vt. 使坚定；使牢固 adv. 稳固地 vi. 变坚实；变稳固

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

name: enterprise
trans: n. 企业；事业；进取心；事业心

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: agent
trans: n. 代理人，代理商；药剂；特工 adj. 代理的 vt. 由…作中介；由…代理

sentences.english: Our agent in Rio deals with all our Brazilian business.
sentences.chinese: 我们在里约热内卢的业务代表处理我们在巴西的全部业务。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

name: entity
trans: n. 实体；存在；本质

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

name: invest
trans: vi. 投资，入股；花钱买 vt. 投资；覆盖；耗费；授予；包围

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

name: input
trans: n. 投入；输入电路 vt. [自][电子] 输入；将…输入电脑

sentences.english: to input text/data/figures
sentences.chinese: 把文本 / 数据 / 数字输入计算机

sentences.english: data input
sentences.chinese: 数据输入

detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer
the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: acquisition
trans: n. 获得物，获得；收购

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

name: goods
trans: n. 商品；动产；合意的人；真本领

sentences.english: a goods train
sentences.chinese: 一列货车

sentences.english: the large market for consumer goods
sentences.chinese: 庞大的消费品市场

sentences.english: Britain’s leading exporter of manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 英国主要的工业制成品出口商

sentences.english: There will be tax increases on a range of goods and services .
sentences.chinese: 有一些商品和服务将要增税。

detailed_translations.english: things which are carried by road, train etc

name: cargo
trans: n. 货物，船货

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: insure
trans: vt. 确保，保证；给…保险 vi. 确保；投保

sentences.english: Have you insured the contents of your home?
sentences.chinese: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

sentences.english: facilities to insure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品 vt. 保证；担保

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: reliable
trans: n. 可靠的人 adj. 可靠的；可信赖的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: attend
trans: vi. 出席；致力于；照料；照顾 vt. 出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: absent
trans: adj. 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的 vt. 使缺席

sentences.english: The dull, absent look on her face implied boredom.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上呆滞、茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的
detailed_translations.english: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go
to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

name: sale
trans: n. 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售

sentences.english: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale (= sells something as part of his job ) .
sentences.chinese: 哈维每做成一笔生意可得到50美元的佣金。

sentences.english: Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale (= fail to sell something ) .
sentences.chinese: 汽车推销员常常宁愿降价也不愿失去一笔生意。

sentences.english: arms sales to Iran
sentences.chinese: 对伊朗的军火销售

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售
detailed_translations.english: when you sell something

name: wholesale
trans: n. 批发 adj. 批发的；大规模的 vt. 批发 adv. 大规模地；以批发方式 vi. 批发；经营批发业

sentences.english: wholesale prices
sentences.chinese: 批发价

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores

name: auction
trans: n. 拍卖 vt. 拍卖；竞卖

sentences.english: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week.
sentences.chinese: 法国艺术家让·科克托的8幅画作将在下周拍卖。

detailed_translations.english: to sell something at an auction
a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

name: bid
trans: n. 出价；叫牌；努力争取 vi. 投标；吩咐 vt. 投标；出价；表示；吩咐

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: deal
trans: n. 交易；（美）政策；待遇；份量 vi. 处理；讨论；对待；做生意 vt. 处理；给予；分配；发牌

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: turnover
trans: n. 翻覆；[贸易] 营业额；流通量；半圆卷饼；失误 adj. 翻过来的；可翻转的

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

name: dump
trans: n. 垃圾场；仓库；无秩序地累积 vt. 倾倒；倾卸；丢下，卸下；摆脱，扔弃；倾销 vi. 倒垃圾；突然跌倒或落下；卸货；转嫁（责任等）

sentences.english: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried toward the market.
sentences.chinese: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德旅馆，急匆匆地向市场赶去。

sentences.english: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
sentences.chinese: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

detailed_translations.english: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

name: export
trans: n. 输出，出口；出口商品 vt. 输出，出口 vi. 输出物资

sentences.english: Italian food has been exported all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利食品已传遍世界。

detailed_translations.english: to sell goods to another country
to sell goods to another country
the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

name: import
trans: n. 进口，进口货；输入；意思，含义；重要性 vt. 输入，进口；含…的意思 vi. 输入，进口

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

name: quota
trans: n. 配额；定额；限额

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: share
trans: n. 份额；股份 vt. 分享，分担；分配 vi. 共享；分担

sentences.english: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

name: benefit
trans: n. 利益，好处；救济金 vt. 有益于，对…有益 vi. 受益，得益

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；趣味；同行 vt. 使……感兴趣；引起……的关心；使……参与

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: dividend
trans: n. 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金

sentences.english: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 percent.
sentences.chinese: 第一季度的股息增加了近4％。

detailed_translations.chinese: 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金
detailed_translations.english: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with  share s  in the company

name: stock
trans: n. 股份，股票；库存；血统；树干；家畜 adj. 存货的，常备的；平凡的 vt. 进货；备有；装把手于… vi. 囤积；办货；出新芽

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述 vt. 认为；把…视为 vi. 解释；导致；报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: deposit
trans: n. 存款；押金；订金；保证金；沉淀物 vt. 使沉积；存放 vi. 沉淀

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: instalment
trans: n. 分期付款；装设；就职

sentences.english: the second instalment of a loan
sentences.chinese: 一项贷款的第二期还款

sentences.english: They’re letting me pay for the washing machine by monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 他们允许我以每月分期付款的方式买下这台洗衣机。

detailed_translations.english: one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe

name: cheque
trans: n. 支票

sentences.english: You could write her a cheque .
sentences.chinese: 你可以给她开张支票。

detailed_translations.english: a printed piece of paper that you write an amount of money on, sign, and use instead of money to pay for things

name: cash
trans: n. 现款，现金 vt. 将…兑现；支付现款

sentences.english: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

name: coin
trans: n. 硬币，钱币 vt. 铸造（货币）；杜撰，创造

sentences.english: Toss a coin to see who goes first.
sentences.chinese: 抛硬币决定谁先来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
to make pieces of money from metal

name: shilling
trans: n. 先令

sentences.english: The prominent coin was called the shilling and it was a silver coin.
sentences.chinese: 那种著名的硬币名叫先令,并且它是一种银质的硬币。

sentences.english: We wanted this to be a twenty shilling coin but now in the market it's trading at twenty-one.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望它是一个值二十先令的硬币,但现在它在市场上以二十一个先令的价值来交换。

sentences.english: Walter Scott wanted to give him a six penny piece to reward him for this service; but not finding any in his purse he presented him with a shilling saying, "You will owe me six pence, my good fellow.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔特•司各脱想奖赏给他一枚六便士的硬币,但他在钱包里找不到便士,于是他给了他一个先令,说:"你将欠我六便士,我亲爱的朋友.

detailed_translations.english: an old British coin or unit of money. There were 20 shillings in one pound.

name: copper
trans: n. 铜；铜币；警察 adj. 铜制的 vt. 镀铜

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

name: treasure
trans: n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品 vt. 珍爱；珍藏

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

name: wealth
trans: n. 财富；大量；富有

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: estate
trans: n. 房地产；财产；身份

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: possess
trans: vt. 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗赠，遗产

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: descend
trans: vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊 vt. 下去；沿…向下

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: worthy
trans: n. 杰出人物；知名人士 adj. 值得的；有价值的；配得上的，相称的；可尊敬的；应…的

sentences.english: Leeds United were worthy winners of the competition.
sentences.chinese: 利兹联队是比赛当之无愧的获胜者。

sentences.english: a worthy opponent
sentences.chinese: 值得钦佩的对手

sentences.english: A couple of other books are worthy of mention.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些其他的书值得一提

detailed_translations.english: deserving respect from people

name: valuable
trans: n. 贵重物品 adj. 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的

name: cheap
trans: adj. 便宜的；小气的；不值钱的 adv. 便宜地

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票

sentences.english: the cheapest TV on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上最便宜的电视机

sentences.english: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。

sentences.english: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )
sentences.chinese: 廉价商店

sentences.english: The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.
sentences.chinese: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。

sentences.english: Cheap wine gives me a headache.
sentences.chinese: 我喝劣质的葡萄酒会头痛。

detailed_translations.english: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

name: incentive
trans: n. 动机；刺激 adj. 激励的；刺激的

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: accelerate
trans: vt. 使……加快；使……增速 vi. 加速；促进；增加

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: prompt
trans: n. 提示；付款期限；DOS命令：改变DOS系统提示符的风格 adj. 敏捷的，迅速的；立刻的 vt. 提示；促进；激起；（给演员）提白 adv. 准时地

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: salary
trans: n. 薪水 vt. 给...加薪；给...薪水

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

name: income
trans: n. 收入，收益；所得

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: wage
trans: n. 工资；代价；报偿 vt. 进行；开展 vi. 进行；发动；从事

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name: payment
trans: n. 付款，支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应

sentences.english: She demanded payment in advance.
sentences.chinese: 她要求预先付款。

sentences.english: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
sentences.chinese: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。

detailed_translations.english: the act of paying for something

name: refund
trans: n. 退款；偿还，偿还额 vt. 退还；偿还；付还 vi. 退还；偿还，归还

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

name: reimburse
trans: vt. 偿还；赔偿

sentences.english: I'll be happy to reimburse you for any expenses you've had.
sentences.chinese: 我很乐意报销你的所有花费。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money back to someone when their money has been spent or lost

name: payroll
trans: n. 工资单；在册职工人数；工资名单

sentences.english: the annual payroll was $88 million
sentences.chinese: 年度工资总支出为8,800万美元

detailed_translations.english: the total amount of wages paid to all the people working in a particular company or industry

name: remuneration
trans: n. 报酬；酬劳，赔偿

sentences.english: high rates of remuneration
sentences.chinese: 很高的报酬

detailed_translations.english: the pay you give someone for something they have done for you

name: subsidy
trans: n. 补贴；津贴；补助金

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: earn
trans: vt. 赚，赚得；获得，挣得；使得到；博得

sentences.english: He earns nearly £20,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他每年挣近20,000英镑。

sentences.english: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 当护士挣钱并不多。

sentences.english: He did all sorts of jobs to earn a living.
sentences.chinese: 他为谋生什么活都干。

sentences.english: I was the only person in the house who was earning.
sentences.chinese: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。

sentences.english: She was earning good money at the bank.
sentences.chinese: 她在银行工作，收入不错。

sentences.english: You could earn a higher rate of interest elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 你在别处可以获得更高的利率。

detailed_translations.english: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do

name: undertaking
trans: n. 事业；企业；保证；殡仪业 v. 同意；担任；许诺（undertake的ing形式）

sentences.english: Starting a new business can be a risky undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 创办新企业有时是一件有风险的事情。

sentences.english: Both organizations gave an undertaking to curb violence among their members.
sentences.chinese: 两个组织都作出承诺要约束其成员的暴力行为。

detailed_translations.english: an important job, piece of work, or activity that you are responsible for

name: career
trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速 adj. 作为毕生职业的 vi. 全速前进，猛冲

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: profession
trans: n. 职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: occupation
trans: n. 职业；占有；消遣；占有期

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

name: job
trans: n. 工作；职业 vt. 承包；代客买卖 vi. 做零工

sentences.english: Do you enjoy your job?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢自己的工作吗？

sentences.english: It was the first paid job I ever had.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一份拿工资的工作。

sentences.english: He’s been in the job for six years.
sentences.chinese: 他干这份工作有六年了。

sentences.english: I’m looking for a new job.
sentences.chinese: 我在找一份新工作。

sentences.english: Your pension can be affected if you change jobs.
sentences.chinese: 换工作的话，会影响到你的退休金。

sentences.english: Sam does odd jobs(= small jobs in the house or garden ) for friends and neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆为朋友和邻居打打零工。

detailed_translations.english: the regular paid work that you do for an employer

name: vocation
trans: n. 职业；天职；天命；神召

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

name: labour
trans: n. （英国）工党

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

name: workforce
trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area

name: workaholic
trans: n. 专心工作的人；醉心于工作的人；为免遭辞退而工作过份卖力的人 adj. 醉心于工作的

sentences.english: Eighteen percent of 30-year-olds claim they are workaholics.
sentences.chinese: 18％的30岁的人声称他们是工作狂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心工作的人；醉心于工作的人；为免遭辞退而工作过份卖力的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to work a lot, so that they do not have time to do anything else

name: personnel
trans: n. 人事部门；全体人员 adj. 人员的；有关人事的

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: clerk
trans: n. 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士 vi. 当销售员，当店员；当职员

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: interview
trans: n. 接见，采访；面试，面谈 vt. 采访；接见；对…进行面谈；对某人进行面试

sentences.english: a portfolio of work presented at interview
sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本

sentences.english: a police interview
sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

name: resume
trans: vt.恢复（职位）；回到（座位）vt/vi.(中断后）继续n.简历；摘要；概述

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付 vi. 推荐；建议

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: employ
trans: n. 使用；雇用 vt. 使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于
