sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: arrow
trans: n. 箭，箭头；箭状物；箭头记号 vt. 以箭头指示；箭一般地飞向

sentences.english: Follow the arrows to the X-ray department.
sentences.chinese: 顺着箭头指示的方向去X光科。

detailed_translations.chinese: 箭，箭头；箭状物；箭头记号
detailed_translations.english: a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a  bow

detailed_translations.chinese: 以箭头指示；箭一般地飞向

name: spear
trans: n. 矛，枪 vt. 用矛刺

sentences.english: I fended off his sword thrust with my spear.
sentences.chinese: 他一刀砍来， 我拿枪架住。

sentences.english: He transfixed the enemy's heart with a spear.
sentences.chinese: 他用长矛刺穿了敌人的心脏。

sentences.english: Yes,of course. My shield is the strongest.It can stop any spear in the world.
sentences.chinese: 当然是了。我的盾是最结实的，它能抵挡住世界上任何矛。

detailed_translations.english: a pole with a sharp pointed blade at one end, used as a weapon in the past
to push or throw a spear into something, especially in order to kill it

name: helmet
trans: n. 钢盔，头盔

sentences.english: The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.chinese: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

sentences.english: Instead, he was told the last time that she loved him, got a hug from her, put his helmet on her so that she can live, and die himself...
sentences.chinese: 相反，他叫女孩最后一次说她爱他，最后一次拥抱他，并让她戴上自己的头盔，因而，女孩可以幸免于难，而他自己却离开了人世……

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

detailed_translations.english: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

name: shield
trans: n. 盾；防护物；保护者 vt. 遮蔽；包庇；避开；保卫 vi. 防御；起保护作用

sentences.english: He clanged his sword three times on his shield.
sentences.chinese: 他用他的剑当当当地敲了3下盾。

sentences.english: He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手遮挡反射过来的阳光。

sentences.english: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他抬手遮住眼睛免受阳光照射。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

name: equip
trans: vt. 装备，配备

sentences.english: They try to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽量给他们的车辆配备各种小装置以应付任何可能的突发状况。

detailed_translations.english: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

name: prepare
trans: vt. 准备；使适合；装备；起草 vi. 预备；做好思想准备

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: provide
trans: vt. 提供；规定；准备；装备 vi. 规定；抚养；作准备

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: deploy
trans: n. 部署 vt. 配置；展开；使疏开 vi. 部署；展开

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: hit
trans: n. 打；打击；（演出等）成功；讽刺 vt. 打击；袭击；碰撞；偶然发现；伤…的感情 vi. 打；打击；碰撞；偶然碰上

sentences.english: Which band had a hit with ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’?
sentences.chinese: 《波希米亚狂想曲》是哪支乐队风行一时的歌曲？

detailed_translations.english: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful

name: beat
trans: n. 拍子；敲击；有规律的一连串敲打 adj. 筋疲力尽的；疲惫不堪的 vt. 打；打败 vi. 打；打败；拍打；有节奏地舒张与收缩

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

name: strike
trans: n. 罢工；打击；殴打 vi. 打，打击；罢工；敲，敲击；抓；打动；穿透 vt. 打，击；罢工；撞击，冲击；侵袭；打动；到达

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: punch
trans: n. 冲压机；打洞器；钻孔机 vt. 开洞；以拳重击 vi. 用拳猛击

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: chop
trans: n. 砍；排骨；商标；削球 (俚)丑人 vt. 剁碎；砍

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces

name: stab
trans: n. 刺；戳；尝试；突发的一阵 vt. 刺；刺伤；戳；刺穿；直入 vi. 刺；刺伤；戳；刺痛

sentences.english: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

detailed_translations.english: to push a knife into someone or something
an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife

name: dilemma
trans: n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: plight
trans: n. 困境；境况；誓约 vt. 保证；约定

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

name: pitfall
trans: n. 陷阱，圈套；缺陷；诱惑

sentences.english: the pitfalls associated with the purchase of a used car
sentences.chinese: 购买旧车时可能遇到的圈套

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that is likely to happen in a particular job, course of action, or activity

name: conspiracy
trans: n. 阴谋；共谋；阴谋集团

sentences.english: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.chinese: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

detailed_translations.english: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal

name: destitute
trans: n. 赤贫者 adj. 穷困的；无的；缺乏的 vt. 使穷困；夺去

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute .
sentences.chinese: 这场洪水使许多人变得一无所有。

detailed_translations.english: having no money, no food, no home etc

name: famine
trans: n. 饥荒；饥饿，奇缺

sentences.english: the great potato famine in Ireland
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰严重的土豆荒

sentences.english: A million people are facing famine .
sentences.chinese: 一百万人正面临饥荒。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

name: starve
trans: vi. 饿死；挨饿；渴望 vt. 使饿死；使挨饿

sentences.english: Thousands of people will starve if food doesn’t reach the city.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不能运到那座城市，成千上万的人就要饿死。

sentences.english: pictures of starving children
sentences.chinese: 饥饿儿童的照片

sentences.english: They’ll either die from the cold or starve to death (= die from lack of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要么会冻死，要么会饿死。

detailed_translations.english: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

name: deprive
trans: vt. 使丧失，剥夺

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: seize
trans: vt. 抓住；夺取；理解；逮捕 vi. 抓住；利用；（机器）卡住

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: pursue
trans: vi. 追赶；继续进行 vt. 继续；从事；追赶；纠缠

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: offend
trans: vt. 冒犯；使…不愉快 vi. 违反；进攻；引起不舒服

sentences.english: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.english: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.chinese: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.english: In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.chinese: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
to commit a crime or crimes

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略；侵袭；侵扰；涌入 vi. 侵略；侵入；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: trespass
trans: n. 罪过；非法侵入；过失；擅自进入 vi. 侵入；犯罪；打扰；冒犯

sentences.english: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
sentences.chinese: 他将因擅闯私地而被起诉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪过；非法侵入；过失；擅自进入
detailed_translations.english: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission

name: intrude
trans: vi. 闯入；侵入；侵扰 vt. 把…强加；把…硬挤

sentences.english: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

name: violate
trans: vt. 违反；侵犯，妨碍；亵渎

sentences.english: 34 protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 34名抗议者因违反刑法而被逮捕。

sentences.english: regimes that violate human rights
sentences.chinese: 侵犯人权的政权

detailed_translations.english: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

name: attack
trans: n. 攻击；抨击；疾病发作 vt. 攻击；抨击；动手干 vi. 攻击；腐蚀

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: assault
trans: n. 攻击；袭击 vt. 攻击；袭击 vi. 袭击；动武

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑 vt. 向…挑战；对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: siege
trans: n. 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力 vt. 围攻；包围

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: surround
trans: n. 围绕物 vt. 围绕；包围 adj. 环绕立体声的

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: enclose
trans: vt. 围绕；装入；放入封套

sentences.english: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
sentences.chinese: 请随订单附上支票。

sentences.english: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
sentences.chinese: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter

name: pause
trans: n. 暂停；间歇 vi. 暂停，停顿，中止；踌躇

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

name: halt
trans: n. 停止；立定；休息 vt. 使停止；使立定 vi. 停止；立定；踌躇，犹豫

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: cease
trans: n. 停止 vi. 停止；终了 vt. 停止；结束

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

name: oppose
trans: vt. 反对；对抗，抗争 vi. 反对

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: oppress
trans: vt. 压迫，压抑；使……烦恼；使……感到沉重

sentences.english: native tribes oppressed by the authorities
sentences.chinese: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫， 压制； 使沉重， 使烦恼
detailed_translations.english: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

name: counter
trans: n. 柜台；对立面；计数器；（某些棋盘游戏的）筹码 vi. 逆向移动，对着干；反驳 adj. 相反的 vt. 反击，还击；反向移动，对着干；反驳，回答 adv. 反方向地；背道而驰地

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: deter
trans: vt. 制止，阻止；使打消念头

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

name: forbid
trans: vt. 禁止；不准；不允许；〈正式〉严禁

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: prohibit
trans: vt. 阻止，禁止

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: prevent
trans: vt. 预防，防止；阻止 vi. 妨碍，阻止

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: revolt
trans: n. 反抗；叛乱；反感 vt. 使反感；使恶心 vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

name: betray
trans: vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: treason
trans: n. [法] 叛国罪；不忠

sentences.english: The defendant was convicted of high treason (= treason of the worst kind ) and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪，并处以死刑。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

name: rebel
trans: n. 反叛者；叛徒 adj. 反抗的；造反的 vi. 反叛；反抗；造反

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: traitor
trans: n. 叛徒；卖国贼；背信弃义的人

sentences.english: ...rumours that there were traitors among us who were sending messages to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: …谣言说我们中有正给敌人送信的叛徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not loyal to their country, friends, or beliefs

name: patriot
trans: n. 爱国者

sentences.english: It has been suggested the founders were not true patriots but men out to protect their own interests.
sentences.chinese: 有人指出创建者并非真正的爱国者，而是一些维护自己利益的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

name: blame
trans: n. 责备；责任；过失 vt. 责备；归咎于

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: reproach
trans: n. 责备；耻辱 vt. 责备；申斥

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: proof
trans: n. 证明；证据；校样；考验；验证；试验 adj. 防…的；不能透入的；证明用的；耐…的 vt. 试验；校对；使不被穿透

sentences.english: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: terror
trans: n. 恐怖；恐怖行动；恐怖时期；可怕的人

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

name: terrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；很糟的；令人讨厌的 adv. 很，非常

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: terrific
trans: adj. 极好的；极其的，非常的；可怕的

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

name: horrible
trans: adj. 可怕的；极讨厌的

sentences.english: The weather has been really horrible all week.
sentences.chinese: 整个星期天气都很糟。

sentences.english: a horrible smell
sentences.chinese: 极难闻的气味

sentences.english: The food looked horrible, but it tasted OK.
sentences.chinese: 那食物看上去很糟，可吃起来还不错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人恐惧的， 可怕的； 骇人听闻的； 极讨厌的， 使人不愉快的； 糟透的
detailed_translations.english: very bad - used, for example, about things you see, taste, or smell, or about the weather

name: alarm
trans: n. 闹钟；警报，警告器；惊慌 vt. 警告；使惊恐

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: dread
trans: n. 恐惧；可怕的人（或物） vt. 惧怕；担心 adj. 可怕的 vi. 惧怕；担心

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: frighten
trans: vt. 使惊吓；吓唬… vi. 害怕，惊恐

sentences.english: Don’t stand so near the edge! You’re frightening me.
sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.english: She was frightened by the anger in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.english: Computers used to frighten me, but not now.
sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid

name: tension
trans: n. 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压 vt. 使紧张；使拉紧

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: turbulent
trans: adj. 骚乱的，混乱的；狂暴的；吵闹的；激流的，湍流的

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: turmoil
trans: n. 混乱，骚动

sentences.english: She lived through the turmoil of the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 她经历过法国大革命的混乱之后仍旧活着。

detailed_translations.english: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

name: scenario
trans: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由 vt. 引起，惹起

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: limit
trans: n. 限制；限度；界线 vt. 限制；限定

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

name: boundary
trans: n. 边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: rein
trans: n. 缰绳；驾驭；统治；支配 vt. 控制；驾驭；勒住 vi. 勒住马

sentences.english: Cord held the reins while the stallion tugged and snorted.
sentences.chinese: 当那匹牡马使劲挣扎，打着响鼻的时候，科德勒紧了缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow band of leather that is fastened around a horse’s head in order to control it

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒缰使停步； 控制， 约束

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: contest
trans: n. 竞赛；争夺；争论 vt. 争辩；质疑 vi. 竞争；争辩

sentences.english: Stone decided to hold a contest to see who could write the best song.
sentences.chinese: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.english: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.english: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.chinese: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.english: the 1975 Liberal leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 1975年自由党的领导权之争

detailed_translations.english: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 争夺， 与…竞争； 对…提出质疑， 辩驳
detailed_translations.english: to say formally that you do not accept something or do not agree with it

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争；奋斗；斗争；争论 vt. 主张；为...斗争

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: rival
trans: n. 对手；竞争者 adj. 竞争的 vt. 与…竞争；比得上某人 vi. 竞争

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: competitor
trans: n. 竞争者，对手

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: enemy
trans: n. 敌人，仇敌；敌军 adj. 敌人的，敌方的

sentences.english: She’s a dangerous enemy to have.
sentences.chinese: 与她为敌很危险。

sentences.english: Cats and dogs have always been natural enemies.
sentences.chinese: 猫和狗向来是天敌。

sentences.english: an old enemy of her father
sentences.chinese: 她父亲的一个宿敌

sentences.english: the unforgettable sight of the president shaking hands with his sworn enemy
sentences.chinese: 董事长与其死敌握手的难忘情景

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wishthis on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是我的死对头，我也不愿看到他发生这样的事情。

detailed_translations.english: someone who hates you and wants to harm you

name: strategy
trans: n. 战略，策略

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: tactic
trans: n. 策略，战略 adj. 按顺序的，依次排列的

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: manoeuvre
trans: vi. 调动；演习；用策略 vt. 诱使；操纵；耍花招 n. 策略（等于maneuvre）

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

sentences.english: I manoeuvred my way among the tables to the back corner of the place.
sentences.chinese: 我在那些桌子间穿行，来到那地方后面的角落。

detailed_translations.english: If you manoeuvre something into or out of an awkward position, you skilfully move it there
a skilful or carefully planned action intended to gain an advantage for yourself

name: blueprint
trans: n. 蓝图，设计图；计划 vt. 计划；制成蓝图

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: warn
trans: vt. 警告，提醒；通知 vi. 发出警告，发出预告

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: compel
trans: vt. 强迫，迫使；强使发生

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: oblige
trans: vt. 迫使；强制；赐，施恩惠；责成；义务 vi. 帮忙；施恩惠

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: order
trans: n. 命令；顺序；规则；[贸易] 定单 vt. 命令；整理；定购 vi. 命令；定货

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议 adj. 表示抗议的；抗议性的 vt. 抗议；断言 vi. 抗议；断言

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: refute
trans: vt. 反驳，驳斥；驳倒

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: might
trans: n. 力量；威力；势力 v. 可以；或许（may的过去式）；应该 aux. 可能；也许

sentences.english: If you need more information, you might try the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要更多的信息，可以试试因特网。

sentences.english: I thought we might go to the new Chinese restaurant on the High Street.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们可以到大街上新开的那家中国餐馆去。

sentences.english: It might be a good idea to put those plants in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 把那些植物放在阴凉处也许是个好主意。

sentences.english: We’re going to a concert. You might like to come with us.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听音乐会，你也许想和我们一起去吧。

detailed_translations.english: if something might happen or might be true, there is a possibility that it may happen or may be true, but you are not at all certain

name: force
trans: n. 力量；武力；军队；魄力 vt. 促使，推动；强迫；强加

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料 vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充 vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: impair
trans: vt. 损害；削弱；减少

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

name: mitigate
trans: vt. 使缓和，使减轻 vi. 减轻，缓和下来

sentences.english: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the environmental effects of burning more coal.
sentences.chinese: 需要采取措施来减轻燃煤增加对环境造成的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to make a situation or the effects of something less unpleasant, harmful, or serious

name: comfort
trans: n. 安慰；舒适；安慰者 vt. 安慰；使（痛苦等）缓和

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

name: event
trans: n. 事件，大事；项目；结果

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: matter
trans: n. 物质；事件 vi. 有关系；要紧

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: happen
trans: vi. 发生；碰巧；偶然遇到

sentences.english: When did the accident happen?
sentences.chinese: 事故什么时候发生的？

sentences.english: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.chinese: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.english: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.chinese: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.english: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 这事注定早晚会发生。

sentences.english: This kind of thing happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这种事一直在发生。

sentences.english: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
sentences.chinese: 真巧，我正好认识一个人，这个人也许帮得上忙。

sentences.english: We happened to discover we had a friend in common.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰巧发现我们有个共同的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

name: occur
trans: vi. 发生；出现；存在

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: savage
trans: n. 未开化的人；粗鲁的人；残暴成性的人 adj. 野蛮的；残酷的；狂怒的；荒凉的 vt. 乱咬；粗暴的对待

sentences.english: a savage dog
sentences.chinese: 一条凶猛的狗

sentences.english: a savage murder
sentences.chinese: 凶残的谋杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 野蛮的；残酷的；狂怒的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: very violent or cruel

detailed_translations.chinese: 未开化的人；粗鲁的人；残暴成性的人
detailed_translations.english: a very offensive word for someone who has a simple, traditional way of life
if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly

name: reckless
trans: adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的；粗心大意的

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: foul
trans: n. 犯规；缠绕 adj. 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的 vt. 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害 adv. 违反规则地，不正当地 vi. 犯规；腐烂；缠结

sentences.english: Refugees in the camps are short of food and at risk from foul water.
sentences.chinese: 营中难民缺少食物，还面临水源污染的危险。

sentences.english: extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
sentences.chinese: 排出隧道污浊空气的排气扇

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的
detailed_translations.english: very dirty

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害
detailed_translations.english: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
an action in a sport that is against the rules

name: evil
trans: n. 罪恶，邪恶；不幸 adj. 邪恶的；不幸的；有害的；讨厌的

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: devil
trans: n. 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼 vt. 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

sentences.english: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

detailed_translations.chinese: 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼
detailed_translations.english: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

detailed_translations.chinese: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

name: punishment
trans: n. 惩罚；严厉对待，虐待

sentences.english: ...a group that campaigns against the physical punishment of children.
sentences.chinese: …一个发起运动反对体罚儿童的组织。

detailed_translations.english: Punishment is the act of punishing someone or of being punished

name: execute
trans: vt. 实行；执行；处死

sentences.english: 13 people were summarily executed (= killed without any trial or legal process ) by the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 有13人被游击队员就地处决。

sentences.english: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作包括拟订和实施一个护理计划。

detailed_translations.english: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

name: hang
trans: n. 悬挂；暂停，中止 vt. 悬挂，垂下；装饰；绞死；使悬而未决 vi. 悬着，垂下；被绞死；悬而不决

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉 vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售 vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: casualty
trans: n. 意外事故；伤亡人员；急诊室

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: bury
trans: vt. 埋葬；隐藏

sentences.english: Electric cables are buried beneath the streets.
sentences.chinese: 电缆埋在街道的下面。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone who has died in a  grave

detailed_translations.chinese: (Bury)人名；(法)比里；(英、西)伯里；(德、意、罗、波、捷、匈)布里；(俄)布雷

name: funeral
trans: n. 葬礼；麻烦事 adj. 丧葬的，出殡的

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

name: grave
trans: n. 墓穴，坟墓；死亡 adj. 重大的；严肃的；黯淡的 vt. 雕刻；铭记

sentences.english: Matthew’s life is in grave danger .
sentences.chinese: 马修的生命危在旦夕。

sentences.english: The report expressed grave concern over the technicians’ lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 报告中对技术人员缺乏培训深表忧虑。

sentences.english: I have grave doubts about his ability.
sentences.chinese: 我十分怀疑他的能力。

sentences.english: The situation is becoming very grave.
sentences.chinese: 形势变得非常严峻。

detailed_translations.english: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad
the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

name: tomb
trans: n. 坟墓；死亡 vt. 埋葬

sentences.english: the family tomb
sentences.chinese: 家族坟墓

detailed_translations.english: a stone structure above or below the ground where a dead person is buried

name: hell
trans: n. 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力 vi. 过放荡生活；飞驰 int. 该死；见鬼（表示惊奇、烦恼、厌恶、恼怒、失望等）

sentences.english: I’ve come one hell of a long way to get here.
sentences.chinese: 我走了老远的路才到这里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力
detailed_translations.english: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions

detailed_translations.chinese: 该死；见鬼（表示惊奇、烦恼、厌恶、恼怒、失望等）
detailed_translations.english: used when you are very angry with someone

name: maritime
trans: adj. 海的；海事的；沿海的；海员的

sentences.english: San Francisco has lost nearly all of its maritime industry.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山几乎失去了所有海运业。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海的；海事的；沿海的；海员的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea or ships

name: naval
trans: adj. 海军的；军舰的

sentences.english: a naval officer
sentences.chinese: 海军军官

sentences.english: naval battles
sentences.chinese: 海战

detailed_translations.english: relating to the navy or used by the navy

name: fleet
trans: n. 舰队；港湾；小河 adj. 快速的，敏捷的 vt. 消磨 vi. 飞逝；疾驰；掠过

sentences.english: Atalanta was fleet of foot (= able to run quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

detailed_translations.english: fast or quick
a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

name: troop
trans: vt. 把（骑兵）编成骑兵连 vi. 群集；成群而行；结队 n. 军队；组；群；多数

sentences.english: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
sentences.chinese: 两国都同意撤军。

sentences.english: troops stationed in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷的驻军

detailed_translations.english: soldiers in an organized group
if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

name: landing
trans: n. 登陆；码头；楼梯平台 v. 登陆（land的ing形式）

sentences.english: take-off and landing procedures
sentences.chinese: 起降程序

sentences.english: the Apollo Moon landings
sentences.chinese: 阿波罗宇宙飞船登月

detailed_translations.english: the action of bringing an aircraft down to the ground after being in the air

name: hover
trans: n. 徘徊；盘旋；犹豫 vi. 盘旋，翱翔；徘徊 vt. 孵；徘徊在…近旁

sentences.english: Her younger brother hovered in the background watching us.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟在后面走来走去，观察着我们。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird, insect, or  helicopter  hovers, it stays in one place in the air

name: proceed
trans: vi. 开始；继续进行；发生；行进 n. 收入，获利

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: progress
trans: n. 进步，发展；前进 vi. 前进，进步；进行

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的 n. 军队；军人

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: nuclear
trans: adj. 原子能的；[细胞] 细胞核的；中心的；原子核的

sentences.english: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
sentences.chinese: 法国对核能的依赖

sentences.english: a nuclear power station
sentences.chinese: 核电站

sentences.english: a nuclear-powered submarine
sentences.chinese: 核动力潜艇

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the nucleus of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom

name: poison
trans: n. 毒药，毒物；酒；有毒害的事物；[助剂] 抑制剂 adj. 有毒的 vt. 污染；使中毒，放毒于；败坏；阻碍 vi. 放毒，下毒

sentences.english: Belladonna and red arsenic are deadly poisons .
sentences.chinese: 颠茄和雄黄都是致命的毒物。

sentences.english: a box of rat poison
sentences.chinese: 一盒鼠药

sentences.english: He killed several people by poisoning their tea.
sentences.chinese: 他在茶里下毒杀死了几个人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause death or serious illness if you eat it, drink it etc
to give someone poison, especially by adding it to their food or drink, in order to harm or kill them

name: devastate
trans: vt. 毁灭；毁坏

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

name: risk
trans: n. 风险；危险；冒险 vt. 冒…的危险

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: adventure
trans: n. 冒险；冒险精神；投机活动 vt. 冒险；大胆说出 vi. 冒险

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

name: peril
trans: n. 危险；冒险 vt. 危及；置…于险境

sentences.english: a voyage that was fraught with peril
sentences.chinese: 历尽艰险的旅程

detailed_translations.english: great danger, especially of being harmed or killed

name: catastrophe
trans: n. 大灾难；大祸；惨败

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: collapse
trans: n. 倒塌；失败；衰竭 vt. 使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠 vi. 倒塌；瓦解；暴跌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: torture
trans: n. 折磨；拷问；歪曲 vt. 折磨；拷问；歪曲

sentences.english: He died after five days of excruciating torture.
sentences.chinese: 遭受了五天的严刑拷打之后，他死了。

sentences.english: The waiting must be torture for you.
sentences.chinese: 这样的等待对你来说肯定是一种煎熬。

sentences.english: Political opponents of the regime may be tortured.
sentences.chinese: 这个政权的政治异己可能会遭受酷刑。

detailed_translations.english: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel
to deliberately hurt someone in order to force them to give you information, to punish them, or to be cruel

name: humiliate
trans: vt. 羞辱；使…丢脸；耻辱

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: damage
trans: vi. 损害；损毁 vt. 损害，毁坏 n. 损害；损毁；赔偿金

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

name: harmful
trans: adj. 有害的；能造成损害的

sentences.english: the harmful effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: causing harm

name: mislead
trans: vt. 误导；带错

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: disturb
trans: vt. 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒 vi. 打扰；妨碍

sentences.english: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
sentences.chinese: 对不起打扰一下，我有个紧急消息。

sentences.english: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。

sentences.english: (= a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you ) .
sentences.chinese: 请勿打扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
detailed_translations.english: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

name: interfere
trans: vi. 干涉；妨碍；打扰 vt. 冲突；介入

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: interrupt
trans: n. 中断 vt. 中断；打断；插嘴；妨碍 vi. 打断；打扰

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: retreat
trans: n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退 vt. 退（棋）；使后退 vi. 撤退；退避；向后倾

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: shrink
trans: vi. 收缩；畏缩 n. 收缩；畏缩；<俚>精神病学家 vt. 使缩小，使收缩

sentences.english: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫，怕它会缩水。

detailed_translations.chinese: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
detailed_translations.english: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

name: withdraw
trans: vt. 撤退；收回；撤消；拉开 vi. 撤退；离开

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: withstand
trans: vt. 抵挡；禁得起；反抗 vi. 反抗

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

name: compromise
trans: n. 妥协，和解；折衷 vt. 妥协；危害 vi. 妥协；让步

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: surrender
trans: n. 投降；放弃；交出；屈服 vt. 使投降；放弃；交出；听任 vi. 投降；屈服；自首

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

name: escape
trans: n. 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏 vi. 逃脱；避开；溜走；（气体，液体等）漏出；（未受伤或只受了一点伤害而）逃脱；声音（不自觉地）由…发出 vt. 逃避，避开，避免；被忘掉；被忽视

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: avoid
trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: quit
trans: n. 离开；[计] 退出 vt. 离开；放弃；停止；使…解除 adj. 摆脱了…的；已经了结的 vi. 离开；辞职；停止

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: abandon
trans: n. 放任；狂热 vt. 遗弃；放弃

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: forgo
trans: vi. 放弃；停止；对…断念 vt. 放弃；停止；对…断念 [ 过去式forwent 过去分词forgone 现在分词forgoing ]

sentences.english: I had to forgo lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我只得放弃午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable

name: discard
trans: n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人 vt. 抛弃；放弃；丢弃 vi. 放弃

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: rid
trans: vt. 使摆脱；使去掉

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

name: defend
trans: vi. 保卫；防守 vt. 辩护；防护

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: safeguard
trans: n. [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施 vt. [安全] 保护，护卫

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: defeat
trans: n. 失败的事实；击败的行为 vt. 击败，战胜；挫败；使…失败

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: resist
trans: n. [助剂] 抗蚀剂；防染剂 vt. 抵抗；忍耐，忍住 vi. 抵抗，抗拒；忍耐

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: capture
trans: n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏 vt. 俘获；夺得；捕捉，拍摄

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: victory
trans: n. 胜利；成功；克服

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: triumph
trans: n. 胜利，凯旋；欢欣 vi. 获得胜利，成功

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: conquer
trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取 vi. 胜利；得胜

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品 vt. 为…树碑

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: tablet
trans: n. 碑；药片；写字板；小块；平板电脑 vt. 用碑牌纪念；将(备忘录等)写在板上；将…制成小片或小块

sentences.english: She took a couple of headache tablets .
sentences.chinese: 她吃了几片头痛药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 碑；药片；写字板；小块；平板电脑
detailed_translations.english: a small round hard piece of medicine which you swallow

detailed_translations.chinese: 用碑牌纪念；将(备忘录等)写在板上；将…制成小片或小块

name: statue
trans: n. 雕像，塑像 vt. 以雕像装饰

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: medal
trans: n. 勋章，奖章；纪念章

sentences.english: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

name: honour
trans: n. 荣誉；尊敬；勋章 vt. 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

name: glorious
trans: adj. 光荣的；辉煌的；极好的

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: contribute
trans: vt. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献 vi. 贡献，出力；投稿；捐献 [ 过去式 contributed 过去分词 contributed 现在分词 contributing ]

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: devote
trans: vt. 致力于；奉献

sentences.english: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.
sentences.chinese: 他决定把余生奉献给科学研究。

detailed_translations.english: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

name: owe
trans: vt. 欠；感激；应给予；应该把……归功于 vi. 欠钱

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: patrol
trans: n. 巡逻；巡逻队；侦察队 vt. 巡逻；巡查 vi. 巡逻；巡查

sentences.english: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
sentences.chinese: 安全部队加强了对该地区的巡逻。

detailed_translations.english: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

name: guard
trans: n. 守卫；警戒；护卫队；防护装置 vi. 警惕 vt. 保卫；监视

sentences.english: The Sergeant told Swift to guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 中士叫斯威夫特守着入口。

sentences.english: a lioness guarding her cubs
sentences.chinese: 守护着幼狮的母狮

sentences.english: There were two security guards on duty outside the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼外面有两名保安在值勤。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
someone whose job is to protect a place or person

name: camouflage
trans: n. 伪装，掩饰 vt. 伪装，掩饰 vi. 伪装起来

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰；妨害物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: burrow
trans: n. （兔、狐等的）洞穴，地道；藏身处，住处 vt. 挖掘，挖出；在…挖洞（或通道）；使躲入洞穴 vi. 探索，寻找；挖地洞，挖通道；住入地洞，躲藏起来；钻进某处；偎依著

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: spy
trans: n. 间谍；密探 vt. 侦察；发现；暗中监视 vi. 侦察；当间谍

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: scout
trans: n. 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机 vt. 侦察；跟踪，监视；发现 vi. 侦察；巡视；嘲笑

sentences.english: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机
detailed_translations.english: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

name: general
trans: n. 一般；将军，上将；常规 adj. 一般的，普通的；综合的；大体的

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

name: soldier
trans: n. 军人；[昆] 兵蚁；懒汉；一片烤面包 vi. 当兵；磨洋工；坚持干；假称害病

sentences.english: A British soldier was wounded in the fighting.
sentences.chinese: 战斗中，有一名英国士兵受了伤。

sentences.english: an enemy soldier
sentences.chinese: 敌兵

detailed_translations.chinese: 军人；[昆] 兵蚁；懒汉；一片烤面包
detailed_translations.english: a member of the army of a country, especially someone who is not an officer

detailed_translations.chinese: 当兵；磨洋工；坚持干；假称害病

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员 adj. 经验丰富的；老兵的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

sentences.chinese: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。

sentences.chinese: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is a herald of a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear

sentences.chinese: 琼森是他的政治接班人，他将担任该党派的领袖。

trans: n. 继承者；后续的事物

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: What is your surname?
sentences.chinese: 你姓什么?

sentences.english: Your surname may be derived from a place, such as Lancaster, for example, or an occupation, such as Weaver, but this is not necessarily of relevance to your family history.
sentences.chinese: 或许，你的姓氏来源于一个地方名，例如兰开斯特，或者来源于职业，例如编织工。 但是，这并不能中肯地说出你家族的历史。

sentences.chinese: 如今在电视上看到的尽是性和暴力。

sentences.chinese: 他们在他的汽车后座上做了爱。

sentences.chinese: 她再也不想和他做爱了。

sentences.chinese: “我实话告诉你”，耶稣说道，“这个贫穷的寡妇放入的比其他人的都多。

sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.
sentences.chinese: …在全体成员均为男性的家庭里长大。

sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

sentences.chinese: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

sentences.english: The actress was guest of honour (= the most important guest ) at the launch.
sentences.chinese: 这位女演员是首发式上的贵宾。

sentences.english: I’ve nearly finished the guest list for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 参加婚礼的嘉宾名单我差不多准备好了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is invited to an event or special occasion
for guests to use

name: customer
trans: n. 顾客；家伙

sentences.english: We aim to offer good value and service to all our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We’ve had several letters from satisfied customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了几封顾客表示满意的来信。

sentences.english: He’s one of our regular customers .
sentences.chinese: 他是我们的一个老主顾。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys goods or services from a shop, company etc

name: client
trans: n. [经] 客户；顾客；委托人

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

name: encounter
trans: n. 遭遇，偶然碰见 vi. 遭遇；偶然相遇 vt. 遭遇，邂逅；遇到

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: chase
trans: n. 追逐；追赶；追击 vt. 追逐；追捕；试图赢得；雕镂 vi. 追逐；追赶；奔跑

sentences.english: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗看到他在跑就追他。

sentences.english: kids chasing around the house
sentences.chinese: 在屋里追逐嬉戏的孩子们

detailed_translations.chinese: 追逐， 追赶， 追求
detailed_translations.english: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

name: miss
trans: n. 女士，小姐，年轻未婚女子 vt. 错过，想念，缺（勤）

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
