sentences.chinese: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。

detailed_translations.english: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

name: appointment
trans: n. 任命；约定；任命的职位

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏 vi. 伴奏，伴唱

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: dependent
trans: n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者 adj. 依靠的；从属的；取决于…的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: propose
trans: vi. 建议；求婚；打算 vt. 建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: engagement
trans: n. 婚约；约会；交战；诺言 n. 参与度（指用户点赞、转发、评论、下载文档、观看视频、咨询等交互行为）

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: marry
trans: vt. 嫁；娶；与……结婚 vi. 结婚

sentences.english: He married Bea in 1925.
sentences.chinese: 他在1925年娶了贝亚。

sentences.english: I’m going to ask her to marry me on St Valentine’s Day.
sentences.chinese: 我打算在情人节向她求婚。

sentences.english: She married young (= at a young age ) .
sentences.chinese: 她结婚早。

sentences.english: People in higher social classes are more likely to marry late (= when they are older than is usual ) .
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层较高的人士倾向于晚婚。

sentences.english: Sophia had, in a sense, married beneath her (= married someone of a lower social class than her ) .
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在某种意义上是下嫁了。

detailed_translations.english: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife
if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

name: wedding
trans: n. 婚礼，婚宴；结婚；结合 v. 与…结婚（wed的ing形式）

sentences.english: She’s busy planning her daughter’s wedding.
sentences.chinese: 她正忙着筹备女儿的婚礼。

sentences.english: When is the wedding?
sentences.chinese: 婚礼是什么时候？

detailed_translations.english: a marriage ceremony, especially one with a religious service

name: honeymoon
trans: n. 蜜月；蜜月假期；（新生事物、新建关系等的）短暂的和谐时期 vi. 度蜜月

sentences.english: By 1987, the honeymoon was over .
sentences.chinese: 到1987年，蜜月期已经过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 蜜月；蜜月假期；（新生事物、新建关系等的）短暂的和谐时期
detailed_translations.english: a holiday taken by two people who have just got married
to go somewhere for your honeymoon

name: kiss
trans: vt. 吻；（风等）轻拂 vi. 接吻；（风等）轻触 n. 吻；轻拂

sentences.english: Maggie leaned forward and kissed her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉俯身吻了她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Georgina took him in her arms and kissed him on the lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔治娜抱住他，吻他的嘴唇。

sentences.english: Jim and Mary kissed (= they kissed each other ).
sentences.chinese: 吉姆和玛丽接了吻。

detailed_translations.english: to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
an act of kissing

name: divorce
trans: n. 离婚；分离 vt. 使离婚，使分离；与…离婚 vi. 离婚

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: separate
trans: n. .分开；抽印本 adj. 单独的；分开的；不同的；各自的； vt. 使分离；使分开；使分居 vi. 分开；隔开；分居

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

name: single
trans: n. 一个；单打；单程票 adj. 单一的；单身的；单程的 vt. 选出 vi. 击出一垒安打

sentences.english: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 唯有一棵树遮阴。

sentences.english: They won the game by a single point.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。

sentences.english: the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
sentences.chinese: 为单件艺术品所支付的最高价格

sentences.english: a single-sex school
sentences.chinese: 单一性别的学校

detailed_translations.english: only one
a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again

name: sole
trans: n. 鞋底；脚底；基础；鳎目鱼 adj. 唯一的；单独的；仅有的 vt. 触底；上鞋底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: each
trans: adj. 每；各自的 pron. 每个；各自 adv. 每个；各自

sentences.english: They reviewed each aspect of the plan bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 他们对计划的各个方面逐一地进行了审核。

name: individual
trans: n. 个人，个体 adj. 个人的；个别的；独特的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: commuter
trans: n. 通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客

detailed_translations.chinese: 通勤者，经常乘公共车辆往返者；[交] 月季票乘客
detailed_translations.english: someone who travels a long distance to work every day

name: neighbourhood
trans: n. 邻近；周围；邻居关系；附近一带

sentences.english: Be quiet! You’ll wake up the whole neighbourhood!
sentences.chinese: 安静点！ 你会把邻居全都吵醒的！

sentences.english: She grew up in a quiet neighborhood of Boston.
sentences.chinese: 她是在波士顿一个清静的街区里长大的。

detailed_translations.english: the area around you or around a particular place, or the people who live there

name: member
trans: n. 成员；会员；议员

sentences.english: The majority of union members voted in favour of a strike.
sentences.chinese: 大多数工会成员投票赞成罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization

name: boss
trans: n. 老板；首领；工头 vt. 指挥，调遣；当…的领导 vi. 当首领，发号施令

sentences.english: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
sentences.chinese: 我得向老板请一天假。

sentences.english: Since I’m my own boss (=  I work for myself, rather than for an employer  ) , my hours are flexible.
sentences.chinese: 我自己当老板，所以我的时间很灵活。

sentences.english: Five-year-old girls love to boss people around.
sentences.chinese: 五岁的女孩就爱支使别人。

detailed_translations.english: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it

name: manager
trans: n. 经理；管理人员

sentences.english: one of our regional managers
sentences.chinese: 我们的一位地区经理

sentences.english: a middle manager in a computer company
sentences.chinese: 一家计算机公司的中层管理人员

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to manage part or all of a company or other organization

name: supervisor
trans: n. 监督人，[管理] 管理人；检查员

sentences.english: ...a full-time job as a supervisor at a factory.
sentences.chinese: …在一家工厂担任监督员的一项全职工作。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supervises a person or activity

name: subordinate
trans: n. 下属，下级；部属，属下 adj. 从属的；次要的 vt. 使……居下位；使……服从

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: partner
trans: n. 伙伴；合伙人；配偶 vt. 使合作；与…合伙 vi. 合伙；合股；成为搭档

sentences.english: Discuss your worries with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 和伴侣谈谈你的忧虑。

sentences.english: Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners .
sentences.chinese: 只有29%的单身家长得到他们前配偶的经济资助。

sentences.english: Clare’s my tennis partner.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔是我的网球搭档。

sentences.english: Take your partners for the next dance.
sentences.chinese: 挑选下一支舞的舞伴吧。

detailed_translations.english: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship

name: mate
trans: n. 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物 vt. 使配对；使一致；结伴 vi. 交配；成配偶；紧密配合

sentences.english: He has found his ideal mate.
sentences.chinese: 他已经找到了理想的配偶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物
detailed_translations.english: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

name: colleague
trans: n. 同事，同僚

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: comrade
trans: n. 同志；伙伴

sentences.english: He misses his comrades from his days in the army.
sentences.chinese: 他想念在部队时候的战友。

sentences.english: Comrades, please support this motion.
sentences.chinese: 同志们，请支持这项动议。

detailed_translations.english: a friend, especially someone who shares difficult work or danger

name: acquaintance
trans: n. 熟人；相识；了解；知道

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

name: friendship
trans: n. 友谊；友爱；友善

sentences.english: her close friendship with her aunt
sentences.chinese: 她与姑母的亲密友谊

sentences.english: a lifelong friendship
sentences.chinese: 一生的友谊

sentences.english: The two boys formed a deep and lasting friendship .
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩子建立了深厚持久的友谊。

sentences.english: I could always rely on Gary for friendship and support.
sentences.chinese: 我总是可以依靠加里的友情和支持。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between friends

name: affection
trans: n. 喜爱，感情；影响；感染

sentences.english: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.chinese: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.english: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.english: Anne had two men trying to win her affections.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有两个男人追求。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

name: stranger
trans: n. 陌生人；外地人；局外人

sentences.english: Children must not talk to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子千万不要同陌生人说话。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't know where the bank is. I'm a stranger here myself.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不知道银行在哪儿。我不是本地人。

detailed_translations.english: someone that you do not know

name: apprentice
trans: n. 学徒；生手 vt. 使…当学徒 vi. 当学徒

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: deputy
trans: n. 代理人，代表 adj. 副的；代理的

sentences.english: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副职， 副手； 代表， 代理人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

name: hero
trans: n. 英雄；男主角，男主人公

sentences.english: He had dared to speak out against injustice, and overnight he became a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他敢于站出来抨击不公正的现象，一夜之间就成了国家英雄。

sentences.english: His father was a war hero , a former fighter pilot.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲是一位战争英雄，曾经是战斗机飞行员。

sentences.english: the unsung heroes who drove convoys of aid to Bosnia
sentences.chinese: 运载援助物品到波斯尼亚的那些无名英雄

sentences.english: A man hailed as a hero for 50 years has been unmasked as a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 50年来一直被誉为英雄的人被揭发为叛徒。

sentences.english: The hero of Doctor Zhivago dies in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 《日瓦戈医生》的男主人公于1929年去世。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave

name: heroine
trans: n. 女主角；女英雄；女杰出人物

sentences.english: a heroine of the French Resistance
sentences.chinese: 法国抵抗运动的一位女英雄

sentences.english: The heroine is a senior TV executive.
sentences.chinese: 女主人公是一位电视台高级主管。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is admired for doing something extremely brave

name: actress
trans: n. 女演员

sentences.english: She's not only a great dramatic actress but she's also very funny.
sentences.chinese: 她不仅是一位伟大的女戏剧演员，而且也很幽默。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who performs in a play or film

name: chancellor
trans: n. 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官

sentences.english: Helmut Kohl, the former German Chancellor
sentences.chinese: 赫尔穆特•科尔，德国前总理

detailed_translations.chinese: 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官
detailed_translations.english: the Chancellor of the Exchequer

name: commander
trans: n. 指挥官；司令官

sentences.english: the American Commander, General Otis
sentences.chinese: 美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.english: our platoon commander
sentences.chinese: 我们的排长

detailed_translations.english: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

name: director
trans: n. 主任，主管；导演；人事助理

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: proponent
trans: n. 支持者；建议者；提出认证遗嘱者

sentences.english: Halsey was identified as a leading proponent of the values of progressive education.
sentences.chinese: 哈尔西被认为是进步教育价值观的首要支持者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持者；建议者；提出认证遗嘱者
detailed_translations.english: someone who supports something or persuades people to do something

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: council
trans: n. 委员会；会议；理事会；地方议会；顾问班子

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

name: delegate
trans: ˈdelɪɡeɪt]

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

detailed_translations.chinese: 委派…为代表； 授 ， 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc

name: specialist
trans: n. 专家；专门医师 adj. 专家的；专业的

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: consultant
trans: n. 顾问；咨询者；会诊医生

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 管理顾问

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

name: veterinary
trans: n. 兽医（等于veterinarian） adj. 兽医的

sentences.english: veterinary medicine
sentences.chinese: 兽医学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the medical care and treatment of sick animals

name: counsellor
trans: n. 顾问；参赞；辅导员（等于counselor）；律师；法律顾问

sentences.english: Are you seeing a counsellor?
sentences.chinese: 你是不是在看心理辅导员？

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to help and support people with problems

name: solicitor
trans: n. 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客

sentences.english: You need to see a solicitor.
sentences.chinese: 你需要找个律师。

sentences.english: a small firm of solicitors
sentences.chinese: 一家小型律师事务所

detailed_translations.chinese: 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law

name: attorney
trans: n. 律师；代理人；检查官

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: umpire
trans: n. 裁判员，仲裁人 vt. 仲裁，裁判 vi. 当裁判，任裁判

sentences.english: He umpired baseball games.
sentences.chinese: 他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

detailed_translations.english: to be the umpire in a game or competition
the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket

name: cashier
trans: n. 出纳员；司库；收银员 vt. 解雇；抛弃

sentences.english: The cashier absconded with the money.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员携款潜逃。

sentences.english: The cashier had run out with eighty thousand pounds in cash.
sentences.chinese: 这个出纳员带着八万镑现钞消失得无影无踪。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to receive or pay out money in a shop

name: fireman
trans: n. 消防队员；救火队员；锅炉工

sentences.english: Would you like to be a fireman?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意是一名消防队员吗？

sentences.english: Why would you like to be a fireman?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你愿意是一名消防队员？

sentences.english: When people asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up, I never said fireman or astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 每当有人来问我长大了要做什麽，我从来不会说消防员或是宇航员什麽的。

detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to stop fires burning

name: nurse
trans: vt. 看护，护理；照顾；培养；给…喂奶 vi. 照料，护理；喂奶；当保姆 n. 护士；奶妈，保姆

sentences.english: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士会来给你打针。

sentences.english: The school nurse sent Sara home.
sentences.chinese: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。

sentences.english: a male nurse
sentences.chinese: 男护士

sentences.english: a senior nurse
sentences.chinese: 高级护士

sentences.english: a student nurse (= someone who is learning to be a nurse )
sentences.chinese: 实习护士

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse (= a nurse for people who are mentally ill )
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在照顾一位年老的亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
to look after someone who is ill or injured

name: gardener
trans: n. 园丁；花匠；园艺家

sentences.english: She employed a gardener.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个园丁。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to work in gardens

name: barber
trans: n. 理发师 vt. 为…理发；修整 vi. 当理发师

sentences.english: My father marched me over to Otto, the local barber, to have my hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把我拽到当地理发师奥托跟前，让他把我的头发剪短。

detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to  shave  them

name: haircut
trans: n. 理发；发型

sentences.english: Do you like my new haircut?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢我的新发型吗？

detailed_translations.english: when you have a haircut, someone cuts your hair for you

name: fisherman
trans: n. 渔夫；渔人

sentences.english: The Algarve is a paradise for fishermen whether river anglers or deep-sea fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔加维对河边的垂钓者或深海的渔民都是一个天堂。

detailed_translations.english: someone who catches fish as a sport or as a job

name: butcher
trans: n. 屠夫 vt. 屠杀

sentences.english: Pigs were butchered, hams were hung to dry from the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 猪被宰杀了，火腿吊在屋顶下风干。

detailed_translations.english: to kill animals and prepare them to be used as meat
A butcher is a shopkeeper who cuts up and sells meat. Some butchers also kill animals for meat and make foods such as sausages and meat pies.

name: groom
trans: vi. 打扮 vt. 整饰；推荐；喂马；刷洗（马等） n. 新郎；马夫；男仆

sentences.english: The horses were exercised and groomed with special care.
sentences.chinese: 这些马受到特殊的训练和照料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 整饰；推荐；喂马；刷洗（马等）
detailed_translations.english: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse
a  bridegroom

name: hostage
trans: n. 人质；抵押品

sentences.english: The group are holding two tourists hostage (= keeping them as hostages ) .
sentences.chinese: 这伙人挟持了两名游客作为人质。

sentences.english: a family taken hostage at gunpoint
sentences.chinese: 在枪口下被劫为人质的一家人

detailed_translations.english: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands

name: toil
trans: n. 辛苦；苦工；网；圈套 vt. 费力地做；使…过度劳累 vi. 辛苦工作；艰难地行进

sentences.english: a life of toil
sentences.chinese: 辛劳的一生

sentences.english: People who toiled in dim, dank factories were too exhausted to enjoy their family life.
sentences.chinese: 在阴暗潮湿的工厂里苦作的人们精疲力竭了，无法享受家庭生活。

sentences.english: Workers toiled long hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人们长时间辛苦工作。

detailed_translations.english: hard unpleasant work done over a long period
When people toil, they work very hard doing unpleasant or tiring tasks

name: beggar
trans: n. 乞丐；穷人；家伙 vt. 使贫穷；使沦为乞丐

sentences.english: the beggars on the streets
sentences.chinese: 街头乞丐

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives by asking people for food and money
to make someone very poor

name: slave
trans: n. 奴隶；从动装置 vi. 苦干；拼命工作

sentences.english: a slave to fashion
sentences.chinese: 时尚的奴隶

detailed_translations.english: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money
to work very hard with little time to rest

name: coward
trans: n. 懦夫，懦弱的人 adj. 胆小的，懦怯的

sentences.english: Try it. Don’t be such a coward.
sentences.chinese: 试一下，别那么胆小。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not at all brave

name: act
trans: n. 行为，行动；法令，法案；（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕，段；装腔作势 vt. 扮演；装作，举动像 vi. 行动；扮演，充当；表现，举止；假装，演戏；起作用，见效

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

name: behave
trans: vi. 表现；（机器等）运转；举止端正；（事物）起某种作用 vt. 使守规矩；使表现得…

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: deed
trans: n. 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据 vt. 立契转让

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

sentences.english: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
sentences.chinese: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝，她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据
detailed_translations.english: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

name: accustom
trans: vt. 使习惯于

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

name: react
trans: vi. 反应；影响；反抗；起反作用 vt. 使发生相互作用；使起化学反应

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: respond
trans: n. 应答；唱和 vi. 回答；作出反应；承担责任 vt. 以…回答

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: reflect
trans: vt. 反映；反射，照出；表达；显示;反省 vi. 反射，映现；深思

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: bear
trans: n. 熊 vt. 结果实，开花（正式） vt. 忍受；承受；具有；支撑

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

name: adopt
trans: vi. 采取；过继 vt. 采取；接受；收养；正式通过

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: nourish
trans: vt. 滋养；怀有；使健壮

sentences.english: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。

sentences.english: a well nourished baby
sentences.chinese: 营养良好的婴儿

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

name: mow
trans: n. 草堆；皱眉；谷堆 vt. 割草；收割庄稼 vi. 割草；收割庄稼

sentences.english: It’s time to mow the lawn again.
sentences.chinese: 又该修剪草坪了。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a barn where hay, straw, etc, is stored
to cut grass using a machine

name: support
trans: n. 支持，维持；支援，供养；支持者，支撑物 vt. 支持，支撑，支援；扶持，帮助；赡养，供养

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: exhale
trans: vt. 呼气；发出；发散；使蒸发 vi. 呼气；发出；发散

sentences.english: Take a deep breath, then exhale slowly.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢呼出。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

name: intake
trans: n. 摄取量；通风口；引入口；引入的量

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

name: revive
trans: vt. 使复兴；使苏醒；回想起；重演，重播 vi. 复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: survive
trans: vi. 幸存；活下来 vt. 幸存；生还；幸免于；比...活得长

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: glare
trans: n. 刺眼；耀眼的光；受公众注目 vt. 瞪视；发眩光 vi. 瞪眼表示

sentences.english: The old woman glared at him.
sentences.chinese: 那个老妇人怒视着他。

sentences.english: The sun glared down on us.
sentences.chinese: 刺眼的阳光照在我们身上。

sentences.english: She gave him a hostile glare.
sentences.chinese: 她狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.english: a special screen to reduce glare
sentences.chinese: 一种可以减弱刺眼强光的特殊屏幕

detailed_translations.english: to look angrily at someone for a long time
a long angry look

name: glimpse
trans: n. 一瞥，一看 vt. 瞥见 vi. 瞥见

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: glance
trans: n. 一瞥；一滑；闪光 vt. 扫视；瞥见；擦过 vi. 扫视，匆匆一看；反光；瞥闪，瞥见

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look

name: peep
trans: n. 偷看；隐约看见，瞥见 vi. 窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫 vt. 使出现

sentences.english: "Fourteen minutes," Chris said, taking a peep at his watch.
sentences.chinese: “十四分钟，”克里斯瞥了一眼手表说道。

detailed_translations.english: a quick or secret look at something

detailed_translations.chinese: 窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫
detailed_translations.english: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially through a hole or opening

name: gaze
trans: n. 凝视；注视 vi. 凝视；注视

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: peer
trans: vt. 封为贵族；与…同等 vi. 凝视，盯着看；窥视 n. 贵族；同等的人；同龄人

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: stare
trans: n. 凝视；注视 vt. 凝视，盯着看 vi. 凝视，盯着看；显眼

sentences.english: She sat there staring into space (= looking for a long time at nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 她坐在那里，出神地凝视前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored

name: contemplate
trans: vt. 沉思；注视；思忖；预期 vi. 冥思苦想；深思熟虑

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: vow
trans: n. 发誓；誓言；许愿 vi. 发誓；郑重宣告 vt. 发誓；郑重宣告

sentences.english: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife’s killer.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆发誓要找到杀害他妻子的凶手。

sentences.english: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.
sentences.chinese: 很多模特儿发誓要重返大学，但几乎无人做到。

sentences.english: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我郑重起誓总有一天我要重回欧洲生活。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise
If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: pledge
trans: n. 保证，誓言；抵押；抵押品，典当物 vt. 保证，许诺；用……抵押；举杯祝……健康

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: whistle
trans: n. 口哨；汽笛；呼啸声 vt. 吹口哨；鸣汽笛

sentences.english: The lifeguard blew his whistle.
sentences.chinese: 救生员吹响哨子。

sentences.english: Adam whistled happily on his way to work.
sentences.chinese: 亚当在上班路上愉快地吹着口哨。

detailed_translations.english: a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it
to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips

name: reply
trans: n. 回答；[法] 答辩 vt. 回答；答复 vi. 回答；[法] 答辩；回击

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

name: notify
trans: vt. 通告，通知；公布

sentences.english: You will be notified of any changes in the system.
sentences.chinese: 系统中有任何变化都会通知你。

sentences.english: In August we were notified that our article had been rejected.
sentences.chinese: 8月份我们接到通知，说我们的文章不予采用。

detailed_translations.english: to formally or officially tell someone about something

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: explain
trans: v. 说明；解释

sentences.english: He carefully explained the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细解释了程序。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone about something in a way that is clear or easy to understand

name: quarrel
trans: n. 吵架；反目；怨言；争吵的原因；方头凿 vi. 吵架；争论；挑剔

sentences.english: I wish you two would stop quarreling.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

sentences.english: Jacob left after a quarrel with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布和妻子吵了一架后走了。

detailed_translations.english: to have an argument
an angry argument or disagreement

name: dispute
trans: n. 辩论；争吵 vt. 辩论；怀疑；阻止；抗拒 vi. 争论

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: argument
trans: n. 论证；论据；争吵；内容提要

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: mention
trans: vt. 提到，谈到；提及，论及；说起 n. 提及，说起

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: hurry
trans: n. 匆忙，急忙 v. 仓促（做某事）；催促；（朝某方向）迅速移动；迅速处理

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

name: hasten
trans: vt. 加速；使赶紧；催促 vi. 赶快；急忙

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: urge
trans: n. 强烈的欲望，迫切要求；推动力 vi. 强烈要求 vt. 力劝，催促；驱策，推进

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: scold
trans: n. 责骂；爱责骂的人 vt. 骂；责骂 vi. 责骂；叱责

sentences.english: Do not scold the puppy, but simply and firmly say ‘no’.
sentences.chinese: 不要责骂小狗，但要干脆利落地说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done

name: curse
trans: n. 诅咒；咒骂 vt. 诅咒；咒骂 vi. 诅咒；咒骂

sentences.english: He believed that someone had put a curse on the house.
sentences.chinese: 他相信有人对这房子下了诅咒。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sentence used to ask God or a magical power to do something bad to someone or something

name: swear
trans: n. 宣誓；诅咒 vt. 发誓；咒骂 vi. 发誓，宣誓；诅咒

sentences.english: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 记住你已经宣过誓了，所以必须讲真话。

sentences.english: Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须宣誓效忠美国宪法。

detailed_translations.english: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law
to use rude and offensive language

name: provoke
trans: vt. 驱使；激怒；煽动；惹起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: preach
trans: n. 说教 vt. 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输 vi. 说教；讲道；鼓吹；宣扬

sentences.english: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输
detailed_translations.english: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

name: boast
trans: n. 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物 vi. 自吹自擂 vt. 夸口说，自吹自擂说；以有…而自豪

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: tease
trans: vt. 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛 n. 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩 vi. 取笑

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: mock
trans: n. 英国模拟考试（mocks） vt. 愚弄，嘲弄 adj. 仿制的，模拟的，虚假的，不诚实的 vt. 不尊重，蔑视

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: touch
trans: n. 接触；触觉；格调；少许 vt. 接触；触动；使轻度受害 vi. 触摸；涉及；接近；提到

sentences.english: She reached out to touch his arm.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。

sentences.english: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
sentences.chinese: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

sentences.english: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.english: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

detailed_translations.english: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone

name: hug
trans: n. 拥抱；紧抱；固执 vi. 拥抱；紧抱在一起；挤在一起 vt. 拥抱；紧抱；抱有，坚持

sentences.english: We stood there crying and hugging each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在那里哭着互相拥抱。

sentences.english: She went to her daughter and hugged her tightly .
sentences.chinese: 她走到女儿身边，紧紧地拥抱她。

detailed_translations.english: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship
the action of putting your arms around someone and holding them tightly to show love or friendship

name: tap
trans: n. 水龙头；轻打 vt. 轻敲；轻打；装上嘴子 vi. 轻拍；轻击；轻叩 vt. 采用，利用

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: clap
trans: n. 鼓掌；拍手声 vt. 拍手，鼓掌；轻轻拍打某人 vi. 鼓掌，拍手；啪地关上

sentences.english: One man began to clap, and others joined in.
sentences.chinese: 一个人鼓起了掌，其他人也跟着鼓掌。

sentences.english: The couple were cheered and clapped on their arrival.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妇抵达时人群为他们欢呼鼓掌。

sentences.english: The audience clapped politely but without much enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 观众礼貌地鼓了掌，但并不热烈。

detailed_translations.english: to hit your hands against each other many times to make a sound that shows your approval, agreement, or enjoyment
the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something

name: applaud
trans: vt. 赞同；称赞；向…喝彩 vi. 喝彩；鼓掌欢迎

sentences.english: The audience applauded loudly.
sentences.chinese: 观众掌声雷动。

sentences.english: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
sentences.chinese: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

detailed_translations.english: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc
to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc

name: kneel
trans: vi. 跪下，跪

sentences.english: Tom knelt down and patted the dog.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆跪下来轻轻拍了拍那只狗。

detailed_translations.english: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

name: catch
trans: n. 捕捉；捕获物；窗钩 vt. 赶上；抓住；感染；了解 vi. 赶上；抓住

sentences.english: Did you catch any fish?
sentences.chinese: 你捕到鱼了吗？

sentences.english: Early settlers caught rabbits and squirrels and even rats in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 早期移民为了生存而捕食野兔、松鼠，甚至老鼠。

sentences.english: I caught the 7.15 train to London.
sentences.chinese: 我赶上了7点15分的火车去伦敦。

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我没听清楚你的话。

detailed_translations.english: to trap an animal or fish by using a trap, net, or hook, or by hunting it

name: snatch
trans: n. 抢夺；抓举；小量 vt. 夺得；抽空做；及时救助 vi. 抢走；很快接受

sentences.english: I snatched a glance at the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。

detailed_translations.english: If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things.

detailed_translations.chinese: 夺，夺走，抢走；一下子拉，一把抓住；抓住机会做，抽空做
detailed_translations.english: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement
a short part of a conversation, song etc that you hear

name: grab
trans: n. 攫取；霸占；夺取之物 vt. 攫取；霸占；将…深深吸引 vi. 攫取；夺取

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: grasp
trans: n. 抓住；理解；控制 vi. 抓 vt. 抓住；领会

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: overtake
trans: vt. 赶上；压倒；突然来袭 vi. 超车

sentences.english: He pulled out to overtake the van.
sentences.chinese: 他把车驶出所在车道想超过那辆小货车。

sentences.english: Never try to overtake on a bend.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要在转弯处超车。

detailed_translations.english: to go past a moving vehicle or person because you are going faster than them and want to get in front of them

name: follow
trans: n. 跟随；追随 vi. 跟随；接着 vt. 跟随；遵循；追求；密切注意，注视；注意；倾听

sentences.english: Are those men following us?
sentences.chinese: 那些人在跟着我们吗？

sentences.english: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里，后来就跟丢了。

sentences.english: The conclusion that follows from these findings is that inner city schools need more investment, not less.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些调研得出的结论是，旧城区学校的资金投入需要增加，而不是减少。

detailed_translations.english: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

name: grip
trans: n. 紧握；柄；支配；握拍方式；拍柄绷带 vt. 紧握；夹紧 vi. 抓住

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: mess
trans: n. 混乱；食堂，伙食团；困境；脏乱的东西 vt. 弄乱，弄脏；毁坏；使就餐 vi. 把事情弄糟；制造脏乱；玩弄

sentences.english: What a mess!
sentences.chinese: 太乱了！

sentences.english: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
sentences.chinese: 对不起——这里有些乱。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时，屋子里一片狼藉。

sentences.english: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟，你可以去做甜饼。

sentences.english: She hates mess.
sentences.chinese: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱状态，混乱的局面；困境
detailed_translations.english: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
detailed_translations.english: to make something look untidy or dirty

name: twist
trans: n. 扭曲；拧；扭伤 vt. 捻；拧；扭伤；编织；使苦恼 vi. 扭动；弯曲

sentences.english: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手开始拧她拎着的那个包的拎柄。

sentences.english: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了，嘴巴慢慢一歪，带着嘲笑的意味。

detailed_translations.english: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape
a twisting action or movement

name: scatter
trans: n. 分散；散播，撒播 vt. 使散射；使散开，使分散；使散播，使撒播 vi. 分散，散开；散射

sentences.english: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people or animals scatter, or if something scatters them, they move quickly in different directions

name: fold
trans: n. 折痕；信徒；羊栏 vt. 折叠；合拢；抱住；笼罩 vi. 折叠起来；彻底失败

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
sentences.chinese: 沿虚线将纸折起来。

sentences.english: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
sentences.chinese: 对折的话就能放下了。

detailed_translations.english: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

name: fasten
trans: vt. 使固定；集中于；扎牢；强加于 vi. 扣紧；抓住；集中注意力

sentences.english: ‘I’m going now,’ she said, fastening her coat.
sentences.chinese: “现在我要走了。”她一边说，一边扣上大衣。

sentences.english: Fasten your seat belt.
sentences.chinese: 请系好安全带。

detailed_translations.english: to join together the two sides of a coat, shirt, bag etc so that it is closed
to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed

name: loosen
trans: vt. 放松；松开 vi. 放松；松开

sentences.english: You’ll need a spanner to loosen that bolt.
sentences.chinese: 你需要扳手来拧开那个螺栓。

sentences.english: The screws have loosened.
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

sentences.english: Harry loosened his tie.
sentences.chinese: 哈里松开了领带。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

name: smash
trans: n. 破碎；扣球；冲突；大败 vt. 粉碎；使破产；溃裂 adj. 了不起的；非常轰动的；出色的 vi. 粉碎；打碎

sentences.english: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。

sentences.english: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
sentences.chinese: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。

sentences.english: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
sentences.chinese: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉碎，打烂；狠打，猛击；破灭，失败；猛撞，猛冲
detailed_translations.english: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
detailed_translations.english: the loud sound of something breaking

name: scratch
trans: n. 擦伤；抓痕；刮擦声；乱写 adj. 打草稿用的；凑合的；碰巧的 vt. 抓；刮；挖出；乱涂 vi. 抓；搔；发刮擦声；勉强糊口；退出比赛

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

name: wipe
trans: n. 擦拭；用力打 vi. 擦；打 vt. 擦；消除；涂上

sentences.english: I'll just wipe the table.
sentences.chinese: 我只擦擦桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping
a wiping movement with a cloth

name: scrape
trans: n. 刮掉；擦痕；困境；刮擦声 vt. 刮；擦伤；挖成 vi. 刮掉；刮出刺耳声

sentences.english: Scrape the carrots and slice them thinly.
sentences.chinese: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

sentences.english: The two of them scraped their dishes clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

sentences.english: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

sentences.english: the scrape of iron on stone
sentences.chinese: 铁摩擦石头发出的嚓嚓声

sentences.english: She emerged from the overturned car with only a few scrapes and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc
the action of one thing rubbing roughly against another

name: polish
trans: n. 磨光，擦亮；上光剂，擦亮剂；优雅，精良 vi. 擦亮，变光滑 vt. 磨光，使发亮 adj. 波兰的

sentences.english: Your essay is good, you just need to polish it a bit.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章不错，只要稍加润色就可以了。

detailed_translations.english: to improve a piece of writing, a speech etc by making slight changes to it before it is completely finished
a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny

name: peel
trans: n. 皮 v. 剥，剥落；削

sentences.english: Peel and dice the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯去皮并切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat

name: split
trans: n. 劈开；裂缝 adj. 劈开的 vt. 分离；使分离；劈开；离开；分解 vi. 离开；被劈开；断绝关系

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

name: sway
trans: n. 影响；摇摆；统治 vt. 影响；统治；使摇动 vi. 影响；摇摆

sentences.english: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

name: shake
trans: n. 摇动；哆嗦 vt. 动摇；摇动；震动；握手 vi. 动摇；摇动；发抖

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

name: vibrate
trans: vt. 使振动；使颤动 vi. 振动；颤动；摇摆；踌躇

sentences.english: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。

sentences.english: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
sentences.chinese: 气流通过我们的声带，使之产生振动。

detailed_translations.english: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

name: whirl
trans: n. 旋转，回旋；昏乱；一连串的事；短暂的旅行 vt. 使旋转；卷走，飞快地带走 vi. 旋转，回旋；急走；头晕眼花

sentences.english: the social whirl of New York publishing
sentences.chinese: 纽约出版界纷繁的社交活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转，回旋；昏乱；一连串的事；短暂的旅行
detailed_translations.english: a spinning movement or the shape of something that is spinning

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转，回旋；急走；头晕眼花
detailed_translations.english: to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this

name: rotate
trans: vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流 adj. [植] 辐状的 vi. 旋转；循环

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。

sentences.english: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

detailed_translations.english: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

name: reel
trans: n. 蹒跚；眩晕；旋转 vt. 卷；使旋转 vi. 卷；眩晕；蹒跚地走；退缩

sentences.english: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
sentences.chinese: 安迪踉跄着离开吧台，把凳子都撞倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 摇摇晃晃地移动，蹒跚；眩晕，发昏
detailed_translations.english: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
to wind (cotton, thread, etc) onto a reel

name: shuffle
trans: n. 洗牌，洗纸牌；混乱，蒙混；拖着脚走 v. 洗牌；推诿，推卸；拖曳，慢吞吞地走；搅乱

sentences.english: Is it my turn to shuffle?
sentences.chinese: 轮到我洗牌了吗？

sentences.english: Just shuffle the cards .
sentences.chinese: 请洗牌吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌；推诿，推卸；拖曳，慢吞吞地走；搅乱
detailed_translations.english: to mix  playing card s  into a different order before playing a game with them

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗牌，洗纸牌；混乱，蒙混；拖着脚走
detailed_translations.english: a slow walk in which you do not lift your feet off the ground

name: collide
trans: vi. 碰撞；抵触，冲突 vt. 使碰撞；使相撞

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

name: contact
trans: n. 接触，联系 vt. 使接触，联系 vi. 使接触，联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: connect
trans: vt. 连接；联合；关连 vi. 连接，连结；联合

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: combine
trans: n. 联合收割机；联合企业 vt. 使化合；使联合，使结合 vi. 联合，结合；化合

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: bond
trans: n. 债券；结合；约定；粘合剂；纽带 vt. 使结合；以…作保 vi. 结合，团结在一起

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

name: integrate
trans: n. 一体化；集成体 adj. 整合的；完全的 vi. 求积分；取消隔离；成为一体 vt. 使…完整；使…成整体；求…的积分；表示…的总和

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: wrap
trans: n. 外套；围巾 vt. 包；缠绕；隐藏；掩护 vi. 包起来；缠绕；穿外衣

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: penetrate
trans: vi. 渗透；刺入；看透 vt. 渗透；穿透；洞察

sentences.english: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
sentences.chinese: 穿过厚装甲的子弹

sentences.english: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

name: pierce
trans: vt. 刺穿；洞察；响彻；深深地打动 vi. 进入；透入

sentences.english: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
sentences.chinese: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。

sentences.english: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
sentences.chinese: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部，接受了紧急手术。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

name: insert
trans: n. 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片 vt. 插入；嵌入

sentences.english: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣袋里掏出一把小钥匙，然后缓缓地将其插入锁孔里。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside or into something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
detailed_translations.english: something that is designed to be put inside something else

name: tilt
trans: n. 倾斜 vt. 使倾斜；使翘起 vi. 倾斜；翘起；以言词或文字抨击

sentences.english: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。

sentences.english: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
sentences.chinese: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

detailed_translations.english: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other

name: tow
trans: n. 拖；麻的粗纤维；拖曳所用之绳 vt. 拖；牵引；曳 vi. 被拖带；拖行

sentences.english: The ship had to be towed into the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 那艘轮船不得不被拖进港口。

sentences.english: Can you give us a tow to the garage?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我们把车拖到修车厂吗？

detailed_translations.english: to pull a vehicle or ship along behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain
an act of pulling a vehicle behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain

name: trail
trans: n. 小径；痕迹；尾部；踪迹；一串，一系列 vt. 追踪；拖；蔓延；落后于 vi. 飘出；蔓生；垂下；拖曳

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: arrange
trans: vi. 安排；排列；协商 vt. 安排；排列；整理

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵；操作；巧妙地处理；篡改

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: steer
trans: vt. 控制，引导；驾驶 vi. 驾驶，掌舵；行驶 n. 阉牛

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

name: baptise
trans: vt. 洗涤；给…施洗礼 vi. 施洗礼

name: bet
trans: n. 打赌，赌注；被打赌的事物 vt. 打赌；敢断定，确信 vi. 打赌

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

detailed_translations.english: to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event
an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金 vt. 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌 vi. 打赌

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: gamble
trans: n. 赌博；冒险；打赌 vi. 赌博；孤注一掷；投机；打赌 vt. 赌博；孤注一掷；冒险假设

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

sentences.english: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了他的内阁。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.chinese: 赌博； 投机， 冒险
detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

name: promise
trans: n. 许诺，允诺；希望 vt. 允诺，许诺；给人以…的指望或希望 vi. 许诺；有指望，有前途

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: attract
trans: vt. 吸引；引起 vi. 吸引；有吸引力

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: obsess
trans: vt. 迷住，缠住；使…着迷；使…困扰

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

name: mesmerise
trans: vt. 对…施催眠术; 迷住，迷惑

detailed_translations.chinese: 施以催眠术；使…入迷；使…目瞪口呆

name: nightmare
trans: n. 恶梦；梦魇般的经历 adj. 可怕的；噩梦似的

sentences.english: a recurring nightmare
sentences.chinese: 一再出现的噩梦

detailed_translations.english: a very frightening dream

name: amaze
trans: vt. 使吃惊

sentences.english: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: marvel
trans: n. 奇迹 vt. 对…感到惊异 vi. 感到惊讶

sentences.english: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
sentences.chinese: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

sentences.english: The whale, like the dolphin, has become a symbol of the marvels of creation.
sentences.chinese: 鲸，和海豚一样，已经成为造物杰作的象征。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

name: astonish
trans: vt. 使惊讶

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: involve
trans: vt. 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: annoy
trans: n. 烦恼（等于annoyance） vt. 骚扰；惹恼；打搅 vi. 惹恼；令人讨厌；打搅

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: upset
trans: n. 混乱；翻倒；颠覆 adj. 心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的 vt. 使心烦；颠覆；扰乱 vi. 翻倒

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: bewilder
trans: vt. 使迷惑，使不知所措

sentences.english: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
sentences.chinese: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone

name: irony
trans: n. 讽刺；反语；具有讽刺意味的事 adj. 铁的；似铁的

sentences.english: Life is full of little ironies.
sentences.chinese: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

name: indignity
trans: n. 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动

sentences.english: The prisoners were subjected to all sorts of indignities.
sentences.chinese: 犯人遭受各种侮辱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动
detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes you feel very ashamed and not respected

name: contempt
trans: n. 轻视，蔑视；耻辱

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: neglect
trans: vt. 疏忽，忽视；忽略 n. 疏忽，忽视；怠慢

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: disregard
trans: n. 忽视；不尊重 vt. 忽视；不理；漠视；不顾

sentences.english: He ordered the jury to disregard the witness’s last statement.
sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.english: his disregard for her feelings
sentences.chinese: 他对她情感的忽略

detailed_translations.english: to ignore something or treat it as unimportant
when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知，愚昧；不知，不懂

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见；偏爱；斜纹；乖离率 adj. 偏斜的 vt. 使存偏见 adv. 偏斜地

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: deviate
trans: vi. 脱离；越轨 vt. 使偏离

sentences.english: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.
sentences.chinese: 你一偏离剧本，他们就会叫停。

detailed_translations.english: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

name: expel
trans: vt. 驱逐；开除

sentences.english: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
sentences.chinese: 两名女生因吸毒而被学校开除。

sentences.english: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
sentences.chinese: 外国牧师被驱逐出境。

sentences.english: As the lungs exhale this waste, gas is expelled into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 当肺呼出这股废气，气体就被排到空气中。

detailed_translations.english: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

name: flee
trans: vt. 逃跑，逃走；逃避 vi. 逃走；消失，消散

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: bully
trans: n. 欺凌弱小者；土霸 vt. 欺负；威吓 adj. 第一流的；特好的 vi. 欺侮人 adv. 很；十分 int. 好；妙

sentences.english: Bullies are often cowards.
sentences.chinese: 恃强凌弱者往往是懦夫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses their strength or power to frighten or hurt someone who is weaker
to threaten to hurt someone or frighten them, especially someone smaller or weaker

name: panic
trans: n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌 adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的 vt. 使恐慌 vi. 十分惊慌

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: terrify
trans: vt. 恐吓；使恐怖；使害怕

sentences.english: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely afraid

name: revenge
trans: n. 报复；复仇 vt. 报复；替…报仇；洗雪 vi. 报仇；雪耻

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

name: kidnap
trans: vt. 绑架；诱拐；拐骗

sentences.english: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架，警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

name: hijack
trans: n. 劫持；威逼；敲诈 vt. 抢劫；揩油 vi. 拦路抢劫

sentences.english: The airliner was hijacked by a group of terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 该航班被一帮恐怖分子劫持。

detailed_translations.english: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship
when a plane, vehicle etc is hijacked

name: smuggle
trans: vt. 走私；偷运 vi. 走私，私运；偷带

sentences.english: My message is "If you try to smuggle drugs you are stupid."
sentences.chinese: 我的讯息是，“你若企图走私毒品，那是犯傻。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 走私， 偷带， 偷运
detailed_translations.english: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

detailed_translations.chinese: 走私，非法私运；偷运，偷带
detailed_translations.english: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

name: convict
trans: n. 罪犯 vt. 证明…有罪；宣告…有罪

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: strangle
trans: vt. 把…勒死；使…窒息 vi. 窒息而死；被勒死

sentences.english: He tried to strangle a border policeman and steal his gun.
sentences.chinese: 他试图扼死一位边防警察并偷走他的枪。

detailed_translations.english: To strangle someone means to kill them by squeezing their throat tightly so that they cannot breathe

name: massacre
trans: vt. 残杀；彻底击败 n. 大屠杀；惨败

sentences.english: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.chinese: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.english: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

name: decimation
trans: n. 大批杀害；每十人杀一人；大量毁灭

name: intervene
trans: vi. 干涉；调停；插入

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。
