sentences.english: When they are found, doctors pass a tube with a balloon into the narrowed area and inflate the balloon to compress plaque deposits against the side of the artery.
sentences.chinese: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

sentences.english: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.chinese: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

name: nerve
trans: n. 神经；勇气；[植] 叶脉 vt. 鼓起勇气

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: hormone
trans: n. [生理] 激素，荷尔蒙

sentences.english: ...the male sex hormone testosterone.
sentences.chinese: …男性性激素睾酮。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance produced by your body that influences its growth, development, and condition

name: immune
trans: n. 免疫者；免除者 adj. 免疫的；免于……的，免除的

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: stimulus
trans: n. 刺激；激励；刺激物

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: biorhythm
trans: n. 生物周期；[生理] 生物节律

name: lifestyle
trans: n. 生活方式 保健的

sentences.english: Regular exercise is part of a healthy lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼身体是健康生活方式的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: the way a person or group of people live, including the place they live in, the things they own, the kind of job they do, and the activities they enjoy

name: habit
trans: n. 习惯，习性；嗜好 vt. 使穿衣

sentences.english: Regular exercise is a good habit.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.english: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

sentences.english: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一个习惯，一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。

sentences.english: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
sentences.chinese: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝，也是出于习惯。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉，功能；观念；道理；理智 vt. 感觉到；检测

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: sight
trans: n. 视力；景象；眼界；见解 adj. 见票即付的；即席的 vt. 看见；瞄准 vi. 瞄准；观看

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

name: eyesight
trans: n. 视力；目力

sentences.english: He had a problem with his eyesight.
sentences.chinese: 他的视力有问题。

detailed_translations.english: your ability to see

name: view
trans: n. 观察；视野；意见；风景 vt. 观察；考虑；查看

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: visual
trans: adj. 视觉的，视力的；栩栩如生的

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: visible
trans: n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目 adj. 明显的；看得见的；现有的；可得到的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: vague
trans: adj. 模糊的；含糊的；不明确的；暧昧的

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

name: blind
trans: n. 掩饰，借口；百叶窗 adj. 盲目的；瞎的 vt. 使失明；使失去理智 adv. 盲目地；看不见地

sentences.english: Doctors think he will go blind.
sentences.chinese: 医生们认为他会失明。

sentences.english: blind faith/obedience
sentences.chinese: 盲目的信念；盲从

detailed_translations.english: not able to see

name: dumb
trans: adj. 哑的，无说话能力的；不说话的，无声音的

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: aural
trans: adj. 听觉的；耳的；气味的；先兆的

sentences.english: an aural stimulus
sentences.chinese: 听觉刺激

detailed_translations.chinese: 听觉的；耳的；气味的；先兆的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds

name: dental
trans: n. 齿音 adj. 牙科的；牙齿的，牙的

sentences.english: Good oral hygiene and regular dental care are important, whatever your age.
sentences.chinese: 无论年龄大小，良好的口腔卫生和定期的牙齿保健都非常重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to your teeth

name: awake
trans: adj. 醒着的 vt. 唤醒；使觉醒；激起，唤起 vi. 觉醒，意识到；醒来；被唤起

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: yawn
trans: n. 哈欠；裂口 vt. 张开；打著哈欠说 vi. 打哈欠；裂开

sentences.english: Alan stretched and yawned.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦伸伸懒腰，打了个呵欠。

sentences.english: Kay shook her head and stifled a yawn (= tried to stop yawning ).
sentences.chinese: 凯摇摇头，忍住呵欠。

detailed_translations.english: to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored
an act of yawning

name: nap
trans: n. 小睡，打盹儿；细毛；孤注一掷 vt. 使拉毛 vi. 小睡；疏忽

sentences.english: an afternoon nap
sentences.chinese: 午睡

detailed_translations.chinese: 小睡，打盹儿；细毛；孤注一掷
detailed_translations.english: a short sleep, especially during the day

name: doze
trans: n. 瞌睡 vi. 打瞌睡；假寐 vt. 打瞌睡度过

sentences.english: Grandad was dozing in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷在椅子上打瞌睡。

detailed_translations.english: to sleep lightly for a short time

name: quiet
trans: n. 安静；和平 adj. 安静的；安定的；不动的；温顺的 vt. 使平息；安慰 vi. 平静下来

sentences.english: We’ll have to be quiet so as not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 我们得安静点，免得吵醒宝宝。

sentences.english: It’s a nice car. The engine’s really quiet.
sentences.chinese: 这车真好，发动机声音很小。

sentences.english: I’ll be as quiet as a mouse (= very quiet ).
sentences.chinese: 我会像老鼠一样悄无声息的。

sentences.english: It was a Sunday, about three o’clock, and the streets were quiet.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个星期天，三点钟左右，街上一片寂静。

detailed_translations.english: not making much noise, or making no noise at all

name: asleep
trans: adj. 睡着的；麻木的；长眠的 adv. 熟睡地；进入睡眠状态

sentences.english: Quiet! The baby’s asleep.
sentences.chinese: 安静！ 宝宝在睡觉。

detailed_translations.english: sleeping

name: cripple
trans: n. 跛子；残废 vt. 削弱；使跛；使残废 adj. 跛的；残废的

sentences.english: She has gone from being a healthy, fit, and sporty young woman to being a cripple.
sentences.chinese: 她从一个健康、强壮、爱好体育运动的年轻姑娘变成了一个残疾人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is unable to walk properly because their legs are damaged or injured - now considered offensive
to hurt someone badly so that they cannot walk properly

name: lame
trans: adj. 跛足的；僵痛的；不完全的；无说服力的；差劲的，蹩脚的 vi. 变跛 vt. 使跛；使成残废

sentences.english: a lame attempt to deflect criticism
sentences.chinese: 转移批评的一个无力的尝试

detailed_translations.chinese: 跛足的；僵痛的；不完全的；无说服力的；差劲的，蹩脚的
detailed_translations.english: a lame excuse or explanation is weak and difficult to believe
to make a person or animal unable to walk properly

name: dwarf
trans: n. 侏儒，矮子 adj. 矮小的 vi. 变矮小 vt. 使矮小

sentences.english: The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding skyscrapers.
sentences.chinese: 周围的摩天大楼使得大教堂显得很矮小。

detailed_translations.english: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small
a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.
a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size

name: pregnancy
trans: n. 怀孕；丰富，多产；意义深长

sentences.english: This drug should not be taken during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 这种药妊娠期间不得服用。

sentences.english: her third pregnancy
sentences.chinese: 她的第三次怀孕

sentences.english: teenage pregnancies
sentences.chinese: 少女怀孕

sentences.english: a pregnancy test
sentences.chinese: 妊娠试验，验孕

detailed_translations.english: when a woman is pregnant (= has a baby growing inside her body )

name: born
trans: v. 出世（bear的过去分词） adj. 天生的

sentences.english: a born athlete/writer/leader
sentences.chinese: 天生的运动员 / 作家 / 领袖

detailed_translations.english: having a natural ability or skill for a particular activity or job

name: condom
trans: n. 避孕套；阴茎套

sentences.english: Once again, you need to be careful not to tear or puncture the condom in this process.
sentences.chinese: 再说一遍，你要小心，在这个过程中不要撕裂或戳穿避孕套。

sentences.english: Make sure you wash your hands after you handled a used condom and before you have any further contact with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 在处理了使用过的避孕套后，以及在和你的性伴侣有进一步的性接触之前，你一定要洗手。

detailed_translations.english: a thin rubber bag that a man wears over his  penis (= sex organ )  during sex, to prevent a woman having a baby or to protect against disease

name: clone
trans: n. 克隆；无性系；无性繁殖；靠营养生殖而由母体分离繁殖的植物 vt. 无性繁殖，复制

sentences.english: The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 对绝种的生命形式进行克隆的想法仍然属于科学幻想。

detailed_translations.english: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

detailed_translations.chinese: 无性繁殖系，克隆；复制品，翻版
detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same

name: symptom
trans: n. [临床] 症状；征兆

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: disease
trans: n. 病，[医] 疾病；弊病 vt. 传染；使…有病

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: illness
trans: n. 病；疾病

sentences.english: She had all the normal childhood illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的常见病她小时候都得过。

sentences.english: Her mother was recovering from a serious illness.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲重病后正在逐渐康复。

sentences.english: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
sentences.chinese: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。

sentences.english: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
sentences.chinese: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

detailed_translations.english: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill

name: moan
trans: vi. 抱怨，悲叹；呻吟 n. 呻吟声；悲叹 vt. 抱怨；呻吟着说

sentences.english: ‘I feel seasick already,’ she moaned.
sentences.chinese: “我已经开始晕船了。”她抱怨道。

sentences.english: He moaned and groaned all the way there.
sentences.chinese: 他去的一路上抱怨个没完。

sentences.english: Tony moaned in his sleep and then turned over on his side.
sentences.chinese: 托尼在睡梦中呻吟了一下，然后转身侧躺。

detailed_translations.english: to complain in an annoying way, especially in an unhappy voice and without good reason

detailed_translations.chinese: 呻吟声， 呜咽声 A
detailed_translations.english: a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure
If you moan, you make a low sound, usually because you are unhappy or in pain

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: detriment
trans: n. 损害；伤害；损害物

sentences.english: Nor is the detriment only to the US industry .
sentences.chinese: 受到损害的不仅仅是美国轮胎行业。

sentences.english: Work hard to succeed but not to the detriment of others.
sentences.chinese: 在不损害他人利益的前提下为成功艰苦奋斗。

sentences.english: Governments which ignore them, however, do so to their own detriment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，政府忽略这些因素就是损害自己的利益。

detailed_translations.english: harm or damage

name: broken
trans: v. 折断；打碎；损坏（break的过去分词） adj. 破碎的；坏掉的

sentences.english: Mind the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 当心碎玻璃。

sentences.english: a badly broken leg
sentences.chinese: 严重骨折的腿

sentences.english: Gibbs had an X-ray, which revealed no broken bones.
sentences.chinese: 吉布斯拍了X光片，显示没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: in small pieces because it has been hit, dropped etc

name: disable
trans: vt. 使失去能力；使残废；使无资格

sentences.english: She did all this tendon damage and it really disabled her.
sentences.chinese: 她肌腱受了这么多损伤，这真地使她致残了。

detailed_translations.english: If an injury or illness disables someone, it affects them so badly that it restricts the way that they can live their life

name: invalid
trans: n. 病人；残疾者 adj. 无效的；有病的；残疾的 vt. 使伤残；使退役 vi. 变得病弱；因病而奉命退役

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: patient
trans: n. 病人；患者 adj. 有耐心的，能容忍的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: dysfunction
trans: n. 功能紊乱；机能障碍；官能不良 vi. 功能失调；出现机能障碍；垮掉

sentences.english: ...his severe emotional dysfunction was very clearly apparent.
sentences.chinese: ...他情绪的严重异常是显而易见的。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a dysfunction in something such as a relationship or someone's behaviour, you mean that it is different from what is considered to be normal.

name: diabetes
trans: n. 糖尿病；多尿症

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: obesity
trans: n. 肥大，肥胖

sentences.english: So, what of the future of obesity in America?
sentences.chinese: 那么，未来美国的肥胖状况会怎么发展呢？

sentences.english: Dr.Watson is great on exercise as a cure for obesity.
sentences.chinese: 沃森医生把运动看做是治疗肥胖症的良方。

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

name: overweight
trans: adj. 超重的；过重的 vt. 使负担过重 n. 超重

sentences.english: I wonder if this letter is overweight.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道这封信是否超重。

sentences.english: If your luggage is overweight, you'll have to pay extra.
sentences.chinese: 假如你的行李过重了， 你得付额外的运费。

sentences.english: Why are so many of us overweight?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们中的许多人会超重？

name: hypertension
trans: n. 高血压；过度紧张

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which your  blood pressure  is too high

name: paralyse
trans: vt. 使……无力；使……麻痹；使……瘫痪

sentences.english: Her legs were partly paralysed in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 在撞车事故中她的双腿部分瘫痪。

detailed_translations.english: if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it

name: dizzy
trans: adj. 晕眩的；使人头晕的；昏乱的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的 vt. 使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

sentences.english: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
sentences.chinese: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。

sentences.english: She started to suffer from dizzy spells (= a short period when you feel dizzy ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 晕眩的；使人头晕的；昏乱的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill

detailed_translations.chinese: 使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

name: insane
trans: adj. 疯狂的；精神病的；极愚蠢的

sentences.english: That’s an insane risk.
sentences.chinese: 那是疯狂的冒险之举。

sentences.english: The whole idea sounds absolutely insane to me.
sentences.chinese: 整个主意在我看来荒谬至极。

sentences.english: Why did you do that? Have you gone insane?
sentences.chinese: 为什么这么做？你疯了吗？

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous

name: insomnia
trans: n. 失眠症，失眠

sentences.english: If you have insomnia, try my simple cure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.english: In my insomnia, you have to hold me to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.english: I know someone with insomnia who only gets two hours of sleep each night.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一个患有失眠症的人，他每天晚上只能睡上两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep

name: allergy
trans: n. 过敏症；反感；厌恶

sentences.english: a food allergy
sentences.chinese: 食物过敏

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which you become ill or in which your skin becomes red and painful because you have eaten or touched a particular substance

name: heart attack
trans: n. 心脏病发作

name: cancer
trans: [天] 巨蟹座

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

name: arthritis
trans: n. [外科] 关节炎

sentences.english: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 我的手腕有轻微关节炎。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

name: pimple
trans: n. 疙瘩；[医] 丘疹；面疱

sentences.english: Belushi imitates a giant pimple by squeezing his cheeks and spewing chewed food out of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我们在等候某个毕业生领文凭的同时，可以欣赏像《动物屋》这样与学校有关的经典电影的片断：约翰-贝鲁西模仿一个脸上长满丘疹的巨人，双手挤着脸，从嘴里喷出嚼过的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a small raised red spot on your skin, especially on your face

name: stroke
trans: n. （游泳或划船的）划；中风；（打、击等的）一下；冲程；（成功的）举动；尝试；轻抚 vt. （用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘 vi. 击球；作尾桨手，指挥划桨；（打字时）击打键盘

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: plague
trans: n. 瘟疫；灾祸；麻烦；讨厌的人 vt. 折磨；使苦恼；使得灾祸

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

name: flu
trans: n. 流感

sentences.english: Steven’s still in bed with flu .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文患了流感，仍卧病在床。

sentences.english: She’s got the flu .
sentences.chinese: 她得了流感。

sentences.english: I couldn’t go because I had flu .
sentences.chinese: 我得了流感，去不了。

sentences.english: Doctors now fear a flu epidemic .
sentences.chinese: 医生现在担心会出现流感大爆发。

detailed_translations.english: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

name: fever
trans: n. 发烧，发热；狂热 vt. 使发烧；使狂热；使患热病 vi. 发烧；狂热；患热病

sentences.english: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
sentences.chinese: 安迪发烧了，今天不来上班。

sentences.english: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上醒来时我发烧了，胃也不舒服。

sentences.english: She’s running a fever (= has a fever ) .
sentences.chinese: 她在发烧。

detailed_translations.english: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature

detailed_translations.chinese: 使发烧；使狂热；使患热病

name: headache
trans: n. 头痛；麻烦；令人头痛之事

sentences.english: If you have a headache, you should take some aspirin.
sentences.chinese: 要是头痛，你该吃点阿司匹林。

sentences.english: The airline's biggest headache is the increase in the price of aviation fuel.
sentences.chinese: 令航空公司最头疼的问题是航空燃料价格的上涨。

detailed_translations.english: a pain in your head

name: swell
trans: n. 肿胀；隆起 vt. 使膨胀；使隆起 adj. 漂亮的；一流的 vi. 膨胀；肿胀；隆起

sentences.english: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
sentences.chinese: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。

sentences.english: The window frame was swollen shut.
sentences.chinese: 窗框膨胀变形，关得死死的。

detailed_translations.english: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body
the roundness or curved shape of something
very good

name: choke
trans: n. 窒息；噎；[动力] 阻气门 vi. 窒息；阻塞；说不出话来 vt. 呛；使窒息；阻塞；抑制；扑灭

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly

name: injure
trans: vt. 伤害，损害

sentences.english: Angus injured his leg playing rugby.
sentences.chinese: 安格斯在打橄榄球时弄伤了腿。

detailed_translations.english: to hurt yourself or someone else, for example in an accident or an attack

name: injury
trans: n. 伤害，损害；受伤处

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital with serious head injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受重伤被送到医院。

sentences.english: Beckham has missed several games through injury
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆因伤错过了几场比赛。

sentences.english: He’s a lawyer who specializes in personal injury claims.
sentences.chinese: 他是个专门从事人身伤害索赔的律师。

detailed_translations.english: a wound or damage to part of your body caused by an accident or attack

name: hurt
trans: n. 痛苦；危害；痛苦的原因 vt. 使受伤；损害；使疼痛；使痛心 adj. 受伤的；痛苦的；受损的 vi. 感到疼痛；有坏处；带来痛苦

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

name: bleed
trans: vt. 使出血；榨取 vi. 流血；渗出；悲痛

sentences.english: Your nose is bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 你的鼻子流血了。

sentences.english: Tragically, she bled to death .
sentences.chinese: 非常不幸，她失血过多死了。

detailed_translations.english: to lose blood, especially because of an injury

name: bruise
trans: n. 擦伤；挫伤；青肿 vt. 使受瘀伤；使受挫伤 vi. 擦伤；受伤

sentences.english: minor cuts and bruises
sentences.chinese: 轻微的伤口和淤青

detailed_translations.english: a purple or brown mark on your skin that you get because you have fallen, been hit etc
to affect someone badly and make them feel less confident

name: scar
trans: n. 创伤；伤痕 vt. 伤害；给留下伤痕 vi. 结疤；痊愈

sentences.english: His hands were badly scarred by the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他的双手被那次大火烧得疤痕累累。

sentences.english: She will probably be scarred for life .
sentences.chinese: 她有可能留下永久的疤痕。

detailed_translations.english: if a wound or cut scars you, it leaves a permanent mark on your body
a permanent mark that is left on your skin after you have had a cut or wound

name: wound
trans: n. 创伤，伤口 vt. 使受伤 vi. 受伤，伤害

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 护士把伤口清洗包扎好。

sentences.english: It took several months for his wounds to heal .
sentences.chinese: 他的伤口几个月后才愈合。

sentences.english: The doctor said it was only a flesh wound (= one that does not cut the skin very deeply ) .
sentences.chinese: 医生说那只是皮肉伤。

sentences.english: a gaping wound (= one that is wide and open ) on his thigh
sentences.chinese: 他大腿上裂开的伤口

sentences.english: Gunmen killed two people and wounded six others in an attack today.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的一起袭击事件中，持枪歹徒打死两人，打伤六人。

detailed_translations.english: an injury to your body that is made by a weapon such as a knife or a bullet
to injure someone with a knife, gun etc

name: trauma
trans: n. [外科] 创伤（由心理创伤造成精神上的异常）；外伤

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

name: lump
trans: n. 块，块状；肿块；瘤；很多；笨人 vt. 混在一起；使成块状；忍耐；笨重地移动 vi. 结块 adj. 成团的；总共的 adv. 很；非常

sentences.english: You are the one with a lump.
sentences.chinese: 你是那个有了肿块的人。

sentences.english: One day, I noticed a lump in her skin.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我注意到她皮肤上有个肿块。

sentences.english: Then the lump or cancer attaches itself to this wall.
sentences.chinese: 然后肿块或癌就附着在那钙壁上。

detailed_translations.english: to collect into a mass or group
a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape
to put two or more different people or things together and consider them as a single group, sometimes wrongly

name: pain
trans: n. 疼痛；努力 vt. 使…痛苦；使…烦恼 vi. 感到疼痛；引起疼痛

sentences.english: The pain is getting worse.
sentences.chinese: 疼得越来越厉害了。

sentences.english: Greg was in a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 格雷格疼痛万分。

sentences.english: the pleasures and pains of growing old
sentences.chinese: 变老的苦与乐

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when part of your body hurts

name: death
trans: n. 死；死亡；死神；毁灭

sentences.english: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.
sentences.chinese: 150万人正因饥饿而即将面临死亡的危险。

detailed_translations.english: a creature that looks like a human  skeleton  , used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die

name: mortal
trans: adj. 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的 n. 人类，凡人

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: demise
trans: n. 死亡，终止；转让；传位 vt. 遗赠；禅让

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

name: doom
trans: n. 厄运；死亡；判决；世界末日 vt. 注定；判决；使失败

sentences.english: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.english: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

name: fatal
trans: adj. 致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: lethal
trans: adj. 致命的，致死的 n. 致死因子

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: corpus
trans: n. [计] 语料库；文集；本金

sentences.english: the entire corpus of Shakespeare’s works
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚作品全集

detailed_translations.english: A corpus is a large collection of written or spoken texts that is used for language research

name: overwork
trans: vi. 工作过度 vt. 工作过度 n. 过度工作 过度工作的

sentences.english: You’ve been overworking – why don’t you take a week off?
sentences.chinese: 你最近在超强度工作——为什么不休息一周呢？

sentences.english: Have they been overworking you again?
sentences.chinese: 他们又让你超负荷工作了？

detailed_translations.english: to work too much or to make someone work too much
too much hard work

name: tire
trans: n. 轮胎；头饰 vt. 使…疲倦；使…厌烦 vi. 疲劳；厌倦

sentences.english: As we neared the summit, we were tiring fast.
sentences.chinese: 接近山顶时，我们感到越来越累了。

detailed_translations.english: to start to feel tired, or make someone feel tired

name: exhaust
trans: n. 排气；废气；排气装置 vt. 排出；耗尽；使精疲力尽；彻底探讨 vi. 排气

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

name: fatigue
trans: n. 疲劳，疲乏；杂役 adj. 疲劳的 vt. 使疲劳；使心智衰弱 vi. 疲劳

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.

sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

name: weary
trans: adj. 疲倦的；厌烦的；令人厌烦的 vt. 使疲倦；使厌烦 vi. 疲倦；厌烦

trans: vt. 减少；使变弱；使变淡 vi. 变弱；畏缩；变软弱

trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

name: sorrow
trans: n. 悲伤；懊悔；伤心事 vt. 为…悲痛 vi. 懊悔；遗憾；感到悲伤

trans: n. 受难；苦楚 v. 受苦；蒙受（suffer的ing形式） adj. 受苦的；患病的

sentences.chinese: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

trans: n. 医院

sentences.english: medical staff

sentences.english: medical or surgical treatment
sentences.chinese: 内科或外科疗法

detailed_translations.english: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury

trans: n. 药品；治疗法 adj. 有疗效的；治病的

sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

trans: n. 药房；配药学，药剂学；制药业；一批备用药品

sentences.chinese: 通宵药店

sentences.chinese: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。

sentences.english: She studied medicine at Johns Hopkins University.
sentences.chinese: 她曾在约翰•霍普金斯大学学医。

sentences.english: the remarkable achievements of modern medicine
sentences.chinese: 现代医学的非凡成就

detailed_translations.english: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink

name: remedy
trans: n. 补救；治疗；赔偿 vt. 补救；治疗；纠正

sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

trans: n. 药；毒品；麻醉药；滞销货 vt. 使服麻醉药；使服毒品；掺麻醉药于 vi. 吸毒

sentences.english: a drug used in the treatment of cancer
sentences.chinese: 用于治疗癌症的一种药物

sentences.english: (= ordered for people ) by doctors can be extremely hazardous if used in the wrong way.
sentences.chinese: 医生开的处方药如果使用不当是非常危险的。

sentences.english: The big drug companies make huge profits.
sentences.chinese: 大型制药公司利润丰厚。

detailed_translations.english: a medicine, or a substance for making medicines

name: pill
trans: n. 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药 vt. 把…制成丸剂；使服用药丸；抢劫，掠夺（古语） vi. 做成药丸；服药丸

sentences.english: He has to take pills to control his blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 他必须服药控制血压。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sleeping pills"]}
sentences.chinese: 安眠药

sentences.english: a bottle of vitamin pills
sentences.chinese: 一瓶维生素片

detailed_translations.chinese: 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…制成丸剂；使服用药丸；抢劫，掠夺（古语）

name: antibiotic
trans: n. 抗生素，抗菌素 adj. 抗生的；抗菌的

sentences.english: "If you can stop the enzymes involved in that process with a small molecule or chemical," says Dunman, "that chemical could be an antibiotic.
sentences.chinese: “如果能用一小分子或化学物质阻止这一酶的活性过程，”德明说，“这种化学物质就能够用来做抗生素。”

sentences.english: If we all recognize that antibiotic resistance is one of the greatest threats to public health that we face today, we have to do something about this.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们大家都能认识到耐抗生素（药性）已经成为我们今天面对的最大的公众健康威胁之一，我们就真的需要做点什么了。

name: acupuncture
trans: n. 针刺；[中医] 针刺疗法 vt. 对…施行针刺疗法

trans: n. 盘尼西林（青霉素）

sentences.english: I should have asked him for a shot of penicillin.
