sentences.english: Related to morphine and heroin, the Gaza health ministry recognizes Tramadol as a painkiller and allows its sale only by prescription.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种药和吗啡、海洛因有关，加沙健康部门只允许曲马多在医药处方中作为止痛药使用。

sentences.english: Then the researchers repeated the experiment, but this time they injected rats with a dose of cocaine or morphine on one side and with a neutral saline solution on the other.
sentences.chinese: 然后，研究人员重复这项实验，但是这次他们给一边的小白鼠注射小剂量的可卡因或吗啡，而另一边注射中性盐水。

detailed_translations.english: a powerful and  addictive  drug used for stopping pain and making people calmer

name: dose
trans: n. 剂量；一剂，一服 vt. 给药；给…服药 vi. 服药

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

name: recovery
trans: n. 恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: refresh
trans: vt. 更新；使……恢复；使……清新；消除……的疲劳 vi. 恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: relief
trans: n. 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: alleviate
trans: vt. 减轻，缓和

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: resume
trans: n. 摘要；[管理] 履历，简历 vi. 重新开始，继续 vt. 重新开始，继续；恢复，重新占用

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: ease
trans: n. 轻松，舒适；安逸，悠闲 vt. 减轻，缓和；使安心 vi. 减轻，缓和；放松；灵活地移动

sentences.english: She lived a life of ease.
sentences.chinese: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划对城里的交通拥挤状况应该有所缓解。

detailed_translations.english: lack of difficulty
to become or to make sth less unpleasant, painful, severe, etc.

name: relax
trans: vi. 放松，休息；松懈，松弛；变从容；休养 vt. 放松；使休息；使松弛；缓和；使松懈

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: normal
trans: adj. 正常的；正规的，标准的 n. 正常；标准；常态

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: common
trans: n. 普通；平民；公有地 adj. 共同的；普通的；一般的；通常的

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: usual
trans: adj. 通常的，惯例的；平常的

sentences.english: Make a cheese sauce in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 按通常的做法做奶酪酱。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the usual time.
sentences.chinese: 我在老时间和你碰头。

sentences.english: She ate twice as much as usual.
sentences.chinese: 她吃了平时食量两倍的东西。

detailed_translations.english: happening, done, or existing most of the time or in most situations

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: pessimistic
trans: adj. 悲观的，厌世的；悲观主义的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: positive
trans: n. 正数；[摄] 正片 adj. 积极的；[数] 正的，[医][化学] 阳性的；确定的，肯定的；实际的，真实的；绝对的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: negative
trans: adj. [数] 负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的 n. 否定；负数；[摄] 底片 vt. 否定；拒绝

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: passive
trans: n. 被动语态 adj. 被动的，消极的；被动语态的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: apathetic
trans: adj. 冷漠的；无动于衷的，缺乏兴趣的

sentences.english: She felt too apathetic even to move.
sentences.chinese: 她毫无兴趣，甚至连动都不想动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冷漠的；无动于衷的，缺乏兴趣的
detailed_translations.english: not interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things

name: negligible
trans: adj. 微不足道的，可以忽略的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: happiness
trans: n. 幸福

sentences.english: Juliet’s eyes shone with happiness.
sentences.chinese: 朱丽叶的双眼闪耀着幸福的光芒。

sentences.english: We want our children to have the best possible chance of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望自己的孩子得到追求幸福的最佳机会。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being happy

name: delight
trans: n. 高兴 vt. 使高兴 vi. 高兴

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: merry
trans: adj. 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的 n. 甜樱桃

sentences.english: He marched off, whistling a merry tune.
sentences.chinese: 他吹着一首欢快的曲子大步走了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas

name: fun
trans: n. 乐趣；玩笑；有趣的人或事 adj. 供娱乐用的 vi. 开玩笑

sentences.english: There’s plenty of fun for all the family.
sentences.chinese: 可以让全家人玩得很开心。

sentences.english: The children were having so much fun, I hated to call them inside.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子玩得很开心，我不忍心把他们叫进来。

detailed_translations.english: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting

name: joke
trans: n. 玩笑，笑话；笑柄 vt. 开…的玩笑 vi. 开玩笑

sentences.english: I couldn’t go out with someone for a joke, could you?
sentences.chinese: 我可不能拿谈恋爱当儿戏，对不对？

sentences.english: I never joke about money.
sentences.chinese: 我从不拿钱开玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick
to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

name: laughter
trans: n. 笑；笑声

sentences.english: Foster joined in the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 福斯特也跟着笑了起来。

sentences.english: He looked shocked, then burst into laughter (= started laughing ).
sentences.chinese: 他一脸的震惊，接着便放声大笑起来。

detailed_translations.english: when people laugh, or the sound of people laughing

name: joy
trans: n. 欢乐，快乐；乐趣；高兴 vi. 欣喜，欢喜 vt. 高兴，使快乐

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

name: please
trans: int. 请（礼貌用语） vt. 使喜欢；使高兴，使满意 vi. 讨人喜欢；令人高兴

sentences.english: a business that wants to please its customers
sentences.chinese: 希望让顾客满意的一家公司

sentences.english: She did everything she could to please him.
sentences.chinese: 她千方百计讨好他。

sentences.english: Most children are eager to please .
sentences.chinese: 大多数孩子都渴望取悦别人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone happy or satisfied

name: rejoice
trans: vi. 高兴；庆祝 vt. 使高兴

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

name: thrill
trans: n. 激动；震颤；紧张 vt. 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动 vi. 颤抖；感到兴奋；感到紧张

sentences.english: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
sentences.chinese: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

sentences.english: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我演了多年戏，走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。

sentences.english: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
sentences.chinese: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演，感到十分激动。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel excited and happy

name: cheer
trans: n. 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事 vt. 欢呼；使高兴；为…加油 vi. 欢呼；感到高兴

sentences.english: Everybody cheered when the firemen arrived.
sentences.chinese: 消防员到达时，大家都欢呼起来。

sentences.english: The audience was shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 观众在呐喊欢呼。

sentences.english: The spectators cheered him wildly.
sentences.chinese: 观众拼命为他加油。

detailed_translations.english: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事
detailed_translations.english: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

name: pleasure
trans: n. 快乐；希望；娱乐；令人高兴的事 vt. 使高兴；使满意 vi. 高兴；寻欢作乐

sentences.english: She sipped her drink with obvious pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 她小口抿着喝饮料，显然很高兴

sentences.english: the simple pleasures of life
sentences.chinese: 生活中的简单乐趣

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction that you get from an experience

name: agreeable
trans: adj. 令人愉快的；适合的；和蔼可亲的

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

name: exhilarate
trans: vt. 使高兴，使振奋；使愉快

sentences.english: This dangerous task exhilarate his spirits.
sentences.chinese: 这项危险的任务使他精神振奋。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very excited and happy

name: satisfactory
trans: adj. 满意的；符合要求的；赎罪的

sentences.english: His progress this term has been satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 他这学期的进步令人满意。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for a particular purpose

name: desirable
trans: n. 合意的人或事物 adj. 令人满意的；值得要的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: exciting
trans: adj. 令人兴奋的；使人激动的 v. 激动；刺激（excite的ing形式）；唤起

sentences.english: an exciting discovery
sentences.chinese: 激动人心的发现

sentences.english: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.chinese: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.english: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。

sentences.english: Let’s do something exciting.
sentences.chinese: 我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.english: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel excited

name: keen
trans: adj. 敏锐的，敏捷的；渴望的；强烈的；热心的；锐利的 n. 痛哭，挽歌

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: zeal
trans: n. 热情；热心；热诚

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

name: lively
trans: adj. 活泼的；生动的；真实的；生气勃勃的

sentences.english: a lively child
sentences.chinese: 精力充沛的孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼的；生动的；真实的；生气勃勃的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is lively has a lot of energy and is very active

name: lovely
trans: adj. 可爱的；令人愉快的；爱恋的；秀丽的，优美的 n. 美女；可爱的东西

sentences.english: She had a lovely face.
sentences.chinese: 她有一张漂亮的脸蛋。

sentences.english: What a lovely house!
sentences.chinese: 多么漂亮的房子啊！

sentences.english: You look lovely in that dress.
sentences.chinese: 你穿那条连衣裙很漂亮。

sentences.english: He was a lovely little boy.
sentences.chinese: 他是个可爱的小男孩。

sentences.english: What a lovely day!
sentences.chinese: 多好的天气啊！

sentences.english: Thank you for a lovely evening.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你让我们度过了一个美好的夜晚。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful or attractive

name: fond
trans: adj. 喜欢的；温柔的；宠爱的

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

name: favour
trans: n. 偏爱；赞同；善行 vt. 赞成；喜爱；有助于

sentences.english: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
sentences.chinese: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？

sentences.english: He hired John as a favour to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。

sentences.english: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
sentences.chinese: 保罗，能帮我一下吗？

sentences.english: I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一个人情，所以无法拒绝。

sentences.english: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
sentences.chinese: 我忙的时候她来帮忙，我能帮她的时候就还她人情。

sentences.english: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 对自己好些，一定要留点时间给自己。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them

detailed_translations.chinese: 赞同； 喜爱， 偏爱； 有利于
detailed_translations.english: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen

name: startle
trans: n. 惊愕；惊恐 vt. 使吓一跳；使惊奇 vi. 惊吓；惊跳；惊奇

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: amazing
trans: adj. 令人惊异的 v. 使吃惊（amaze的ing形式）

sentences.english: He’s an amazing player to watch.
sentences.chinese: 看他比赛那才叫精彩呢。

sentences.english: an amazing bargain
sentences.chinese: 令人惊喜的便宜货

detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in an unexpected way

name: astound
trans: vt. 使惊骇；使震惊

sentences.english: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们所做的都是我们擅长的事情，我们最终将使自己大吃一惊。

sentences.english: “You astound me!” Mrs. Willoughby said, pressing her clasped hands to her lips, a gesture she normally bestowed upon seniors who were making their final appearance in the spring choral concert.
sentences.chinese: “你真是令我大吃一惊啊！” 威洛比太太说道，双手紧紧的按在嘴唇上——这是她通常在毕业班学生参加春季合唱音乐会上最后献唱时才会做出的姿势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊骇, 使大吃一惊

name: hectic
trans: n. 脸红；患肺结核 adj. 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的

sentences.english: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
sentences.chinese: 我忙乱了一整天。

sentences.english: a hectic social life
sentences.chinese: 繁忙的社交生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
detailed_translations.english: very busy or full of activity

name: liberal
trans: adj. 自由主义的；慷慨的；不拘泥的；宽大的 n. 自由主义者

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的，大方的；宽宏大量的；有雅量的

sentences.english: Dietler is generous with his time and money.
sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: gentle
trans: n. 蛆，饵 adj. 温和的；文雅的 vt. 使温和，使驯服

sentences.english: Arthur was a very gentle, caring person.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟是一个非常温柔体贴的人。

sentences.english: After a little gentle persuasion , she agreed to go back to her family.
sentences.chinese: 经过几句温和的劝说，她同意回到家里去。

detailed_translations.english: kind and careful in the way you behave or do things, so that you do not hurt or damage anyone or anything

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的 vt. 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: modest
trans: adj. 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: humorous
trans: adj. 诙谐的，幽默的；滑稽的，可笑的

sentences.english: humorous stories
sentences.chinese: 诙谐的故事

sentences.english: The film has some mildly humorous moments.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影中有些略显幽默的片段。

detailed_translations.english: funny and enjoyable

name: polite
trans: adj. 有礼貌的，客气的；文雅的；上流的；优雅的

sentences.english: She’s always very polite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是很有礼貌。

sentences.english: polite, well-behaved children
sentences.chinese: 懂礼貌、守规矩的孩子

sentences.english: a clear but polite request
sentences.chinese: 明确但客气的请求

sentences.english: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

name: frank
trans: n. 免费邮寄特权 adj. 坦白的，直率的；老实的 vt. 免费邮寄

sentences.english: To be perfectly frank, I think it’s a bad idea.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，我认为这个主意不好。

detailed_translations.english: honest and truthful

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: curious
trans: adj. 好奇的，有求知欲的；古怪的；爱挑剔的

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: daring
trans: n. 胆量，勇气 v. 敢（dare的现在分词） adj. 大胆的，勇敢的

sentences.english: a daring rescue attempt
sentences.chinese: 大胆的营救行动

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things
courage that makes you willing to take risks

name: manly
trans: adj. 男子气概的；强壮的；适于男人的 adv. 雄赳赳地

sentences.english: a deep manly voice
sentences.chinese: 低沉雄浑的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 男子气概的；强壮的；适于男人的
detailed_translations.english: having qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong

name: direct
trans: adj. 直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的 vt. 管理；指挥；导演；指向 adv. 直接地；正好；按直系关系 vi. 指导；指挥

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: earnest
trans: n. 认真；定金；诚挚 adj. 认真的，热心的；重要的

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

name: honesty
trans: n. 诚实，正直

sentences.english: a politician of rare honesty and courage
sentences.chinese: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest

name: proud
trans: adj. 自豪的；得意的；自负的

sentences.english: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
sentences.chinese: 自以为是、不愿认错的男子

sentences.english: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

name: rational
trans: n. 有理数 adj. 合理的；理性的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: seriously
trans: adv. 认真地；严重地，严肃地

sentences.english: Something was seriously wrong .
sentences.chinese: 出大问题了。

sentences.english: It’s time we talked seriously about our relationship.
sentences.chinese: 我们该认真谈一谈我们的关系了。

detailed_translations.english: very much or to a great degree

name: stern
trans: n. 船尾；末端 adj. 严厉的；坚定的

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: friendly
trans: adj. 友好的；亲切的；支持的；融洽的，和睦的 adv. 友善地；温和地

sentences.english: a friendly smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

sentences.english: I’ve found a great pub – good beer and a friendly atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 我找到了一家很棒的酒馆——啤酒好，氛围也亲切。

sentences.english: a friendly match against AC Milan
sentences.chinese: 与AC米兰队的友谊赛

detailed_translations.english: behaving towards someone in a way that shows you like them and are ready to talk to them or help them

name: hospitable
trans: adj. 热情友好的；（环境）舒适的

sentences.english: The local people were very kind and hospitable.
sentences.chinese: 当地人非常友好热情。

detailed_translations.english: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors

name: romantic
trans: n. 浪漫的人 adj. 浪漫的；多情的；空想的 vt. 使…浪漫化

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

name: freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主；直率

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: careful
trans: adj. 仔细的，小心的

sentences.english: Any school trip requires careful planning.
sentences.chinese: 学校的任何出游活动都需要周密的安排。

detailed_translations.english: giving a lot of attention to details

name: concern
trans: n. 关系；关心；关心的事；忧虑 vt. 涉及，关系到；使担心

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: confidence
trans: n. 信心；信任；秘密 adj. （美）诈骗的；骗得信任的

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: considerate
trans: adj. 体贴的；体谅的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: thoughtful
trans: adj. 深思的；体贴的；关切的

sentences.english: Paul is very thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常体贴人。

sentences.english: a thoughtful look
sentences.chinese: 若有所思的神情

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of the things you can do to make people happy or comfortable

name: sympathetic
trans: n. 交感神经；容易感受的人 adj. 同情的；交感神经的；共鸣的；赞同的；和谐的；合意的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: ready
trans: n. 现款；预备好的状态 adj. 准备好；现成的；迅速的；情愿的；快要…的 vt. 使准备好 adv. 迅速地；预先

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: apologise
trans: vi. 道歉（等于apologize）

sentences.english: When he received the letter he offered to apologise and to change his comments, but the club rejected this.
sentences.chinese: 奈杰尔收到信后，愿意向俱乐部道歉，并修正他的评论，但俱乐部拒绝了这个服软的表示。

sentences.english: But it has been on my mind for so long, and I apologise if it is irrelevant to some readers.
sentences.chinese: 但是它占据我的内心很久了。 如果它与一些读者没有关系，我向你们道歉。

name: apology
trans: n. 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物

sentences.english: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
sentences.chinese: 爱德华今天来不了，他向大家表示歉意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

name: mercy
trans: n. 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

name: admire
trans: vt. 钦佩；赞美 vi. 钦佩；称赞

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: gratitude
trans: n. 感谢（的心情）；感激

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: eager
trans: adj. 渴望的；热切的；热心的

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

name: sound
trans: n. 声音，语音；噪音；海峡；吵闹；听力范围；[医] 探条 adj. 健全的，健康的；合理的；可靠的；有效彻底的 vt. 听（诊）；测量，测…深；使发声；试探；宣告 vi. 听起来；发出声音；回响；测深 adv. 彻底地，充分地

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: picturesque
trans: adj. 独特的；生动的；别致的；图画般的

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: promising
trans: v. 许诺，答应（promise的现在分词形式） adj. 有希望的，有前途的

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

name: prominent
trans: adj. 突出的，显著的；杰出的；卓越的

sentences.english: a prominent Russian scientist
sentences.chinese: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

sentences.english: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

sentences.english: a prominent nose
sentences.chinese: 高鼻子

detailed_translations.english: important

name: awesome
trans: adj. 令人敬畏的；使人畏惧的；可怕的；极好的

sentences.english: an awesome responsibility
sentences.chinese: 一项令人惊惧的责任

sentences.english: the awesome sweep of the scenery
sentences.chinese: 连绵的壮丽景色

detailed_translations.english: extremely impressive, serious, or difficult so that you feel great respect, worry, or fear

name: arduous
trans: adj. 努力的；费力的；险峻的

sentences.english: ...a long, hot and arduous trip.
sentences.chinese: …一段漫长、灼热、艰难的旅程。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of strength and effort

name: tough
trans: n. 恶棍 adj. 艰苦的，困难的；坚强的，不屈不挠的；坚韧的，牢固的；强壮的，结实的 vt. 坚持；忍受，忍耐 adv. 强硬地，顽强地

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: robust
trans: adj. 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

name: sturdy
trans: n. 羊晕倒病 adj. 坚定的；强健的；健全的

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

detailed_translations.english: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

name: steadfast
trans: adj. 坚定的；不变的

sentences.english: her father’s steadfast love for her
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

detailed_translations.english: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

name: tender
trans: n. 偿付，清偿；看管人；小船 adj. 温柔的；柔软的；脆弱的；幼稚的；难对付的 vt. 提供，偿还；使…变嫩；使…变柔软 vi. 投标；变柔软

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: temperate
trans: adj. 温和的；适度的；有节制的

sentences.english: The Nile Valley keeps a temperate climate throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 尼罗河流域全年气候温和。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和的；适度的；有节制的
detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is temperate is calm and sensible

name: delicate
trans: adj. 微妙的；精美的，雅致的；柔和的；易碎的；纤弱的；清淡可口的

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

name: mundane
trans: adj. 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: naive
trans: adj. 天真的

sentences.english: a naive young girl
sentences.chinese: 天真的小女孩

sentences.english: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的； 天真的； 轻信的
detailed_translations.english: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

name: childish
trans: adj. 幼稚的，孩子气的

sentences.english: a high childish laugh
sentences.chinese: 孩子气的高声大笑

sentences.english: her childish excitement
sentences.chinese: 她孩子般的激动

sentences.english: I wish politicians would stop this childish name-calling.
sentences.chinese: 我希望政客们能停止这种幼稚的谩骂。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or typical of a child

name: sincere
trans: adj. 真诚的；诚挚的；真实的

sentences.english: Please accept my sincere apologies .
sentences.chinese: 请接受我真诚的道歉。

sentences.english: his sincere desire to find out the truth
sentences.chinese: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

detailed_translations.english: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe

name: liable
trans: adj. 有责任的，有义务的；应受罚的；有…倾向的；易…的

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: trustworthy
trans: adj. 可靠的；可信赖的

sentences.english: He is a trustworthy and level-headed leader.
sentences.chinese: 他是个可信赖的、头脑冷静的领导。

detailed_translations.english: able to be trusted and depended on

name: enterprising
trans: adj. 有事业心的；有进取心的；有魄力的；有胆量的

sentences.english: Some enterprising students are designing software.
sentences.chinese: 一些有创业精神的学生在设计软件。

sentences.english: an enterprising scheme to provide interest-free loans
sentences.chinese: 一项提供无息贷款的创业计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 有事业心的, 有进取心的
detailed_translations.english: having the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work

name: sane
trans: adj. 健全的；理智的；[临床] 神志正常的

sentences.english: He seems perfectly sane (= completely sane ) to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来他神志完全正常。

sentences.english: No sane person would want to kill a baby.
sentences.chinese: 神志正常的人不会去杀一个婴儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健全的；理智的；[临床] 神志正常的
detailed_translations.english: able to think in a normal and reasonable way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sane)人名；(日)实(姓)；(日)实(名)；(芬、塞、冈、几比、塞内)萨内

name: strenuous
trans: adj. 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的

sentences.english: a strenuous climb
sentences.chinese: 艰难的攀登

sentences.english: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort or strength

name: rigorous
trans: adj. 严格的，严厉的；严密的；严酷的

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

name: strict
trans: adj. 严格的；绝对的；精确的；详细的

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

name: severe
trans: adj. 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: mutual
trans: adj. 共同的；相互的，彼此的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: resemble
trans: vt. 类似，像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: similar
trans: n. 类似物 adj. 相似的

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: familiar
trans: n. 常客；密友 adj. 熟悉的；常见的；亲近的

sentences.english: a familiar tune
sentences.chinese: 熟悉的曲调

sentences.english: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
sentences.chinese: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。

sentences.english: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
sentences.chinese: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: This kind of situation was all too familiar (= very familiar ) to John.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。

sentences.english: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
sentences.chinese: 她看起来有点面熟，但我还是认不出她来。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize

name: naked
trans: adj. 裸体的；无装饰的；无证据的；直率的

sentences.english: The children ran naked through the yard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们光着身子跑过院子。

sentences.english: a picture of a naked man
sentences.chinese: 裸体男子的照片

sentences.english: They found the body lying half naked in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现尸体半裸着躺在草丛中。

sentences.english: The governor ordered the prisoner to be stripped naked and whipped.
sentences.chinese: 监狱长下令将那个犯人剥光衣服进行鞭笞。

detailed_translations.english: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

name: bare
trans: adj. 空的；赤裸的，无遮蔽的 vt. 露出，使赤裸

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

name: private
trans: n. 列兵；二等兵 adj. 私人的；私有的；私下的

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: intuition
trans: n. 直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

name: spontaneous
trans: adj. 自发的；自然的；无意识的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: implicit
trans: adj. 含蓄的；暗示的；盲从的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: illusion
trans: n. 幻觉，错觉；错误的观念或信仰

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: imaginary
trans: adj. 虚构的，假想的；想像的；虚数的

sentences.english: As she listened, she played an imaginary piano on her knees.
sentences.chinese: 她边听边在膝盖上作弹钢琴状。

sentences.english: We must protect older people from harm, whether it is real or imaginary.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保护老人免受伤害，无论这伤害是真实的还是假想的。

detailed_translations.english: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind

name: fancy
trans: n. 幻想；想象力；爱好 adj. 想象的；奇特的；昂贵的；精选的 vt. 想象；喜爱；设想；自负 vi. 幻想；想象

sentences.english: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
to like or want something, or want to do something

name: fate
trans: n. 命运 vt. 注定

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: fortune
trans: n. 财富；命运；运气 vt. 给予财富 vi. 偶然发生

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

name: agony
trans: n. 苦恼；极大的痛苦；临死的挣扎

sentences.english: the agony of arthritis
sentences.chinese: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

detailed_translations.english: very severe pain

name: grief
trans: n. 悲痛；忧伤；不幸

sentences.english: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

detailed_translations.english: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

name: grieve
trans: vi. 悲痛，哀悼 vt. 使悲伤，使苦恼

sentences.english: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

name: miserable
trans: adj. 悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: distress
trans: n. 危难，不幸；贫困；悲痛 vt. 使悲痛；使贫困

sentences.english: The dream had distressed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very upset

name: sadness
trans: n. 悲哀

sentences.english: There was a touch of sadness in his voice (= he sounded a little sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的声音里含着一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: His relief was tinged with sadness (= he also felt rather sad ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的欣慰中带着一丝哀伤。

detailed_translations.english: the state of feeling sad

name: gloomy
trans: adj. 黑暗的；沮丧的；阴郁的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: disappoint
trans: vt. 使失望

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: discourage
trans: vt. 阻止；使气馁

sentences.english: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less likely to happen

name: wretched
trans: adj. 可怜的；卑鄙的；令人苦恼或难受的

sentences.english: the poor, wretched girl
sentences.chinese: 极其不幸的可怜姑娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them

name: frustrating
trans: v. 使沮丧（frustrate的ing形式） adj. 令人沮丧的

sentences.english: My job can be very frustrating sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我的工作令人很沮丧。

sentences.english: This is an immensely frustrating experience for the student.
sentences.chinese: 对于学生来说，这是非常令人沮丧的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel annoyed, upset, or impatient because you cannot do what you want to do

name: mourn
trans: v. 哀悼；忧伤；服丧

sentences.english: Hundreds of people gathered to mourn the slain president.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千人聚集在一起悼念遇刺的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

trans: n. 怒，愤怒；忿怒 vt. 使发怒，激怒；恼火 vi. 发怒；恼火

sentences.chinese: 民众对政府越来越不满。

sentences.chinese: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

to make someone angry

name: furious
trans: adj. 激烈的；狂怒的；热烈兴奋的；喧闹的

sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

trans: n. 皱眉，蹙额 vt. 皱眉，蹙额 vi. 皱眉；不同意

sentences.chinese: 她看着信皱起了眉头。

detailed_translations.english: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

name: rage
trans: n. 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动 vi. 大怒，发怒；流行，风行

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动

to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: irritate
trans: vt. 刺激，使兴奋；激怒 vi. 引起恼怒，引起不愉快

sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: hate
trans: n. 憎恨；反感 vt. 憎恨；厌恶；遗憾 vi. 仇恨

sentences.english: It’s the kind of movie you either love or hate.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种你要么喜欢要么讨厌的电影。

sentences.english: He hates his job.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike something very much

name: hatred
trans: n. 憎恨；怨恨；敌意

sentences.english: A look of pure hatred flashed across her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上闪过十足的仇恨表情。

sentences.english: the old hatreds and prejudices that simmered below the surface

detailed_translations.english: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

name: nuisance
trans: n. 讨厌的人；损害；麻烦事；讨厌的东西

sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

name: disgust
trans: n. 厌恶，嫌恶 vt. 使厌恶；使作呕

sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

sentences.chinese: 他以其粗鲁的行为使许多人感到厌恶。

To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

name: vex
trans: vt. 使烦恼；使困惑；使恼怒 vi. 烦恼

sentences.chinese: 想到别人在我背后说闲话让我很恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or worried

name: harass
trans: vt. 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击

sentences.english: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击

name: bore
trans: n. 孔；令人讨厌的人 vt. 钻孔；使烦扰 vi. 钻孔

sentences.english: Get the special drill bit to bore the correct size hole for the job.
sentences.chinese: 找个特殊的钻头，钻个尺寸合适的孔。

something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

name: bother
trans: n. 麻烦；烦恼 vt. 烦扰，打扰；使……不安；使……恼怒 vi. 操心，麻烦；烦恼

sentences.english: Danny, don’t bother Ellen while she’s reading.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼，埃伦看书的时候不要去打扰她 。

sentences.english: You seem to have got yourself into a spot of bother.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎让自己遇上了点麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: to annoy, worry or upset sb
trouble or difficulty

trans: adj. 麻烦的；讨厌的；使人苦恼的

sentences.chinese: 经济状况已成为保守党的一大难题。

detailed_translations.english: A troublesome situation or issue is full of complicated problems or difficulties.

name: awful
trans: adj. 可怕的；极坏的；使人敬畏的

sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

name: unpleasant
trans: adj. 讨厌的；使人不愉快的

sentences.english: an unpleasant experience
sentences.chinese: 不愉快的经历

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant smell
sentences.chinese: 极其难闻的味道

sentences.english: an unpleasant surprise
sentences.chinese: 令人不快的意外

name: adverse
trans: adj. 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

name: indignant
trans: adj. 愤愤不平的；义愤的

sentences.chinese: 愤慨的回复

trans: n. 基础；激进分子；[物化] 原子团；[数] 根数 adj. 激进的；根本的；彻底的

sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

trans: adj. 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的 n. 狂怒

sentences.english: He can’t possibly get that finished in time. He must be mad !
sentences.chinese: 他不可能按时完成的。他一定是疯了！

sentences.english: I’d go mad (= start to feel crazy ) if I was stuck at home all day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我整天困在家里我会发疯的。

sentences.chinese: 他真让我受不了！

sentences.chinese: 你已经同意跟他结婚了！你疯了吗？

sentences.english: Surely no one would be mad enough to fly in this weather?
sentences.chinese: 肯定没有人会傻到在这样的天气条件下飞行吧？

sentences.english: My friends all think I’m stark raving mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友都认为我是彻底疯了。

sentences.english: It’s enough to send you barking mad (= completely crazy ) .

trans: adj. 疯狂的；狂热的，着迷的

sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

name: wicked
trans: adj. 邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的

sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

trans: adj. 恶毒的；恶意的；堕落的；有错误的；品性不端的；剧烈的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

sentences.chinese: 粗俗的行为

sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

trans: n. 自我；自负；自我意识

sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).

trans: adj. 自私的；利己主义的

sentences.chinese: 你怎能这样自私？

sentences.chinese: 自私的行为

trans: adj. 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的 n. 令人不快的事物 性的吸引力

sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的

name: rash

sentences.english: Please Jessie, don’t do anything rash.
sentences.chinese: 求你了，杰西，不要草率行事。

sentences.english: Don’t go making any rash decisions about your future!
sentences.chinese: 不要对你的未来贸然作决定！

detailed_translations.english: if you are rash, you do things too quickly, without thinking carefully about whether they are sensible or not

trans: n. 挥发物；有翅的动物 adj. [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: weird
trans: n. （苏格兰）命运；预言 adj. 怪异的；不可思议的；超自然的

sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

sentences.chinese: 在马赛住了几星期后，我开始待不住了，决定换个地方。

name: uneasy
trans: adj. 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: fear
trans: n. 害怕；恐惧；敬畏；担心 vt. 害怕；敬畏；为…担心 vi. 害怕；敬畏；为…担心

sentences.english: a fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 害怕坐飞机

sentences.english: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
sentences.chinese: 该团体担心发生暴力事件，所以请求警方保护。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen
to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

name: timid
trans: adj. 胆小的；羞怯的

sentences.english: I was a timid child.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。

sentences.english: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.chinese: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

detailed_translations.english: not having courage or confidence

name: fuss
trans: n. 大惊小怪，大惊小怪的人；小题大作；忙乱 vt. 使烦恼，使烦忧 vi. 小题大作；忙乱；焦燥；焦急；无事自扰

sentences.english: James said he’d better be getting back or there’d be a fuss.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯说他最好回来，否则就会有人小题大做了。

sentences.english: Stop fussing around and find something useful to do!
sentences.chinese: 别瞎忙活了，找点有用的事干！

detailed_translations.english: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things
to do things, or pay too much attention to things, that are not important or necessary

name: insult
trans: n. 侮辱；凌辱；无礼 vt. 侮辱；辱骂；损害

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

name: unkind
trans: adj. 无情的；不仁慈的，不厚道的

sentences.english: A lot of unkind things were said.
sentences.chinese: 说了很多刻薄话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；不仁慈的，不厚道的
detailed_translations.english: nasty, unpleasant, or cruel

name: envy
trans: n. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕 vt. 嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕 vi. 感到妒忌；显示出妒忌

sentences.english: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.chinese: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.english: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.english: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

detailed_translations.english: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

name: jealous
trans: adj. 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

name: doubt
trans: n. 怀疑；疑问；疑惑 v. 怀疑；不信；恐怕；拿不准

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
