name: suspicion
trans: n. 怀疑；嫌疑；疑心；一点儿 vt. 怀疑

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: sceptical
trans: adj. 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

name: unsatisfactory
trans: adj. 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的

sentences.english: an unsatisfactory situation
sentences.chinese: 让人不满意的状况

detailed_translations.chinese: 不令人满意的；不满足的；不符合要求的
detailed_translations.english: not good enough or not acceptable

name: unstable
trans: adj. 不稳定的；动荡的；易变的

sentences.english: The political situation is still very unstable.
sentences.chinese: 政局依然非常动荡。

sentences.english: an unstable relationship
sentences.chinese: 不稳定的关系

detailed_translations.english: likely to change sud­denly and become worse

name: unsuitable
trans: adj. 不适合的；不适宜的；不相称的

sentences.english: unsuitable housing
sentences.chinese: 不合适的住房

detailed_translations.chinese: 不适宜的, 不合适的
detailed_translations.english: not having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

name: unwilling
trans: adj. 不愿意的；不情愿的；勉强的

sentences.english: an unwilling helper
sentences.chinese: 勉强来帮忙的人

detailed_translations.english: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: hesitate
trans: vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意 vi. 踌躇，犹豫；不愿

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: confuse
trans: vt. 使混乱；使困惑

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: guilty
trans: adj. 有罪的；内疚的

sentences.english: She looked self-conscious and guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去很不自然，很内疚的样子。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty of the death of PC Jones.
sentences.chinese: 关于警员琼斯的死，他被判无罪。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

name: embarrass
trans: vt. 使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: regret
trans: n. 遗憾；抱歉；悲叹 vi. 感到后悔；感到抱歉 vt. 后悔；惋惜；哀悼

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: repent
trans: adj. [植] 匍匐生根的；[动] 爬行的 vi. 后悔；忏悔 vt. 后悔；对…感到后悔

sentences.english: Those who refuse to repent, he said, will be punished.
sentences.chinese: 他说，那些不肯悔悟的人将受到惩罚。

sentences.english: repent stems

detailed_translations.english: to be sorry for something and wish you had not done it – used especially when considering your actions in a religious way

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 匍匐生根的；[动] 爬行的
detailed_translations.english: lying or creeping along the ground; reptant

name: ashamed
trans: adj. 惭愧的，感到难为情的；耻于……的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: sigh
trans: n. 叹息，叹气 vt. 叹息，叹气 vi. 叹息，叹气

sentences.english: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
sentences.chinese: “唉，我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
an act or sound of sighing

name: weep
trans: n. 哭泣；眼泪；滴下 vt. 哭泣；流泪；悲叹；流出或渗出液体 vi. 哭泣；流泪；哀悼；滴落；渗出液体

sentences.english: James broke down and wept.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯控制不住感情，哭了起来。

sentences.english: He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.
sentences.chinese: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

detailed_translations.english: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

name: tolerance
trans: n. 公差；宽容；容忍；公差

sentences.english: ...his tolerance and understanding of diverse human nature.
sentences.chinese: …他对各种人性的宽容和理解。

detailed_translations.english: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: ignorant
trans: adj. 无知的；愚昧的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍 vi. 忍耐；持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: sly
trans: adj. 狡猾的；淘气的；诡密的

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

name: cunning
trans: n. 狡猾 adj. 狡猾的；巧妙的；可爱的

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: arbitrary
trans: adj. [数] 任意的；武断的；专制的

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的；荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: stupid
trans: n. 傻瓜，笨蛋 adj. 愚蠢的；麻木的；乏味的

sentences.english: stupid mistakes
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的错误

sentences.english: That was a stupid thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 那样说可真傻。

sentences.english: I can’t believe Kate was stupid enough to get involved in this.
sentences.chinese: 我简直不能相信凯特这么傻，会介入这件事情。

sentences.english: It was stupid of me to lose my temper.
sentences.chinese: 我大发脾气，真是太愚蠢了。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lack of good sense or good judgment
an insulting way of talking to someone who you think is being stupid

name: awkward
trans: adj. 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: clumsy
trans: adj. 笨拙的 笨拙地 不得当的 不得当地

sentences.english: A clumsy waiter spilled wine all over her new skirt.
sentences.chinese: 一名笨手笨脚的服务员把葡萄酒洒得她新裙子上到处都是。

sentences.english: a clumsy attempt to catch the ball
sentences.chinese: 笨拙的接球动作

detailed_translations.english: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

name: careless
trans: adj. 粗心的；无忧无虑的；淡漠的

sentences.english: It was careless of him to leave the door unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 他忘了锁门，真是粗心大意。

sentences.english: a careless mistake
sentences.chinese: 粗心造成的错误

sentences.english: careless driving
sentences.chinese: 粗心驾驶

sentences.english: Careless talk can be disastrous for a business.
sentences.chinese: 谈话不慎有时会给企业带来灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: She gave a careless shrug.
sentences.chinese: 她漠然地耸了耸肩。

detailed_translations.english: not paying enough attention to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes, damage things etc

name: oblivious
trans: adj. 遗忘的；健忘的；不注意的；不知道的

sentences.english: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一动不动地躺在原地，感觉不到疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it

name: naughty
trans: adj. 顽皮的，淘气的；不听话的；没规矩的；不适当的；下流的

sentences.english: You’re a very naughty boy! Look what you’ve done!
sentences.chinese: 你真是个淘气鬼！瞧你干了些什么！

detailed_translations.english: a naughty child does not obey adults and behaves badly

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪吃的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: obtrusive
trans: adj. 突出的；强迫人的；冒失的

sentences.english: obtrusive TV antennas
sentences.chinese: 碍眼的电视天线

detailed_translations.chinese: 突出的；强迫人的；冒失的

name: slothful
trans: adj. 怠惰的，懒惰的；迟钝的

sentences.english: He was not slothful: he had been busy all night.
sentences.chinese: 他可没偷懒：他忙了整整一夜。

detailed_translations.english: lazy or not active

name: sluggish
trans: n. 市况呆滞；市势疲弱 adj. 萧条的；迟钝的；行动迟缓的；懒惰的

sentences.english: Alex woke late, feeling tired and sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯醒得很晚，感到很倦怠。

sentences.english: Economic recovery has so far been sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的速度目前仍然缓慢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 萧条的；迟钝的；行动迟缓的；懒惰的
detailed_translations.english: moving or reacting more slowly than normal

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动；[电子] 脉冲；刺激；神经冲动；推动力 vt. 推动

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: rigid
trans: adj. 严格的；僵硬的，死板的；坚硬的；精确的

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

name: stubborn
trans: adj. 顽固的；顽强的；难处理的

sentences.english: Why are you so stubborn?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么这么固执？

sentences.english: I’ve got a very stubborn streak (= a tendency to be stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的个性很固执。

sentences.english: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule (= very stubborn ) .
sentences.chinese: 保尔有时倔得像头驴。

detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable

name: stereotype
trans: n. 陈腔滥调，老套；铅版 vt. 使用铅版；套用老套，使一成不变

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: daily
trans: n. 日报；朝来夜去的女佣 adj. 日常的；每日的 adv. 日常地；每日；天天

sentences.english: daily flights to Miami
sentences.chinese: 每日飞往迈阿密的航班

sentences.english: China Daily receives dispatches from all parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《中国日报》收到世界各地发来的电讯。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done every day
a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday

name: monthly
trans: adj. 每月的，每月一次的；有效期为一个月的 n. 月刊 adv. 每月，每月一次

sentences.english: The mortgage is payable in monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款每月分期偿还。

sentences.english: a monthly publication
sentences.chinese: 月刊

sentences.english: In some areas the property price can rise monthly.
sentences.chinese: 有些地区，房价能每月都涨。

sentences.english: They meet monthly to discuss progress.
sentences.chinese: 他们每月碰一次头讨论进展情况。

sentences.english: a leading women’s monthly
sentences.chinese: 一本主要的女性月刊

detailed_translations.english: happening once a month
every month or once a month
a magazine that appears once a month

name: quarterly
trans: n. 季刊 adj. 季度的，按季度的；一年四次的 adv. 按季度，[农] 一季一次地；纵横四分地

sentences.english: We publish a quarterly journal.
sentences.chinese: 我们出版一份季刊。

sentences.english: The rent is payable quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 房租按季度支付。

sentences.english: It makes no difference whether dividends are paid quarterly or annually.
sentences.chinese: 红利是按季度还是按年度支付没有区别。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季度的，按季度的；一年四次的
detailed_translations.english: produced or happening four times a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 按季度，[农] 一季一次地；纵横四分地
detailed_translations.english: Quarterly is also an adverb
a magazine that is produced four times a year

name: annual
trans: n. 年刊，年鉴；一年生植物 adj. 年度的；每年的

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: yearly
trans: n. 年刊；年鉴 adj. 每年的 adv. 每年；一年一次

sentences.english: Salary levels are reviewed on a yearly basis.
sentences.chinese: 工资水平每年都要审查。

sentences.english: a total yearly income of $78,000
sentences.chinese: 7.8万美元的年总收入

sentences.english: Clients normally pay fees in advance, monthly, quarterly, or yearly.
sentences.chinese: 客户们通常提前付费，或按月，或按季度，或按年。

detailed_translations.english: happening or appearing every year or once a year
Yearly is also an adverb

name: anniversary
trans: n. 周年纪念日

sentences.english: Jack and Kim celebrated their twentieth wedding anniversary in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月，杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准 adj. 现在的；出席的 vt. 提出；介绍；呈现；赠送 vi. 举枪瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: contemporary
trans: n. 同时代的人；同时期的东西 adj. 当代的；同时代的；属于同一时期的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；原始的；仿中世纪的；老式的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: century
trans: n. 世纪，百年；（板球）一百分

sentences.english: the story of life on a small farm at the turn of the century
sentences.chinese: 讲述世纪初一个小农场生活的故事

detailed_translations.english: one of the 100-year periods measured from before or after the year of Christ’s birth

name: millennium
trans: n. 千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代

sentences.english: people who have inhabited this land for millennia
sentences.chinese: 在这片土地上已经居住了数千年的人们

detailed_translations.chinese: 千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代
detailed_translations.english: a period of 1,000 years

name: million
trans: n. 百万；无数 adj. 百万的；无数的 num. 百万

sentences.english: The book sold more than a million copies.
sentences.chinese: 这本书售出了一百多万册。

sentences.english: I’ve got a million ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我主意多得很。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000
an extremely large number of people or things

name: billion
trans: num. 十亿 n. 十亿；大量 adj. 十亿的

sentences.english: The final cost could be as much as one billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 最后的费用可能高达十亿美元。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000,000

name: dozen
trans: n. 十二个，一打 adj. 一打的

sentences.english: a dozen eggs
sentences.chinese: 一打鸡蛋

sentences.english: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯、海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。

sentences.english: (= about 12 ) cars were parked near the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: twelve

name: dawn
trans: n. 黎明；开端 vt. 破晓；出现；被领悟

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: midday
trans: n. 中午；正午 adj. 正午的

sentences.english: We stopped off in Colchester for our midday meal.
sentences.chinese: 我们中途在科尔切斯特停留吃了午饭。

sentences.english: the full heat of the midday sun
sentences.chinese: 正午烈日的酷热

detailed_translations.english: the middle of the day, at or around 12 o’clock

name: midnight
trans: n. 午夜，半夜12点钟 adj. 半夜的；漆黑的

sentences.english: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.chinese: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

sentences.english: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.chinese: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.english: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜去游泳了。

detailed_translations.english: 12 o’clock at night

name: overnight
trans: adv. 通宵；突然；昨晚 adj. 晚上的；通宵的；前夜的 n. 头天晚上；一夜的逗留 vt. 连夜快递 vi. 过一夜

sentences.english: He became a millionaire overnight.
sentences.chinese: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

detailed_translations.english: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
happening during the night or for the night

name: night
trans: n. 夜晚，晚上；黑暗，黑夜 adj. 夜晚的，夜间的

sentences.english: It was a cold moonlit night.
sentences.chinese: 那是个寒冷的月夜。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep too well last night.
sentences.chinese: 我昨晚睡得不太好。

detailed_translations.english: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep

name: modern
trans: adj. 现代的，近代的；时髦的 n. 现代人；有思想的人

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

name: recent
trans: adj. 最近的；近代的

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: up-to-date
trans: adj. 最新的，最近的；现代的，新式的

sentences.english: ...the most up-to-date information available on foods today.
sentences.chinese: …今日有关食品的最新消息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直到最近的， 现代的； 跟上时代的
detailed_translations.english: modern or fashionable

name: first
trans: num. 第一 n. 第一；开始；冠军 adj. 第一的；基本的；最早的 adv. 第一；首先；优先；宁愿

sentences.english: These results are firsts in the history of women’s athletics.
sentences.chinese: 这些成绩在女运动员历史上是第一次。

sentences.english: First I had to decide what to wear.
sentences.chinese: 首先我得决定穿什么。

detailed_translations.english: 1st
at the beginning

name: secondly
trans: adv. 其次；第二

sentences.english: Firstly, they are not efficient, and secondly, they are expensive to make.
sentences.chinese: 首先，它们效率不高，其次，它们的制作成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to give a second point or fact, or give a second reason for something

name: finally
trans: adv. 最后；终于；决定性地

sentences.english: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 几经耽搁后，我们终于在六点起飞了。

sentences.english: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 最后，卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time

name: finish
trans: n. 结束；完美；回味（葡萄酒） vt. 完成；结束；用完 vi. 结束，终止；终结

sentences.english: You can’t go anywhere until you’ve finished your homework.
sentences.chinese: 没完成家庭作业前你哪儿也不能去。

sentences.english: Have you finished that book yet?
sentences.chinese: 那本书你看完了吗？

sentences.english: ‘How’s the decorating going?’ ‘We’ve nearly finished.’
sentences.chinese: “装修进行得怎么样了？”“差不多快完成了。”

sentences.english: The football season finishes in May.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛季在 5 月份结束。

sentences.english: a dramatic finish to the race
sentences.chinese: 赛跑的戏剧性结局

detailed_translations.english: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
the end or last part of something

name: immediately
trans: conj. 一…就 adv. 立即，立刻；直接地

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

name: instant
trans: n. 瞬间；立即；片刻 adj. 立即的；紧急的；紧迫的

sentences.english: an instant success
sentences.chinese: 马到成功

sentences.english: a system that provides instant access to client information
sentences.chinese: 能立即查到客户信息的系统

sentences.english: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
sentences.chinese: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。

sentences.english: The programme brought an instant response.
sentences.chinese: 节目立即引起了反响。

sentences.english: For an instant, Barney was tempted to flee.
sentences.chinese: 那一瞬间，巴尼很想逃走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 立即的； 紧急的； 可以速食的
detailed_translations.english: happening or produced immediately
An instant is an extremely short period of time

name: moment
trans: n. 片刻，瞬间，时刻；重要，契机

sentences.english: It was one of the most exciting moments in his life.
sentences.chinese: 这是他一生中最激动人心的时刻之一。

sentences.english: She may be in trouble at this very moment and trying to call you.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻她可能遇到了麻烦，正想方设法给你打电话。

sentences.english: I remember the moment when I first saw him after the operation.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得手术后第一次见到他的那一刻。

sentences.english: Quinn always seems to be in the right place at the crucial moment.
sentences.chinese: 奎因似乎总能在关键时刻把握时机。

sentences.english: I just this moment (= only a very short time ago ) arrived and already Dan wants to know when I’m leaving.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚到，丹就想知道我什么时候走。

sentences.english: At this moment in time it would be inappropriate to comment on the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这个时候恐怕不宜对局势作出评论。

sentences.english: It was quiet for a moment, then Rae spoke.
sentences.chinese: 沉寂了片刻，然后雷开始说话了。

detailed_translations.english: a particular point in time

name: minute
trans: n. 分，分钟；片刻，一会儿；备忘录，笔记；会议记录 vt. 将…记录下来 adj. 微小的，详细的 [maɪˈnjuːt; US -ˈnuːt; maɪˋnut]

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

name: prior
trans: adj. 优先的；在先的，在前的 adv. 在前，居先

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: former
trans: n. 模型，样板；起形成作用的人 adj. 从前的，前者的；前任的

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: preceding
trans: v. 在...之前（precede的ing形式） adj. 在前的；前述的

sentences.english: As we saw in the preceding chapter, groups can be powerful agents of socialization.
sentences.chinese: 如我们在前一章所见，团组可以是社会化的有力动因。

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming before the time, place, or part mentioned

name: precedent
trans: n. 先例；前例 adj. 在前的；在先的

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

name: foremost
trans: adj. 最重要的；最先的 adv. 首先；居于首位地

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: opening
trans: n. 开始；机会；通路；空缺的职位 adj. 开始的 v. 开放（open的ing形式）；打开；公开

sentences.english: the opening match of the season
sentences.chinese: 本赛季的首场比赛

sentences.english: the opening chapter of the book
sentences.chinese: 本书的第一章

sentences.english: at the opening of the trial
sentences.chinese: 审判伊始

detailed_translations.english: first or beginning
the beginning or first part of something

name: initially
trans: adv. 最初，首先；开头

sentences.english: Stan initially wanted to go to medical school.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦最初想进医学院。

sentences.english: Initially, I thought I would only stay there a year.
sentences.chinese: 起初，我以为我只会在那儿待一年。

detailed_translations.english: at the beginning

name: intermediate
trans: n. [化学] 中间物；媒介 adj. 中间的，中级的 vi. 起媒介作用

sentences.english: an intermediate coursebook
sentences.chinese: 中级课本

sentences.english: an intermediate stage/step in a process
sentences.chinese: 中间阶段 / 步骤

detailed_translations.english: having more than a basic knowledge of sth but not yet advanced

name: midst
trans: n. 当中，中间 prep. 在…中间（等于amidst）

sentences.english: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

name: meantime
trans: n. 其时，其间 adv. 同时；其间

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

name: meanwhile
trans: adv. 同时，其间 n. 其间，其时

sentences.english: Cook the sauce over a medium heat until it thickens. Meanwhile start boiling the water for the pasta.
sentences.chinese: 用中火把调味汁煮到变稠，同时烧水准备煮意大利面。

detailed_translations.english: while something else is happening

name: simultaneous
trans: n. 同时译员 adj. 同时的；联立的；同时发生的

sentences.english: They grabbed each other’s hands in simultaneous panic.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩同时惊慌起来，相互抓住对方的手。

sentences.english: Up to twenty users can have simultaneous access to the system.
sentences.chinese: 最多可有20名用户同时登该系统。

sentences.english: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation (= immediate translation, as the person is speaking ) into English.
sentences.chinese: 这些演讲将作现场直播，并配有英语同声传译。

detailed_translations.english: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time

name: ongoing
trans: adj. 不间断的，进行的；前进的 n. 前进；行为，举止

sentences.english: their ongoing search for a new director
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.english: ongoing negotiations
sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

name: everlasting
trans: adj. 永恒的；接连不断的

sentences.english: everlasting fame
sentences.chinese: 永久的名声

sentences.english: a symbol of God’s everlasting love
sentences.chinese: 上帝永恒之爱的象征

sentences.english: a belief in life everlasting
sentences.chinese: 对永生的信念

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever, even after someone has died

name: permanent
trans: n. 烫发（等于permanent wave） adj. 永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: punctual
trans: adj. 准时的，守时的；精确的

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: duration
trans: n. 持续，持续的时间，期间 [语音学]音长，音延

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: consecutive
trans: adj. 连贯的；连续不断的

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: periodically
trans: adv. 定期地；周期性地；偶尔；间歇

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将来临的；迫近的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: incidentally
trans: adv. 顺便；偶然地；附带地

sentences.english: Incidentally, where were you born?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

sentences.english: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说一下，这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

detailed_translations.english: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of
